Great food service and atmosphere!  Highly recommend to check it out when in Toronto Thank you for a great time

- excellent chips!
- pad thai was spicy (level: spicy, but not thai spicy) with 5 pieces of shrimp
- fried shrimp was excellent
- really good pineapple juice
The venue is huge, fun, and has good vibes. Food came out fast and the portions were large. It's got an upbeat party-type vibe here and is a LOT bigger than it looks.
Prices were reasonable, on the higher end of Thai in general. Excellent food nonetheless.
Shame there was no thai iced coffee.

Deliscious, cool ambiance, great service. 
Get there a little early to get a spot. We had a short 25 min wait.

This Thai spot is a little pricey but very good. Strongly recommend reservations and there are two locations if you can't get a reservation. Dinner menu starts at 4pm so if you want mango sticky rice, wait until then. They are cashless, so bring a credit card and your phone has enough battery to browse the menu.
Drinks were interesting. Wifey got the Lowry which was delicious. It was like a limeade, although I couldn't taste the alcohol. I am not sure if the drink was that ridiculously good or just weak. I got the scotch Barnes which is a Hennessy cocktail. I love Hennessy but I didn't enjoy it unfortunately. It was a little spicy and tasted a little medicinal. Maybe the Lowry ruined my taste buds*shrug*. 
For the entree's we got the shrimp pad see yu and the oxtail. The pad see yu was one of the best I've ever had. It wasn't overly sweet and had plenty of shrimp and veggies. Being Chinese, the only thing that would've been out of this world is getting enough wok hei, although it came close. I love oxtail so I ordered this. I'm used to carribean style oxtail and viet oxtail so I was intrigued by this style which is a sweet and sour. It was different but good. The flavor profile was good but I prefer the savory and tomato oxtail or the curried versions more. There was plenty of oxtail and the rice is served in banana leaf which was fun and great presentation.
I would def come again, I would try the khao soi next time. That seemed very popular but I couldn't turn down a chance at oxtail. I would def order the pad see you again!
Avoid scotch Barnes, get the Lowry, get pad see yu, oxtail is solid. Smokey somehow. Would try khao soi n

Having lived in Bangkok and being married to a (Chinese) Thai wife, I consider myself somewhat of a Thai food aficionado. As such, I could expertly proclaim that Pai has some of the absolute best versions of Thai dishes produced outside of Thailand: specifically their pork skewers (moo ping), Northern Thai sausage and khao soi were all top notch, beautifully presented, expertly seasoned and composed of the highest quality ingredients. And it helps that the location is cavernous, slightly divey (in the best sense of the word), with Thai signage and photos of all their adoring celebrity fans. Well worth the trip!!

The BEST khao soi I have ever eaten. If you get one thing here, I would highly recommend giving your taste buds a treat and ordering this dish. I was recommended Pai by quite a few others so I knew I had to try it on my visit to Toronto. We arrived at around 6:30pm and it was around an hour wait before we got the text that our table was ready.
The inside is really cool and has a great vibe. Our table was in a more secluded area which was actually really nice. Service was fast and friendly, and after ordering we didn't have to wait too long for our food but long enough to know they were making it fresh. 
I got the khao soi with tofu and veggies which came with a good portion of wide egg noodles, tons of tofu, and a good variety of veggies in the signature broth. It was also topped with crispy egg noodles as well. The broth was so so flavorful and had the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and spicy. It was soaked up so well by the noodles and was absolutely delicious! 
I completely understand why this spot is so popular! Definitely be prepared to wait if you arrive without a reservation, but it's certainly worth it :)

Ordered delivery and the food arrived still piping hot. I ordered excellent dishes, all with amazing flavor and hit the spot immediately, especially during a snowy Toronto night. 
- Seasonal Mango Slaw salad, I could've gone without this, the portion was so large! It could have just been my main dish! But this was very fresh, thin slices of mango, carrots, onions all tossed in a delicious lime and fish sauce (Yum!) was only able to finish half of this!
- Gai Satay (chicken), there were 5 skewers, and was in a delicious curry sauce and they homemade their peanut dipping sauce!  
- Panang Curry with Chicken, this was my main dish, but the portion was so small, the Mango Slaw size should've been reversed with my Panang Curry! 
Overall, the flavors were amazing, delicious and totally hit the spot! Loved this Toronto Thai spot!

Everyone said we had to eat here while in Toronto. We arrived ten minutes after opening on a Saturday afternoon. I'm not sure how large the restaurant has and how many rooms but it seemed already pretty full when we got there. We were sat straight away. Service was decent. You use the QR code for the menu. A lot of items aren't available til after 4pm - which is a shame. I had the Pad See Ew with shrimp which was delicious, the rice noodles were great, I like that they gave you the spice on the side so you could add your own heat level. My husband didn't order well and went with the Chiang Mai Beef Noodle Soup, he was looking for something like Drunken Noodles which is what my dish was similar to, he wanted wide noodles and messed up! Lol. His dish was still good but not what he was looking for.

Came here on a Wed night and it was busy due to TIFF. We waited about 20 minutes for our table which was great! They have a lot of seating that goes to the back of the restaurant. Everything we ordered was so delicious! You can order the level of spice you want. Our server was helpful in describing the menu and gave a suggestion for dessert which is a must, coconut sorbet in a coconut shell. If you want Thai food with authentic taste and great flavour you need to go to Pai!
Ambiance was sick af, the decor and atmosphere is nice. Food was so good even before the full menu after 4 pm, excellent service as well, have to visit if you in Toronto

I came with a few friends for dinner on a Monday night. Our wait was about 35 minutes which wasn't too bad. We had a drink next door while we waited. Once we got the text, we went back and got seated. I honestly didn't expect this place to be as big as it was inside. I liked how colorful and fun it was, very trendy.
The menu had quite a few options and they did a great job with accommodating my gluten free friend too. We started out with the garlic chicken which I loved. It was juicy, crispy and flavorful. It didn't have a huge garlic taste at all so don't let that scare you. Next I shared the shrimp pad thai. This was great too, really flavorful and big meaty shrimps. Finally, I shared the beef khao soi. I really wanted to like this more than I did, but the beef just tasted so dry to me. Maybe with a different protein it would have been better. 
Overall it was good. I did feel like our sever rushed us a bit and wasn't the most friendly, but the food was still good which made it worth it.
Great food, drinks and service. Loved this place so much, we went back twice! Definitely worth the trip and will be back once I return to Toronto.

One word - INCREDIBLE!
The ambiance, service and most of all the food is amazing at this place. Hands down it is one of the best Thai restaurants I have been to (and I have had Thai around the world).
Definitely go for the tom yum soup as it is wonderful in any weather. I will hands down say their Panang curry with chicken is absolutely amazing.
I look forward to coming back here on every Toronto layover I have.

Excellent food. Papaya and mango salads, pad see ewe, spring rolls, refreshing cocktails. Casual and festive decor. Efficient staff. Highly recommend. But maybe expect a wait (even at 2 on a Sat. Afternoon)

Llike this place a lot .. it is actually bigger inside ..but dont like how you need to make reservations way in advance, at least a few months in advance because they closed off their limited reservations as restaurants tend not to hold up tables for the busiest dining time and they rather you do walk ins.. which can be a hit and miss.
Also some area are just too noisy.. you can't have a conversation.. food is good though so go when it is not as busy, which is rare LOL

Yelp Review 2023 #26:
When in Toronto, you MUST come to Pai. If you're thinking whether to have lunch or dinner here, pick dinner as they have more items only served during dinner service.
Certain regions of Thailand use certain ingredients. The southern part like their food spicier compared to the northern part. The popular dish in Northern Thailand is Khao Soi so, naturally, that's what I had to get.
Khao Soi:
A bowl of egg noodles in a golden coconut milk curry m with crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, and your choice of protein ((Braised Beef, Chicken Breast, Shrimp, Tofu & Veggies (contains shrimp paste), or Vegan)). I opted for chicken. They'll give you a side of chili, and lime to adjust the flavors. By itself, it's a little bit sweet. 4/5
Pad Ga Prow:
Rice dish with stir-fried holy basil with your choice of Ground Pork, Crispy Pork (Moo Grob), Chicken, Beef, Shrimp, or Tofu - topped with a fried egg. Served with nam prik nam pla sauce. Spice level of your choice (No Spice, Mild, Medium, Farang Spicy, or Thai Spicy). The crispy pork was the perfect choice. Man, I'm drooling as I'm reliving the moment I was eating this dish. 5/5
Do make a reservation way ahead of time (a month ahead because Open Table will not let you make a reservation more than that). Once you are seated, they'll let you know you only have 90-120 minutes to eat. But stress not because the food comes out quick. So, my suggestion is to look up their menu before coming here and know what you want so you don't waste time trying to decide what you might be interested in. Also, they have multiple locations so, make sure you go to the right one.
Due to their popularity, the service seemed rush. Not the best but not the worst.

I was so excited to visit a popular and known spot in Toronto when I visited. I'm also a huge fan of all things Thai so my expectations were high. 
My party shared a variety of dishes they were known for including the pad Thai, beef curry, Moo ping, as well as the mango sticky rice. I thought all the dishes has nice flavors and nice presentation. I also really liked that they brought out a variety of items to enhance the ! I will say the only pain point was that the portions of the dish was smaller than I expected for the price but I can move past that.
Service was good, and helped at every request! The ambience and layout is something else, I thought the inside was only the main lobby but actually is like 2-3x the size I originally thought!
The food is so good. Oldies decor and music are fun and enjoyable. Service is great. Did I mention the food was good??? Definitely try the chef favorites on the menu.

Grabbed takeout from pai after a long day of traveling and it was exactly what we needed. The Pad gra prow had so much flavor and was perfectly balanced between the chicken, veggies, and rice. We had the khao son road too and loved it. It was difficult to eat since we were in a hotel and the takeout came in two separate containers. Loved the spring roll with mushrooms too! 
Their online ordering wasn't available at the time and we had to call 3 times before we finally were able to get through on the phone.

not good i went inside and the place stank like old mc donalds farm like i can still smell the ee i ee i o and the food was ROTTEN and STALE and CHUBBY i gave my dog the food and she eats everything BUT SHE VOMITED ON MY HUSBAND bobby.
the staff were so mean and they for got to give me my water
ive considored NEVER EVER EVER COMING BACK 
and they wouldnt let me pay in cash im angry
Great vegan options for Thai food! Loved the Khao Soi and Mango Salad with good service and ambience.

Excellent ambiance, we were not in the main room but it turned out to be better, less noisy. 
Great food and service.

Back again at Pai!
Got their pad gra prow with beef - thai spicy! and it was the perfect amount of almost uncomfortable spicy but still quite spicy. It was super flavourful and the portion was okay for the price. Also tried my friend's spring rolls and they were good. Service was great as usual. We came around 4pm on a weekday afternoon and were seated immediately so come early if you don't have a reservation or else you may be lining up outside.

So good, it kind of ruined Thai food (non-Pai) for me forever
Waited about a half hour on a Saturday afternoon. Seems a little silly to have a waiting space when it could just be more seats, but it works and you'll find people waiting. They offer a call back but I'm visiting from US so we opted to wait. We were just about to order our Thai teas from the bar when we were seated - wish there was more encouragement to take advantage of the bar while waiting, but I digress
The Khao Soi is OUT OF THIS WORLD. The presentation and the lightness of the curry go hand-in-hand to a really special experience. It's pretty big and can be shared. We also had some skewers that were so moist and tender. Yum yum!
This was also just peak experience for us - the restaurant is so cute and so much to look at. The staff is extremely kind and friendly too, they even gave us some city recommendations. 
Yeah I can't eat from any other Thai restaurant again. Thanks a lot you guys (sarcasm here)
Food was outstanding, the pork skewers were the star. Food came out quick and service was good. I will definitely be back.

Delicious! If you're in Toronto you must visit Pai. They don't take reservations so there's going to be  a wait, but it's worth it. There's a bar area you can wait in, but there's not much seating. This place is pretty big and it gets packed. We waited about 45 minutes for a table for 4 on a Friday night. The staff provided good customer service during our visit. The highlight was the food. Everything was so flavorful and fresh. The spring rolls, spicy fried rice, pad Thai, chicken strips and Thai tea were my favorites. Enjoy!

Amazing northern Thai restaurant located in downtown Toronto! Waited outside for around 20 minutes, but quickly sat down after checking in since I was a party of 1. Ordered their vegetarian Khao Soi, and had outstanding flavor! Couldn't stop drinking the soup broth- highly recommend! If you're in downtown Toronto, wouldn't miss this spot!

Come back again for dinner. Very popular place and good vibes. The server is very efficient to serve. The dinner only allows 90 minutes per table. Once found you are almost done, he will deliver the bill ( that is only 60 minutes) .
The Khao Sai is good. Its curry is very rich. Tom Yum Kung also has strong flavour and have 4 big shrimp in it. Only happen that the soup is not very hot even it is served under a small fire.

Pai might have been the most recommended restaurant to us for our trip to Toronto, and it definitely lived up to the hype!
My boyfriend and I came in on Saturday for lunch and we arrived right before a huge rush. They limit you 90 minutes to dine in, which is plenty of time given how quickly the kitchen pumps out dishes! Between the two of us, we ordered 5 wings to share, pad gra pow with crispy pork, and khao soi with shrimp. 
Wings - Not as crispy as advertised, but the sauce it came with was nice and sweet! Was still delicious, but nothing to rave about. 
Pad Gra Pow - ALL OF IT. YES. I couldn't stop eating this dish despite how full I was, but every component of this dish was perfection. The crispy pork gave the dish a little bit more bite and the fried egg was just perfection! We ordered it mild, but didn't taste any kick to it, so if you're a spice lover, definitely order it spicier. :)
Khao Soi - The broth was creamy, coconutty, and very very fragrant. The noodles were cooked perfectly and still had a great bite to it. I loved the addition of the crispy noodles for a little extra texture. The broth was really rich and was the perfect soup for a chilly afternoon! 
Can't recommend Pai enough and definitely coming back for the next Toronto trip!

This review is for take out because I wasn't prepared to wait around for this popular joint! Even in the early evening, the line was long with many people waiting their turn. 
I understand why! I don't know that I've tried Northern Thai before but I could definitely tell there was a slight difference in the way things were made in comparison to my usual local Thai joint. 
We ordered the pad thai, khao soi and pad gra prow. Everything was very full of flavor! The pad thai was my favorite. It wasn't your typical pad thai. It was filled with different veggies and just had so many different textures and tastes that lit up the tastebuds! The food was absolutely fantastic and takeout was a great option to avoid the wait!

Very solid Northern Thai with an excellent spicy beef noodle soup, grren curry, and pad thai.  Their takes on the classics just have that extra boost of umani which take them to the next level.  We also tried the penang curry which is a sweeter than most versions and less creamy - so your mileage may vary based on your preference.  They are perpetually packed and a walk-in table may take up to an hour, with reservations hard to come by.  They will offer to text/call you so you can wander around or grab drinks elsewhere while waiting.  We ended up ordering from Uber Eats, which took only about 30 min.  Worth checking out if you are Downtown.

SO and I stopped here for lunch and although it was a tad bit pricy, everything was prepared well.  We started off with the garlic shrimp, which were nice and flaky and came with a tasty sweet tamarind sauce.  SO had the beef noodle soup, which was perfect on a cold day, and I had the panang chicken, which was tasty and hit the spot. 
Bottom line, the service was fast and the food was tasty.  We'll probably venture to a different Thai restaurant just because there are so many of them that we haven't visited, but it's good to know that this place does Thai well.

One of my favourite restaurants in the city. 
Always fresh, friendly, fast but not rushed.
I am always impressed with the theming as well.
Great experience. Came here both before COVID and post pandemic. Nothing changed. Will recommend to friends coming to Toronto

This is a neat place in the basement of a building in downtown which sets the atmosphere well. I was by myself and got there around 415P so I didn't have to wait for a table. By the time I left, there was a line starting to make its way up the stairs to the street.
At the recommendation of two servers I got the Pad Gra Prow with Moo Grob (crispy pork). I got it one step below Thai spicy. It was excellent. There was good flavor and the perfect amount of spice. As I ate, my mouth wasn't on fire but there was still some heat. The ground pork seemed to carry most of the spice.
I also got a Thai Iced Tea. It was really good too. 
I don't make it to Toronto often but I'll definitely stop here next time I'm in town.

Toronto really delivered on the food scene and Pai was no different! We had the Khao Soi and Pad Gra Prow. I miss these dishes. Thai in Nashville is not great. Thai in SF was great. Pai in Toronto was like wrapping myself in a warm blanket just out of the dryer. I wish I could Goldbelly it. Can I? Is that an option?? Both dishes had so much flavor. The consistency of the Khao Soi was thick enough, but not too thick. The PGP's egg was cooked perfectly, the meat was the same, and the sauces and flavorings blew me away. It's now my favorite Thai dish. If done well, it's all I want to eat.
The space was really wonderful too. It has been transformed form head to toe. What was most amazing was that we were clearly not regulars. The guy next to us ordered the Khao Soi. He slurped down all of it once he was done, he went to the bathroom and changed shirts. This guy understood the assignment. My poor husband had a napkin around his neck trying to contain the splash back. Come hungry, their portions do not disappoint!

My expectations for this restaurant was out of the world. It really was so delicious. I really would love to come back the ambience the food the service was outstanding. I love the attention detail and that they were very knowledgeable about their food.

"It doesn't really matter what chords I play
What words I say or time of day it is
As it's only a Northern song"
(The Beatles)
Q: So when you're visiting a city for the first time, and you'll only be in town for a few days, how do you decide where to go for dinner on a free night?
A: Easy, you reach out to that city's Yelp Community Manager for recommendations. That explains how we ended up at Pai Northern, on the recommendation of the Yelp Toronto CM Janice Y.
Quite a few Torontonians share Janice's favorable opinion of Pai Northern -and here's why I'm saying that. We walked in at a quarter to five on a Tuesday night and the place was packed. We grabbed a cocktail (Clear Peach Cider for $9) and waited about 20 minutes to be seated. By the time we sat down, the dining rooms seemed to be at 99% capacity, the bar was jammed up five deep, and the line to check in went all the way up the stairs to street level.
My dinner choice was Pad Phet Chicken and my wife went with Chicken Pad Thai. Both portions were enormous. Half of each came back to our hotel room for lunch tomorrow
My Pad Phet was fantastic! It was a delicious stir fry of chicken and king oyster mushroom in a red chilli paste with snow peas, bamboo shoots, Thai basil leaves, sliced ginger, and peppercorns on a bed of sticky Jasmine rice. It was a magnificent dish.
It was only offered as "mild spicy" so when I asked for extra spicy, our server Renz brought out a small bowl of nuclear hot chili oil. It should have been served with an eye dropper, because just a little dab'll do ya good.
Our two cocktails and two dinner entrees ran $64.41 before tip. 
Thank you Janice Y. and Pai Northern for a fantastic dinner.

I had heard about this place since a long time but didn't get a chance to visit until a few weeks back! 
Pai is known for their delicious Northern Thai food and have a few locations spread across the GTA. We went to this location and had to wait for 2 hours straight for a table on a Friday evening - so take a cue and book reservations well in advance! 
The service was really decent and we were told the table was allotted for 2 hours. 
Coming to the food we got:
 Pork skewers - was delicious!
 Starter bowl of tom yum soup - just to taste it! 
 Khao Soi - the classic! Didn't disappoint but the gravy was a little too runny.
 Gaeng Massaman - Personally did not like the flavours in this one.
 Chef Nuit's Pad Thai - quite spicy, but flavourful!
Finally, the showstopper according to us was the Coconut Sorbet ice cream. It came inside a tender coconut served with chunks of mango, peanuts and grated coconut. I was so happy to see this since it took me back to the feeling of having tender coconut ice cream back home - the taste was SO good. This ice cream is perfect to share between 2-3 people. 
Overall, this place is a must visit if you love Thai food or want to give it a try for the first time!

We are visiting Toronto from California and some friends recommended this restaurant as a must-try! It didn't disappoint and reignited why I love Thai food in the first place. Probably one of the best Thai restaurants I've ever had in this side of the world.
We came on a Sunday night around 7 pm with no reservation. We were told that waiting time would be an hour but it only took 25 mins! The space is huge, vibrant, and very alive! Perfect for group settings. 
WHAT WE ORDERED:
Thai tea -- textbook, perfect Thai tea! Comparable to Cha Tra Mue in Thailand. 
Khao Soi -- this creamy, coconut-based stew with noodles is so comforting for the frigid weather in Toronto. Each sip is brimming with rich flavors! We chose chicken as our protein though shrimp sounds amazing, too.
Pad Gra Pow -- with crispy pork belly and stir-fried ground pork, topped with the most perfect fried egg. *chef's kiss* we overestimated the spice level and just went for mild which didn't have much kick into it! But good thing they serve chili on the side so you can take it up a notch if you want to.
Coconut sorbet -- rich, thick, and creamy coconut sorbet with nuts and mango and coconut meat. Wish it came with more mango chunks but it's already perfect as is!
Serving-wise, dishes are huge and good to share. We want to come back next time for their moo ping and Thai green curry! So many promising options on the menu. Definitely recommend this place!!

I went there for dinner with colleagues. The wait was too long (55 minutes) for a table of 3. The service was excellent once we sat down. 
For food, appetizers were good; entree tasted good, but I felt there was some plastic in my grounded chicken. It was actually prawn shell in the Pad Gra Prow Chicken. 
I am feeling really bad after eating it.

Great food, great service! We went on a Tuesday night and there was about a 50 min wait. There's regular table and communal table which we got sat at. It's perfectly fine! 
The food was absolutely delicious! The panang curry and pad kra prow were my favorites! The thai spicy level was so spicy!!! Would recommend farang spicy or medium if possible. 
The coconut sorbet was absolutely delicious!!! Great way to end the night

Went for an early dinner on a Wednesday at 5:00pm and the wait was about 35-40min. We got drinks (definitely recommend the Scotchie Burnes, so tasty!) and looked at the menu while waiting for our table. They take your number and text you when your table is ready.
Outside there is a nice waiting area with tables and chairs.
The Khao soi was delicious, I'd recommend getting extra noodles or a side of rice if you order it. My friend who got the Pad See Ew liked it. My other friend got a braised beef rice noodle soup which was good but she liked the Pad See Ew better.
We ordered as soon as we were seated and we're given a 90 minute time limit. Most of our time was waiting on the food to arrive but we left well within the time frame given. Halfway through our meal there was a line up the stairs waiting to put their names down for the dinner rush.

THE BEST THAI FOOD I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE
This place has won many awards in the past and it definitely lives up to the hype. My party of 2 waited about 35mins for our table. Check in with the host and they'll text you when your table is ready. 
F O O D :
+ Tom Yum Soup 5/5 - Welcome to flavor town! Very pronounced shrimp flavor, packed with veggies and slightly sour. Oh soo good!
+ Garlic Chicken Nuggets 5/5 - Golden, crispy chicken nuggies that were fried to perfection. The dipping sauce was bright and acidic. Paired perfectly 
+ Beef Salad 4/5 - Our waitress recommended this. Super refreshing salad if you still want a little bit of protein with your meal. Limes were definitely used in this dressing. Super light and refreshing as well
+ Pad Thai 5/5 - Solid pad Thai if you've never tried it before! Some other places overcook the noodles so they're really mushy but not here!
D R I N K S :
+ Sangria 5/5 - DELICIOUSSS! 
AMBIANCE :
The restaurant was A LOT bigger than I expected. They have a mix of high tops and regular tables. They were playing all the 2000s hip hop jams during the night so it was super fun being there. 
Overall amazing experience! Super sad they don't have a location in LA but that just means I'll have to come back someday :D

Was recommended to try this place while I was in Toronto and it definitely did not disappoint! I had the khao soi which was seasoned perfectly, though I wish they gave us a little more chili sauce because I like my soup spicier. I also tried their Thai tea which was also phenomenal. My only complaint is that the portion of khao soi was ample but not generous and I was hoping for a larger portion given the price. We came for lunch on a monday without a reservation and had to wait around half an hour. Overall, the service was great and I would definitely recommend.

I've been to Pai once before several years ago for a friends bday and I didn't really like it but can't remember why.
When my friend suggested eating here, I wasn't really that excited but went anyway.  What a difference! The flavours were much more authentic than what I remembered.
We ordered the fried tofu nuggets and it came with a dipping sauce. They were ok nothing special here but to be expected for deep fried tofu.
Tom yum soup had good flavours with balance of spicy, tangy and spicy kick finish. It was served in a stainless steel vessel, probably was traditional but it made it little hard to get to fish out the soup, but you know small stuff.
We also ordered the Northern Thai platter. Came with squash fritters, pork skewers, ground pork and lettuce for a wrap and pork sausages. The pork sausages were the real star. They were moist and juicy and bursted with authentic Thai flavours which was surprising.
The green coconut curry was ok. I usually don't order green curry (prefer red more) but the flavours were there. My only criticism is it was served in a young coconut bowl and it was hard to scoop it out. Had to ask for a small ladle to get at it.
Overall, I enjoyed the flavours more this time around. I would come back if I was in the mood for Thai and in the area.

Pai is an institution in downtown Toronto! There's always a line and it's frequented by locals and tourists alike. I honestly love taking my out of town friends to Pai because it's close to most attractions and the food is very delicious. I always get the Khao Soi but sometimes mix it up with Pad Thai, pad gra prow, and pad see ew. 
Will it be the best Thai food you'll ever try in your life? Probably not but the vibes make up for it. Seriously check out the place if you're in the area. Always find myself going back...must be the food and people. Haha.

The food was amazing and very cleverly displayed. The food here is amazing. I'm always up for checking out new places during my travels. This restaurant was not that close to the hotel but we walked over and then took an Uber back. If you're hungry, try to get there early because there will be a line to get in. Our server was amazing as well, one of our appetizers came in after our entrées already arrived so there was no issue canceling the order.

Wow!!  Had to wait about 50 minutes for a table but the food was worth the wait!  We had:
SPRING ROLLS
Three deep-fried vegetarian wheat paper wraps filled with mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots, and bean sprouts served with a sweet and spicy Thai chilli sauce.
KUNG TAWT 'GARLIC SHRIMP
Six deep-fried, breaded black tiger garlic shrimp served with a sweet tamarind sauce.
GAENG PANANG
Thick panang curry sauce with makrut lime leaves, Thai basil leaves, red bell peppers, and coconut milk. (contains shrimp paste and dairy).  We had it with chicken and it's served with jasmine rice.  It's a little spicy but totally bearable.
PAD GRA PROW
Holy basil stir-fried with beef and it's served on steamed jasmine rice and topped with a Thai-style fried egg. (contains oyster sauce).  Nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chilli & lime) is served on the side.  We poured the whole thing on our dish and mixed everything up!  Ordered it mild.
CHEF NUIT PAD THAI x 2
Red-flame stir-fried rice noodles in a house-made tamarind-palm sugar sauce with beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, long leaf coriander, shredded cabbage, fresh lime, and house-roasted peanuts.  We had it mild with chicken.
THAI ICE TEA x 2
THAI MOJITO (mock tail)
Lemongrass Syrup, fresh basil, lime, topped with Soda and butterfly pea flower.
The appetizers came quickly but the entrees took at least 30 minutes.  I loved the food!  I normally don't like nuts in my food so I usually don't eat pad thai even though my family likes it. This pad thai was so good that I think I'll have cravings!  It was the best pad thai that I've ever had!  The panang curry was perfectly balanced between sweet and spicy!  This restaurant is definitely a must try if you're in downtown Toronto!!

Amazing so perfect and great food we expect to go back again and again 
Soon as we do we will try the other items

Pai is my favourite place for Thai food! I came here after work and lined up around 5ish on a Friday and it wasn't too bad. I was told that there's a limited seating time and was worried since my other guests are arriving late. 
The restaurant was fully packed and we had to wait awhile to get service. Luckily I knew what my other guests was ordering so we just ordered ahead. 
By the time my guests arrived, food wasn't ready yet. I've also noticed that the price has increased since the last time I've been to Pai. 
In general, you cannot go wrong with the butternut squash fritters and the khao soi. Both were fantastic! For the butternut squash I felt like we needed extra sauce. The khao soi was also big portioned that I had to get a takeout box, this was probably like 3 servings for me. 
Overall, I do enjoy the food however I thought the service was a bit lacking. When I left, the line was so long that you'd probably have to wait over an hour. 
I'd recommend going early or going at another weekday.

We came here on our last day in Toronto.  We all enjoyed our meal.  I tried their Grabong appetizer, which is available only with dine in.  It was delicious and wish it was offered locally in my town. I will have to make another visit to Toronto and will definitely put Pai at the top next f the list.
Pretty awesome place and we had a super friendly waitress who found a way to store our luggages for us while we ate. Their sticky mango rice is the bomb

Overhyped!!!
Food was good here but not the best Thai I ever had. This place seems to just be busy at anytime. Came in on a Sunday at 630pm and was quoted 35-40 minutes and it actually only took about 20 minutes. Walk in only no reservations.
If you sit close to the bar it was a constant cluster of people bumping your chair and walking by. 
We ordered the butternut squash fritters, they did not have any flavor just tasted like a crunchy veggie. We were between that and the papaya salad. Wish we would have ordered the salad instead!!! 
For entrees we got Gaeng Panang and Pad Phet Chicken both were good but not amazing like other reviewers say.
Service was nice and friendly. 90 minute table limits. Overall dont be sad if you dont eat here.

The restaurant was vibrant and the staff was fantastic. I ordered the spring rolls to start which were delicious and the pad Thai which was just as good. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone!

We came in on a Saturday and it was very busy. We were told it would be a 25 minute wait, but were seated within 10 minutes. The waitress/waiters are all very nice and attentive. 
We got a thai iced tea which was probably one of the best ones I've ever had. I got the green curry which came in a coconut and jasmine rice on the side. It was perfectly spiced and tasted delicious. We also got Khao Soi which was creamy and light. 
I would definitely recommend this place if you ever in Toronto!

What we had
MOO PING: Northern Thai sweet grilled pork skewers $17
KHAO SOI: Fresh egg noodles in a golden coconut milk curry topped with crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, and Chicken Breast $23
CHIANG MAI BEEF NOODLE SOUP: Braised beef in a bold peanut, tamarind and lime broth. Served with rice noodles, long-leaf coriander, green onions, home roastedL9B peanuts and topped with cilantro and crispy wontons $23.5
GAENG MASSAMAN: Peanut and tamarind curry with potatoes and pearl white onions and topped with deep-fried crispy shallots. Served with steamed jasmine rice and Tofu & Veggies $22.5
GAENG HUNGLAY: Sweet and sour garlic-ginger curry with braised oxtail. Served with steamed jasmine rice $25
MANGO STICKY RICE: Sweet coconut sticky rice topped with fresh-cut mango and coconut cream $13
THAI ICE TEA $6
THAI MOJITO: 1.5oz Kingston 62 White Rum, Lemongrass Syrup, fresh basil, lime, topped with Soda and butterfly pea flower $13
Taste: 4/5
The main dishes were awesome! The broths were rich in flavour and really comforting. The beef noodle soup was my favourite. I highly recommend that!!
But for the skewers and milk tea... tbh we expected more from a Michelin restaurant. The skewers were a bit overcooked and the milk tea was a bit bland.
Vibe: 4.5/5
I love the decors! The wall of photos at the entrance could be a photo op.
Service: 3.5/5
The queue was long (about 45mins). Make sure to make a reservation in advance.
The servers were polite but also pretty busy.

We arrived at Pai around 4:30pm on a Tuesday, in a party of two, and was told the wait would be up to 30 minutes. Since Pai is located in a great location to walk around and sightsee, we walked to the CN Tower while waiting for our text that our table was ready. Our wait ended up being around 20 minutes, we were seated towards the back and the noise level was low. 
The menu is online via QR code. We ordered the papaya salad and khao soi to share. Service was good, the waiters were attentive. The food was excellent. My only quibble was the broth for the khao soi was rather warm (in temperature) rather than hot, I was pretty out off by this but the taste was good. I was pretty blown away by the papaya salad, such a refreshing taste!

if you love thai curry, get this! saw it on one of the netflix food travel shows and been looking for it ever since. i don't have this back in my home town.  the egg noodle plus deep fried egg noodles is amazing in this broth. add the the pickled vegetable for an occasional crunch and acidic tones. easily, this dish has climbed to one of my favorite soup and noodle dishes. 
went during lunch hours on a weekday and was seated fairly quickly. service was great. food came out quick and drinks were refilled quickly.

the food was amazing, and the service was great. my only suggestion is that the Tom Yum needs just a little more spice to taste proper. 
great job thank you.

Good food, but maybe not as great as the 5 star reviews say. The dark wooden interior housed a fun and lively environment: crowded, casual, and loud clanking of cutlery. Our party of 4 waited about 30 mins during weeknight dinner rush.
I ordered a Thai mojito (rum, lemongrass, basil, lime, butterfly pea flower). While it was pretty to look at, and the flavor of the mix was good, the alcohol seemed watered down. I only buzzed despite drinking on an empty stomach.
My Gaeng Hunglay oxtail curry was salty, sweet, sour, and a little smoky. I could taste the garlic and spices. Unfortunately, the curry was too salty, which undermined the complexity of the flavors. The oxtail meat was tender and fell off bone, but it was also studded with bits of broken bone. Not only did this interrupt the eating experience, but I also thought it was a choking hazard. The portion was also huge, so that's a plus.

It's been a few years since my last visit but this place doesn't disappoint!! The quality is as good as it was pre-pandemic.
We ordered the gabong / kabocha fritters to start - I could eat these in place of fries any day. They're perfectly crunchy and sweet. The tangy dip served with the fritters is the perfect accompaniment. 
I then got a pad gra prow and was amazed at the portion size! It was so big and generously. The egg was crispy with a soft yolk, and the meat was so flavourful but not too dry nor saucy. I loaded my dish up with the fish sauce on the side. So delicious!
I also had a bite of my friend's beef khao soi. I've forgotten how rich and creamy and deep the soup is! I've only had the Mo Thai one, but it simply doesn't compare. Theirs is sweeter but lacks the depth of flavour as this one. 
Service was also impeccable - our server continuously refilled our glasses and was so attentive as to even notice that my friend barely touched her dish (she was feeling unwell).
I definitely want to come here more often!

I absolutely love going here. You walk into a really great environment and will be dining on some of the best Thai in the city. 
Service is great, you should expect a line to get in as it is always busy. But once in they are attentive and quick. 
I had the Pad Gra Pow and it was just too delicious and very filling. There is a wide range of options to make everyone happy.

My friend loves this restaurant. Me, well, it's just ok for me. #1 way too crowded inside. People waiting by the tables to be seated makes it very uncomfortable dining experience. #2 we got a high table with tall stools for our dining experience. Host said no chance to switch to a regular table. Very uncomfortable. No where to put our coats, purses. Our feet just dangled. #3 we ordered pork skewers as app. Very tasty. Curry dish came with rice. That was good. We also ordered Pad Thai which was also good. The other dish was with ground pork and served with rice and an egg. It was just ok for me. #4 I noticed that the food came out less than lukewarm. I like my food served really hot so who knows how long our food sat under warmers before it was served. #5 order Thai spicy. Our food was not spicy at all...even tho we ordered our dishes spicy.
On the positive side the server was good.
Don't know if I would return.

Tbh when I saw this was the most reviewed restaurant in Toronto I had my doubts about whether it'd stack up to Thai restaurants I've had in NYC, but it for sure exceeded my expectations. Everything we had for lunch here was FIRE and we were so sad that we couldn't get a reservation for dinner bc there are so many other items on the menu that are after 4pm only. 
We got in line ~10 min before they opened on a Thursday and there were already at least 10 people in line, but there's sufficient seating inside so we didn't have to wait. Ordered the tom yum soup (appetizer size), green curry with fish,  pad thai, pineapple smoothie, and fresh coconut juice. Tom yum was the perfect level of spicy (as in quite spicy but not intolerable) and so packed with flavor. Fish in the green curry was so extremely tender it p much melted in my mouth. Pad thai was prob the best pad thai I've ever had. The drinks went perfectly with the heat of the savory dishes and were super fresh and delicious. If I ever come back to Toronto I'm 100% coming back here!

Went here for dinner based on yelp recommendations for the area - It did not disappoint!!!!!! We went in a saturday night. Expect a long wait. It will be worth it. You can put your name down and hang out at one of the other nearby pubs. 
The food was outstanding. Best Pad thai i have ever had in my life. The spring rolls were also excellent! Everyone in my party loved their meal and everyone wants to eat there again tomorrow! 
Our server was so sweet, she laughed at our parties silly jokes and was timely. The ambiance is perfect too. 
Everyone needs to check this place out!!!!
Best Thai food we've had in a long time. Loved it, short walk from the Sheraton. Thanks Yelp for this restaurant!!!!
Delicious food!! Drinks were good as well. Definitely recommend making a reservation as they get packed. Fun atmosphere.

We are THAI FOOD LOVERS, and this place lived up to its reputation.  Every dish we had was wonderfully executed, from the laab and skewers we loved at the start, to the perfectly executed pad ka prao... It was wonderful.
Also highly recommend the Khao soi, it's not easy to find everywhere and it's dinner as well as in Thailand.
The cocktails had awesome NBA raptors names, and more awesome flavor.
Lastly we finished with mango sticky rice that delivered as one would hope!

i grew up more familiar with bangkok style (aka more central) thai food and khao soi was always harder to find. because of that, the first time i ever had Pai, i was SO excited!!! and rightfully so! the khao soi is a very solid dish.
would i say this is THE BEST thai spot in the GTA? maybe not? but i definitely understand the hype behind it.
for my taste, i can tell there's added sweetness to the dishes. growing up, my parents and the aunties and uncles would equate sweeter-than-they're-used-to thai dishes as making the dishes more palatable for the western taste. honestly, i don't think there's anything wrong with that, but my personal preference  is less added sweetness/less sweet flavors and more sour&spicy.
service is always great whenever i come here! whenever my family visits, we always take people to Pai because we all grew up with thai food. so far folks have enjoyed it and we've had very prompt service from the host desk through to paying the bill, even when the place is packed!
the decor is super fun and feels reminiscent to street markets in thailand in regular seasons. for halloween (at least 2022 & 2023), i've seen some clown-type thing at the front which is VERY scary for me, so i think i'll avoid Pai near halloween season. i only add this detail to let other scaredy cats like me know so that they're aware :) if you're not faint of heart, you'll probably be absolutely fine with the festive october decor.
OVERALL:
- solid spot for thai food, despite being sweeter for my personal taste
- great place to bring friends
- usually busy, but great service
- it's called Pai Northern Thai Kitchen because Pai is in northern thailand! expect northern style dishes if you're familiar with thai cuisine!

Holy cow, this might be my favorite Thai place! My friends and I had the chance to eat here recently, and simply put, I'm obsessed. We made a reservation and showed up early, but it turned out that we had made a reservation for the wrong day. Thankfully, because we came right around opening time, they were really kind about it and fit us in even without a proper reservation. The restaurant was really busy when we left, so I definitely recommend making a (correct!) reservation for the best experience. 
I usually don't care too much about restaurant décor but this space was GORGEOUS and deserves some recognition! I loved how thoroughly and nostalgically it was decorated. We learned that the décor is based off of the chef's Northern Thai upbringing. This restaurant is bigger than it looks! The host took us through several winding rooms to get to our table, and each was colorful and creatively decorated, from trinkets to folding screen room dividers to posters to ceiling garlands. There was a display case full of memorabilia near our table, and it was a cool glimpse into Thai culture.
We didn't order that much since we were not too hungry, but judging by the tables around us the appetizers were quite popular. I got the Kanom jin nham ngeaw, which was a pork rib and tomato soup with rice noodle. The rice noodle came on the side in small bundles, which was a first for me. I threw them into the soup where they were able to loosen and separate. The broth was incredible! Super savory, complex, bright, and slightly pungent. It's quite rich because of the stewed pork ribs, so I found it even tastier with a squeeze of lime juice. There was a large portion of meat, all fall-off-the-bone tender. 
Pai is some of the most unique and well-executed Thai food that I've ever had. It's on the pricer side for Thai food, but the experience and the food are well worth it. This is definitely on my list for any future Toronto visits!

Amazing food, everything is very tasty. Don't miss out on the salads/slaws. Full vegan option for almost everything on the menu, with tofu and mock pork. Only downside is they don't take reservations, you'll have to put your name down and wait... or try takeout!

This place is delicious! We went around 430 pm and there was already a line, although the wait was less than 10 min. I ordered the khao soi with beef and my sister got the pad gra pow with pork. Food came out quickly and server was very attentive. They do tell you when you get seated that it's only 90 minutes, which is kind of weird but I guess they are really busy so need to tell guests upfront.
The khao soi was so flavorful! The curry was smooth and had a coconut flavor but wasn't too strong. The beef was also cooked very well. We ordered drinks at the bar as well since we thought the wait would be long - I got a lychee drink called the summer dog and my sister got the tea mac which came with Thai tea. Two drinks and two entrees cost about $75 CAD, up to ~$90 including tip so be prepared to spend if you want drinks and food! Their drinks definitely tasted great so would recommend.
We walked to Thai location from the waterfront. Parking overall in this area seems tough. It is nearby the subway /TTC line 1.

I got the pineapple slush and a chicken pad thai. I enjoyed both items! Not sure if it's the best I have had, but it was flavourful and the portion was big. 
I came on a Saturday afternoon and waited about 15 minutes for a table of four. The food came out fast and the service was decent.

literally amazing - this place is popular for a reason. reservations are hard to come by, but i recommend trying to snag one. they do take walk ins, but expect a wait.
we went all out when we came here and tried a bit of everything. our server was great helping us choosing what to get!! 
all dishes were extremely delicious and we left FULL!!! 
prices are what you would expect for downtown toronto.
more of a special occasion place than your everyday spot, but nonetheless we will absolutely be back.

Pai has to be my ultimate fav Thai place in Toronto. The wait time is crazy though. I wish you can make reservations. Oddest thing is when we got our table
there were so many empty tables around us yet people were lined up outside.
Interior ambiance:
Super cute and very Asian decor. The place is huge and has 2 other seating area. It looks small when you enter. 
The washrooms are so tight. I'm small and I had to squeeze into the stall to close it.
Food:
Food is 10/10 so so good. Very flavourful! My fav dishes there are the Pad gro and the Pad see ew thick noodles. The prices definitely went up $19+ a dish is pretty high.  When you do take out you get more food I noticed.
I took off one star for the wait times and the prices are quite high.

I found myself unexpectedly alone for 8 hours in Toronto. Thai food sounded great and the reviews on Yelp were good, so I decided to try Pai Northern Thai Kitchen. It was packed, but since I was solo, I was able to be seated quickly. It was delicious! Service was wonderful! I absolutely loved the whole experience. The staff and ambiance were welcoming and fun.

I was craving Thai food during my recent visit to Toronto and had Pai come up on a few searches. I was in the area and decided to come by. It's a nice location with great decor. Our server was mostly nice but also felt a bit awkward with the service. We started with spring rolls. They mention mushrooms are in it and I asked him whether it was small bits a lot of mushroom. He said small bits. I'm not a big fan of mushrooms so I wanted to double check. We ordered the spring rolls, vegetable pad Thai, and a Thai iced tea. 
The spring rolls were mostly mushroom so the server's information was not entirely accurate. Nonetheless I had them and the dipping sauce was pretty good. The Thai iced tea was very fragrant and overly sweet so struggled to drink it. The pad Thai was pretty good. It was a generous portion with a good amount of vegetables. The curry smelled so good that I instantly regretted not trying it. Maybe on my next visit!

My friends and family kept raving about Pai, so I finally had the chance to give it a go. Reservations were full, but we were able to get a walk-in table within 15 minutes on a Thursday night around 6pm. Despite it being a bit early and a weeknight, it was quite busy. They have a lineup outside to put you on the wait-list and check your vaccination status during COVID times. Service was very good overall! 
We ordered lots of appetizers and three entrees to share. The entrees weren't really it for me (someone in our party who has been here before did say that their food quality changed that night, so maybe they were just busy?) but the apps were really great!! I especially recommend their grabong and moo ping. I had their chicken khao soi and it was a bit dry... Their Thai iced tea was great  though!
Overall, prices are a little pricier than other Thai places, but their food and service make up for it! Definitely a go-to if you're in the area or visiting Toronto.

One of the best Thai food I have ever had and I'm a Thai food lover! Tried their pad Thai and the khao soi-- too good, definitely coming back for one more meal during my current trip. 
Note to the management- Perhaps you can have a reservation system, that could save a lot of people a lot of time and going and checking out other places.

I'm from LA. Thai food is an abundance there. This place is solid. Very busy. We waited almost an hour and we got there at 3pm. The food is great. Everything tastes decently good. Everything was well prepared and flavorful. Was it amazing? Not really. If I lived nearby, I would eat it often but it's nothing to come back to Toronto for. The service wasn't great. They're nice but they seemed to forget about us. We had to go after them for things and to order instead of them checking in on us. 
Tom yum soup (3/5; very average)
Garlic chicken bites (3/5; very crispy)
Tofu bites (4/5)
Pad gra prow spicy with crispy pork (5/5; flavorful; the crispy pork is eh)
Pad see yew shrimp (5/5; no complaints)
khao pad Baan nok chicken (3/5; average)
Thai tea (3/5; average)

I really used to love this place.
the prices recently have gone way up, I got order for takeout. It was ready when they promised, took about 40 minutes. 
I got massaman curry with chicken. It came out to 20$ before tax and tip!!! 
The food was underwhelming, the sauce did not have much flavour. For someone who is sensitive to spicy food, this was very bland.

When I moved to Toronto and was asking around about Thai food, this was the place that I kept hearing about. It was hyped up to be the best Thai food around.
Toronto has a lot of good Thai food and picking a favourite is not easy. I can't say I have done an exhaustive comparison either, but I can say that this place lived up to the hype. Everything we ordered was great. Not a single item missed the mark for my taste buds. All of those enchantic flavours of spice, sour, and sweet that Thai food combines so perfectly were very satisfying.
I heard the backstory of the couple that started Pai and their Thai food empire in Toronto. Given how good this place was, I am not surprised. Thanks for letting everyone experience these wonderful flavours.

This is the place I go to when I have tourist friends coming to Toronto. Pai has great vibes, drinks, and food. It has a louder hustle and bustle vibe which gives a more authentic experience. The decor is on point and there's even a table section where you can sit cross legged on pillows on the ground. It's really fun. The food is delicious and you can't go wrong with anything whether it's pad Thai, khao soi, green curry, and squash fritters. Their Thai iced tea is addictive. No reservations so it's always a wait so come during non peak times, if you can. The service is also fantastic. Highly recommend.

Extremely popular Thai restaurant. Highly recommend making a reservation ahead of time or be ready to wait quite a while during dinner time or anytime on weekends.  Their food is always delicious. I personally really like their pad Thai and green curry and fried fish lunch special. This place is quite big inside and has very colourful thai decor inside. Sometimes, it's a bit too loud here to carry a conversation with friends but I think that's just a personal preference.

Love this place!  Brian and I had our first date here.  I started to fall in love with him and I definitely fell in love with Pai!  Living in Los Angeles, now Florida, traveling all over, my fav Seattle Thai place (Thai Tom) was dethroned for Pai Toronto!!!  Incredible food and drinks, great atmosphere, and a consistent line out the door all confirm that Pai is outstanding.  Try the spicy P cocktail... and if fortune shines on you - mango sticky rice is outstanding!
Almost every plate is real Thai authentic. But Khao Soi was modified, I think it's too sweet. But the others are superb. Service and environment are very good. It's worth to wait a long time.

Finally got to try this place and I was glad that I didn't have to line up long to get a table.  The pad Thai was okay. I feel like I can get that anywhere else.  My favorite dish there is actually the khao soi.  The broth was the bomb.

Went to Pai on July 31st and I'm not a Thai food person. However I found this dish tasty, although I had to have it mild. Service was good and food came to the table pretty quickly. Ambiance was kinda hip as well.

We actually vacationed in Toronto to eat here. We had visited once before and when we had a chance to do a spur of the moment trip, we picked Toronto and came back!  
We ate there twice and each time just took suggestions from the bartender and waiter. I bet we have had 80% of the menu and have never had anything we didn't like!
Go, explore all the dishes, and enjoy!  Can't wait yo go back here!

We got here late at 9:30pm on a Saturday night.  A good size restaurant with plenty of seating and a variety of decor, really liked that.  About 70% full, got seated immediately.  A mostly young crowd at that hour.  
We chose only main dishes as the kitchen was closing in less than a half hour.  A Basil Thai stir fry and a Penang curry, neither of which are specific to northern Thailand.  The Penang curry with beef was about average, not enough zing to the sauce, and it was not served hot enough, I let that pass due to the lateness of the hour. The stir fry presented nicely, very colourful, once again though served only lukewarm.  
Wait staff were extremely friendly and professional.  I wish we had ordered something more specific to the North of Thailand like the khao suey and so can only give an average rating to the food due to the taste of the dishes we did order, but give an excellent rating to the ambiance, service and value.  We will return for another taste.
Everything was so delicious.. Finally was able to get into this restaurant. Go early around 5pm! Great good. Great time. Kinda pricier than other Thai places but for once in a while it's good!!
Amazing Thai food! Wait can be a bit long during peak hours and by the time we sat down a couple menu items had already sold out for the day. But service was great and food was incredible!

I only had one night in Toronto and this was where I went for dinner after a friend recommended it. It did not disappoint and I can see why my friend recommended it. The high rating speaks for itself.
I'll be honest, I did little to none when it came to researching this restaurant prior to visiting and I think it made it that much better.
I had no idea what I was getting myself into. This place was definitely interesting, you walk in and head down the stairs to check in. Despite coming on a weekday there was still a 30-minute wait. There was a bar that you could order at while you wait.
The atmosphere made it feel you were transported to a different place. The music was playing loudly but I didn't mind and actually enjoyed the music selection.
Finally was seated and I ordered a Thai tea and pad gra prow. Oh 'em gee, it was so delicious. I wish I could have ordered more but I couldn't fit it all in my tummy. 
The service was good just as much as their food. I would definitely come back if I ever return to Toronto. I actually dream about their food. Ugh Toronto, you guys are quite lucky with this gem.

Such a festive, neon & lively dining experience. Definitely come in with a reservation or be prepared to wait 30+ min (longer if you're more than a party of two). Big plus that you are welcome to warm up at the bar until you get that "your table is ready" text. The Thai mojito is especially aesthetic with the butterfly pea flower & garnishes. The classic Thai iced tea also looked especially delectable. Overall prices are good if not on the higher end, and the food is on the less traditional Thai side.
On to the food: we ordered the papaya salad, Tom yum soup, Khao Soi (very popular dish here) and the garlic tofu. Beautiful plating and quite quick service. The favorite was definitely the Khao Soi - which is was tangy, creamy, soupy and noodly. It comes with your choice of protein. I asked for an extra spicy papaya salad - which is usually my favorite dish - but found the dish to be a little lacking & bland. The shrimp chips were delicious. 
Would definitely come back when visiting again - especially with a group of friends.

Good food! We chose the most classic dishes since we weren't too familiar with Thai cuisine. 
We reserved a month ago before going, but if you go at 12 when they are just open, there are plenty of seats left.

In Toronto for a couple of days and showed up Friday at 6pm with no reservation (four of us). The place was hopping busy! Offered a "community" table and we said absolutely! 20 minutes later we were in! 
I thought $14.00 for three spring rolls was a bit much but we ordered them anyway. They are about THREE times the size of a normal fried spring roll! 
My teens split the kow pod (fried rice) and loved it. I got the Pad ka Prow chicken and it was delicious. Been eating Thai food for 40 years and always order this dish. Hands down Top 5 ever. Flavor was superb, portion was great, and I ordered Thai spicy and it didn't disappoint. 
My wife got the Beef Yum Nuah. She wound have preferred more like juice and fish sauce but it was solid.
This place has it going on! Very cool atmosphere as well!

I arrived at the restaurant and was seated at the bar immediately. The staff was fantastic and helped me choose my dish. 
Enjoyed everything about my dinner at Pai Northern. I had the Pad Gra Pow with fried pork belly, it was the best Thai dish I've ever had. With dinner I enjoyed a ginger beer and for dessert the coconut ice cream. I would come back to Toronto just to eat here!

We had a delicious dinner at Pai after a long day of sightseeing. My group of 5 was able to walk-in and be seated after a short wait. The decor felt like a family restaurant you'd see traveling in Southeast Asia, where I'm from, which made me excited for the meal ahead. 
To start, I ordered the Tea Mac and it was perfect. All the flavor of a thai tea with the buzz of vodka. My group shared the Moo Ping, which was smoky and the right amount of savory and sweet. I had the Gaeng Hunglay as my entreé and wow this was stellar. The pork belly was amazingly tender and the curry was thick and savory. I was also able to try some of my friends dishes and I loved the Pad See Ew and the Khao Soi. 
Overall, this place is a must-try if you like Thai food and want to experience the delicious cuisine of Northern Thailand! Pro Tip: Come after 4pm as there are some items that cannot be ordered before 4pm!
Really nice and sweet place with cute decors and colourful food. Wait time might be long during busy hours.

Some of the best Thai food in town
Service: N/A - ordered food through a delivery app, order was accurate
Food: The Chef Nuit Pad Thai is an almost-perfect balance of sweet, savoury, salty, spicy, and sour, reminiscent of classic Thai cooking. It seems a little bit more tangy and less sweet/spicy than I'd like, but the flavours and ingredients were all there. They didn't skimp on the noodles and sprouts, but they did on the shrimp/protein. The Thai Ice Tea was really strong, but the portion is a bit small for what you pay for (perhaps due to delivery). 
Overall: A great spot for authentic Thai food in the city, definitely try to visit in person!

Food: 4
Decor: n/a
Service: 4
Came here with a work colleague for lunch, but then found out they weren't seating and were only doing delivery. We left and got delivery instead. Place seemed packed for dinner at night.
SPRING ROLLS
Three deep-fried vegetarian wheat paper wraps filled with mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots, and bean sprouts served with a sweet and spicy Thai chilli sauce. (contains gluten)
$13.00
Tasty. Rolls were perfectly fried with a ton of filling. Maybe the best spring roll I've ever had.
KUNG TAWT 'GARLIC SHRIMP'
Six deep-fried, breaded black tiger garlic shrimp (contains oyster sauce) served with a sweet tamarind sauce.
$16.00
Tasty. Shrimp were perfectly fried and went really well with the sauce.
KHAO SOI
Fresh egg noodles in a golden coconut milk curry topped with crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, and your choice of, Braised Beef, Chicken Breast, Shrimp, or Tofu & Veggies (contains shrimp paste). Vegan/Gluten-free available upon request.
$22.00
Pretty good. Opted for the chicken breast, and everything was pretty tasty.
CHEF NUIT PAD THAI
Red-flame stir-fried rice noodles in a house-made tamarind-palm sugar sauce with beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, long leaf coriander, shredded cabbage, fresh lime, and house-roasted peanuts. Choice of Chicken, Beef, Shrimp, or Tofu & Veggies. (contains oyster sauce) Choice of No Spice, Mild, Medium, Farang Spicy, or Thai Spicy. Gluten-free/Peanut-free available upon request.
$28.00 - Chicken & Shrimp
Tasty. One of the best pad thais I've had, and I don't order it often. Ingredients were fresh and complemented each other well.
Service was good, although I wish I knew they weren't seating for lunch that day.

Best meal we had in Toronto! They get sooo busy. The first night we tried to get a table around 9:30 pm but were turned away since there were already 11 other parties waiting to be seated and the restaurant closes at 10 pm. We went the next day at 5 pm and the wait was about 20 minutes. The place was so good, we had to stop by again before we left Toronto! It's a very popular place, so definitely don't go super hungry because there will likely be a long wait. The good thing is that they have a waiting area and you are able to get drinks from the bar while you wait. The service is attentive and efficient. The food takes a very long time to come out. On both occasions we waited 40-50 minutes for our entrees to come out. The wait staff were great about filling waters and keeping us updated on our food status. 
I loved the ambience. It was cozy but didn't feel cramped. For drinks I tried the Lowry (a bit sweet for my liking), cool mule, spicy p (my favorite but was very smoky and spicy), and the tea mac. We ordered the pad thai, pad see ew, and the pad phet chicken. All were very flavorful and good portion sizes. 
Will most definitely be visiting Pai again the next time I am in Toronto!
Phenomenal , I had the kho soi it was delectable , service was great and friendly. This pace lives up to the hype and is worth the wait.

Overall the service was good. We did have to wait a bit but not too long. The food wasn't bad, a little too salty for my liking but taste-wise, while not authentic it's not bad. We ordered shrimp chips, stir-fry seasonal vegetables, pad Thai, pad gra prow and pad see ewe. The server was very friendly and accommodating.

First place we ate on a trip to Toronto and we were so pleased! The vibe is so unique, like an underground restaurant! We were lucky to come at a time that it wasn't crowded so we sat right away. We enjoyed a pot of tea that was served promptly. We had the spring rolls that came out in like 30 seconds! They were perfectly crispy and fresh! The sauce was a perfect match for them too. I am a big pad Thai fan so when in Canada, that's what I got and I was so happy with my choice! The portion was great, not too much and not too little. The beef was perfectly cooked, the noodles were light and tasted fresh. The ingredients came together perfectly! I got medium spicy because i am usually disappointed that it's not spicy enough. This was a perfect level of heat for me, made my nose run but it was so good! My mom got the PAD PHET CHICKEN and enjoyed it. She was unsure what to get and took a shot in the dark but was happy with her choice. She felt it was a little on the spicy side, although she was told it wouldn't be but she still liked it. We are so pleased that our hotel recommended this location! We may even be back before we head back to the US.

Good place, but it is certainly overhyped and not worth waiting over 30 mins for. No complaints as I've always enjoyed the food here. However, there are plenty of Thai restaurants that are just as good if not better.
Excellent food! Great ambiance, good service. The drinks were as good as the food. Big portions. Parking is a challenge. But other than that is was a great experience. Definitely will come again.

Made reservations for uptown but decided to take a chance with a ealk-in for 2 at their Duncan location. We were so lucky and only waited 5mins for our table. Great service from the host and our server! Very attentive and our server seemed so happy as he smiled a lot. 
We tried:
Lobster pad thai
Eggrolls
Tom yum soup
Khao Soi w/ shrimp and tofu
Thai iced tea
Singha beer 
Everything was AMAZING!!
Very nice lunch option for convention goers.  Tasty options hard to decide on lunch but we all enjoyed our meal
Amazing restaurant. Couldn't get how full the place was after only being open ten minutes and we didn't have to queue or wait to seat down. Lots of options. Great dining experience. Great food.

Food was incredible 
As a tourist I felt welcomed and at home
Folks behind the bar steered me in the right directions for food and drinks, both of which were home runs 
Loved the atmosphere- busy and loud to make it interesting but not overwhelming. Get there early because there is (apparently) always a line out the door - no different for my visit!

Amazing food!  Everything we ordered was delicious!  The servers are very friendly and helpful if you can't decide what to get.  We wanted to order everything!!  The bartenders were awesome!  Definitely a must go eatery!

Definitely worth a visit if you're in Toronto! The food was delicious, the service was amazing, and I LOVE LOVE LOVED the decor/vibes here. Our server was wonderful and since we were from out of town, we decided to order the fan favorites according to our server. They were: Pad Thai, Khao Soi and the Green Curry. All of them were delicious! We also ordered the Grabong which was surprisingly my favorite dish (menu description - freshly shredded buttercup squash fritters lightly coated in red curry paste batter, deep-fried and served with a sweet garlic tamarind dip with peanuts) because the flavors and texture were wonderful!

Ordered:
Thai Chicken Wings - 1/2lb (~CAD$10): 4 fried chicken wings topped with crispy shallots, magrud lime leaves, and crispy chillies with a sweet tamarind sauce
Pad See Ew with Chicken (~CAD$20): stir-fried hand-cut rice noodles with sweet soy sauce, Chinese broccoli, and egg
Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Beef (~CAD$20): red-flame stir-fried rice noodles in a house-made tamarind-palm sugar sauce with beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, long leaf coriander, shredded cabbage, fresh lime, and house-roasted peanuts; mild spice
Thai Iced Tea (~CAD$20)
Aya's take:
When I tell you we (party of 2) waited a whole hour to eat here - I am not joking. For a Sunday evening, it was insanely busy and unfortunately you had to go in, put your name down, and then wait around to receive a text. Despite that, I'm here to tell you it was worth it! After an hour of staring at and salivating over the menu waiting for a table, we knew what to order right away. The Thai Chicken Wings were sticky, crispy, and aromatic. What a great way to start the meal. Both noodle dishes were phenomenal. The Pad See Ew was smokey, sweet, and fresh. The Pad Thai was loaded with beef and had an unbelievable depth of flavors. There was a tad too many beansprouts but overall, that wasn't too distracting. The Thai Iced Tea was sweet, creamy, and balanced out the spices and richness of the dishes. I completely understand the hype around Pai and why it was so busy on a Sunday night. My only complaint would be the wait time, but the food is well worth a visit!

We decided to get dinner at PAI Northern Thai Kitchen on a Tuesday after work.  We arrived around 5:15 PM and was at first told that there would be a 30-minute wait for a table.  
As we were adding our name to the wait list, a waitress informed the hostess that there was a cancellation, and a table was now available and somehow were immediately seated.  I'm not sure how that happened, but it worked out well.
On entering the restaurant, we noticed that although it was very busy and somewhat nosily, the dining area was well decorated had a good ambiance.  After being seated, we were informed that we had a 90-minute time limit, which was fine as we did not plan on lingering after eating.
We ordered the following:
1X Northern Thai Platter
1 X Khao Soi with Beef
1 X Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Chicken
The Northern Thai Platter was well prepared and well presented and was a good way to sample several of the appetizers that are offered.  The Pad Thai was authentic, but a bit ordinary compared to the other dishes.  The Khao Soi was the standout dish and had a very silky, yet thick and satisfying broth with a good server of noodles.
Overall, the service was very good (especially since we did not have to wait to be seated), the food was delicious, authentic, well presented and well prepared with fresh ingredients.  I would definitely return again and order the Khao Soi.

This has got to be our best Thai experience in Canada. It compares to some really great Thai we've eaten in Philly (Chabba) and in Amsterdam. It's a busy place but we got our table in half hour. They put you on wait-list and text you when your table is ready. In the meantime, you can check out the PAI story and other cool things on the wall.
The waitress did mention that none of the items are spicy but brought us their hot oil which is very flavorful. We had their signature green curry which was definitely the highlight. Do dig in to the coconut and scrape the tender coconut and eat it too! We also got their noodles which was great. The amount of protein and in general their quantity is pretty generous. I would think they're decently priced, not too bad for the area especially because the quantity is so good. Taste totally hits the spot.
Service is pretty great too. We were seated next to the toilets at first and asked to be moved and they obliged immediately even though they're really busy.
Decor is so bright and beautiful with all the hanging lanterns. You don't feel like you're in a dingy basement. It's pretty vibrant and loud.
We are going to keep coming back when we have Thai cravings.

Visiting Toronto and was told this place is one of the best Thai restaurants in North America.  Well it's it good, but maybe not that good.  Great location, nice atmosphere and pretty good service.  Make sure you arrive early or be prepared to wait.  We arrived at 5 md had no problem but by the time we left a line was out the door.  Best dish we hadn't the table were the wings!!

Funky & Delicious! Great food and atmosphere, with lots of Thai options that include different tastes, textures and spice levels. I would highly recommend it if you are going out with a group, or wanting to impress someone with a delicious dinner. Not the place to go for a quiet dinner, but there are enough private areas. Be forewarned, the wait times can be quite long as it's so popular.

It's Pai - you know it's gonna be good! My all time favourite Thai place in Toronto. I will always keep coming back. The only reason I don't come back as often as I'd like is that it's hard to get reservations and it's really popular so I don't want to wait in line most of the time. Make sure to come early if you're doing walk in. 
My top two favourites are the beef salad (so flavourful) and the pad Thai (so delicious). The pad thai is seasoned so well, I can't eat any other pad thai in Toronto.
The soup was so good we shared everything and I forgot to take a picture before we got the food. It's my first time here but this place is a must go to

My friend recommended this place and the hotel staff of the hotel I stayed at all gushed about how "life changing" this place was. They weren't wrong. The unique decor transports you to another world upon entering the restaurant, but make sure you come early to wait for a table--they're always packed! You only get 90 minutes to eat your dinner because of how crowded they are.
Pad see ewe: Noodles are cooked perfectly al dente and there's a very healthy mouthful of veggies with every bite. Not as much "smokiness" as I'm used to from other Thai places, but it definitely holds it's own.
Khao soi: This was a favorite at our table. What's not to love? Deliciously coconutty broth to impart a mellow savoriness that lingers on the tongue. Quite a dish for the taste buds.
Tom yum soup: Yet another dish that makes your taste buds sing. Very rich, vibrant flavor to the point of almost too savory (LOTS of fish sauce) but I love that it's more flavor and less "sour" as most inauthentic tom yums tend to be made.
Papaya salad: lots of tiny shrimp and freshness. I really liked the shrimp chips (peppery!) and pork rinds that come with this dish. Mix those and the noodles with the salad and you've got yourself a textural treasure. 
Pad thai: I saved the best for last--my personal favorite of the bunch. The noodles are again, made perfectly and the sauce is slightly sweet without being overly so. They probably put a healthy amount of crack in there as well because I kept going back for more. Amazing must-have!
Overall, this is a place every tourist and local alike must experience if they are ever in the area. It's worth the wait!

Sadly we did not get a chance to dine-in, due to a 1.5 hour wait, but we did order takeout.  There's a designated waiting area for takeout orders, which made the 30 minute wait acceptable.  We were told by locals to try the Khao Soi, which we had never tried or heard of before.  We were not led astray, because that was the BEST Thai dish I've tasted.  I wish we could have experienced it at the restaurant itself, but it was still out of this world!  I'm hoping the next time we're in Toronto, we'll get a chance to. The 4-stars is for not being able to review the service/dine-in experience, otherwise a 5-star.

I've heard great things about Pai so I've been wanting to go. We had to wait for a while because it was a weekend but IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT. We loved everything we ordered and they were well-priced given the serving. I still can't stop thinking about the papaya salad and pork skewer--definitely order that when you go!
If you go with friends, order (almost) everything on the menu and share so you can have a taste of every dish. I will definitely go back and won't stop raving about this restaurant!

A must visit place but try to go for lunch or there is a long wait for approximately 30-50 minutes.
The food is just delicious, got to give this a try. 
The service is great and super quick as well.

Rubbish, irresponsible restaurant. Ordered two dishes with protein as chicken. One dish had chicken and was way lesser in quantity. The khao soi was given with beef instead of chicken.
