And was way more in quantity. It looked like they were trying to get rid of some old stuff and just dumped a ton of it. These guys can't even take basic directions and shows how lightly they take customers' preferences

Yum! Stopped by for some Thai food and was not disappointed! Definitely make a reservation because there was a huge line during lunch time. 
Got the Thai chicken wings as an appetizer. Three fried chicken wings topped with crispy shallots, lemongrass, and crispy chillies with a sweet tamarind sauce ($6). Definitely nice and crispy. 
For the main, I got the shrimp green curry ($19.50) which came with jasmine rice. Green curry with bamboo shoots, makrut lime leaves, basil leaves, and coconut milk. Topped with Thai basil and red pepper. Loved the presentation - the curry came in the coconut and also in a bowl - there was so much food! 
My friend got the Tom yum soup and it was also served with rice. It was quite big so she got half packed to go!

This is the best Thai restaurant I've ever been to outside of Thailand! It's super authentic and yummy! Highly recommend! There's two different locations, one in downtown core and one midtown but they are both busy so honestly does not matter which one you go to. It is faster if you plan in advance and make a reso or are willing to sit at the bar but otherwise it's generally a 30 to 45 minute wait. It's interesting because you go in and initially it looks like a small place but it actually opens up  to multiple rooms so its actually a large spot. It's decor reminds me of Thailand too! 
I would recommend the khao soi which is a soup based dish that is rich in flavour. You can choose your protein - chicken, beef or tofu and it comes with egg noodles and condiments on the side to make it as spicy as you wish. The crispy and soft egg noodles with the coconut mild flavoured spicy sauce is just "chefs kiss" . There was also lots of beef added to mine which was fresh and yum. 
Had the coconut sorbet for dessert which was lots of coconut ice cream in a legitimate coconut haha so you could also scrape the sides and eat some fresh coconut at the end. Great dessert to share - kinda impossible to finish on your own haha

Went to the downtown location of Pai for the first time! The door was on the left of the exit door which was kind of weird but cool. At first we were pretty confused on how to enter, until a delivery driver pointed it out! We reserved a table a month in advance since that was the only slot available at the time. 
We dined in on Sunday 28th, 2022. As we walked in, it became quite clear that this was a very popular spot! It was quite packed, as expected for a Sunday evening.
We followed the waiter to a very dark and small seating area. We requested to be seated elsewhere but were told with a very unremorseful tone that there are no other tables available. However, there was a table that remained empty the entire time we were at the restaurant. To add, the service from the waiters were pretty slow. We had to call the server just to order and call them to get any refills of water and to get the bill. None of them approached the table to ask how the meal was going or how things were going, but this was not the same for other tables, maybe because we were a young couple they thought it was okay to not pay as much attention to us! 
Despite the depressing environment and service, we thought the food was pretty decent! We got three starters to try: the skewers (moo ping), the garlic shrimp and the tom yom soup. The garlic shrimp was our favorite and the tom yom soup was our least liked one. The garlic shrimp was so tasty and cooked to perfection and the tom yom soup was too oily and a bit spicy. Skewers were chewy but pretty good!
For our main dish we chose the pad thai and the chicken Gaeng Panang curry. Both were really good! 
Overall, we would rate our experience 6.5-7/10.

Pros: large waiting area
Cons: waiting for mediocre food
Came here for a late lunch (3pm on a Saturday) and the place was packed! For a table of 2, I had to wait for 30 minutes. They have a big waiting area with seats and a standing table so you don't need to wait in the cold.
I ordered the papaya salad, (6) chicken wings, and khao soi. Chicken wings and noodle soup came out warm, but on the cold side warm. Chicken wings had a bitter after taste. I was expecting the khao soi to be bigger from pictures and price point. The $19 noodle soup didn't have a generous portion. Papaya salad was pretty good, but the dried shrimp was a bit tough to eat. I would recommend shredding it and combining it to the dish. 
Menu: 
https://www.paitoronto.com/menu/pai-menu?

Whenever I spend a night out in downtown Toronto we always want to eat Thai food. This city has some of the best restaurants. We dropped by here around 6pm and there was a waiting list. You can request to be seated at the bar if you like the bar vibe.
As you walk through the restaurant you will smell the aromatic curries, pad thai, noodle dishes,  fried squash fritters, spring rolls, etc. The Northern Thai platter looked so yummy. I will definitely order that next time.
We ordered the Khao Soi and Gaeng Massaman. Khao Soi is fresh egg noodles in a golden coconut milk curry. It was just a bit too salty for my liking but I really enjoyed the curry broth. The protein  of choice was beef brisket. There's also crispy deep fried noodles served on top kind of like garlic bread with pasta. 4/5
Gaeng massaman is a peanut tamarind curry also with choice of protein or tofu veggie. The curry had a little sweet kick to it. The rice was wrapped in banana leave and served on the side.  The serving of rice should be bigger as most of us like to pour some curry on top of the rice. Otherwise the dish was pleasing for the palate . 4/5
Service was exceptional we didnt have to wait for a table as we were given a seat at the bar. The bartender and servers were all friendly and attentive. They asked me if I needed help with the menu.  He was able to explain some of the dishes to me on the menu. Menu are scanned by phone using QR codes. 
Next time I will study the menu and pick out my next dish I want to try. There are so many options to choose. If you want to take a trip to street food in Northern Thailand give this place a try you won't regret it.
One of the best Thai spots in Toronto! Great ambiance, terrific service. Would recommend to anyone!!!!!

We went here with high expectations we ordered the Khao Soi and Pad Thai, the Khao Soi was great but the Pad Thai was not anything special, and they did not take cash., still willing to give it another try

It was our first time at Pai. I was interested in visiting this restaurant as I follow them on Instagram and I really appreciate their history and the chef Nuit's passion for cooking.
We went on a Saturday for lunch and we didn't have a reservation. When we arrived there, the receptionist told us it would take two minutes to get a table ready for us. And it took less than that.
The receptionist took us to our table and I really liked the place. It was like we were walking through a street in Thailand. The tables are not so close one from another, so you have enough space to walk enjoying the decoration, without bumping in others chairs. I really liked the washroom area. It was super clean and there were a lot of private washrooms  with a toilet and a sink in each one of them. You could enter, close the door and take your time without others pressing you to hurry up.
We ordered Chef Nuit Pad Thai and the food was delicious.  It was a perfect balance of flavors, the sweetness, the spiciness and the coriander flavor. By the end of the meal we were planning our next visit.
I'd recommend it as a nice place to go with friends, family, or a partner.

Ordered the chicken khao soi and wow - it was as delicious as I've read about it. The presentation was amazing, coming with sides of chili, limes and pickles. I only wish I could eat this noodle dish more frequently. Highly recommend for anyone, especially if you haven't had northern Thai food before. Place was pretty crowded so recommend making a reservation. Service was super friendly and on top of everything.
Maybe I am spoiled by great Thai place in the Chicago area but this place was not bad for middle of Wyoming Thai.

***4.5 Stars***
Chef Nuit does it again. I've been to the old SukhoThai restaurants, but this was my first time trying out Pai.
Granted I got take-out, but the food was still good. Ordered the Thai wings, Chicken Pad Thai, Chicken Green Curry, Spring Rolls and a Shrimp Tom Yum.
The online ordering process was easy and food was prepared in a timely manner. It is on the pricier side, for Thai food, but quality is definitely up there. 
I would return for a dine-in experience.

PAI IS MY FAV RESTAURANT IN TORONTO. thats my statement. They deserve all the fame and high ratings in my opinion :)
most recently visit of mine was a weekend lunch, we ordered pad gra prow, pad thai, grapong (fried squash fritter) , GAENG HUNGLAY ( curry with braised oxtail) and ofc some thai tea.
1. pad gra prow is my go to, you cant believe how much money I spent on this on delivery platform. the best is to add crispy pork to it, it is soooooo good. best i have ever had.
2. the fritter is A LOT, it might get greasy after a while but when you have a big group, it is such a good snack to share when you are waiting for main dishes
another thing which i always order, its their papaya salad with dried shrimp. OH MY GOD, please try it. the fish sauce, the crackers, the pork rinds and the shrimp, with the papaya, its like a huge party on your tongue. 
they have so many good dishes, its hard to order something bad here. only tip i have to give here is, please go there early for dinner for lunch whatever, they are SOOOOOO busy.

I love Thailand and Thai food! This place is incredible for the good vibes and great food. I felt like I was back in Thailand because of the ambiance. I got the prettiest mocktail! For starters we got the grabong. It was a dish i've never had but was advised it was a best seller. I would definitely get it to start again. The crispness and sweet sauce really made the dish.
I got the Shrimp Pad Thai as my main and loved it. I got it Thai spicy and boy was it spicy! Authentic and very flavorful. I will definitely be back!

Wow, what a find! Make sure you plan your reservations a few days before, because you do not want to miss this one. We ended up with a last minute reservation for a 4pm dinner, and I'm so glad we took it! 
I'm an avid lover of all things "Thai-food" and this place did not disappoint!
From the perfectly cooked noodles, to the steamed rice delivered wrapped in a banana leaf, to the green curry served hot in a fresh coconut, we were thrilled with every aspect of our meal. 
I also recommend the drinks... The Thai mojito was a fun twist on the classic. 
The tom yum soup was a delicious starter and prepped us for the spice level of the dishes to come... Yes, it's spicy (maybe even VERY spicy), but I wouldn't have it any other way.  
Definitely recommend and will return next time I'm in Toronto.

Service was great - attentive and quick. The wait was long - nearly an hour for 2 people on a weeknight. The mango slaw and sai ua were excellent, but neither the khao soi nor the pad Thai were anything to write home about.

An easy 4.5 stars. 
One of the best Thai restaurants I've been to outside of Thailand.
We sampled the Green Curry, Panang Curry, Pad Thai, Moo Ping, Chicken Wings and Tom Yum soup. 
I'm not going to go through a play by play. Everything was fantastic and I would put your fate in their hands. Order anything on the menu. You won't be disappointed.

Pai is a well known thai place in Toronto! Highly recommend to make reservations. If not expect to wait for a long time to be seated.
Covid vaccine proof is required to dine in! Have your ID and vaccine copy handy (digital or card).
We made a reservation and got seated right away. Their menu specializes on northern thai food along with classic thai dishes. We started off with drinks which i highly recommend, very refreshing. 
We got their fried rice, pork curry, chicken stir fry. The food came in quick and was delicious. A bit pricey but seems to be the norm in Toronto. 
Highly recommend checking them out!

Beautiful restaurant interior with soaring ceilings and south east Asian street decor. Food was very tasty and they had a variety of alcoholic drinks I will need to come back to try. Server was nice and provided good recommendations as the item I originally wanted to order was out of stock. I do recommend making a reservation in advance as it can get very busy in the evenings. Save room for dessert!

Make a reservation and enjoy the food. There's a reason why this place is always packed! 
I went with a few friends and sampled the Northern Thai Appetizer platter, shrimp chips, and had the pad gra prow. I wanted to try the Pad see ew and the coconut dessert but unfortunately both were sold out when I was here. 
I was honestly surprised that laab was on the menu, but it was great to see the authentic meals! I will be back for sure to try more dishes :)
We heard this is the best in Toronto.  We had a great time.  The food was very authentic and is also a very hip place.
Authentic, flavorful Northern Thai cuisine. Modern ambiance and friendly service make it a standout dining experience.

This restaurant exudes rustic charm, offering a captivating ambiance perfect for a memorable dining experience. The soothing music complements the inviting decor, making it an ideal setting for gatherings with friends or family. The perpetual 30-minute wait for a table is a testament to its popularity. The menu showcases expertly crafted Thai dishes, each a flavorful delight using fresh, high-quality ingredients. The staff's efficient and friendly service adds to the overall appeal. Despite the wait, this culinary gem delivers an authentic Thai experience, making it a must-visit for those seeking exceptional cuisine and ambiance.

On my hunt to find the best Thai food in the GTA, I've finally had the chance to try Pai.
Now, I wasn't expecting it to be as large as it was, looks can be deceiving, you turn the corner inside and there's a full seating area which can be restaurant on its own. Reservations highly recommended as by around 5:30 it was filling up fairly quickly.
Once inside, there are lanterns hanging from the ceiling, wall art, seating included everything from high top, to bench's & tables.
The menu had a variety of options. The squash fritters were a tad bit hard, the garlic chicken was a bit overcooked to my liking, with each bite, I could taste the oil.
The Green curry was served in a coconut which was fascinating. They also provided a small bowl of extra curry.  This was very  tasty, rich of earthy flavours, served with rice in a leaf.
kaosoi, was also very flavourful.
Oh boy, when they say Thai hot, they aren't a kidding that will set anyone's mouth on fire.
Even though it was as busy as it was, our food arrived almost immediately, the server was attentive and we had everything we needed quickly.
Overall, I can see the hype! I will be back to try the Panang
Great food, popular place, always crowded but worth the wait. Great ambiance too! Good place to go for first dates or friend catch-ups

Definitely come here for great food, drinks, and a great social atmosphere. Prepare for 15-20 minute wait because it is very popular but the staff is super friendly and attentive. The ambiance is comfortable, fun photos, and sayings to keep you occupied during the wait or entertained because there's something to catch your attention on every turn. My friend and I enjoyed all the flavors our appetizers had to offer. Thank you for an enjoyable experience in Toronto!

Excellent food
Tried pad thai, Khao sol, spring roll
Wait time is a bit long
and restaurant is cramped and run down, but will visit it due to quality of food!

Very good food. 
Shrimp chips, khao soi, pad gra prow, and the khao pad baan nok are a must try. 
Good vibes and good service. 
The food and the ambiance will make you come back again and again

Best pad thai I have had, restaurant was also such a cool vibe, service was super friendly and everyone seemed like they were genuinely enjoying working there, which is really cool. Would highly recommend if you are a Thai food lover!
Food was well 'seasoned ' the cost was reasonable given its downtown. Authentic Thai (I worked in Bangkok for about  6 months) very busy

Those 3400 Yelpsters who gave 4.5 stars couldn't be more right as our dining experience after my using Open Table to book a reservation that same day only to discover when I arrived had made it for the wrong location. The place was packed with a separate queue waiting to score a seat. Fortunately the hostess handled my mistake and we were seated within 15 mins. I can best describe Pau Northern as a hip place for some amazing home cooked Thai food. The place is loud and vibrant with locals and tourists wanting to try some of their amazing dishes. We loved everything with the exception of the beef skewers as they were slightly on the dry side compared to the chicken skewers which were fantastic. Papaya salad was great but the two white noodles curled up on the side of this dish like when a cat curls up when taking a nap were mixed with salad which caused them to be too wet. The shrimp chips were used as a scoop to place the ingredients in which were then eaten in this manner. Both the Pad Thai with chicken and the Pad Gra Prow were super with a slight nod to the latter. And of course, one cannot leave without having the mango sticky rice. 5 solid stars and special thanks to our host and server who made our dining experience special.

Ate here a couple years ago pre-pandemic on the recommendation of a friend- grabbed take out again recently and was transported back- PAI IS GOOD! The flavors are complex and they were super efficient and quick for takeout (even though I got quoted a much longer wait, it was ready in like 15 minutes at peak dinner time..) 
They have a LONG wait for dinner. I suggest you just grab takeout and enjoy at home.

An authentic experience for some hard to find thai dishes. 
Reservations recommended but walking also possible with a little wait. The venue is quite big so they can churn out new seatings fast. 
They have your typical Thai dishes but also some unique dishes that you won't find at other Thai restaurants. The Chiangmai beef noodle soup had an excellent broth but the beef was a little tough. The beef salad was reasonable. The pad krow pow was excellent and they also gave up some fresh peppers to adjust the spicyness to our desired level. Massaman curry hit it out of the park. Pandan cake was fluffy and not too sweet which is what I like. 
It took a little to get out entree but the waiter did apologize but we had our huge glasses of Sapporo to bud the time. Overall it's a low end 5* just making it pass the 4 mark.

The Green Curry is my Thai go to dish for new places, and this one did not disappoint! Plus it came in a coconut! Nice touch. Servers and bar tenders were kind and interesting. Also very unique and cool atmosphere.

Excellent quality Thai dishes! The only reason I'll give it a 4/5 is because the popularity of the restaurant results in long wait times and slow service. My favorites are the pad thai and pad ga prow!

Wowza - the most fantastic Thai food in a long long long time.  Took me back to the streets of Bangkok and Koh Samui.
The pork skewers were to die for. Tom yum hit the spot - can't wait to come back on a cold winter night and chug it!!  The pork and basil - woah!  Been hunting for this since my last Thai trip a few years back.  Found you and not only am I having some tonight but getting one more portion packed for tomorrow.  
Drinks are spot on.  Had the spicy p - ok had three.  Fantastic.
Service is so so good - super friendly people, very fast service.  
Ambiance is amazing - the space looks super welcoming while being super modern.  Crowd skews younger but that could have been because we went super late.  It's noisy without being loud.  Definitely a place to put on the regular rotation.

Went on a Wednesday night,  Had to wait a few minutes for a table. Waited at the bar, and ordered some drinks. Bartender Zavier was friendly and attentive. We were sat down shortly after. Our waitress was a sweetheart. She was patient and went over the menu with us. She gave us great recommendations. Even though the place was lively and packed it felt intimate. This restaurant has such a great vibe, such a unique atmosphere. I felt like we stepped into another dimension. Nothing like the cold night it was in the city. Honestly we had a great time from the moment we stepped in till we walked out. The staff is welcoming. The food is delicious and full of flavor. We ordered the Pad Gra Prow. The egg was fried perfectly. The spice was Worth it. We loved our time here. This checks off all the boxes for a great time. From date night to drinks with friends to a cozy night out. Would recommend to everyone !

A friend from the area recommended this place as a good Thai restaurant, and we really enjoyed it! We arrived around 5, thinking we beat the dinner rush (which we did), but still had to wait 15 minutes for a table. By the time we got our table, the line to put your name down was out the door and down the street, so this place is definitely a busy one! The waiter told us that by the time they open at 4 pm, there's already a line outside. 
I can definitely understand why people are willing to wait for this! They had your normal Thai favorites and a lot of additional options to pick from. We went with the Khai Soi with tofu and the Pad Gra Prow with shrimp, which were both very good. Personally if I were to go back and could only order one of the two, I would go with the Pad Gra Prow, but it is a really close race. The Pad Gra Prow's rice was cooked perfectly well, with the right amount of seasoning to go with the entire dish. They were very generous with their portions, which made up for their higher than expected prices. The Khai Soi was also very flavorful and creamy. It was the perfect flavor blend for a curry, with a good amount of noodles to go with every bite of soup. 
Overall, the meal was extremely good, but a little pricier than expected. I would highly recommend trying out this place!
Food and staff were great, the ambience was very cool. My kids loved it, made me a super hero for sure. Thank you
Great food,m especially the pad Thai and I highly recommend it for a meal with friends or family.

We werent sure if we'd be seated since we didnt have reservations. It was our luck and glad for it because everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dish. We were seated at a high table for 6 and since there was only 4 of us, we said we didnt mind if 2 additional ppl were seated at the table later, which dis happen. Its was busy and while I didnt particularly like the decor it wasnt horrible and there was a welcoming vibe by the staff.

PAI was highly recommended by numerous friends, and it did not disappoint! My friend and I arrived around 4:45pm to beat the crowd, and were seated within minutes. We tried their famous sweet milk tea, the green curry served in a coconut, the tender beef skewers, the pad thai, the rice served and wrapped in the leaf, as well as the coconut sherbet! My favourites were definitely the skewers and the green curry! The pad thai would have been perfect if only they cracked an egg in there haha (just my personal opinion!). Service was friendly and efficient. Would highly recommend!

amazing food! gluten friendly 
vegetarian friendly...Great to bring family. 
little loud 
service excellent

Idk if it's a Canada thing, but on top of having amazing food, they have the best customer service. I am regrettably a very difficult customer due to my dietary restrictions (pescatarian, always get stuff removed, non-dairy, the list goes on...lol). They made me feel like nothing I asked for was too much, and they were happy to accommodate every need.
Now to the food... Hands down, the near pad Thai I have ever had. Thai food is one of my favorite types of food, and I live in LA. I have been to most, if not all, the best spots in town. Mind you, I have never been to Thailand. It tasted like nothing I have ever had before. The tofu and vegetables were cooked to perfection. Heat and temperature levels were perfect. Flavor was on point. It also had a barbecue taste to it that's hard to explain. Overall, amazing.
I also had the spring rolls. Those were amazing as well. Very basic but still one of the best spring fried rolls I have ever had, if not the best.
I also ordered the khao soi to go, for me to try later. This is one of my favorite Thai dishes (my other is pad Kee mao, which they didn't have). I was disappointed :(. The tofu was hard, and the food was barely Luke warm. Some of the vegetables were warm, and some were actually cold. The flavor was also lacking. I make khao sou at home and order it at restaurants all the time. It's always amazing and very flavorful. I was shocked that it wasn't good. One thing to note is that they brought out my order to eat there, and I told them I ordered it to go, but requested a bowl so I could try some before I leave. It took another ~10min to bring the food back, and I imagine that is why it tasted the way it did. Very disappointed, but was very satisfied with how they handled and remedied the situation.
I would overall recommend this place. The comments are all true. I see why this is the first restaurant that came up when I searched "best restaurant in Toronto" on Yelp. Well deserved and highly recommended!

I'm struggling to give 4 stars while this place used to be my favorite every time we visited Toronto over the years. Lately I feel the quality of the food has gone down a bit. For starter, lunch is noticeably not as good as dinner. I'm talking about back to back Pad Thai, one ordered during dinner the night before vs the next lunch. But in general it's still a solid place for Chiang mai/northern Thai cuisine. 
What we're ordered in the past:
Gang hunglae (oxtail) --delicious, the sauce is quite close to what I've had in Chiang mai. The oxtail was tender, sadly there wasn't enough meat compared to the soup
Pad Thai-- In general it's very flavorful, nice and dry with beautiful aroma. Plenty of shrimp. Again, lately the presentation and condiments seem a bit downgraded. Still one of the best dishes here
Khao Soy (beef/chicken) --we used to love khao soy here! It was a flavor closest to the original imo years back. Yesterday when we went back I must say it has tasted quite bland and watered down. Generous portion as always. 
Krabong -- solid app, herbs forward and we've always enjoyed this. Wishing they would add more veggies like fried lemongrass /herbs to add to the texture 
Sai oa (northern sausage) --mild flavored, beautiful presentation. I'd like it turned up a notch but I think it's catered to the gen pop well. 
Ambience 5/5 : a bit loud but great atmosphere
Service 4/5 : very nice people, slow service but they try their best. 
Still beat Thai restaurants in Midwest US any day!
Tasty, warm staff, but the heat is adjusted for "falang" meaning non-Thai so while the flavors are there, the heat is missing.  Highly recommended.

Had a long craving for Thai but just couldn't get a table for this one... booked nearly 1 month ahead only to secure a reservation at 5pm!! So "better be good" I thought :D
Turns out the food is quite satisfactory , with amazingly generous portion!! (We two have small stomaches though) would recommend:
Tom Yum Soup -absolutely THE best I've ever had, with this perfect balance of sweetness and sourness
Shrimp chips- cannot afford to miss the homemade  sauce
Other dishes are tasting just fine- the most applauded Pad Thai isn't quite our thing, tasting a bit distant from what we had when traveling to Thailand.  
Oh I need to mention the great service: We found Pad Thai to be slightly spicier than we had expected , and they made a new one outright, with generous beef topping! Would love to go another time - if we ever get a reservation again

We stopped by Pai on a Saturday around 3:45pm. They said it would be a forty-five minute to fifty minute wait, so we decided to explore the neighboring area while we waited. They asked for our name and phone number, and they texted us once they were ready to take us. 
At around 4:30pm, we received a text and then got back in line. Within a few minutes, they sat us down, said there was a 90 minute turn around and told us the menu was available via QR code. You can check out the menu online. 
They also informed us that they take debit or credit but no cash. Our server got to us pretty quickly and we ordered a few things:
Khao Soi with Braised Beef ($20) - tasted like a more liquified red curry. Noodles had a good texture, chewy but not over cooked. Loved the fried egg noodles. I think that was my favorite part. It might've been a bit more appetizing had it been more spicy or if it came with a side of rice. 
Chicken Pad Thai ($20) - a bit on the tangy side, but the ingredients and noodles tasted very fresh. We finished this entree, and I could definitely see myself ordering the Pad Thai for takeout. 
Odd Future IPA ($10) - it first came as a can, so the guy who brought it asked if my husband wanted a glass. The glass, however, didn't look very clean... so he decided not to use it.  It's light for an IPA and a little fruity. Pretty refreshing. 
Thai Iced Tea - I tried to order one in the evening, but the server said they ran out and recommended some other drinks. 
Total came out to be a little less than $70 with tip. All in all, I'd give this place a solid four. Cleanliness could be better, but the food is all around solid. Service is about a 4/5 as well. Definitely a place to stop by if you're in town!

Best Pad Thai I've ever had!
My biggest struggle with Thai food is most dishes have fish sauce and its been a challenge finding restaurants that accommodate for different dietary restrictions.
Through some recommendations I finally got some pad thai for takeout and was pleasantly surprised. The dish was delicious and kept you wanting more. We also got the green curry which was also delicious and included plenty of tofu pieces to keep you full. 
Usually I find most places over do it on the veggies but it was well balanced here and you can see why they're always so busy!
The in restaurant experience is a vibe in its own, so looking forward to doing that the next time I'm in town.
My first meal in Toronto at Pai's, Food is soooo delicious, setting the bar very high for my expectations of the meals I'll be having the next few days.

Always my go to for Thai when in Toronto! 
Loved the service food and ambiance. Glad it's reopened'

Portions are small but flavors are good!
We ordered:Pad Gra Prow, Panang Curry, Squash Fritters, Beef Curry and a few other dishes.
I'd recommend coming early  to avoid the wait.

Been coming here for a a while and it's always been really good but a word of warning it's spicy and very good. I have done takeout mainly, as I like to sit beside my date, rather than across the table from them. Have sat up at the bar and had a margarita and the bartender was very good.

Pai was a bit of discovery and it felt like peeling off onions as we did not realize how big the place was at first. We hung out at the front bar while waiting to be called for our seats then we got to go all the way to the back to realize wait there's another bar :D Despite being a much larger restaurant than we thought, it felt very intimate and private. Service was quick and the server was nice The food was delicious. I enjoyed their Gaeng Massaman and my partner had Pad Thai with Tofu in both. The meals tasted quite good and that smoky flavor to the Pad Thai was on point. My only two complaints was that mine was a very small bowl and I wish it had more peanut flavor which I felt was not very present for a dish that's supposed to highlight peanut as the main ingredient. As far as drinks, I had a Tea Mac be warned it has milk I didn't realize so I broke my veganism for a moment. While I am not hardcore, I'd rather know from the menu because I would have not selected it. My partner had a lemony pepperminty drink that was fresh and enjoyable. Overall we liked our experience. We selected this place spontaneously as I know my partner loves Thai food and it'd be a good place to go on her birthday. We'd go back again for sure!

Meh... I don't get the hype around this place.. the food is oily and soulless, good to fill you up.. The place is loud
The Queen Mother Cafe, located few minutes away has been my 'go to' for the past 20 years, everything on their menu taste fresh and is definitely more authentic... Their Khao Soy Gai and Ping Gai are addictive,  same price range..

Hot spot in town! We had to go.. we landed from US and quickly ran over to put our name in around 6pm'ish on a Wednesday night. Within 45 min our table was ready! Service was excellent and the place was beyond packed! We ordered Thai iced teas both regular and 1 with vodka, yum. We tried papaya salad - it was spicy but good. We also ordered Shrimp Pad Thai and Chicken Pad See Ew (they don't offer beef? Maybe it's not traditional? No clue) - once my mouth was on fire from the delish papaya salad I flagged the waiter and begged him to please notify kitchen not to make the entrees spicy. He agreed and came back to let me know - all is ok!  Not only was it not ok, I had to send back my Pad Thai. Ugh. I hate doing that. Spicy incident aside I'd absolutely recommend this spot! It was close to the hotel and the wait was so worth it overall! The mango rice also looked delish, I'd absolutely want to try that next time!

I've been a fan of Chef Nuit Regular for years (Sukho Thai is my fav), but somehow never made it to Pai. 
An old friend/chef offered to make us reservations and we were so glad he did, as we were seated at the best table in the place with a great view of the restaurant. Ambience was dim and lovely. Service was fantastic. 
We ordered: 
- Gai Satay (so tender!)
- Khao Soi
- Green Curry (served in a coconut)
- Pad Gra Prow
I don't think you could go wrong ordering any item on the menu. Each dish was phenomenal. So many layers of flavour. The absolute best Thai food in Toronto. Truly a gem and a must visit.
Great authentic Thai food. Friendly staff. Prices are commensurate with food quality. Being Michelin-star, this place is indeed highly recommended!

I ordered take out from here and walked over to pick it up and man that line to wait and eat inside was real. I was so glad pick up was easy and quick. I got the Tom yum soup and chicken pad Thai and both were excellent. I finished them both. Prices were reasonable as well. I can see why the spot is so popular.

Great food! Always a pleasure to visit. I ordered their mango salad which was great and refreshing. 
I also ordered their khao soi (amazing as always). You can choose your own spiciness level and be warned it is quite potent! 
Tip: make resos ahead of time .. there is always a super long line up!

An extremely cozy and delicious restaurant with friendly staff! all for a very reasonable price!
The wait may be long usually, but it's worth it. You can even make a reservation via email.

DELISH. Will be back. Restaurant is bigger than it looks. We came on a Saturday for an early dinner (2 people) and were able to get seated right away. The portions were big, definitely recommend sharing family style. The flavors were rich and balanced. We went for the pad see ewe and was surprised at how much they were able to elevate this very common dish!

Pai is hands down my favorite Thai restaurant, and I couldn't recommend it enough. I have ordered from here numerous times since first trying it last winter (2022), and every time has been an absolute delight. The atmosphere of the restaurant is cozy and inviting, and the decor sets the perfect ambiance for an intimate evening out.
One of the main positives of this restaurant is the food - it is absolutely delicious and unlike any other Thai food I have tried. The flavors are unique and exciting, and it is evident that the chefs have a deep understanding of Thai cuisine. Whether you're in the mood for spicy noodles or a curry dish, the food at Pai is always a treat for the taste buds. The drink options are also diverse, and the cocktail menu is especially noteworthy. (although I personally recommend their beer) 
In addition to the food and drink options, the staff at Pai is wonderful. The waiters are friendly, professional, and attentive, and they always make sure that your dining experience is as pleasant as possible. They are knowledgeable about the menu and are happy to make recommendations based on your preferences.
One minor issue to keep in mind is that the wait can be longer than other restaurants, especially during peak hours. It is advisable to sign in or join the waitlist sooner rather than later to avoid any unnecessary delays. Additionally, it's important to note that the spicy level is beyond the normal "hot sauce" spicy. Even if you're usually good with spicy food, I recommend starting with the low - middle level of spice recommendations as the highest level can be very intense.
In conclusion, Pai is a must-visit Thai restaurant for anyone who loves great food, a cozy atmosphere, and wonderful service. From the diverse drink options to the excellent food choices and the friendly and professional staff, the experience at Pai is simply outstanding. I would highly recommend giving it a try and savoring every bite of their authentic and delicious Thai cuisine.

Super authentic and amazing ambiance. I felt transported to a hip restaurant in Thailand right away and we were seated towards the back which was amazing as we saw the entire place which is huge and colorful and brimming with life
Service was good too, normal and busy. 
We got the pad thai and khao soi. Pad Thai was a huge hit. Definite 5/5 especially when getting it Thai spicy. The khao soi could be a bit better with thicker gravy but flavors were amazing so 4/5 for that. 
Mango sticky rice was amazing too. Another 5/5!
Thai ice tea was very good too. Also a 5/5!
Overall super amazing especially with the ambiance.

This place is home to the best Thai curry I've
ever had! (And I've had a lot lol)
I went out to their restaurant for the first time
and was surprised by how beautiful and cozy
the interior was. Laterns decorated the ceilings,
there were 3 separate rooms for seating and of
course, a great selection of dishes.
I had the Mussaman curry which I've had delivered before but having it in house takes it to another level! I also really appreciated the authentic wrapping of the rice, it was a nice touch.
I can't say enough great things about their food
you seriously just have to try it out for yourself.

Probably some of the most flavorful Thai food I've ever had. And Thai one of my favorite cuisines. Ordered tom yum ( not pictured 5/5), a chicken khaki soi and a tofu Khoi soi ordered, panang curry, pad Thai and chefs special stir fry! The dishes were unique and very vegetarian vegan and gluten free friendly! Their chilli oil also consisted of flavors that balance the heat but still maintained the kick which made it addicting! The reviews are NOT deceiving as some places can be in big citY restaurants! Def going back when I'm in Toronto again in a Couple weeks. A local mentioned "if you don't like the food, there's something wrong with you" and I second that!!

Ordered a lot of take out from here during the pandemic and it was always good. The portions are solid and the flavor is amazing. I would normally get the green curry or khao soi with tofu and veggies. The green curry is good, but I would recommend trying the khao soi with your choice of protein. The egg noodles are crispy and if you let them soak in the coconut curry for a bit it packs that extra flavor. The green curry is also great and I usually mix it with my rice to soak in the curry flavor. Everything always tastes fresh and the smell always gets me. 
The pricing here is quite reasonable for downtown Toronto and for anyone that is looking to try some delicious Thai food, Pai is a great choice. Be warned the taste is amazing, but the smells can also be quite strong so if you let empty containers linger it will stick to your clothing.
Brought colleagues here.  No matter the heat, taste comes through.  PAI delivers with every single dish.

Delicious Thai food! The green curry in coconut is very flavorful; it's a little spicy. The garlic tofu is really good as well. The tofu was marinated before deep frying, which is nice. Reservation is sold out pretty fast and wait time can get quite long, so try to get here when they open if you can.

Always busy amazing restaurant. Do not come starving as you'll likely need to wait but so worth it! Anything you order will be delicious. The northern platter is a great dish to share. My favourite and always have to order is the pad see ew. You really don't need my review for Pai. The line ups speak for itself! Go try it!

Unbelievably delicious, absolutely would recommend to anyone.
FOOD:  Took my family here and we all loved the variety of foods. Our favorites were the green curry and pad thai. Incredibly delicious food and was very authentic. Also got a few drinks that were quite delicious--try their spiked thai tea, it's hard not to gulp down glass after glass!
PRICE: The food quality and service to price was fantastic. It's reasonably priced, and the cuisines you get are well worth its price--and beyond.
VIBES: From the moment you step in you feel transported to Thailand. The vibes and decor of the restaurant were so on-point, and was decorated with homages to the owners' trip/roots. There's also a cute photo album of their story together!

Definitely worth the hype.  Make a reservation or there will be a wait. We ended up doing take out and took a minute as well, but well worth it.
We got the pad Thai which was amazing, well spiced, and ample for 2 people.
I didn't realize there was oyster sauce in it, so if you have an allergy beware. Otherwise, definitely add to your food stop while in town. 
Interior is amazing, so I suggest a dine in.
Wonderful atmosphere, excellent food, friendly staff. If you looking for gluten free options, amazing availability

We waited at the bar for a table to be available. Usually a good sign if you need to wait for a table midweek. The bar here seemed, from our limited experience with bars in Toronto, to be typical for the area with beer and spirits. We love whiskey, so one of our goals with our first visit to Toronto was to explore Canadian whiskeys. The bartenders listened to what we like and what we wanted to learn before offering Alberta Premium Cask Strength whiskey. Great choice and a great value at this location as it was priced very reasonably. They were in a lull at the time so we spent some time discussing the offered whiskey and others. The bar starts a tab that will transfer to your table. Plus, they share all tips so you don't have to close out the bar tab to make sure the bartenders get their share.
Once seated, we asked for advice from our server. They suggested many things based on our request for items with lots of flavor. We really like Thai cuisine, but sometimes the flavors are a bit too subtle for us. We ordered khao soi with shrimp and panang curries. We also love lots of veg in our food, so I asked for the vegetarian panang, but replace the tofu with shrimp. Since I really wanted the shimeji mushrooms, I guess I could have also asked for the shrimp panang and add mushroom, but I wanted to get variety as well. I got a ton of mushrooms, a few shrimp, and some onion and red pepper strips. More variety would be nice, but the dish was great.
Since we were new to this place, we asked for the khao soi to be mild but to bring out the spice tray. The spice tray was tiny. The chili oil was about a teaspoon and not very hot, but tasted good. The tray also included one lime wedge, and something like a seasoned, perhaps fermented, bok choy or other greens. The greens were delicious, but it wasn't even half a bite so adding it to a large khao soi or even a small panang was going to do nothing. In the end, we just requested more lime and added as much of the chili oil as could scrape out of the tray into our dishes. We each loved both dishes, but had chosen the right dish for ourselves.
The atmosphere is cozy and somewhat eclectic. Certainly fun. The servers were all wonderful and attentive without being intrusive. If we go back we will ask for more lime up front, more chili oil and/or chili powder up front. Otherwise, the rest, and most important parts of the experience, were great. We highly recommend PAI... especially if you have to wait at the bar for a table.

I honestly have to say that I wasn't too impressed with this place. Maybe my expectations was too high since the review was good and a couple of my family members really enjoyed this place. We managed to come around opening time and got seated right away.
Our waiter was a little snobbish in my opinion, he kinda just told us what to do and told us what to offer. Even when we got the check, I tried to wave him down to tell him he gave us the wrong check and he basically didn't even let me finish and cut me off. 
Foodwise, it wasn't the typical Thai food that you usually would get and it was good, pricy though in my opinion.
Shrimp salad platter---- not sure what this was called but it was a dish filled with various fillings and you make a small wrap from the betel leaves. It was good, very enjoyable and tasty and I love that they made an example of what it would look like so we know what to do 
Khao soi --- this is apparently very popular and it was delicious. I love the curry flavor. I do wish they gave us more noodles, there wasn't that much in it. We ended up having most of our soup left over but no noodles. The tofu (protein choice we opt for) was nothing really spectacular. They just cut up some soft tofu and put it in.
Those 2 dishes cost us close to $50 and we that was a light meal. Overall, it was ok.

Delicious. The best Thai food in Toronto, and the closest I've gotten to Thailand authentic food
It's gotten really busy but still worth it if you want real Thai 
If you're a spice fiend like me, ask for chopped chillies on the side
Best pad Thai in the city. Service is great but place is usually very busy, be sure to call ahead. The vibe inside is fantastic!

It's restaurants like these that make me really appreciate the variety of amazing food we have here in Toronto. I say this every time when I travel away from Canada. If you want the best Thai food in the city, this hits the spot for me. They get it every time and have a variety of vegan options. My favourite dishes are the curries and pad thai dishes. It's a classic but it hits me every single time. 
We were seated right away when we walked in at 4:30pm on a Friday evening right before the Justin Bieber concert. It was a very fine choice for an evening of adventure, fun and Bieber fever! Surprisingly, we finished almost everything and did not have a poor experience of any sort. Best tip for future customers: arrive early to avoid long queues and get seated right away!

An institution of the Toronto food scene, I haven't been back in a while. The food is good, some dishes better than others. The homeruns were definitely the fried squash, pad thai and khao soi. It's the best when eating with a large group, so you can have a bit of everything. Not to mention, the thai iced tea is a perfect pairing to soothe that burning tongue. Overall, the food was good - but definitely at a higher price point!

We left Halton Region to celebrate a birthday with party of 6 to Pai downtown location on Duncan street. 
After the usual long wait time our server escorted us to our table and proceeded to tell us (and lecture us) that there is a mandatory 20% gratuity charge. The rationale was it's more work and standard practice.
The said 'manager' (I think her name is Sharon...) was quite adamant.
We left and went to the Keg in Mississauga where we had an amazing event and experience. We will no longer be dining at Pai. We will not be recommending Pai either. 
Many better establishments that put the customer 1st.

What a fun find! Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and even better food. Bartender helped with some fun drinks while we waited for our table on a busy Saturday evening. Went with the recommended Khao Soi and can't wait to return to try another dish!

Before visiting, I saw Pai referenced everywhere so I jnew that we had to go. Given that it was saturday night I was a bit worried about the wait but it worked out that we had to wait on a friend until later at night anyway. It was, in fact busy, but we got on the list at 7:40 and were told the wait would be 1-1:30h. And they have a takeout counter too which would be so much faster! Our's friend's eta was about 9:20 which worked out perfected because that's about when I got texted. In the time spent waiting we had a shopped around eaton centre, had a great haul, and were able to make it back slightly over the 10 min callback wait time but had to issues getting seated once there. I got the khao soi since this place is northern thai, and my friends got the pad thai and kanom jin nham ngeaw. We also got the grabong which although listed under appetizers, I'd be happy to eat as a meal. I actually think that may have been my favorite. But what can I say, everything was great!
Always amazing. Food is delicious and the ambiance is so fun. Definitely recommend!!!

saw that simu came here and had to try!
overall, it lives up to the hype. their spiciest "thai spicy" option on walks the perfect line between painful and enjoyable, though it does get more painful as you eat more of it. the khao soi has all the right flavors and textures. the ambience and decor is immaculate, and service was very friendly and efficient. this restaurant runs like a well-oiled machine!

Very authentic Thai food with many vegan options, I was very surprised by their options under vegan category, there are more than a dozen dishes that I can choose from. Tried classic psi Thai, it was nicely down and I will come back to try the other vegan dishes.

The line was out the door when we got there, luckily we had reservations but if we didn't, this place is definitely worth the wait! This is the type of place you get shivers down your spine from the food. If you are in town visiting, definitely try this restaurant out.
One of my favourite restaurants in the city! Love the lively ambiance and the new expanded space, reducing wait times. Food is amazing and service is great.

The food is always so delicious and fresh, my favorite is the Khao Soi, it's my fav out of other Thai restos I've been to. The broth is so thick and flavourful. Their snack platter is great for sharing with friends

You would never find this, if it wasn't so well recommended.  
Lining up down the stairs, I thought we would be waiting forever.  But once we made it down, they took us in right away and proceeded to take us through this awesome grey bricked underground that opened up into what became a huge restaurant.  
The vibe is cool, from the atmosphere to the music to the great staff.  Never mind the incredible northern Thai cuisine.  Thai food like this doesn't appear often.  Don't miss out.

For all you west side kids, Pai has a location in Etobicoke delivering through apps. 
Location: Pai Etobicoke
Delivery: UberEats
I had to write my review before my words are slowly fleeting away..
Ordered Khao Soi, coconut curry egg noodle, one tofu/veggie and one beef. 
Beef Khao Soi. There are 5-6 large chunks of beef. 
Tofu/Veggie Khao Soi. Broccoli and cauliflower were overcooked and broke upon touch. 
Despite the overcooked vegetables, the coconut curry was so rich, creamy, and flavourful. The egg noodle was a smaller portion than expected; the broth to noodle ratio was really skewed in the broth's favour. 
I really appreciated the following: 
Lime/green onions were packed into a small Dixie cup container. 
Fried noodles were plentiful, a whole sandwich bag full. 
Egg noodles were perfectly cooked and packed into a small round container. 
Would 100% reorder with a slight hope for non-overcooked broccoli and cauliflower. 
I hope the Pai Etobicoke location allows dine in once we return to a semi normalcy in the not so distant future.

We try this place based on yelp's review.  We were able to seat down in 15 minutes.  However the food took longer than more 30 minutes  to be ready.  We see other people order ready before ours.  Beef was very dry and the  portion are small on both dishes.  Also, the banana leaf rice only partially soft and part of the rice was burnt. We went to Wendy's after. The service is ok. But I won't recommended.

Absolute heavenly perfection, I'll never find Thai food as good, ever. Unless I go to Thailand, I guess! Tables are limited to 90 minutes so they can accept walk-ins, but it's no problem whatsoever and we didn't feel rushed at all.
Probably the best Thai food in Toronto. Love the Tom yum soup! The platter was amazing - everything in the platter was good. The ambiance was nice with live music playing.

Came in on a weekend after normal lunch hours and there was still a wait (just 20 minutes). We were seated and told that we had limited seating time, which I wasn't surprised about since this place was popping! It took a very long time for our food to arrive after we ordered (more than 40 minutes), but when we received our noodles dishes they were both very delicious and generously portioned. I had tried their second Toronto location a couple of years back and enjoyed this location much better in terms of tasting. They also have a not-so-secret room in the back right of the restaurants which opens to a whole other bright dining area which I thought was pretty neat. I can't wait to come back here when I visit Toronto again! Would be 5 stars if not for the long wait.

I had to come visit this place as everyone who has been to Toronto had recommended this Thai restaurant as it is one of the best. We had got a table for two and the wait was about an hour, but was totally worth it! I have to say that the service was exceptional to begin with.
Additionally, we had ordered the Khao Soi and Green Curry as our entries. The Khao Soi was phenomenal as the soup had a ton of flavor and paired well with the noodles. The Green Curry was good as well, but could have been a little bit thicker and would have been better with chicken. Aside from that, the Thai Iced Tea was also a good drink to go with our meal! The Mango Sticky Rice could have been a little sweeter with the coconut milk and mango, but was still a delicious dessert to end our meal. I will likely check out this place again if I come back to Toronto!
Superb. Great food and great service. Be advised debit/credit only no cash. Always a great choice.

Went for a quick workday lunch with colleagues on Wednesday. We came there around 12:16 pm - only 16min after opening and it's already 85% full. The atmosphere is relaxed and somewhat quirky- a nice little break amid work. We were seated immediately in the (probably) inner most room (a bar room right at the entrance and another one between ours and the bar room)
The menu can be viewed online after scanning a QR code. My colleague has less good phone signal so she had some trouble with it. The menu has a wide selection BUT a lot are only available after 4pm. They don't have a separated lunch section so we had to look 1 by 1 and manually filter dishes that are not available - which is a small inconvenience but caused some frustrations.
Food we ordered: 
Thai Chicken Wings - very tasty and would highly recommend. The outside is crispy but not too greasy and the insight is tender and juicy. The flavor is sweet & savory with a tiny hint of spice. 
Khao Soi with tofu - good but too thick and creamy for personal taste. 
Pad See Ew with shrimp - tasty and nice portion size. Will suit most people's taste buds if don't know what to order
Overall pretty good food. Would go again and try different entries. Will definitely order Thai Chicken Wings tho

Awesome dinner from PAI. We ordered our dinner and opted for pickup as dine in is not available due to COVID-19 and delivery was not an option. We ordered and started from our place which was around 40 mins. By the time we reached, the food was ready to be picked up. The pickup process was smooth. You just enter the building and all orders were kept on a table waiting to be picked up. We went in, shared our order details and our packet was handed over to us quickly.  
We ordered Green curry, Pad Thai and Pad Gra Prow. Green curry is our favorite now as it is one of the best Green Curry we had. Probably the best in Toronto. Pad Thai was also too good with good amount of chicken, tofu and eggs mixed. The taste was really amazing. There were crushed peanut provided separately which added in the taste. Gra Pro was also good and tasted well, but it was a bit too oily for us. Otherwise it would have been another hit for sure.  
The portion seemed to be a bit on the lesser side based on the cost of the dishes. Before all the offices in downtown closed down, we had PAI dishes frequently for much lesser price and more quantity. But now it seemed to be less for more prices. This is the reason for 1 less star in the reviews. Otherwise PAI is definitely an authentic Thai place in Toronto and definitely worth trying.  
Definitely recommended. Enjoy your Thai.

Went to have Thai food on a cold day in Toronto right when I walked into the place I loved it and knew it was going to be good, went with a coworker who tried Thai for the first time and absolutely loved it

NOTE: I would rate this place 4.5 stars
I've been here before but this is my first time leaving a review. Everyone says PAI as the place to go for their Thai food fix and I agree. This restaurant definitely lives up to the hype. Great service and great food again and again. 
A thing to note is that this place is always packed- I don't think I've ever went here without waiting at least 20 minutes. As well, this time, my sister and I got the bar area where the stools were wobbly. Furthermore, they take a while to cook your food. 
We got:
Pad Thai with Shrimp 5/5
-Amazing! The noodles are not too soft, which I love. Good flavor. 
Thai Iced Tea 5/5
- My go-to drink - has that nice blend of sweetness without being overly sweet.
Green Curry 4/5
-This was a new dish I tried today. You can scoop out the coconut insides that the curry comes in and eat it with the curry, which was interesting. It gave a nice contrast compared to the hot curry but I honestly didn't think the coconut did much. Curry flavor was not bland and it had a nice flavour. You can't control the spicy level for this dish. 
The dishes were definitely more than enough and I could have taken some home as leftovers.
Overall, definitely recommend! This restaurant is definitely not hyped. However, because of its popularity, there's probably going to be a long wait and lots of people are going to be at the restaurant, so might not be the place to dine-in if you just want a quick bite, are short on time or uncomfortable with crowds due to COVID or other reasons.

So... I LOVE Thai food and this place so hyped up by my friends and we ended up going here for my "send off party" from my last job. The place was insanely busy! They don't take reservations and my poor friend had to hold a table from 5pm for a 6pm setting. Now is it worth the hype? ABSOLUTELY! I was doing the "yummy food bop" in my seat the entire time. And the cocktails were also a huge success. Good times! Great times! Definitely try Pai for great Thai (heh that rhymed)

Its a good sign for a restaurant when it is busy at off times. I went on a weekday for lunch and it was packed. Even the rain didn't keep people away. This is a very good place to eat in with a great vibe. The flavors tasted authentic but I've only been to Thailand one time.  I understand why this place has so many reviews. I had the pad gra prow and pad thai. The rice was so good and the pad Thai was not too sweet. Great miz of sweet sour and savory.
The best Thai restaurant in town. Fantastic Thai food and great cultural ambience. Have been there many times.
Pai, is a town in Northern Thailand where this nurse turned chef/ owner was from. The food was unpretentious and bold. Delicious would be an understatement. #paitoronto

Food was excellent with great decor in the restaurant!! Vintage indeed.
I went there for lunch with a bit of a stomachache after eating so much the previous night. I just wanted something light and fresh. I tried their Pad Gra Paow with Chicken. It tasted very authentic and I felt like I was in Thailand, even from the setting of the place itself. The food was fresh and the chicken was juicy. I loved the runny yolk that came from the fried egg. The restaurant was inviting too and I'd definitely come back here another time.

Delicious food. Walked in party of 1, asked if the food could be made quickly because I was in a rush. The service was extremely quick in response and very friendly. Highly recommend their pad gra prow at the Thai spice level. Nose and mouth watering.

Fantastic food
Great ambiance
Great service
100% will be back
Everything we ate was a solid 10

The best Thai food I've had in Toronto! Can't believe a vegetarian spring roll can taste so good. The best green curry and it's served in a coconut... too bad you can't change the spice level, it's done medium spicy. We got their Pai Thai in Thai Spicy level... they don't mess around there, ouch but in a good way. Would def keep coming again & again!

Came here for a dinner with friends and really enjoyed it!
I started with the sangria with lychee. It was really refreshing and not overly sweet.
Get the green curry with chicken! This was recommended by a friend and it was fantastic. Comes with a side of rice.
Service was excellent as well!

I got the squash fritters and pad Thai via Ubereats takeout.
Squash fritters - huge portion, unique snacking type of appetizer that is similar to fries with dip. It's addictive and worth the big price tag 
Pad Thai - after being disappointed from pad Thai elsewhere, I was blown away by the flavour explosion in Chef Nuits pad Thai! The sauce and beef were very generous. Seriously, I had a beef slice in every bite! I just wish there was more veggie and tofu  I'm also glad this came with free chili oil as I selected medium spicy. It just gave me a little tongue tingle and was otherwise mild. Adding the chili oil made it perfect!!
I also got "Extra green curry sauce" for $3. I'm very glad this was an option, so that I can try another dish. I haven't opened it yet to taste, but it is a nice sampler size for $3. (note: it is purely sauce, no meat or veggies)

Ended up at Pai after reading countless reviews on it and seeing that they made really authentic Northern Thai food. I am a lover of asian food, especially Thai food so it was a no brainer that I try this place out. I ended up getting takeout food - and even when I went for pickup there were countless people around waiting to get their food which means its very fresh (which it was).
I ended up trying:
*Green Curry chicken - delicious and flavorful and came with lots of chicken and a side of rice which was nice
* Pad see ew - came with tofu and lots of veggies, this dish really hit the spot
*Penang curry - came with tofu as well - I enjoyed this more actually because I really like the peanuty curry like taste alot. Am a personal fan of this!
*Papaya Salad - all the flavors you want in a delicious, refreshing salad. Everyone who tried this in the house, loved it!
Overall, food was good - definitely expensive for the quantity, but I guess  that's due to downtown and the popularity.
We came in for dinner - better make reservations! The place is loud. Everything was really good! We had the beef curry, mango salad and pad tai chicken.  Dry tasty! Service is friendly and fast.

I ordered from the vegan menu.  I ordered the omni "pork" pad gra prow and the chef nuit pad Thai.  They were AH-mazing!  They were so good that I had a difficult time stopping.  I wanted to make room for dessert.  It was so good that I ordered a second pad gra prow to take home with me for the next day.  We also ordered the coconut sorbet and shared it, but I think secretly we had wished we ordered one each.  I still can't believe that was vegan...it was a mind f***.  I want to try everything on the vegan menu.

Gread food and service. Loved it! 
 Very pretty and cozy ambiance. It's a must try. Best place for thai

Very poor experience. We tried to reserve the table so that we get dinner before the show. Tried to call the restaurant, there is not even an option to reserve over the phone. Sent email with reservation details, never received any response. Tried to book with the Open Table, the earliest availability was 2 weeks away. Finally, decided to show up without the reservation, the place looks nice but we were told it will be an hour wait. We were very upset that we ended up wasting so much time and had to get sandwiched at nearby pub as we didn't have time for proper dinner before the show.

Came here on a recommendation and because it was rated best Thai restaurant in Toronto on Yelp. 
Had to wait about 35 mins after putting name in around 5ish. 
Guava juice and Thai iced tea were good, just a little bit too sweet.
Tom yum soup was nice. It's a sweet and sour soup and was very flavorful. 
The moo ping pork skewers were the best. 
Chicken satay with peanut sauce was just ok. I probably would not get this again.
I tried the khao soi with traditional braised beef as I had never heard of this dish before. It was very good, also rich and filling. Has a bit of a sweetness to it.  I dumped all 3 of the add-ons into the dish for more flavor. 
Coconut sorbet was lovely. It has noodles of the fresh young coconut and you can also scrape the fresh coconut from inside the shell. The entire inside of the coconut was also filled sorbet. The mango was a nice addition. I didn't care too much for the peanuts, but you can ask for without or just remove them to eat separately.
Best Khao soi outside of Chiang Mai. Service was quick and efficient, food was excellent. A little noisy at times but when the food is so good, who cares?

Absolutely fantastic food, good service and nice funky young ambiance. 
Ten out of ten.

by far one of the best Thai food I have tried 
Definitely worth the wait and would definitely recommend to anyone visiting or in the area

Excellent Thai food that we ordered for takeout and glad I did not try to walk in with a group during dinner because there was a long line to try and get in.  The khai soi with braised beef was amazing here.  I also loved their version of massaman curry with chicken and their pad thai and tom yum soup was also really delicious.  The khao pad baan nok fried rice with chicken and shrimp was also really good.

Our group of four had gone here right before Ontario started its QR codes for vaccinated people.
Regardless this Phai on Dundas in Toronto's DT was hard to get a table without long waits on a Saturday evening. Luckily, we reserved weeks in advance.
It's simple and had a good vibe.
$-$$

A must try!! I was actually blown away at how good the food here was. They were able to take something as simple as chicken skewers and turn it into something I felt like I was tasting for the first time. The pad thai was for sure better than average and the khao soi curry noddles .. wow. The curry was rich with coconut flavor and paired sooo well with the noodles and braised beef. I also really liked the addition of crispy noodles for texture. Everything was flavorful and delicious, the workers were friendly, cozy environment, no complaints here.

Covid delivery review!
First time trying this popular Toronto restaurant and definitely didn't disappoint!
Tom yum was very light on the stomach and had a few simple ingredients. The broth was the best part.
The curry was basically the same experience such that the curry sauce was my fav part.
Both items had a very rich flavour and were very easy on the stomach. I'd definitely recommend trying this restaurant if you haven't been here before.

Visited Toronto for the weekend and a friend recommended we had to come here. We came around 4:30p before the dinner rush and put our name down, it was only about a 30 min wait and they texted us when our table was ready. When we came back, the line for the waitlist became pretty long.
We ordered:
- grabong 
- moo ping
- tom yum soup 
- pad thai
- khao soi
- green curry
- coconut sorbet
Our top choices were the grabong (squash fritters--one of their most popular items), moo ping (pork skewers) which were super juicy, and coconut sorbet! The Tom yum soup is pretty spicy! I can only handle mild spice so this was way too spicy for me. We ordered the khao soi with braised beef and green curry with chicken. The pad thai was nothing special in our opinion but I like that you can get mixed protein so we ordered ours with shrimp and chicken. My absolute favorite was the coconut sorbet which comes with fresh coconut shavings incorporated in the sorbet. The peanuts were a nice touch and an added texture/flavor that somehow complimented the whole thing very well and the tart mangos balanced the smooth milky flavor of the coconut sorbet.
All in all, a great spot. I would come back JUST for coconut sorbet though. It's pretty large so order to share!

Amazing food. Well worth the wait. 
No pretense just authentic Thai. And affordable as a bonus!

The mango slaw wasn't really tasty and I felt awful at having spent over $20 on it. Though it was a pretty large portion. Just wasn't for me.
The Pad Thai was only ok. Wasn't the best I'd ever had.
Don't think I'd repeat. Eat BKK Thai is much better.
Thr khao Soy here is a highlight. Big space that feels empty most of the so it isn't a great place to take a date.
It's unfortunately non accessible if you're walking impaired. It's only a staircase with no access for any wheels. And nothing could be offered. Sad

Best Thai food I've ever had. The dining experience at Pai was truly exceptional. The dedication to authenticity, the skilled craftsmanship of the chefs, and the attentive service made it a dining delight. If you're a Thai food enthusiast or looking to embark on an unforgettable culinary journey, I wholeheartedly recommend Pai.

I've been wanting to go to this restaurant for a long time to see what all the fuss was about. and WOW! The food was delicious. I ordered the green curry while my friends ordered the khao sai and pad see ew, which I tried all of. But I have to say, the pad see ew was my favourite; I kept stealing some. The hint of lime that comes with the pad see ew was absolutely delicious. Every bite had a flavour explosion from all of the food we ordered.
We did, however, order the Thai Ice Tea, which was not my favourite. It was my first time trying it, and I found it to be extremely sweet.
The servers were also extremely pleasant, and I was completely blown away by this restaurant. Will undoubtedly return soon.

Stumbled upon this restaraunt while taking a walk so my friend and I decided to give it a try. We came on a Saturday night so the line was a bit long. We waited ~20 minutes in line to put our name down. Once we put our name down, the wait was ~30-40 minutes. We were able to grab some drinks at the bar while we waited so that was nice! They also have an indoor waiting area with seats so the wait didn't feel too long. 
What we ordered: 
-Golden chicken nuggets: 10/10 when the order came out, I expected the nuggets to be smaller in size but it was like the size of chicken tenders. Definitely a shareable plate. It was SO delicious (especially with the sauce)
-Steak salad: 9/10 when the waiter recommended us this place I was like ehh.... but when it came out and I tried it, Wow! the salad sauce was soooo good and the steak was cooked to perfection. Must try!!! 
-Tom yum soup: 11/10 I have never tasted a tom yum soup as good as the one I tasted here. The broth was so rich in flavor and the spice was just right. 
-Khao Soi: 9/10 amazing! Curry broth flavor was SO delicious and the noodles were just perfect. If you're looking for a noddle curry dish, this is THE one!
-Pad thai: 8/10 it was really good! I've had a lot of pad thai's in my life so all I can say is that it tastes better than what I've had before. Giving it a 8/10 because I'm not a big fan of pad thai but just wanted to try it because of the amount of reviews this dish got
Overall, my experience here was great and I enjoyed every single dish I ordered. The vibes are immaculate and the service was AMAZING.

Food is always good here! It's one of our go to spots. Dining in is better but there's usually quite a bit of a wait especially on weekends. We usually do take out which is still delicious. Spring rolls are the best, pad thai, Chiang Mai, khao soi, pad gra prow, massaman curry with beef, mango sticky rice. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Cheers!
Tastiest Thai food in Toronto.  Strong menu but expect a lot of dishes to only be served at dinner.  I came here on a weekday before TIFF and there was probably a 45 minute wait at 1pm.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Toronto.  I usually go with the green Thai curry and the dish always tastes fresh and flavorful.  Expect reasonable service.  In my opinion what really sets this restaurant apart is the food combined with the atmosphere.  The tropical stylings of the restaurant combined with vibrant music and tasty food really do make for a pleasurable dining experience.

This is one of the best Thai places I have ever been to. We came right when it opened and was able to get a spot without waiting (other than waiting for the people in front of us to get quickly seated). All the food was sooo good. They give so much vegetables, which I really appreciated. And everything came in large amounts. This was such a comforting meal that was super flavorful, but also not too salty. Best of all, the interior decorations were super nice too! Since we came for lunch, there was quite a few items that were unavailable until 4, so keep that in mind when you come!

We selected Pai after reading outstanding Yelp reviews. We came in on a Tuesday evening for dinner and there was a line up the stairs, out the door, and down the street. We placed our name on the waiting list and had a solid hour+ wait time to be seated. We enjoyed walking around the area and had a drink at the bar. I enjoyed the flavor of the lychee cocktail I ordered. The vibe of the restaurant is very unique, laid back, and casual. There is very dim lighting and neat decor. 
My husband and I shared chicken pad Thai and chicken Khao soi. We enjoyed both entrees but did not feel it was worth the long wait time and 'hype'. The pad Thai was flavorful but did not taste unique or different than my typical Thai take-out. And the khao soi had a great flavor to the broth, but the noodles were the wrong texture. I feel like it would have been better served over rice (or side of rice) or with the noodles typically used in pad see ew.

The food here is amazing with strong ad bold flavours and unique dishes (or a unique take on the dishes), and the portions are a good size. My favourite dishes are the khao soi, gaeng hunglay, pad gra prow, mango sticky rice and the thai iced tea. I prefer to share the dishes family-style so that everyone can try a bit of everything. 
There is usually a wait, so be prepared. One time, I popped in after a meeting at 3pm, hoping to snag a table for 1 and there was still a 20-30 minute wait. It is THAT popular, but I can assure you, the food and service are worth the wait! 
The take-out is also very good - they package the dishes in a way that maintains each dish's freshness (even though, sometimes the packaging can seem a bit wasteful, separating the noodles from the soup will prevent the noodles from overcooking, so there is a reason). 
I highly recommend Pai - it's my go-to place for authentic Thai cuisine. Once you've had it, you cannot go back to ketchup pad thai - you know what I'm talking about!

Had the squash blossom app and it was divine!!! Just go here and order everything (food and drinks). It's so worth it. I'm definitely going again next time I'm in town! The layout and decor is gorgeous and so unique too!

Great food but hard to get a spot unless you go early
I ordered take out another time but they got my order wrong

This place is great. Its got a basement feel though. Like you're underground low low cause you gotta walk down to your place. The food is bomb though. I got me some regular Pad Thai and it's good, for sure. 
The price was a bit steep cause your sister could have went to Thai Express but nah this place is authentic. It's worth the price to try some Thai food
The portions are big. I had to get a take out box and bring my noods home. I burped about 3 times so that's a good sign you're getting your money's worth. Some for now, some for later :D 
Overall good place. The people are nice. Chill vibe. This place is casual too so that's a bonus
I went back in June 2022 but yes they take Credit Card

SOME OF THE BEST FOOD IVE HAD IN TORONTO! Their pad thai and every si gel one of the curries is to die for. The restaurant itself has the best ambience with the music and decor! The service is okkkk. But def great with how busy they are! Loved it, 10/10 recommend

Staff was friendly and the ambience was nice but the food arrived lukewarm. The green curry was a bit sweet for me, but I liked that it's served in a coconut and that they put more bamboo shoot instead of tons of ginger.

The ambiance is cool, chill, the music is good and up to date, not too laud so you can have a nice chat with your party. The food is delicious and tastes well-balanced. Only tried the two dishes in the pics and they are not spicy (I can't with spicy food) which is good because I thought Thai kitchen would be only spicy. The fried shredded buttercup squash is not oily and is not heavy, it's yummy! The egg noodles in the coconut milk curry is really good but it can be cloying by the end because there's the sweetness to it. The service... they are nice but it took to long to get the service and every time I asked for something it would take even longer... But overall I like it and would go again!
Terrific selection, great service, center of everywhere. Very busy for a good reason. Get there early, expect a 20 minute wait. Pub like setting.

the food is great
the service is a little slow
the ambience is exactly thailand. its a great escape right here in the city. 
its not authentic in that way that makes the environment third world and you are like where am I? thats a different level of interesting and nice, but this wasnt like that. 
this was upscale but also good food, and the ambiance was very classy but less than that.
Authentic Thai food. Always a queue outside the restaurant. Go early for a shorter wait in line
