Never disappoints. We order Pai from Kitchen Hub A LOT. And I have eaten at the Duncan location several times. Just no weak links! Highlights - Tom yum soup, pad thai, green curry. The khao soi is suuuuuuper rich. I couldn't eat it alone, it's a must share. This place is worth the hype!
After so many years this is still the best Thai in DT. Go early if you don't have a reservation online!
absolutely delicious. gorgeous ambiance and everything i tasted was amazing, would definitely return

Ill start by saying we had to wait about an hour to get seated, and the guy taking our name put down 7 people when it was just the 2 of us, which may have made the wait a bit longer, so that was a little annoying. When we finally got seated, the service was good and fast. We ordered the pad thai and the khao soi. My only real complaint was that the khao soi would have been much better if it was served with rice instead of noodles. The flavor was good. The pad thai was good.
Amazing service!  I thoroughly enjoyed this wonderful place! there's a reason why this place has a Michelin award. All of our meals are so so good
This is the best restaurant we ate at in Toronto. The food was phenomenal as well as the sangria! Service was great and the ambiance was perfect. HIGHLY recommend!!
One of the best meals I have ever had!  The restaurant and their story is very quaint and unique making for a great and memorable experience.

traveling in the area and had a taste for Thai. the reviews alone were enough to make me want to try Pai. However, not being from toronto, I had no idea how bad traffic would be downtown. Holy cow, it was excruciating. an hour to go 5 miles. THat said, it was totally worth it. 
before ordering i look over at two young women who had jsut received their order. after the first bite, one of them tossed her head back and had the biggest smile on her face. 
colleague and i each has a small bowl of tom yum, split an order of Spring Rolls, and we split the pad thai and the massamam curry. yeah this is 100% a revisit. the food was great and even worth that terrible  drive.

10/10 absolutely recommend. I was in Toronto for 3 days and went here twice because of how yummy kr was!! I had the green curry (comes in a coconut!) and it was so perfect and a little spicy! My friends for the pad Thai, which was sooo very yum. I went back for the pad Thai the next day and ate every drop of my leftovers. Also enjoyed the garlic fried shrimp and the spring rolls! Even the sangria was amazing. Don't hesitate. Go NOW!

I've tried a lot of different Thai restaurants and I will have to say this was definitely the best. The Tum Yum soup had a ridiculous amount of flavor, the curry was great and the NBA themed drinks were cool. The overall ambiance of this place is something to enjoy as well.

Not even going to bother rating this restaurant. Sent an email for reservation 3 weeks early as requested by them and had to reemail as no answer after 10 days and then get the response that they are full and made a mistake with reading the email. NOT going to this restaurant and don't recommend them base on this experience

Absolutely worth the hype! Came on Sunday at opening time without a reservation and were seated right away. The decor inside is very welcoming and bright, the music complemented to make a chill vibe. Our waiter informed us they only accept credit card and have a 90 minute table limit. 
The thai iced tea is delicious - perfect level of sweetness and crushed ice assures it doesn't get watered down. The pad see ew was flavorful and had a great ratio of noodle to greens to shrimp. The hot chili flakes on the side was a nice addition with a squeeze of lemon. Portion size was large. Pad thai was also excellent! The service is fast and attentive. Best restaurant experience I've had in Toronto so far.
The service is mixed. Decent food. Look like a scene in a movie. I say it is overrated.

Went by a week or 2 after lockdown, dine in reservations were full, only walk-in first come first serve. Only waited about 20-30 minutes. 
First time experiencing Pai as a friend recommended this place. Thai milk tea was very nice just a hint too sweet for me but tasted quite authentic as I have been to Thailand. 
Also ordered PAD THAI, thai spicy. Very nice kick as I'm used to spicy food

This review is almost 2 years late. But it has always been a great dining experience at Pai. I will more so often get the pad gra, the squash fritters and the thai ice tea and it never fails to amaze me. The service is alright, could it get better? Definitely. Love the ambiance and the small market at the back.

Atmosphere: 5
Cleanliness: 5
Quality: 5
Service: 5
Taste: 5
Couldn't secure a reservation during my visit to Toronto but they take walk-ins so that's what I did. The wait for a party of 2 on the evening (the day after new year) was estimated to be about 20 minutes but we were seated before that. 
For drinks I had the regular Thai tea and then later an alcohol version of Thai tea  featuring vodka (yea, you read that right!! IT was rather tasty!)
The spring rolls and tom yum soup were  our appetizers of choice. The rolls were fried with cabbage and mushrooms inside. The soup served with mushrooms and shrimp was flavorful and well balanced.
The khao soi and pad krapow were our entrées of choice. The pad krapow came out with the fried egg and rice and tasted as it should. And khao soi was truly excellent. The curry was  possibly one the best I've tasted .
Overall, Pai lived up to my expectations and to it's name. By the time we walked out, there was a line of people waiting to be seated that went around the block it seemed and when I saw that, I nodded in agreement. Worth the wait!

It's the third time I've been here and it's probably my favorite Thai restaurant in whole of Toronto and one of the best overall. Even after years away it's just as popular as it was the fist time I was there. At 2pm on Saturday we had to wait 30 min to be seated and didn't get any less busy afterwards. There were some new additions to the menu such as the oxtail dish with garlic and rice(pictured). It does feel similar to something else I've eaten before, but definitely had this extra flavour. The pad Thai and the curry are classic dishes but still so tasty. Service is great considering how busy they were. Spilled some water on the table and they cleaned it immediately. Someone even came to check if we are okay shortly. Its the kind of place I'd never get tired of visiting. Too bad I won't be staying in the city much longer.

It lives up to the name, as the service, the atmosphere and most importantly the food are absolutely amazing! Its worth the wait, and I love that the only thing that you have to accept is a bit of a wait due to limited reservations. The curries are all amazing, dabang is worth trying and pad thai is great! The skewers are a great addition as well! I love it and prices are very reasonable for being in downtown and for the quality!
All I have to say is I love Nathan and nay nae. they're the best. they're shots are not watered down! Nay nae is such a genuine soul!

Pai has its fair share of rave reviews, and I have to agree for the most part. I've been 4-5 times before and it's always busy. There is ALWAYS a wait if you're going to walk in. We went on a Saturday night and surprisingly only waited 15 min for a table for 2. I've had to wait for over an hour during previous visits. Pai makes you feel like you're on a street in Thailand, experiencing their vibrant street foods. Service is casual and friendly - they are always super busy so I was satisfied with the level of attention from the wait staff. 
1) squash fritters - a crispy delicious finger food, served with a sweet and sour dipping sauce. I just found the fritters a little mushy towards the middle, I wish the whole fritter was as crispy as the edges. 
2) pad Thai - excellent!! One of the best pad Thais I've had, super balanced flavours and the medium spicy was perfect for us. 
3) green curry - served in a young coconut, I did not really enjoy this. The curry was watery and the chicken was very dry. The only part I enjoyed was scraping the coconut pulp out of the shell.

WOW!! Completely understand why this restaurant has such amazing reviews. We arrived here around 7:15pm and only waited 15 minutes before being seated. There's a designated area for those waiting for seating so customers aren't standing around the entrance. 
We ordered the spring rolls (vegetarian), Chef Nuit Pad Thai, and Khao Soi. For the dishes, you're able to select the level of spiciness as well. This was my first time trying Khao Soi at any thai restaurant and I was blown away! The broth was creamy and the dishes were all cooked and seasoned to perfection. 
Definitely one of our favorite meals in Toronto.

Authentic and very delicious Thai food. This time I was able to get a reservation for dine in, which was nice. Their Khao soi is slightly more watery than other ones I've had, but creamy and flavorful nonetheless. The pork rib soup was sour, spicy, and addictive; they don't skimp on the meat. 
I would actually recommend sitting inside rather than on their two patios, as the interior is beautifully decorated and outside can smell a little like sewer if the wind isn't blowing in your favor

So this is a really interesting place, the decor is very Thai local feel and the food was fantastic. We did a shared big plate witha  variety of items and all of them were very good. The pork skewers were excellent, the lettuce wraps were very good and the fried stack of sweet potatoes was also great. We had a vegitarian at the table so we did an order of the fried Tofu and I usually hate tofu but this was pretty darn good. They have a lot different cocktails but we got a bottle of wine which was priced well and overall pretty good. This is a good value and some of the best Thai food. I will be back for sure next trip to Toronto!
Amazing place. To be honest my first visit wasn't that great, but every other time it has been the best. Definitely the Thai place I would take my family or friends to if they ever visit Toronto.

Went here for lunch. Other than having to wait for a table, it was terrific!   The food was definitely worth the wait.  I had a pad Thai dish and my coworker had a fried rice dish.  Both were amazing.

Honestly, not sure why this place is so hyped. As an American I'm wondering if this is the only Thai place in Downtown Toronto. The wait is at least 30-40 minutes and the food was just average. I've definitely had better Thai food in America West Coast. We ordered the beef Salad and the Khao Pad Thamada. The beef salad flavor was good, but the beef was a bit over cooked. We ordered pork the the Khao Pad Thamada and it was a bit too sweet  and oily for us. Honestly, if this place was so hyped (over 3k reviews) I'd say this place is pretty good, but the wait time and the amount of reviews isn't worth the quality of food served here.

Came across this restaurant while browsing food places closeby the DoubleTree hotel. It was about a 13 min walk and my boyfriend and I came at 9pm. We were thinking the crowd would die down by then but we were wrong. The restaurant was still packed. We were able to get seated quickly. 
I ordered the pad Thai and my boyfriend ordered the pad gra prow. I can't have spicy so I ordered no spice. You have the option of adjusting the spice level. My boyfriend got medium spice for his dish. He cleaned his plate good and ended up finishing mine. Portions were good for the price. Plates range starting from $15-16. Quality and flavors were there so it was a good meal. We loved the playlist they were playing and the ambiance. It was pretty loud in there with the music playing and the crowd, but we enjoyed our meal. Servers gave us great and fast service!
Great Thai food.  Good service.  Really enjoyed our meal at Pai.  Highly recommend, it's well worth the wait.

This is absolutely my favourite Thai restaurant in the city - It's my go to hands down and one of my top 10 restaurants that I recommend to any of my friends who aren't from Toronto to visit. 
Their khao soi is one of the best dishes on their menu - noodles and soup curry with braised beef? Hell yes! 
Another one of their recommendations are their pad Thai - hands down one of the best pad thai I've ever had in Toronto. It's not so ketchup-y like most places make it. 
Moo ping- one of my other favourites for appetizers- this dish is SO GOOD. Sometimes it sells out so you won't be able to order ( had that happen to me many times) so I highly suggest trying this out if they don't " run out" 
grabong- super good !! It's a good snack that's pairs great with beer or alone! 
Overall I highly highly recommend trying pai out if you are in town in the downtown toronto core. 
Ps. You will be waiting approx 1-2 hours for a table
If you walk in. But trust me, it's worth the wait!

Excellent restaurant, excellent food, good service!
Best pad Thai ever, great apps.
Line seemed long but it is a much bigger place then you realize and we didn't wait very long to sit.
Good system with everyone working together, would definitely return.

ooooo, i'm SO glad my sister's friend recommended this place to us because it was genuinely one of the best thai places i've been to in a long while. there was a waiting list of an hour but time quickly passed since we walked to the toronto sign and back. parking was pretty easy to find (not free - metered). the staff was awesome, very insightful and attentive. we started off with thai iced tea, chicken wings, moo ping & gai satay (skewers). we got two main entrees - pad thai & khao si. i'm personally not a fan of pad thai so i only had the khao si but it was really good. we ended the night with drinks (i got the summer dog). had a very good experience - definitely recommend & want to come back

Located in the heart of downtown, this is definitely a hidden gem. 
Very down to earth, and a nice place to chill and dine with friends or family. They do also have a bar area for solo diners. I do not recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet romantic date. However if you seek an upbeat, busy yet savoury food, this is your go to. 
If you crave Thai food, their food here is flavourful and delicious. You can tell they use fresh ingredients to make a great meal. 
Definitely a must try for Thai cuisine.

This is my absolute favourite Thai restaurant in
Toronto downtown.
It takes some time to get a table, but worth the wait. The staff is friendly and the food is good.
Pad Grow Prow - 8.5/10 
a little over salted
Pad See Ew - 10/10
I would order Pad Thai and Pad See Ew next time.

4 stars for cool ambiance, aesthetics and service. Food was beautifully presented and some of the appetizers were very good and different than Thai food Im used to. They were able to accommodate our huge group with such short notice. Definitely a different type of Thai restaurant and from what the locals say this was a very popular spot!

This is a great place... the ambience, the service and the food are amazing!
4 stars for giving us 90 minute to dine, yet it is understandable because there was a long line when we got out. If you can't make a reservation, get in line, it is  worth it! Staff are friendly and the food are delicious!
Had the Beef brisket khao soi here and it was delicious. Also the fritters were tasty!

This place is definitely one of my favourite Thai restaurants in Toronto! The flavours are very authentic and I am still craving this now as I write this. Reservations are preferred, especially for a large group as this restaurant is extremely popular and crowded. The decor is very welcoming and unique, with vintage items on the walls and tables. I would recommend dining in the separate area in the back, as it is quite loud and may be too noisy for some. 
My favourite dishes are the pad gra prow (Basil Stir-Fry Beef with steamed jasmine rice) and the green curry that comes inside a coconut, which is a nice touch. I don't normally have a high spice tolerance, but the medium spice level was just right for me or it would be too bland otherwise. I also loved their Thai Iced Tea which was very rich and refreshing! Look forward to my next visit!

Amazing service. Despite being busy they have a great system for getting you seated quickly. Such a cool vibe in there. Some of the best Thai food I've had in a while. Cant wait to come back when I am in Toronto.

Hands down my go to Thai place in Toronto. The vibes are so great, and the decor takes me back to when I was in Thailand with my group of friends. Their Pad Thai is one of my favourites and I always recommend this restaurant to my friends who visit the city.

Pai Northern Thai Kitchen was born out of a love story. The couple who opened this eatery met in Thailand and wanted to bring their love of Pai to Toronto, and now this must be the busiest Thai restaurant in the entire city! The Plah Nua was a beef sirloin steak grilled to a juicy medium and dressed with shallots, lemongrass, and other herbs and served over chopped lettuce and shredded cabbage. From the section of the menu labeled "Chef Nuit's Favorites," the Khao Soi was a bowl of egg noodles in a coconut milk curry, served with chunks of braised beef and topped with crispy noodles, along with pickled mustard greens, onion, chili oil, and lime on the side. But my favorite dish (though not by far) was the Kanom Jim Nham Ngeaw, a soup made of pork ribs, tomatoes, and chilies, topped with crispy pork rinds and served with rice noodle bundles, shredded cabbage, lime, pickled mustard greens, and red chili powder on the side. The soup had a complex sweet, sour, hot and spicy flavor that was more than the sum of its parts, and the meaty, fatty pork ribs were tender and flavorful. Overall, though the service wasn't a highlight (as the place was super busy), this was a fantastic Thai restaurant with a funky, casual vibe and uncompromised flavors!

We walked miles to get to this place after looking them up on Yelp and seeing their 3k+ reviews. It was well worth it. The food was fantastic. The atmosphere was hip and full of positive energy. We highly recommend this place.

With their new vegan options they won my 4 stars!!!  They have scope to be better to be 5 but yeah now I visit them more often and recommend to fellow vegan and vegetarian yelpers.
The ambiance has always been great, not quite but more celebration kind. The seating is a little cramped but again they have always a queue, everyone wants to have a good food , I don't mind that. Their bar selection and cocktails have always been decent. And now they have both regular and vegan / vegetarian food selection and so far what ever I tried was great. Above average Thai food. Their curries are so balanced and fresh . The appetizers are yumm. Portions are fairly sized. I love their Chilli sauce... and they accommodate every spice level to a perfection. 
Great place to go when you crave Thai food.

Alright, alright, I'll grant the coveted 5th star. The food was amazing, but while the food came out fairly quick, the service seemed overwhelmed by the business that evening (a little short handed perhaps?). They were, however kind enough to permit me to swap the Spicy P for something else, more on that later.
This place is popular and gets packed quick. Saturday at ~4:30 there was hardly a spot left, I got lucky and was able to snag a seat at the rear bar.
There was a little bit of a queue for the Host Stand which moved a little slow. To the staff's credit, it seemed like they were juggling a lot: seating guests, phone calls, etc. 
I started off with the Spicy P to drink, and it was fire! Don't get me wrong, it was quite tasty, until you transformed into a fire-breathing dragon. Mind you I have a higher than average heat tolerance.
They were kind enough to let me swap it for something else, and I opted for The Serge Protector.  This one hit all the right notes: it was gently sweet, savory, not too heavy, with pleasant foam and just the right amount of heat!
Getting the drinks took a little while; but there was only one bar for an almost packed house.
For a main, I ordered the Pad Gra Prow with crisp pork. This dish was delicious from the bottom up. The rice was cooked perfectly, and the sauce that made its way there gave it great flavor! The veggies gave a great amount of freshness. The meat was extremely flavorful, cooked perfectly, and especially with the Crisp Pork added some wonderful texture variety. 
I was also extremely fond of the portion size that was filling, yet didn't have me bursting at the seams. I also liked that it wasn't the overly saccharine.
This dish was to come to a Chili Oil, which I alas received towards the very end of the meal when almost everything was eaten. 
The service was very polite, but a bit overwhelmed or short-handed that night. Also, the story of the couple that openness this place is awesome!
Well done, folks!

Good food
Great ambient
The crew are so nice
Will back to try the other menus for sure!

I am blown away. I don't remember why I thought it deserved a 3 star.
Came here during lunchtime on a weekday and we didn't have to wait. There's actually a whole another big room behind the main area!
The khao soi was amazing. Very rich sweet salty soup full of coconut taste and flavourings. The noodles were tender and the crispy noodles were fried perfectly. So delicious, recommend! Waiter was really passionate and friendly too.

Came all the way from So California for the best Thai food I've ever had!   Had to come here based on the recs of friends and reviews.  The presentation and flavors were on point.  Everything was delish.
Very good option for Thai food in Toronto, very consistent and always yummy! Definitely a little more authentic than most of the Thai restaurants in the city.

Hearty Thai food in Toronto. Was fairly busy but got seated at the bar promptly as a single diner. Rich and deep flavors, with an outstanding curry base. Comparable with some of the finest Thai I have had in North America and worth the 15 min Uber ride to the spot. Fast and attentive service. Minor details like cooking the potatoes a tad bit more would have earned them a five star rating.

Came here with my family. It was super packed on a Friday night with people lining on the stairs at both ends and outside. However, there is plenty of seatings (someone mentioned there were over 75 seats), and our wait time was less than 25 minutes. 
The place is dimly lit, but it is well decorated. We were seated all the way in the back, and they truly make use of all the spaces available to them. 
We ordered Grabong (so many pictures of it on Yelp, and it is definitely something that you should just dive right in when it is served), Thai Chicken Wings (only 3 pieces, which was pricey, but the sauce was on point), and I had its Green Curry. The green curry was served inside a coconut, but they would give me a side of extra broth (and protein!) and rice. I can then dump everything in a bowl and eat it like that. Service was very quick despite how packed the place was. Prices are reasonable.

I was so hyped for Pai given all the reviews, but coming from the Bay area where we have tons of delicious food, this place fell short. It was absolutely packed and the dishes looked great, but honestly it was just average Thai food. It took over 20 minutes for a server to even get us beverages. Tables and chairs were sticky, and the service was so slow the whole time. Portions were fair, but beyond that I have nothing much more to say.

Holy cow. Like wow. I came to Pai Northern Thai Kitchen with extremely high expectations because everyone and their mothers (and fathers, aunts, uncles and neighbors) was raving about this amazing restaurant.
And. It. Did. Not. Disappoint.
I was thoroughly impressed with Pai from the very start. The venue is nested in a very busy area in Downtown Toronto. It's a bit unassuming at first, but once you walk in --- it's like you're in a whole new place. I decided to venture out to this popular (and extremely highly sought out restaurant) on Sunday afternoon during TIFF. Yeah, lol. Big mistake. I waited in line with 50+ other folks before they opened at 3PM and luckily made the first wave. 
I ordered the following:
Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Shrimp for $18.50 The dish was sprinkled with beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives and stir fried in a delicious, homemade tamarind sauce.
Okay, okay. I know what you're thinking. How can Pad Thai taste so good? Isn't it the same everywhere? And even if it was "amazing," is it really that game-changing? Yes, it is. The flavor packed a huge punch.
Side note: The noodles were cooked inconsistently i.e. some parts were soggier than others. However, the flavor really made up for it a lot. I was extremely impressed and couldn't help, but savor each and every bite.
Thai Chicken Wings for $6, which comes in three. They were layered with crispy shallots, lemongrass and crispy chillies with a sweet tamarind sauce. This was a great compliment to my dish.
Overall, I would strongly recommend making a stop at Pai Norther Thai Kitchen. Trust the reviews -- it's that good and totally worth the wait.

So glad my guy finally decided to try Thai food, and pai of all places!
I've only heard good things from this place. I had the pad Thai with chicken, mild spicy, and he had a beef curry with rice.
His beef curry was pretty spicy and it eventually gave a kick near the end. Portions were a good size! We felt full but not bursting at the seams. He did have food coma later.
I had the pad Thai and it was p lit. The peanuts were actually underwhelming but the tamarind sauce gave a nice umami flavour to the whole thing. Good ratio of meat to noodles and the banana leaf was a nice touch :) a tad salty though... I downed a ton of water near the end and needed gum.
Overall a great place for a cute date idea. Come at opening time to secure a seat because this place gets packed really fast!
Beef Curry Braised BeefChiang Mai Beef Noodle SoupCoconut CurryFried FishGaeng Hunglay Oxtail CurryGaeng MasamanFried Fish
My go to for Thai food. Always so good! Line can sometimes be long during dinner and weekends, but worth the wait!

Oh wow!!! 
So ..I had posted on Facebook that I was in Toronto and a friend in Manhattan commented that I needed to try Pai Northern Thai Kitchen so we stopped in after seeing Military Wives at TIFF.
If I could give this restaurant a 10 I would!
We thought it would be easy to get a table at 3:30pm but we had a 35min wait! That gave me a clue that we were in  a good spot!
We started with drinks while we waited - the kwahian Punch was so good !! We shared the pad Thai with shrimp and the chasing mai beef noodle soup!  Our neighbor shared her Kung tawt garlic shrimp. We also got to see her gaing kiaw wan in a coconut bowl - she raved about it!
Both of our dishes were amazing -the Pad Thai a bit sweeter than I have had before. The soup was enough for two! I wish we had room in our bellies to try it all!!

I would consider myself a Thai food connoisseur, and Pai certainly did not disappoint ( My girlfriend who is new to Thai food will also agree). Possibly the best Panang curry I've ever had in my life. Not to mention the coconut sorbet might have been the most memorable dessert I've had in a very long time (still dreaming about it). Don't wait until last minute to get here though, they get on a wait fast and if you don't get there before 6:00pm it's likely you'll have to wait some time. All in all it was a super cool restaurant experience.

This is my favorite restaurant in Toronto over the years. Pad thai here is the best in Toronto and I've visited Thailand too. They don't take reservations which is really irritating and stops me from visiting often, but this is the one trust me.
Always had good food however the service a lot of the time has been really bad. Not sure why. Just very dismissive. Like they don't want you there.

Arrived around 5 pm on a Thursday night and it was packed, but we were able to get a table and noticed that the place is huge. 
Service was quick and I was expecting something delicious... Pad Thai with shrimp was more sweet than spicy even though I requested medium. Wife ordered Tom Yum Kung and it was okay, likewise for the rice unless you like it on the hard side. 
Got some good pics, but that's it...
This place is no 4.5 stars as advertised/reviewed

Pai is a town in Northen Thailand, thus the street sign is used as the restaurant sign.  It is a not a fancy posh sign but simple and rustic to reflect the ambiance of the interior. 
We heard this place gets very crowded and we had a large group of 10 but we found out their machine system does not allow for same day reservations.   On a Tue at 5pm, some of us showed up and were seated immediately at a table even though not everyone arrived until 5:30.  By then, there was a long line out the door.
GRABONG - Popular appetizer of deep fried shredded kabocha (buttercup squash). It tasted similar to sweet potato fries.
PAPAYA SALAD - It was presented nicely in sectional ingredients which made it hard work for us to break the chips and pork rinds and unravel the noodles and mix everything together. (not user friendly so I would not recommend this)
GAENG MASAMAN CHICKEN- This is mild sweet curry with meat, potatoes, onion, peanuts, tamarind, coconut milk, cardamom, cinnamon, cloves and nutmeg.  Can't go wrong with this beginners curry, even for kids.
GAENG PANAG BEEF- Red curry made with red chillies and coconut milk, shrimp paste, kaffir lime leaves, eggplant and meat.  It was good.
GAENG KIAW WAN FISH - Green curry made with green chillies and coconut milk, bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, basil leaves, bell peppers.  This is their most popular curry, thus served in a coconut.
PAD THAI VEGGIES - typical pad thai with lots of stuff; better than I can make it.
MANGO STICKY RICE - up to my standards but nothing special
I was impressed with the server's knowledge of the food.
She asked if we have any dietary restrictions, we replied that one person cannot eat shrimp else he swells up.  She then told us which dishes on our list contained shrimp by products and which ones were clear for him to eat.

Strongly recommend. Some of the tastiest Thai food we've had. The service was excellent. Note, I would have given 5 stars had the Tom Yom Soup not been served late and cold. I had to send the soup back to he reheated. The dining environment is trendy and very busy, but comfortable. The food was so good we'll make the drive or take the GO train to dine there again.

I had some guests from the states coming so I decided to take them to Pai. I had never actually dined in the restaurant but have had take out from Pai and it was amazing. This review is based on my experience in the restaurant. I was able to get a reservation for 4 on Open Table 2-3 days in advance for Saturday night. Definitely made the right call since there was a huuuge line when we got to the restaurant, and as we were leaving at around 7:30, the line extended to almost around the corner of Duncan and Adelaide.
We started off with the papaya salad, tom yum soup, and Pai sangria. At first, I said that I didn't like salads and probably would not eat much of the salad. My friends ordered it anyway, and I ended up having a lot of the papaya salad. It was soooo good. It came in a platter and we were advised that it can be eaten all mixed or like nachos. We ended up eating them like nachos and it was fantastic. I loved their tom yum soup, it may even be the best I've ever had. The tom yum soup was so flavorful, not like the watered downed stuff you see at other Thai restaurants. We shared four mains--Pad Thai with Shrimp, Hunglay Oxtail, Khao Soi with chicken drumsticks, and Gaeng Penang with beef. They were all amazing and extremely flavorful but I think my favorite was the Khao Soi and Hunglay Oxtail. The Hunglay Oxtail was not spicy and is a good option for those who can't handle spice.
Overall, our experience at Pai was amazing, the service is a little slow, but it's understandable since the restaurant is crazy busy all the time. Great choice for impressing your guests as well as your taste buds

Expensive (dinner), over-crowded, bad air-quality and food was okay-ish. I've tried Pai multiple times and I still don't understand why it deserves such a huge crowd. The interior is dark, crammed, and extremely loud. This is not a great place for socials (dates/friends/family). You almost have to yell for someone to hear you. If you want to eat Pai, go very early, eat, and get out ASAP. It's just not a great environment. I especially don't like the fact they limit the reservations so you pretty much have to book 1 month in advance if you want to reserve online (which explains the line because no one could reserve).
As for the food, it's about 4 stars for certain items and some 3 stars. They are not bad, but not like the best Thai either. The food decor is nice yet the Khao Soi beef I had was dry and hard to chew. Food portions is also quite small, you'd definitely need appetizers. For the price that it charges, I don't think it's a good deal.
Pai has really good location and it's the closest Thai restaurant to the Financial District, that's why it attracts all these office workers. But it doesn't live up to its hype. I recommend going to Khao San Road nearby for much better quality food, ambience, prices, service and quantity.
The food could have been better and I wasn't blown away. Khao San Road is better. The service is good though.

A wonderful example of Thai food. The plan Curry was deliciously creamy yet had a mouth spice, which we ordered. 
my favorite item was actually on the dessert menu. The mango sticky rice was amazing. The mango was cut nicely and ripe and juicy. 
The ambiance is no frills and there are so many seating options from the bar to two different dining. It's good for groups all the way down to a solo lunch.
It's a bit of a wait at times. Our 3 p.m. lunch on a Friday was super busy.

Great food, wait times could be daunting though. I loved my Penang Curry and Mango Sticky Rice. I asked for 8/10 spice and I feel it was still mild for my tastebuds. Do ask for their Chili Oil, it's a life savior if you like hot and spicy food like I do!

My friend and I came here for dinner before going to a play and had an ok experience. 
The Ambiance:
The ambiance is pretty cool and this place is much bigger than it looks. It is underground and they have tables with beach umbrellas and the vibe makes you feel like you are above ground. 
The Service:
The service has pros and cons. We were seated at the bar relatively quickly with how busy the restaurant was. We placed our orders and saw people around us who ordered after us receiving their food. We waited over an hour for our food until I said something to an employee. They went to the kitchen to check on our orders and came back with our dishes which were now cold. I'm pretty sure they were forgotten in the kitchen and just sitting there. My friend sent hers back and I just ate mine since I was famished at this point. My friend had to send her dish back 2 more times before it came back at a decent temperature. My dish was just Luke warm. 
The Food:
I ordered the green curry dish. It was really spicy and really flavourful. It is served in a real coconut, which makes it pretty cool since you can also eat the coconut meat. The dish was like warm and didn't come with enough vegetables. I wish the waitress told me that I could have added vegetables to my dish when I placed the order. I was told about this after I ate my meal and I then placed an order for a side of steamed vegetables due to my food allergies. 
My friend ordered the an ox dish and she found it way too fatty and extremely cold. She was not a fan!
Would I return?
Possibly but I would opt to try other restaurants before going back here.

Came here around 4:30pm. There was already a line up. I roughly waited around 30 mins, and got a table.
The restaurant feels very homey. Just Like a local thai restaurant.
I ordered the chicken wing, vegetarian pad thai and a cold thai ice tea.
The chicken wings are crispy and not too dry. The sauce on the side is a sweet and sour. I just wish there was more. 
Pad thai with vegetarian and tofu came after. It looks ascetically pleasing. The vegetables came with bean sprouts, broccoli and cauliflower. If you can do spicy, medium spicy gives u little hit on ur tongue. But if you cant eat spicy, beware of the spiciness level you choose. Overall, the noodles are soup but not too mushy, 5/5!! 
The only thing i didn't like is the side dry lettuce. Great of appearance, but very dry and flavourless. 
P.S. If you are not a fan of coriander, remember to ask them to take it out. 
Overall experience 5/5!! Would recommend making reservations to avoid the wait line. Real Authentic Thai food right here!! (:

I've heard really good things about this restaurant and so I figured I'd come check it out after a long day of conferencing in Downtown Toronto.
Despite being a solo-diner, lining up still took 20 minutes or so before someone was able to find me a seat. The location is much bigger than I thought, and as my host walked me to my seat, I was amazed to find out how many more 'sections' there are inside the restaurant. So, lesson learned: even if there's a long line up, don't lose hope, because there's PLENTY of seats inside - you just have to wait for your turn!
I ordered the Khao Soi, and it is, by far, the best curry noodle dish I have ever had in my life! No wonder people line up in this place! The chewy noodles and the creamy (slightly spicy?) curry soup is just truly amazing! What a heavenly experience! I think next time though, I will order drumstick for my chicken, instead of breast meat. I think it will be more flavourful this way.
Service was a relatively slow during my visit (peak hours), I thought. 
Overall, this is a MUST TRY place if you're ever in downtown Toronto!

Some of the best Thai food in the city. Reasonably priced, with large portions. Good balance of noodle to topping ratio. Do make reservations otherwise walk-in has long lines most days. Food does come quickly.

The venue is quite loud. Over 80 and sometimes reaching 100. The food was OK but found it was too sweet. 
I was not impressed.
Best Thai food in the city, bar none. I've eaten at two different locations and each location is fun, colorful, clean with great wait staff and an amazing menu. Highly recommend.

My husband and I were in Toronto for 24 hours and we had heard this is the absolute place to go. So we went - and we were not disappointed! We were so excited actually that we ordered 1 app and 3 entrees because we wanted to try as many things as we could in our short time in town. We were not disappointed! We ordered the pork pad see ew, penang curry, khao soi and pork spring roll appetizers. Honestly, would pass on the spring rolls. The meat inside was dry and the outside was a big stiff, not crunchy enough. Khao soi was relatively similar to the penang curry but the penang curry had more of a sweet undertone. I loved the penang curry so much I packed it up to take home to America, but of course, realized that I would never be able to pass airport security with it *sad face* They have a nice little waiting area off to the side where you can relax and order drinks before you're seated for your meal.

Excellent food but busy so plan accordingly. I had the Pad Thai and the portion was generous and the perfect amount of spicy! Overall, this is a place every tourist and local alike must experience if they are ever in the area. It's worth the wait!

Great ambiance! Good service! Amazing food! Best combo for best experience. 
I ordered Pad Sew Ew and Red Curry, both tasted awesome and were generous in size. The ambience makes you feel like you are in the streets of Thailand, and the staff were very friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back!

Came here alone and got a seat at the bar while groups waited what seemed like an hour for a table. 
I ordered the Khao Soi. It's egg noodles and beef in a curry sauce/soup. 
This was an excellent dish. The curry sauce was luxuriously smooth, thick, buttery, creamy, and aromatic. The blend of spices was complex. 
The egg noodles tasted freshly made and had a pleasant egginess, spring, and chew. 
The beef was tender and almost fall apart (though not perfectly executed). 
Sitting atop the bowl were crispy fried straws of something (maybe onion?)
This is an excellent dish. And it's their most popular. I suggest you order it when you go.

First time trying PAI and it was soooo delicious! Got their shrimp pad thai ($20) & their chicken khao soi ($18). The khao soi was honestly the best I've had! Soup was flavourful, the perfect amount of curry and coconut milk. For drinks, we got a pineapple shake ($6) and mango juice ($4) which was super refreshing .
Lastly, we ended off with their mango sticky rice ($10). 
I reserved one month in advance on opentable for a table for 2 for a Sunday at 6pm. They're always super busy and lunch and dinner times are always full so make sure to reserve early!

Let me just start by saying this was the best pad thai I've ever eaten. Now, I'm not sure how much that is saying considering I'm not an avid Thai food eater; however, this is the best tasting one I've ever eaten. The portion was generous and the dish had the perfect amount of sweetness and saltiness. I ordered the Chef Nuit Pad Thai, inclusive of stir fried rice noodles, house-made tamarind sauce, beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, Thai coriander, fresh lime, home roasted peanuts, choice of chicken, beef or tofu and veggies. The lime adds a nice touch at the end. The cost was either 14 or 15 Canadian dollars. 
We also ordered the spring rolls, inclusive of deep fried vegetarian rice paper wraps, mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots. sprouts served with sweet and spicy Thai chilli sauce. Those spring rolls were so good. The fried taste of the spring rolls were reminiscent of the egg rolls I ate growing up. The glass noodles and mushrooms certainly made the dish but everything was intentionally combined for the perfect morsel of goodness. The cost of the spring rolls were CA $7.99 or $8.99. I would definitely order the spring rolls and the pad Thai again.
The place isn't that big and the line builds up pretty quickly. I advise going earlier in the primary meal times like 11/11:30am for lunch or 5 or 5:30pm for dinner. These times are ideals for those who do not like confined spaces or want to avoid crowds. If you don't mind, you may have to wait a fair amount of time before you get seated. The takeout line was pretty long too because it is a very popular place to eat. I also went with a friend that eats vegan and Pai demarcates vegan options on the menu. I thought that was a nice touch!
With over 2300 reviews at 4.5 stars, I can confirm that it is worth the hype. I'm not a huge fan of lines but if I pick a good time to go, I'll certainly go back.

If we were not in the digital era I wouldn't have found this place, it's so unassuming from the outside. Yet once inside I was surprised to find such a packed restaurant, they even have a waiting area with tables and everything. Fortunately you can have drinks while you wait and they have some very good cocktails. So cocktail in hand we waited. Once on our table we got some crispy chicken as an appetizer, oh, it was so good. My main was a Panang curry that was a bit different from what I'm used to, but that it was delicious anyways. Really enjoyed this place and will be going back when I'm in Toronto again.

Fun restaurant in Toronto that gets packed, so either come early to get a seat or make a reservation ahead of time online.  I wasn't able to make a reservation, but I was able to snag a table for dinner by coming by on a weeknight at 5:15 pm.  
The first time, I had Thai sangria, fried spring rolls, and green coconut curry with shrimp.  The food was delicious, and I loved how the curry was served in an actual coconut.  The sangria didn't taste very alcoholic though--more like a fruit punch.  
On my second visit, I had fresh coconut water and Chef Nuit pad thai with shrimp.  The coconut water looked kind of brownish and not clear, like the coconut water I had in California.  I wonder how long the coconut had been sitting out.  
The pad Thai was really good, with large pieces of shrimp.  At first, I thought they had skimped me on the shrimp, but then I realized all the large pieces were buried underneath the noodles.  Medium spicy wasn't too spicy for me to eat, and I don't like spicy food.  
You can choose the spice level only on some of the dishes, but I think the hottest isn't on par with true "Thai hot", so don't worry if you can't handle the heat, like me.

What can I say that hasn't been said before, other than just amazing food! Favourites were the Khao Soi and had to for sure try the mango sticky rice dessert!
Heads up though, ordered the mango juice and saw that they poured out a glass of rubican. Still a great drink, but just wasn't what I was expecting for $4.00.
Overall, AMAZING and I'll be back soon!
Great food, love the ambiance of the location. Always receive excellent service. Always leave full and satisfied!

I would firstly like to say that the food here was incredible. My partner and I got the gai satay to start, and gaeng massaman and chef nuit pad thai for mains. 
We came here two separate times, the first was so good that we revisited to order the same thing a few months later. 
The service was overall very nice, and the place is very big and usually busy. 
Unfortunately I could not give a five-star review and will probably not return because of the lack of attention to our stated food allergies. 
My partner has celiac and I am allergic to dairy. The dishes we ordered can be made without and I am in the habit of double checking with the server when they take the order and when they bring the food that the staff is aware of our allergies. Our food on our second visit clearly was not made without the allergens as we were severly sick afterwards. It's disappointing as I really did like the food. 
If you are allergen free I highly recommend this place, and to those with allergies-I hope your experience is not marred like mine!

A friend recommended this restaurant and I would have waked right by otherwise. Down a flight of stairs, once you walk in, it's a cozy hub of bustling activity, feeling intimate, warm, and hip all at the same time. We had the Thai chicken wings, gai satay, moo ping, and spring rolls to start. The chicken wings were crispy with just enough sauce and the tamarind came through well - we ordered a second serving immediately after getting the first. We opted to dine family style, sharing the Khao Soi, Massaman curry, and the Chef Nuit Pad Thai. These dishes were all well-executed, with the typical flavours of lime, coconut milk, pepper, peanut, and tamarind balanced appropriately. Serving sizes were also great for a group of four to share and get a taste of everything. 
Service was quick, considering how incredibly busy it was for a Saturday night. Would certainly recommend making reservations in advance, as this place gets PACKED around dinnertime. Prices are only slightly higher than other Thai restaurants and on-par for the location and quality of food.

Everyone who said I HAVE to come here when visiting Toronto was RIGHT! 
We got the beef pad Thai, the chefs Khao soi. The Khao soi is like a pumpkin coconut creamy curry with noodles! Both were extremely flavorful and DELICIOUS with such big servings for the price. These were so good that we ordered take out with the beef braised curry and another pad Thai. 
The spice levels aren't THAT bad actually. I would say average spice eaters could definitely handle mild/medium levels. 
The waiters were all friendly and accommodating! You HAVE to make a reservation the DAY before! It gets packed on the weekdays right at 5 PM. The winter dog drink was like a blue lemonade. Will miss this place SO much in America

Everything is Amazing - Ambience, Food , Service.  Typically a long wait but this place is worth every second.  Honestly I would wait hours for the Pad Thai but fortunately for me the wait was less than 45 minutes.   Really try this place, it is a gem!
Awesome food and the service is fantastic. Love the ambiance of the place with the records on the walls and classic rock being played

Holy crap did Pai get even better?
The food was SO good, even better than I remember. Everything we ordered was A++. 
The Khao Soi was so deliciously flavourful I wanted to put my face into that bowl. I would've licked the bowl clean if it wasn't embarrassing to do so. 
Thai Spicy Pad Thai was super spicy but still super flavourful. Green Curry in a coconut makes my mouth water just thinking about it. The coconut bowl is a great touch because you get to carve the coconut flesh out as you liked. Yum! The red curry was really good too, but personal preference is almost always green curry.
The Sake bombs (4 point play) were super fun. I think Sake bombs were $5 on Saturday when we went. Beer was delicious. Thai Iced Tea was GREAT. 
Love it. Can't wait to go back. Worth the line up if you weren't fast enough to get reservations.

This is a huge restaurant and it was quite busy during the time we visited despite it being mid-day. 
The service was lackluster, as it took awhile to be acknowledged by our waitress after we were seated.  Once she came by for drink orders it was awhile before the drinks came out and one was not included and had to be asked for again. Speaking of drinks, the Thai Ice Tea was fantastic! 
The food was superior to the service however, so it is definitely worth a visit if you are nearby.
A place with great experience. In the heart of the Toronto downtown. Food is delicious and restaurant setting is amazing. I do like it and will come back again.

Wait wasn't long and atmosphere was nice. Reasons I have to rate so low is I guess my high expectations for this place with the ratings here was over rated. The wings were great I won't lie very nice flavor, fried to perfection and presentation was even nice. Problem here is I figured I'd be getting a little more than 4 wings for 10 bucks and felt cheated, reason why I didn't I ordered the plate of stir fry with just vegetables. The stir fry was mediocre at best, I had a plate of veggies and it wasn't like it was fried or roasted or anything spectacular to cost me 17 bucks. I waited over 20 minutes for this plate of veggies got my wings before the veggies which was crazy. Overall I paid 35 dollars for 4 small but delicious chicken wings, a big ass plate of semi sautéed vegetables and a small bottle of sparkling water. Gotta say not what I expected. Not not edible just not enough of a place to run back to.

I came here on a Friday afternoon for lunch with a friend because it was highly recommended to me by a local. I was told to order the khao soi and the pad gra prow, both of which came out super flavorful. This was my first time every trying these dishes, and I can confidently say that they've set a pretty high bar for the khao soi's and pad gra prow's I'll run into in the future. The khao soi had a heavy, rich soup base that flavored all the vegetables, noodles, and chicken that came with it. The Thai basil really shone through in the pad gra prow and had just the right amount of spice too. Portions were generous and prices were very affordable. Plus, the venue's great for a nice celebratory lunch or dinner out in the city!

Had heard lots about this place so were here with some friends for lunch 
Driving to downtown on a weekday and back and parking there was a real challenge 
Worth it though 
The lunch menu is really limited and so is the experience 
Wanted to order green curry within the green coconut but they said they didn't serve it for lunch
So lunch kills those wonderful options with some great food as really a limited menu 
Ordered Kung twist shrimp, wings and spring rolls for starters and with coconut water which was good 
Then ordered Tom yum soup which was super excellent to die for with great flavours Have never had such great Tom yum
For mains khow soi with shrimp was very good and Penang curry was just fine too
If you want a good experience here and a wide choice AVOID going here for lunch

Our office loves the food here, however we had a terrible time ordering from this restaurant for our firm lunch yesterday. They don't answer the phones when they open at 11:30 - we tried 4-5 times before giving up and placing an order on uber. Then they cancelled our order because they couldn't do any of the appetizers we had ordered (and we weren't notified). By this time it was 12:15pm so I called again and finally got through and they told me to place it on uber again but that it wouldn't be ready for an hour. I asked if they could rush it as we had originally placed the order 30 minutes before, and thought it would be ready by 12:30pm. They said it could probably be ready in about 30 minutes. I placed the order again on uber with the items adjusted and uber estimated ready at 1pm. I went to the restaurant at 12:45pm as the woman on the phone said she'd try to have it ready by then. The order was ready - all except 2 items. These 2 items took a further 30 MINUTES to make as the rest of our food went cold (after 1pm as well). I asked the staff member there what was taking so long and he said that the kitchen was prioritizing seated guests over our order.... I think that was incredibly rude to say, especially as our original order was placed over an hour before then and I had been sitting waiting patiently for 15 minutes. I could also see other take out orders behind ours in the line being completed first. As I said, we love the food at this restaurant, but not when the service is like this and the food is left to go cold...

Yummmmmm! This place is delicious! Came here on a Monday night, the parking is not great but there is a lot one block away for $10. The restaurant is quite large but we were lucky enough not to wait around 6pm. We were seated quickly and the service was great! They were attentive and got us drinks to start and kept refilling our water throughout dinner.
We order the green curry. It came in a coconut- we selected chicken with the bamboo shoots and it was tasty. Very flavorful, they even gave us the remaining curry in a separate bowl.
We had the crispy fish! There were two sauces that really added to the flavors and kept the fish crisp since it was on the side. The rice comes with fried shallots which were delicious!
The khoa soi was the last dish but my favorite! It was so flavorful with a really good kick. The egg noodles were done right and there were fried noodles as well. The beef was very tender!
Come and enjoy! You won't regret it!
Food was okay, if you are Asian and have tried different Thai restaurant, you probably only give 3 stars.
This was probably the best Thai I've ever had. Love the environment and the easy to order menu. Highly recommend for anyone into Thai to try this spot!

The wait is worth the wait. The hostess said it was going to be 1.5 hours at 7:30pm and they closed at 9pm. Well we got lucky, thanks to the hostess. Our anniversary dinner was amazing!! Pad Thai, soup, and egg rolls were delicious!!
The khao soi is great here. Lots of tables available but there's usually wait. Prices are reasonable and portions are decent

Visited Pai on a Friday night and had to wait an hour for a table. The quick service and warm ambience was incredibly welcoming. We started with the Shrimp Chips, they were perfectly seasoned and paired well the tamarind sauce. For mains we got Gaeng Hunglay with pork belly, shrimp Khao Suey, and the Green Curry. Both the curries were quite delicious. The Gang Hunglay was sweet, sour, and had a nice kick to it. The Khao Suey was disappointing and lacked flavour. Overall, it was a pretty decent meal and am looking forward to trying out other things on the menu.
Sooo sooo good!!! Long lines but worth the wait!!!  We all loved it. Can't wait to try the other things on the menu!

This place is very very busy. We had walked by around 6pm on a Thursday and the line was out the door just to see the hostess. So we went the next day for lunch, and it was still quite busy. It has very much a laid back hipster vibe. Your choice of seating range from bar style, shared communal, to individual tables. At that point, because it's so busy you kind of take what you can get.
It's a little bit on the pricier side for size portion to quality for its price. However, the dishes do come with great packs of flavor.
We ordered the Tom Yum soup, beef Thai fried rice, and shrimp Pad Thai.
Tom Yum was interesting with much more tang from the tamarind. It's sweeter with the sliced bell peppers and slice onions. It was a balance between your sweet, salty, sour.
Beef fried rice was good although the beef protein was not charred enough as served. 
Pad thai was great and the shrimp was very bold and meaty. The spice was great and it was unique to have it accompanied with a type of cabbage slaw to mix in.
Overall a nice place to try. Just some minor food qualms.

It's good. I think Pai is higher quality than your average Eat BKK and Thai Room. I do think that it is slightly overrated, the portions are not as big as other similar priced places, it's always crowded and the flavour is comparable to other pricier Thai places. 
Nothing mind blowing, but it's consistent and I know I'll have a good time here.
The food was great, I would consider coming here again! I loved the energy, the service was awesome, there is definitely a nice charm about the place!

Great Thai food!  Usually I am a pad Thai or Panang Curry kind of guy but I wanted to try something different. I had the Pad Gra Prow and I'm so glad I did. It was something totally different from my normal but so super tasty. If you've never had it, give it a try!
The service was wonderful. I wish I caught the name of my waitress as she was top notch.

Pai is worth the wait -- literally. 
Don't be scared off by the dinner line out the door! Pai had a trendy yet authentic atmosphere in a great location in the city for a weekend night out. 
I appreciate that the menu indicates which options can be made vegan or gluten free. I had Khao Soi with tofu instead of meat and no shrimp sauce. And the flavor and presentation was AMAZING. 
My friends had the oxtail dish which they said was well seasoned. The curry portions that come in the coconut may be smaller than what you are used to but it was a fun presentation with great flavor. 
I wish I was in town long enough to try more on the menu!
This is the best Thai food I've ever had. The atmosphere is beautiful and everything I've tried on the menu is spectacular!

Excellent Thai food that was worth the wait. Khao Soi was delicious, spring rolls were tasty, and the pad Thai was delicious. Would definitely come back!
Service was good and the entire vibe of the restaurant was fun with memorabilia all over.

Pai continues to be one of my favourite restaurants in the city. Even if we can't enjoy the packed tables and fun ambiance inside the restaurant, takeout from Pai is one of the things that has kept me sane throughout the past few months.
My favourite thing to order (and I have ordered a lot) for takeout would be the Khao Soi. The noodles, broth and toppings are all packaged separately, to keep peak freshness. The portion size is great too, sometimes I even have enough extra broth for lunch the next day. I'll continue to come back for takeout until we can safely dine inside again.

This is the place that made me fall in love with Khao Soi. Everything here is good, but the Khao Soi shines brightly amongst the other dishes.
Everyone raves about their pad thai which I get but honestly, the kaho soi is where it's at in my opinion. I've gotten this during COVID-19 and they package everything very well- tight and with lids. The soup and noodles are separated so no worries about getting soggy noodles - i know that's a concern for me! 
That being said, this place is slighttttly on the expensive end but I think it's well worth it for the quality of the food.

After one failed attempt, we finally made it in to give Pai a try. The first time, it was lunchtime on a weekday and two sleeping toddlers in strollers. There was no ramp/elevator so we had to choose a different location if we wanted to have a peaceful lunch (which we did end up having elsewhere). 
We had tickets to the Royal Alexandra Theatre and thought that this would be the perfect time for a second attempt. As we passed by at 5:25pm, we noticed the line up already out the door. I ended up jumping out of the car while hubby went to look for parking. There's a line to get a buzzer and I was pleasantly surprised when I got to the host desk that it would only be a 15-20min wait. Although it looks small, the restaurant is actually quite large and can seat lots of people. 
We ended up eating about 20 minutes and was led to the back area. We passed a couple of "traditional" mat-on-floor type raised seating. The decor reminded me of a street food type setting. 
The menu is in Thai so I needed to read the translated explanations. When we were waiting I saw a bunch of mango sticky rices pass by so I knew I wanted to leave room for those. We bypassed the appies and got a Pad Thai (I wanted to compare with Royal Orchid and one in Grand Cayman which is so far the BEST tasting Pad Thai I've had), and a green curry with chicken served in a young coconut. We also got two iced teas. When I asked if they came pre-sweetened, I should've asked if the level of sweetness could be customized since other places typically make it too sweet for my liking. This one was just that. I'll have to ask next time around if we come back. 
We found that the wait was a bit long... over 15 minutes for the food to come out.  The Pad Thai was served with grated cabbage just like the Caymans so I was excited. The tamarind sauce was sweet, like Royal Orchid's but didn't have that savory flavour like the one in the Caymans (good thing we are going back! Can't wait!!!). So flavour was ok but the noodles were complete stuck together in a mass. Maybe too soft? Not enough oil?  I don't know. 
The green curry was nice and anything they couldn't fit into the coconut was served in a separate bowl. 
Mango sticky rice came nicely carved and on regular sticky rice. I've had ones served on purple sticky rice which gives it a nice texture. Flavour wise it was good but a bit skimpy on the mango. This dish was quite small for the $10 price tag. 
All-in-all, I'd say it's an average Thai restaurant. I wouldn't drive downtown and wait in line when I could have the same quality food uptown without lineups and free parking.

I've heard a lot of people rave about this place and decided that it was prime time I tried it out.  I came here with my family on a Saturday early evening (around 5pm).  It's a quick walk from the Princess of Wales theatre, which was nice.  I was forewarned that it may be very busy and that there is usually a line outside the door.  I wasn't surprised.  about 9 steps of stairs takes you from the hostess to the door ... so in theory, 9 people in a single filed line before the line up is outside the door (not really a huge line up to me. That's like a party or 2 waiting for a table). 
The outside is very cute, the streets are quiet.   I may have waited maybe... 5 minutes before getting seated at a high table top that seats four comfortably.  Keep in mind though that these are bar stools, however they do have regular sized tables around. First impressions were that this was a very cute spot.  The smells were good too, fragrant. 
We ordered the Garbong (it was highly recommended), which was fried squash straws that came with a tamarind sweet chili sauce.  The sauce was delicious.  The garbong was ok. It's good for the first few bites but it gets really heavy afterwards.  We shared it amongst 3 people and by the time the mains came, we were stuffed. It was crisp though, so if you're looking for a healthy fries alternative, this would be it. 
Ordered the Kawahi special?  Some kind of cocktail named after an athlete. It was good - gin based. pineapple juice.  You don't taste the gin at all, so it went down real smooth... too smooth.
The thai milk tea was amazing - I would have had like 5 of them. Condensed milk with a good balance of tea flavour. 
The mains we ordered were the chicken green curry that was served inside a young coconut with a side of sauce, and a chicken pad thai.  
Green curry was amazing.  i had ordered the medium heat and barely felt anything - would probably order full on spice the next time. The flavours of coconut and curry were delicious and the plus was you can scrape the coconut meat out of the coconut. Delish!
The padthai was kind of a let down. I was hoping for the authentic flavours of a pad thai - which it was  and hoped that it would be mind blowing since it's the first thing on their mains menu.  It was that nice, sweet, tamarind like flavour rather than the fake orange stuff you get at food courts.  The only problem I had with this dish was that it was dry... so dry that I had opted to pour the curry sauce on top to make it more edible. Good pieces of chicken and what not though. 
This is a good place for thai.  i highly recommend the curry. oh. and the milk tea. GET THE MILK TEA!

The first place people recommend when you visit Toronto is always to come to Pai. Focusing on authentic Thai food and staying true to the warm nature of thai hospitality, Pai delivers on all fronts. The khao suey and the iconic Tom Yum Soup are worth the wait (dont forget to add shrimp to the soup for extra flavour). Honestly, you couldnt go wrong with anything on this menu. Also keep your eyes peeled for the Toronto Raptors frequenting this location post game

Been wanting to come here for a very long time. This was my time here and I decided to try a bit of everything from the menu. The Khao soi was super flavourful and I love the crispy noodles that comes with it. The peanut sauce that comes with the satay skewered was also very delicious. I decided to splurge and got the lobster pad Thai, which is based on market price and only available on Fridays and Saturdays. On the day that I got it, it was going for $50. To my surprised, the lobster is exceptionally fresh and delicious and a decent size too. I actually think it's worth a try. It was definitely the highlight of the night. 5/5 for the lobster Pad Thai!
Great ambiance and amazing food. Consistent.  It's a popular spot so I would suggest making a reservation on the weekends.

Came here on a Wednesday at 1:30pm and to my surprise was this place busy. Line moved quickly but the line was still a 30 minute wait before getting seated. Was seated without water for 15 minutes before finally given water and the menu to browse through. 
Decided to order khao soi and gaeng masaman. Order took another 45 minutes before arriving at lukewarm temperature. Food tasted great but was disappointed with the temperature along with the portion size for the price that was being charged. 
Food was great but service was lacking.

Been here 4 times and each time is absolutely delicious.
Taste, portion sizes, beverages, vibe and wide selection are strengths.
It's generally always busy, but the place is huge and usually they can find you a spot (if you're just 2).
I love to bring friends here.

45-50 min wait from the door to the table to when the food arrived (Saturday evening). Slow wait to be seated and slow service. Therefore I'd advise coming here BEFORE you're in starvation mode. Once at the table the service was Not attentive - It took a while to get our drinks refilled. 
Beef Pad krapow- ordinary. Smaller plate in comparison to khao San road. 
Pad Thai - we ordered it spicy but it usually isn't. Spice works. The level "Thai spicy" is legit! Acceptable for those than can handle it. Yum!! They also accommodate and remove nuts if you're allergic. Definitely more fulfilling and more in terms of quantity than the first dish we ordered.
Based on the flavor of the food alone, this place has my vote. Good flavor, authentic Thai food.

This place was amazing. Right off the start, the atmosphere when you walk in and down the stairs is hard to ignore. It's very spacious, so walks in perfectly fine, especially if you don't mind sitting at the bars! My boyfriend and I, both when for the pad Thai, and were completely blown away. Hands down our favourite Thai spot in the city. Portions are great size and delicious !

The place was okay, the food was not bad but it is definitely overrated. There was a huge line up at 4:45pm and they do not take reservations. We waited about 25-30 minutes for our table and the hostess told us that we would be seated quite shortly. Which obviously 25-30minutes was not a short wait, but it's fine as this restaurant was extremely hyped and popular. We got seated and ordered our food. We got the summer salad which was served immediately (probably 2minutes after we placed our order) but then the rest of our dishes came out exactly 36minutes later and it seemed as though this was a common occurrence as the table next to us was also waiting a long while for their food. It was hard to flag down a server to ask how long the wait was and once our food arrived it was not even hot. It was more warm. And it did taste good but not anything exceptional. 
I would say overall, this place is extremely overrated. It was definitely not worth the wait and not worth the price. $20 for one dish and it was not even hot and it took 36minutes to get to us. It was definitely more waiting than eating here.

I have been wanting to try Pai for years but have always been deterred by the long lines. Enabled by a friend with the patience of a saint, I finally got to try it earlier this year before shutdowns happened and I can confidently say that the hype for Pai is absolutely well-deserved. I'm partial towards Northern Thai cuisine and having tried over 40 Thai restaurants in Canada/US believe me when I say this is one of the better ones!
This is one of the BEST thai restaurants I've been to outside of Thailand and 
both dishes we got were cooked to perfection. I got the khao soi with braised beef and my friend got the gaeng kiaw wan with shrimp (green curry served with jasmine rice). Presentation was drool-worthy and portion sizes were huge (we both had enough left over for the next day's lunch). The flavors were so rich and fragrant with the combination of coconut milk curries and just the right amount of shrimp paste. I was genuinely impressed and can't wait to come back to try out more dishes.
During quarantine, I haven't ordered take-out from there myself but I've heard amazing things and strongly urge you to try this option out and support them if you're in a position to do so!
Wonderful food flavourings with an extensive menu. Ambiance is rustic but works well for a casual dining experience.

Best pad thai ever! Packed full of flavors and dimension. That's what I really remember from this place. 
I got here right when it opened and there was already ten people waiting on a weekday. When you get there, the decor seems a little more hippie than Thai in my opinion. I was surprised that it was so dark in there, but I guess it makes it a fun atmosphere. 
My sister and I also ordered the pad gra prow and khao soi. The basil stir fry was moist and had a lot of basil flavor to it. The white rice balanced it very well. My least favorite dish was the khao soi. When we got it, the curry seemed lukewarm. I wasn't sure if that was normal, but I sent it back. It didn't taste appetizing. I enjoyed the noodles, but overall I'm not a fan of curry with carbs other than rice. 
The portions are big so if you want to try more than one dish, do community style. Service was great. I'd come back just for the pad thai.
The famous chef Thomas one day wanted Thai food and stopped here. Very good food with excellent flavor and good service. If in Toronto the famous chef Thomas recommends this place.

Heard this place topped Khao San Road, so it was decided for our NYE lunch spot. At 1:30pm it was a 10 min wait, but it got way busier after 2pm. The stairwell area was filled with people.  
Pai is a rustic place with a hip touch, with amber dimmed lights, wooden tables, painted artworks, tapestries, and a soul/r&b playlist. I like the picture wall telling the story of how Pai came to be. Be sure to check that out in the waiting area. There aren't a lot of servers so expect to wait a bit for the food and your check. 
With the place filled with so many people (lots of tables) already, the booming music wasn't really helpful in balancing out the chatter across the room. It gave us a headache and conversation was too muffled to be heard from across the table. 
Got the Tom Yum Soup (7$), Khao Soi (16.50$) and the Chef Nuit Pad Thai (15.50$). Portions for the entrees were fair, but the soup (small size) was tiny (altho the spiciness and flavour was awesome). See for yourself in the pictures. There is an option to upgrade to a large bowl (13$) which comes with rice, but that then becomes an entree. If only they had a medium size for people to share. 
Khao Soi has fresh egg noodles, golden curry, crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, choice of braised beef, chicken breast or chicken drumsticks. The drumsticks had shrimp paste so watch out if you have allergies. I got the chicken breast option. The crispy noodles were a good start to tasting this dish, but the curry itself did not appeal to my tastebuds. I wasn't sure what I was eating because the flavours seemed to conflict with one another. There were sweet and salty notes which clashed and so the curry did not shine through. Also, the chicken breast wasn't strips, it was more like frozen bits of chicken that were recooked - very dry and tasteless. The proportion of noodle vs chicken was off - I would have preferred more noods over the dry chicken pieces. 
Chef Nuit Pad Thai has stir fried rice noodles, house-made tamarind sauce, beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, Thai coriander, fresh lime, home roasted peanuts, choice of chicken, beef or tofu and veggies. My friend chose tofu and veggies, and medium spicy. There is also Farang Spicy for foreigners who can't tolerate much spice. Honestly I was eyeing the pad thai for the entire meal once I had tried a bit of it - so much more flavour explosion compared to my Khao Soi noods. The spiciness hits you at the back of the throat and warms up your system, and the seasoning makes you want to gulp down the next bite. Not sure bout the worthiness of the dish though, because the pad thai's had equal amounts of veggie - again, would've preferred more noods. 
Next time, I would probably get the soup entree alone next time since the large size = size of other entrees.

Pai is one of my go to restaurants in the city for quality Thai food. Their mango sticky rice is on point and their skewers are loaded with flavour. Would highly recommend! Key downside are the long wait times to get a table at the restaurant, but that speaks to the high demand of their food!
Best Thai in the city. Authentic but innovative. Order anything on the menu. Great first date place as their cocktails are delicious

I came to Pai on July 30 for a patio dinner.
Booking was a simple online process. 
SERVICE: 5/5
I was promptly seated upon arriving. The waiter was friendly and, most importantly, wearing his PPE properly. They kept a good distance away from me and my friend whenever approaching the table. Their kitchen staff COVID case was handled extremely well with 100% transparency. I am not worried but taking extra precautions myself to be more mindful. (I've also called Public Health and they told me this doesn't sound like I should be concerned but self-monitor for symptoms - which I don't have any). 
FOOD: 5/5
Pad Gra Prao: I get this medium heat with beef. I love the extra little kick to the food. It's always fresh & filling. 
Note: there's a lot of things that are missing from the menu - check before you come in to avoid disappointment!
Looking forward to when the restaurant reopens :)

I came here on a friday night in late November and was pretty impressed with how bust it was years later after it first opened. 
When I gave my name at the front, they asked me if our party would be ok sharing a table or being seated at the bar. ( to which we said yes to, because we were starvvving ) 
After about a 15min wait, our party of two was called up. They seated us at the bar, which actually was still pretty nice. 
We decided to start off with some cocktails and I got the Winter Dog Cocktail, which was a vodka based drink with peach schnapps , blue curacao & and lychee juice. It was pretty tasty! I would definitely recommend trying it. 
For my main, I went with the Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Chicken, I originally opted for Medium Spice, but then decided to go with mild spicy, but wasn't sure if that would be enough. So they offered to bring some chili oil on the side to help spice it up. You can always add spice, but you can't really take it away.
Overall the drinks were good, the food was filling and tasty. The service was pretty good, especially on such a busy night, and the atmosphere was lively.  I would probably come back here if I was in the downtown core, but it's tough to say if I would come here again if I was coming from the outskirts of the GTA.

Pretty authentic thai food in Toronto! Some dishes are a little too salty (the Tom Yum was too salty for me), but everything was quite delicious. Pai is well known and has gained a lot of probability in recent years and now reservations are pretty difficult to make! 
Not sure if the food if worth the line-up, but it is delicious. There are just other thai restaurants in the city that are just as delicious with no line.

The food here is really really great. I always get the khao soi! The service is also good, it gets really busy on weekends, but has never really impacted the service (for better or worse). The ambiance is just.. a typical cool Toronto restaurant. Mellow lighting, good music, lots of chatter!

50 minute wait, but worth every minute! Visited while on vacation and tried the Pad Gra Prow with Chicken ---  enjoyed it so much that we had it again a couple of days later. Great flavor, a nice spice to it and really good service.

we came here to eat..waited for our tables more than 30 mins long?
finally got a table..we sat on the back.. meals was good..
staff wear regular clothing.. very crowded place..
they play loud music..bathroom a bite dirty. 
i didnt ordered the meals.

I like the Thai food in the PAI near the king street . There a lot of people who want to eat there, and we waited for about half an hour to get a table. The soup is very delicious, I like summer salad and grabong with dipping sauce.

We love coming here. The food and service are great. We don't even mind waiting for a table. 
We love everything about Pai EXCEPT THE BACKGROUND NOISE. IT IS SO ANNOYING AND DEAFENING. 
How about some nice Asian music instead.?

PAI has been serving some of Toronto's best Thai food since I first dined here several years ago. There's always a crowd and party atmosphere in this basement restaurant that has vibes of a traditional northern Thai kitchen.
