I've had Chef Nuit's Pad Thai and Khao Soi before and all of our party raved about the food. On my most recent visit, there was still a line to be seated on a weekday afternoon.
This time I ordered the Pad Gra Prow with shrimp. After quite a wait, the dish arrived in an authentic metal plate (like one from my childhood). A perfectly cooked Thai style fried egg topped a bowl of rice with sauteed black tiger shrimps. The dish had plenty of Thai flavours but I was surprised at the small portion. The menu prices have also increased a bit with the popularity. Waitresses seemed a little too busy to regularly check in on all guests.
But if you're looking for a delicious Thai meal, PAI is one of the hotspots in town. I'm not surprised that Chef Nuit also started other popular places such as Khao San Road and Sukho Thai which also have overwhelming crowds. I recall the chef making a guest appearance on Masterchef Canada, so her good food is definitely not a secret.

Holy popularity contest winner! 
I had heard the hype for this place, but once I arrived and witnessed the wait list, I knew the hype had to be for real. Thankfully it was a short wait for a single attendee (Phew!). The actual resturant is oddly tucked away in a multi level setup, which I entered in what could be determined as a second floor, but actually ground level? Either way, it's laid out well and the staff really know how to squeeze you into every nook and cranny. Phobia of tight spaces...likely not for you as there was not much wiggle room in the restaurant. The staff are on point though as busy as they were, constantly checking in with me to make sure if I had any questions or needed anything else, so bravo! Menu offers some typical Thai dishes, but they also go a little bit more into depth of the fantastic Thai cultural dishes that you rarely see in the Americas. Of course...I saw Khao Soi...my complete downfall. It did not take me long to grab the Khao Soi followed by a fresh coconut water, yes actually fresh, in the sense of being sliced open and served to you hull and all. So why four out of five stars? I can tell you the flavor of the food was not an issue, more so along the lines of portion. I was still hungry after an appetizer of a meal being the Khao Soi and being I spent over $16 dollars on it, I felt a tad cheated. Not a huge deal, but was not aware of the finger food portions they served or I would of ordered more initially. 
Still well worth it though!
The food overall tasted good, but it is very oily. Also, go early if you can because it is always crowded. Service was ok.

This is an amazing restaurant that I would highly recommend to anyone. All the cocktails are very unique and delicious, especially the tea Mac and the Lowry. The Khao Soi is the best coconut curry I've ever had. It was amazing with the shrimp. If you go to Pai you MUST try the Khao Soi. The pad Thai, oxtail curry, and pork skewers were also delicious.
Amazing food. Tasty and with great texture. It takes a bit of time when ordering it to go, but it is worth the wait.

visited twice when visiting from Newmarket. The food was good quality, and the service was great. However the place was very loud and hard to talk with my friends, maybe need to ask for a quieter area next time. I recommend them!
Food is always amazing,I recommend the pad see ew. People from other cities who come here love it

HOLY COW! This was the best thai food I have ever had. Everything from the ambiance, the staff, the food was spectacular. I've had a lot of westernized Thai food in my lifetime and these dishes were the closest I've gotten to the quality of my sister-in-law's family cooking (from Thailand). When the Pad Gra Prow comes with a fried egg on top you know its legit. Looking at this photo my mouth is watering.
A fabulous spot for authentic Northern Thai cuisine.  Considered one of the best in the city.  Be prepared to wait in line - especially on weekends.

One of Toronto's iconic Thai restaurants!
Had the 'Thai chicken wings' which were good, but needed the sweet tamarind sauce as the wings itself didnt have much flavor
The spring rolls are vegetarian, filled with mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots and sprouts. Unfortunately these came out dry, cold and not crispy. The filling wasn't exciting or flavorful at all.
For the mains we had the 'Pad Gra Prow' with holy basil fried with chicken and rice with a fried egg on top. This was a delicious dish, the only thing was the rice to meat ratio... too much rice!
The last main is probably one of the most Instagram popular. The 'khao soi' with fresh egg noodles in golden curry with beef was delicious. The flavors were not overpowering and salty. Will try it with chicken next time instead as the beef chunks were a bit too big for my liking!

Everything is excellent except the coconut drink is not really good. I ordered fried chicken wings, gaeng hunglay with porkbelly and khao pla tawt. I love all the food and the restaurant is very beautiful. Will definitely go again!

Good food, BUT... long wait for a table (4pm on a Wednesday). We had no idea there was a 90 min turnover for tables (server brought bills and informed us at the 80 min mark). They don't take cash, unacceptable in my opinion. Our pregnant friend could not swivel the door of the toilet stall past her big belly & was forced to leave it open, regrettable design choice. 
Management could easily post signs in the entrance/waiting area that indicate their 90 min dining time and no cash policy, as a simple courtesy. Any place with prices this high should not be rushing you out of your seats as you try to order more drinks.
Excellent service, good drinks and authentic Thai food. Looks like a small place upfront but is huge on the inside.

Stucco cement is the ultimate exterior finish due to its durability and low-maintenance. Not to mention, stucco walls are resistant to fire, sound, and offer more energy-efficiency than several other materials. Stucco cement is a worthwhile investment for all types of commercial and residential properties.
With vast experience and expertise under our belt, Surrey Stucco LTD specializes in residential and commercial stucco exterior services.
Surrey Stucco LTD.
13345 104 Ave #5, Surrey, BC V3T 1V5
(778) 655-8475
https://surreystuccoltd.com/

An amazing spot!!! This place is a gem! The service, ambiance, food and everything about this place makes it phenomenal culinary experience. 
You will not be disappointed.

People say Pai is overrated, but I honestly can come here every week. Their food is delicious and addicting - with their pad Thai and khao soi as my top 2 favourites. Their wings appetizer is amazing as well. I always come here whenever I want to treat myself! Would love to eventually try their entire menu.
PAI Serves some of the best Thai food in Toronto! Every dish is phenomenal and full of flavour! Their pad thai is outstanding!!!

Energetic vibe with a touch of kitsch. The wait staff was friendly, helpful, and fast. The food was delicious and decent portions. We must've just come in on the front end of the lunch rush, but our waters were always filled and the wait staff checked in with us to make sure all was well.
It's loud so if you're looking for a place to have a deep conversation this may not be the place, but it would be perfect for an awkward conversation you need to have in public or for a group because everyone has to yell a little to be heard.
I loved my green curry - perfect heat and coconut flavor.
Awesome Thai food and service! Deserving of all its accolades. And expanding its dining room was a great idea. Thanks
This place has the best Thai food that i have ever tried in the city. The seating is a little tight & can have long wait lines, but it is worth the wait!

One of the best spots in downtown for Thai food. I would highly recommend to try Khao. 
The downtown spot has sometimes a long waiting list so be prepared to wait. 
The staff is very courteous and the the overall experience makes me want to go back every time
Excellent Thai food, good service, funky tiki bar ambiance. Had the masaman which was amazing. There's a reason this place is so crowded, but it's worth it.

Great food, good decoration, perfect place to have a chill dinner. 
I'd recommend getting their curry. The flavour is justtttt right.
Such good food!!! Well worth the long wait. The flavours are unlike anything, there is nothing like it outside of Thailand!
服务态度十分好！价钱合适.....烧烤非常好吃！火锅料新鲜品种多....汤底味道非常正宗！点心正！
Best Thai food in Toronto. I have a co-worker whose from Thailand and when I asked him what Thai restaurant he'd recommend and he said Pai, any day!

I have visited this restaurant several times for lunch but had never came for dinner until now. Just like always, Pai never fails. The restaurant is always fun, vibrant and cozy, with friendly staff and long line ups! Their Thai food always impresses and you leave satisfied! Prices are reasonable and justified with the delicious dishes you get. You almost forget you are in Toronto.
We ordered the Grabong to start as recommended by our server. It's buttercup squash fries, kind of like next level sweet potato fries with a Thai spin on the dipping sauce. Then I got the Pad Gra Prow with ground pork for my main and my friend got the Khao Soi. I knew I was going to enjoy the Pad Gra Pow because I've had it before but what surprised me was their Khao Soi. It was better than all the other Khao Soi I have had in Toronto. My friend actually liked the Pad Gra Pow better so we should have switched! Nonetheless you can't go wrong with these signature dishes. Their Thai Milk Tea is also bomb.
Go check this place out! You won't regret it! On

Definite  5/5.  Great  experience. I  looked at the menu and yelled  "Khao soi" because I really just  had to pee. So I  went  to the bathroom  dropped  the kids off at the pool and ran out.  The  staff  was  friendly  as they chased me out of the restaurant. For some reason, it came over  me to yell out "I don't like pineapple!"  Then  they  started yelling at me in another  language, I'm not sure  what it was,   sounded  a little like an  east asian  dialect. I just screamed "no habla, no habla" !!  Any hoots, 10/10  for the  washrooms: impeccable! the  printing on the menu was pretty  cool. I still have  to figure out  what khao soi is, but it sounds  delicious. By the way, I love pineapple, so I have no idea where that came from!  I must say, they have  a very enthusiastic staff!  The  whole experience was a great relief! FREE  PARKING!!
Drew

Great restaurant! Worth a bit of a wait in the line, which you can't really avoid. Tried a few different curries and loved them all, both the taste and the presentation! Cosy atmosphere made me quickly understand why so many famous people visited the restaurant. Love the story behind the place and the cool basketball posters! Good service.
Hubby and I saw this place on YouTube's "Worth It" and we were curious and had to try this place out. Is it all hype or is it "Worth It?"

This Thai restaurants food is lovely! A tad bit smaller menu than lots of places but the food delivers big though. Very flavorful and tasty. The Pad gra pow and the khao soi both has lovely flavors. 
Service was pretty good. Prompt once ordered. The place is a bit loud so you have to be ready for that. Loud music and lots of people so it is not intimate at all. Great food though!
I've been here around 4 times and I absolutely loved every dish I've had! The pricing is reasonable and the dish size is quite big. Definitely shareable with another person!

I'm not the biggest fan of Thai food, but I had Pai when a party I went to had catered from here.  I had some of the pad thai and spring rolls and was actually really impressed.  My partner is a huge Thai fan, so I even suggested coming here for dinner!
The food was good!  The only thing is that they didn't have drunken noodles(pad kee mao), when I asked the guy didn't know what it was. It supposed to be the most traditional Thai food.

Will this review be number 2892 for Pai? That's quite a bit of reviews but it makes sense given how popular this place is in Toronto. I've had the pleasure of dining here twice. It's a must to go here if you like Thai food.
It's always busy, always. I've only ever come here with a reservation. The reservation ends up being at an early time for dinner, as those are what are mainly open. 
Seats are very close to each other, which likely won't be the case during COVID as for now, I'd expect this place to be takeout only. 
I have not had any of the drinks here but would love to try them in the future. 
The Chef Nuit Pad Thai and Green Curry were both delicious. I am a vegetarian and there were plenty of options.
Thanks for reading and don't forget to wear a mask!

3.5 - People I knew really raved about this place and it gave me high expectations when we came here. Luckily we were seated right away despite it being a busy time. Service here was good but I found the food mediocre for me. Maybe it could have been since I have been having so much Thai food from one restaurant that I based my taste from them but the food here did not "wow" me. I am happy though to try this place as it has been on my bookmarks for years.

Let's talk about Thai food!!
This local Toronto restaurant is worth the wait. Chances are if you didn't make reservations weeks in advance, you won't get one days before your visit... but THAT IS OK! 
I came here for a birthday dinner, because all of my friends have been raving about it and I felt it was time I try it myself!
So first things first:
- if you come for dinner and don't have reservations, chances are you're going to have to wait a decent amount. IT IS STILL WORTH IT.
- you will have to wait to get your number and put your name down, then wait for your number to get called. 
Ambience: underground vibe, crowded, full bar, good music and wooden decor 
Now the part you're most interested in... THE FOOD: 
- Thai iced milk tea: BOMB. I've had this before at other Thai restaurants, but this one was by far the best. You really taste the tea, aka richer in flavour. Bonus is they serve it in a larger glass! 
- Squash Frits: I honestly can't remember the actually name of this appetizer, but if you're with a group of 2+ you gotta try it. Comes with a peanut sauce that has a nice kick. What I loved most is how light this appetizer was, and of course the flavour.
- Green curry: I NEED TO COME BACK FOR THIS. I love eating out of fruits so if you're on the same boat, you'll love this. It's served in a coconut!!! Given that I am slowly building my spice tolerance (this may not even seem spicy to other people), I actually really enjoyed the kick it had to it. I ordered mine with chicken, but you have the option of veggie, tofu, and beef or shrimp for an extra $2. The flavour was insane!!! They really give you a lot of the protein you order with it, so you don't need to worry about not having enough. It comes with rice for you to pour the curry and meats on so it's easier to eat. I underestimated how much was in the coconut because there was still some curry left. 
All in all, I think I have officially hoped on the Thai food train and will find myself back here. 
If you can overlook the noisy crowds, long lines, and smaller walk areas - then I have no doubt you will find this place just as enjoyable!
Amazing food and great atmosphere I highly recommend this as a must try been a few times and never disappointed

We stopped here for drinks before dinner reservations elsewhere and now planning to return for that good-looking food!
Bar/cocktail menu attached and everything looked good but my absolute fave was The Serge Protector!!! It's a little mezcal, a little Germaine, egg white, pepper... great combination!
If you're a fru-fru drinker, go with Summer Dog.. I was lured in my the fresh lychee, which was great but it's a very sweet cocktail.
We also tried the sangria with the red wine floater which was excellent.
If you have a group, get the sangria glass pitcher; the presentation with the wine floater is beautiful.
Very friendly, knowledgeable and efficient bar service.  Hip vibe and feels like a place you want to hang out.  Such a good find in a neighborhood full of more commercial feeling/theatre district bars/restaurants.
Great service fun atmosphere! The shrimp pad  Thai and pork satay were very tasty would love to come back next time we're in Toronto!

Bold flavours and a electric atmosphere make Pai a go to if you're craving Thai in Toronto. The dishes are full of flavour and the pleasant heat that comes with Northern Thai food specifically. The beef curry that I had was rich without being overpowering, and the Tom Yum soup was just the right balance of sour and spicy. 
I would definitely recommend going, but be sure to either make a reservation or be prepared to wait in line for a table. I went on a random weekday night and still needed to call a few days in advance for a table for four
food is always amazing there.loads of different dishes. pricing is amazing and portions sizes also
Great food. Love that they expanded. Less wait. Great Thai tea. Would recommend for anyone visiting toronto.
Favourite spot to go to for Pai! Order the Khao Soi, you won't be disappointed. I also love the fritters, and the lychee sangria is prime

I have been here many many times in the past years. It is ALWAYS packed. I don't even bother with near-term reservations because I know there will be a long wait. If you go at a random time, or for an early dinner, there is ample space.
The food: I prefer going as a group because then you can order appetizers to share. The papaya salad is a great shareable option. I almost always get the Khao Soi (~$18). I have also tried the green curry in a coconut. Both are amazing. The serving sizes are on the larger size, but hey, who is complaining? The food is decently priced. The service is fast and most importantly, everything tastes amazing.

You can't go wrong with a place that has 1500+ 5star reviews. We came here after a friend who is local here recommended it. We stopped by on a Friday afternoon for lunch and it was pretty crowded. You can order drinks and appetizers while you are waiting though which is great and made the wait painless.
We ordered the eggrolls while we were waiting and to be honest I never thought I would write a review for an eggroll. This eggroll was definitely the best I have had so far; we liked it so much that we ordered a second plate of the appetizer. In addition, we got Penang curry and fried rice and both were great as well. 
Staff were super friendly and service was good.They don't do same day reservations though, so plan ahead because it does get super crowded.

This was probably one of the most delicious Thai places I've ever been to. Also, one of the best places I was able to eat at in Toronto. It was absolutely PACKED around 3pm. This just highlights how amazing the food is and people come here no matter what time of the day. We got the Thai fried rice, the panang beef curry and the pad thai. I could not tell you which I loved more because they were all soooooo amazing. I would highly recommend coming here if you are a fan of Thai food. The menu is  simple, but there are so many amazing dishes offered. The beef noodle soup appeared to be popular and I can't wait to go back to try it.

I ordered the pad Thai and it was completely different from the downtown venue.  No where near as tasty 
But recently ordered in the green curry and it was delicious.
This is my favourite Thai restaurant, and I've been to many.  The ambiance is amazing, and the food is absolutely incredible.  I highly recommend the beef Massaman curry.

Finally had a chance to visit Pai after so long. The food still tastes as wonderful as it used to be. Of course we had to order the classic Tom yum and buttercup squash fritters along with Shrimp pad thai and our all time favourite "Pad gra prow". The service however might need some improvements, they were not attentive. We had to wait a good 10 mins to be served, not too happy about this!
Amazing food and great service. The Pad Gra Prow was my favorite plate by far. Highly recommended

Still as good as it was 5 years ago.
Pad Thai $18
Pad See Ew $18
Grabong $15.50
Thai iced tea $6
Sangria $11
Everything we got was cooked and made to perfection. Great service and food has been consistently on point. I think my favourite main dish is now the pad see ew. Damn that thick noodle just hits the spot!
Get the sangria, you won't regret this.
Amazing food, atmosphere is so funky and authentic. And the staff are incredible attentive!

This is not based on my experience of food. They would not tell you how long is the wait time to be seated in the restaurant until you reach there. I called several times to check on the wait time as I didn't want to get into the hassle of finding a parking spot ( that area has construction going on) with a toddler. I told them I would reach in another 10 mins if that helps but they were adamant not to give out the information. I found it extremely unreasonable and unhelpful. I decided to eat elsewhere.
Great food, and friendly service! The space was clean, and we had a lovely night out with friends here. Highly recommend!

O. M. G. This is THE best Thai food I have ever had. I was in town for a conference, and my friend and I received a recommendation for this restaurant. We happened to be in the area and walked by to see what the wait would be. It was an hour, but decided to wait. It was absolutely worth the wait. I'm from the US and have traveled a lot across the country, and always look for the "best" Thai food in every major city (New York, Chicago, etc.) The food at Pai blew all of my favorite spots out of the water. We ordered the papaya salad (which was the most delicious and beautiful papaya salad I've ever had--photo attached), beef pad Thai, and panang curry. All of our dishes came out quickly, were fresh, hot, and delicious. Spice levels were just right and the flavors were outstanding. This food was on another level. I highly recommend! I will return if I'm ever in Toronto again in the future. Thank you, Chef Nuit Regular!

OMG this is the best Thai food I've had in Toronto! The Green Curry with shrimp is legit out of this world (medium spice), the shrimp are massive and very tender. I also got the Chef Nuit Pad Thai and while the dish was delicious, I found it a tad dry (I'm sure it was because it was delivery), but then I threw some green curry sauce on it and it was a game changer! 
I ordered through Uber Eats, so I can't speak to what the restaurant or service is like- but oh my god the food is fantastic. Fresh ingredients, generous portions and really flavourful. 
I will definitely try dining in soon and update my review .

We were a bit concerned seeing the long line at 8 pm on a weekday night but so relieved we stayed through the line since have never had such a delightful meal!  
Yes the atmosphere was a little bit on the loud side but the friendly service and the food more than make up for it.  We loved the high tables with stools and the veggie spring rolls were delicious.  
We ordered Gaeng hunglay with oxtail (a delicious oxtail stew reminiscent of an Indian curry), khao pad thamada (a Thai style fried rice), chef nult Phad Thai, and khao pla tawt (basa fish).  I appreciate that you could customize the spice level of each dish and even though we got everything mild it was still so flavorful!  All were wonderful but the oxtail was our favorite, shocked at the tenderness and uniqueness of that dish.  
I wish that we lived closer since would frequent this spot more often...  I'll dream for now until the next time I'm back in Toronto to visit :).

Went on a Sunday night and there was already a line. We got a table for two within five minutes. For a Thai restaurant, I would have to say this place has an unusual ambience -- it's dimly lit with popular North American songs blasting on speakers throughout the restaurant, and can be quite loud. There is also a full bar here if that's your thing.
All in all, the food was great. The Gaeng Kiaw Wan 'In a Coconut' is a green curry dish served with rice and extra green curry in a bowl on the side (the waiter said it was because it can't all fit in the coconut). It is a dish more on the spicy side, but I would say it's still manageable. The coconut really gives this dish some character, and you can also scoop out some coconut meat with your spoon to eat as well. You can choose between chicken, beef, dish, or tofu & veggies.
Khao Soi is also a curry dish but it is a coconut curry dish. It is more sweet than spicy but still has a kick of spice to it. I like the combination of egg noodles and crunchy noodles. We got braised beef chunks (like the ones you put in beef stew), but you can choose between chicken or beef. I thought this dish might be overhyped when I was reading Yelp reviews prior to coming here, but it really is worth the hype.
Highly recommend this place for anyone looking to have Thai food in Toronto. I'll definitely be back again.

Came here for the second time and really enjoyed my experience yet again. 
Once we got a number, we were directed to the bar to enjoy a drink or two while we wait inside the restaurant for them to buzz our number. During our wait, we ordered Tom Yum Caesar and Thai Mojito. Tom yum Caesar felt really strange at first, as it felt like cold tom yum soup with alcohol, but slowly became addicting. 
 
When we finally got seated after about 20 to 30 minutes, we ordered:
1- Miang Kung - various ingredients wrapped in betel leaf (really different than what I had tried before, it felt really refreshing...if you'd like a cold dish for appetizer, I'd recommend this dish. It's great that you can control your flavour to your liking as well
2- Tom yum kung - large pot of tom yum soup with large shrimps, served with a bowl of white rice (it's a good portion to share between 2 people, a lot of soup)
3- Pad gra prow - basil stir fried with our selection (tofu) ... also a tasty dish, but became really spicy
Overall, I had really enjoyed the environment, except that it was unfortunate that the fire alarm went off and we were beside it, so a few tables around us including us rushed through dinner and left. Not sure what happened, but hopefully that won't happen again!

If you want the best Tom Yum soup of your life then come here !! I've had a lot of Tom Yum soups in my life and I have to say this puts it at the top of my list for me . So much flavor and done correctly ! It gets pretty busy in here so get ready to wait a few but it's totally worth it ! I ended up getting the Khao soi for lunch . The flavor was good but it came out lukewarm . The braised beef was pretty tender . I didn't care TOO much about this dish . The fiancé got the rice ground beef dish . That was AMAZING !! Loved it so much . I thought that was better than my Khao Soi dish . Service was very attentive . Got my food out right away while it was pretty much packed inside the bar . Also - the bathrooms are really clean !!!

This is a warm & cozy buzzing, basement level restaurant, with a cocktail
menu so delicious that you'll wish they were open past 10:30pm.
The food is generously portioned, delicious, and reasonably priced. Be prepared to wait for a table, they have a side room with benches and tables.  
My companion had a veggie Thai meal that was served in a carved coconut.
 I was thrilled with the amazing rice noodle beef soup.  Our cocktails (a plum wine mule and a cool sake were excellent.
Definitely want to return.  Staff was incredibly friendly, welcoming, and have a rule to never rush folks out at closing time.  Photos below.
If you like Thai food and you are downtown Toronto this is the place to be.  It is busy but the food is fantastic.

THIS PLACE WAS SOOOOO GOOD! I was in Toronto for a women's conference and my friend and I decided to check this place out for dinner. We were promptly seated and given menus. She's a vegetarian and they had really nice options to choose from. I went with the pad Thai. We got our food and holy portions! I ate mine for dinner, a later meal before bed, then STILL had some left for the next day. My friend got the soup and also got 2 meals out of it. Service was great, location was great and priced very reasonable for downtown Toronto!

Hands down the best Thai restaurant in TO. There is always a line up to get in but worth the wait. 
Love the decor and the vibe. 
For starters we had the Garbong (squash fritters), along with Miang Kung. For the main, we had Khao Soi and 
Laap Salad. You can really taste the ingredients with every bite. We loved the food and the atmosphere 
The service made it even more pleasurable. Our waiter and the helpers where all pleasant and made sure we where ok at all times. I highly recommend this restaurant to my family and friends, you won't be disappointed 
The only thing I would recommend is to book a reservation  prior, the line up to wait is really long if you don't reserve
PAI's pad kra pao and pad see ew are a MUST. They're always delicious! One of the best authentic Thai foods in town hands down.
One of the best Thai food in the town! Since I tried this place like 6 years ago, I've been their regulars like many others. Always super busy but food comes out in timely manner. Highly recommend!

I've been here numerous times and contemplating of adding more to the more than 1000 glowing reviews but I just feel I need to have a say in this restaurant too.
4 words for you - YOU SHOULD EAT HERE!
If you love good FOOD especially Thai cuisine then seriously by all means you should try PAI. I've taken more than 100 people in this restaurant including out-of-towners and recommended to families and friends. And every time they come back to thank me for introducing them to Pai.
If you're ever going to order something here, that should be the Khao Soi. 
Rich and creamy and packed with flavour from the slew of aromatics combine with tender braised beef, this is my fave dish and the one I normally order here. 
If you want a unique cold beverage, you should try their Thai iced tea. This sweet, creamy beverage is very popular in Thailand and Pai's version is so refreshing and not so sweet. 
Another dish I enjoy ordering is the Thai Fried Rice. The subtle taste of fish sauce blends nicely with the other ingredients which makes it so delish!
The restaurant ambiance is also homey and cosy and they have this one area where diners sit on cushions. Everyone from the hostess to the servers are very nice and friendly.
I would have given 5 stars but noticed that the portions have gotten smaller. Nevertheless this is still one of my fave Toronto restaurant.
Excellent food. Efficient customer service. Meal prices were reasonable. Will visit again. The ambiance was nothing exceptional. Very noisy.

Came here on Saturday at 1145 and a line has already started forming so come early! Waitress was very friendly and attentive. The best dish for me was the shrimp miang kum. Definitely a must! I'm surprised they have this here as it's a very niche thai dish - will definitely return for more! The platter is alright, I like the moo ping (pork skewers) the most. The laab (minced pork) tasted kinda soapy (?) Which is weird I'm not sure why but I didn't enjoy it too much. The fritters were crunchy and fun to eat. Last the beef salad was okay. It was a little dry, I wish there was more sauce or dressing because the dressing is really good. All in all it was very good and I would definitely come back to try the rest!

The ambience and hum of hungry diners on a cold Toronto night really set the tone for a terrific evening. I could tell the servers were proud of the cuisine coming from the kitchen and the various Thailand scents that permeated the restaurant did not disappoint!
Be ready for a wait if you want to walk in during prime dining hours, but the venue is expansive. What looks like a quaint location rapidly expands into quite the venue upon being summoned by the hostess and led to a table. It'll be close quarters with you fellow patrons but by no means claustrophobic.
 I selected the following: PAD GRA PROW (holy basil stir fried with your choice of ground pork, chicken, beef or tofu, steamed jasmine rice, thai style fried egg, nam price nam pla sauce). Downright delicious with really well executed crispy pork. The medium heat level as requested wasn't that hot and really let the other flavors of the dish shine through. It was slightly small portion than I was hoping but all-in-all, a terrific experience.

First time at this restaurant.
Had heard from many people that is a must try place and it definitely did not disappoint. From the moment we walked in we were greeted and accommodated by all staff. They were very knowledgeable about their food and made great suggestions. But I cannnot say enough about the food.....wow soooo delicious  I would go back again and again.

Pai pai pai! I would definitely recommend this joint. Pai has been on my hit list for quite some time now. When I finally had the chance to go, I took it! The experience was pretty good. Just what I expected. 
I ordered their khao soi and their mojito. The khao soi is a peanut based sauce/noodle soup. I usually get it with beef. It's amazing. Yum! Loved it. The flavours are very strong, not overpowering but hearty. Definitely worth it. Even tho it's a little pricey, it's worth it. I don't give a lot of 5s out, but for what it's worth, I enjoyed it. 
Definitely coming back to try more!! Try to reserve or come in early! 
$$ -15-25ish

I mostly order khao soi from thai places. The one here is solid. Great broth flavour. I got the veggie with tofu. Still prefer the liberal ingredients used in the khao soi at Sukothai on Wellington  ( more green onion, cilantro , lime and option to increase level of spice ) but Pai's version isn't far off. Will order again in the future.

Back in 2016 I took a trip of a lifetime and one of the destinations was Thailand. I have been dreaming of the flavours that I experienced there ever since. If you're like me, forever seeking truly authentic memories of Thailand, look no further than the Entertainment District's PAI. NOW Toronto voted them as the #1 Best Thai Restaurant 2018, they're featured in the Day of Gluttony: 24 Toronto Restaurants in 24 Hours video, and blogTO has named them #1 Best Thai Restaurant and #1 Best Pad Thai in Toronto. Reservations are highly recommended as this restaurant is regularly lined up out the door.
Executive Chef and Owner Nuit Regular is from Northern Thailand herself and opened her very first restaurant in a town called Pai (northwest of Chaing Mai). After moving to Canada her goal was to bring the distinct flavour of Northern Thai cuisine to Toronto. She now owns a family of four different Thai restaurants in the city but considers PAI her home. You'll recognize the restaurant right away from its "highway signage," letting you know that you are about to enter the correct place: Thai food heaven.
As you descend the stairs into Chef Nuit's subterranean Thai lair, the vibe feels extremely laid-back and unpretentious. It's as if you've stumbled upon some kind of secret basement - except that everyone is well aware of how good they are and it's no secret at all. This place isn't "traditional" Thailand in decor, not even close. It's more of a modern, young hippy's take on Thai, with beams and brick walls, twinkling string lights, and pictures of musicians and street signs as artistic pieces. The ambiance is the fun side of Thailand, captured in restaurant form. The dining room is always packed and busy. It's noisy and plates of food are constantly passing by... And the best thing for you to do is to jump in and hold on for the ride.
The staff is friendly (but busy) and after a short wait we were seated at our table with the room's activity unfolding around us. I ordered a Thai Iced Tea ($5.75), my favourite thing to drink. I loved the fact that they also do Thai buckets (complete with rum, Red Bull, and coke) but since I didn't want to die that night, I abstained. On the other hand, I was disappointed that Chang is not present on their beer list. Regardless, my Thai iced tea took me straight back to the hot, hot days that I spent in Thailand, constantly consuming this beverage in an attempt to cool off. Strong black tea paired with the sweetness of condensed milk is never wrong.
Thai food involves complex layers of flavour and sophisticated balances; spicy, sour, a little bitter, salty, herby. Colour and texture are important; crispy, soft, cold, hot. This interplay between elements is what makes Thai food so thrilling and addictive. The best Thai restaurants in Canada are the ones that truly honour these intricacies and offer an authentic dining experience. There are a lot of Thai restaurants. There are far fewer good Thai restaurants. PAI is one of them (along with Maenam in Vancouver).
The menu at PAI involves six different sections, none of which are overwhelmed with too many dishes. The menu is paired down to exactly the right offerings, showcasing exactly what is best. The group that I was dining with was ready for a feast!
We started with the Som Tum Tad 'Papaya Salad' with Dried Shrimp (Shredded green papaya, tomato, long green beans, garlic, red chili, tamarind juice, long leaf coriander, coconut sugar and freshly squeezed lime. Served with pork rinds and shrimp chips - $14.00). The presentation of this gorgeous platter set the tone for the rest of the meal and built excitement for what was to come. I loved the crisp freshness of this salad. Most of all, I appreciated the zesty spice of the dressing used. The best papaya salad that I ever tasted was at a night market in Krabi, and it was exceptional in large part due to the punchy dressing that the salad was bathed in. The version at PAI is by far the closest that I have come to tasting anything else like it. I enjoyed the addition of texture with the crunchy and playful pork rinds and shrimp chips. An ideal way to begin a meal.
Once the salad was finished the rest of our feast arrived all at once. Our table was an eclectic array of bowls, dishes, platters, all being passed from hand to hand. Colours danced across the table and tantalizing aromas beckoned us to dig in.
From the Stir Fry section we obviously had to try Chef Nuit Pad Thai (Stir fried rice noodle in a homemade tamarind sauce with bean sprouts, tofu, egg, chives, long leaf coriander, shredded cabbage, fresh lime and house roasted peanuts - $16.50), known as the best pad thai in the city. You also get to select whether you would like your pad thai made with chicken, beef, tofu & veggies, or shrimp. I chose the tofu & veggies because our other dishes contained either chicken or beef. When asked about which spice level we wanted, I chose medium. Pad thai is such a standard dish in every Thai

Make a reservation! This place is Hot crazy busy!  There were long lines of ppl waiting for tables as we were leaving. I do have to say it is worth the wait.  Because it is located downtown expect traffic.  And getting into a garage for parking is kind of a pain, but once the food arrived we forgot about the stresses of getting there on time. 
The food is very authentic and true to form. It's not often you can say that when it comes to Thai food. It was just insanely tasty.  So good in fact we ordered food to go, since we knew we wouldn't be returning.  The pad Thai for breakfast was still phenomenal by the way. 
Expect nothing but exceptional flavors.  Our service was good, I do feel it could be a little better but given they were jam packed and there wasn't an empty seat anywhere in the restaurant it's understandable.
Solid place for takeout but the restaurant itself isn't good for dates or anything more than getting a quick bite.

This place is absolute heaven for Thai cuisine inthusiasts. All of the dishes are absolutely delectable, and crafted perfectly. The squash fritters are a must and so is the tom yum soup. Frankly, everything else is equally as delightful. Please visit this space if you ever get the chance. Do not be intimidated by the line ups as there are no reservations at PAI. However, lineups move very quickly and the experience following is beyond worthy. 
P.S no photos of the food were taken simply because it was too delectable for me to occur to pick up the phone.
11/10
P.P.S service is lovely and the atmosphere is transporting.
A great place.  My family felt tight at home. The service was exceptional and the price was reasonable. If you Uber it might take longer than quoted.

Just went here for lunch.    Amazing food and great service.   Get here early or make sure to have a reservation, because this place gets busy (and for good reason).
Had the green curry with fish.   For $16 you get a ton of food.   Got about 5 pieces of delicious fish (Basa though, but I like the taste of Basa).   The fish is not over battered in its panko crust.    Fried to perfection and very juicy.  The curry sauce is so good which is served on the side.   I dipped the fish and poured some on my rice.   
Have to go back to try the Khao soi next time.   Can't wait to go back
Excellent food, interesting venue, great service. Highly recommended. The food seems to be from a different region than we're used to so I'm glad we tried something new.

We tried this place couple of times during our trip to eastern Canada from California due to the rave yelp reviews.  Our first time we only had the northern platter which was very good.  It consisted of the Thai sausage, pork laab and skewers and the grabong squash fritter.  That was my first time having the fritter and I enjoyed it very much.  They were out of some food during that night.  
The second time, we had the plah nua, summer salad, shrimp Tom yum soup and again the grabong fritter with a couple of sticky rice.  The soup was good.  I thought the summer salad was quite tart so only took a couple of bites.  They also ran out of some menu items when we were there at 7 pm.  It doesn't seem like they offer any spice as the laab and plah nua had no Thai chilies in it, unusual for Thai food.  We did ask for fresh, raw Thai chilies to eat on the side to add some heat to the dishes.  
Service was ok, seems to be understaffed for a busy place.  
4 stars as I can't stand it when restaurants are unprepared and run out of food.  Both nights we were there, they ran out of the coconut ice cream.

Hm... I'm gonna try coming back here to get the full experience but for now I'm just going to comment on the food because I've only ever gotten takeout.
I've only ever tried the Pad Thai here and you know what I have absolutely nothing bad to say about it. It checks off everything I want in a Pad Thai and this is the safest bet you'll get in Toronto. The only reason why I wouldn't give it five stars is cause I'm not particularly wowed by anything, if anything I feel every other Pad Thai place is like below standard and this one is the standard. 
My boyfriend also tried the green curry and he seemed to really like it. I tried a bite and it was quite refreshing and coconut-y but very filling. 
Can't wait to try this in house someday!

Best Pad Thai I've had in my life. They make most things vegan. Kind of expensive though- $18 for a Pad Thai and $11 for an order of 3 (tasty) egg rolls? ($CAD). Can probably find cheaper, but you're wanting the best, Pai is it. Very friendly waitstaff that anticipate your needs (more chili sauce? looks like you need more water?). Easy to get a table when I went, but I'm told it's sometimes difficult -- really worth it.

So my coworkers and I decided to make a visit to Pai to get some authentic Thai food as the food choices around my office is bad. It is quite a walk from my office to Pai. But we ordered ahead through Ritual and it is hassle free. 
I ordered the Thai Fried Rice and this is so good that I was like WOW! Added some fish sauce and the lime. WOW! The flavour just kicked up a notch. The only comment I had is after a bit of a walk back to the office, the rice became a bit soggy. So not really anyone's fault. Just how takeouts are. So my experience with the rice is still good, just minus the sogginess. I am coming back again either for lunch or take out. And yes, I must try the curry. 
I do have a comment regarding the restaurant. So when I got in, I felt the air was a bit stuffy. So I felt a bit disoriented. Just a thought.

My husband and I were visiting Toronto and came here after reading the reviews. Pai did not disappoint! We had to wait for a table for close to an hour but it's okay since we didn't make a reservation. The service was great from start to finish. Everything we ordered was very tasty! Great vibes too. Would definitely come back the next time we are in town.

This place is busy busy busy, I'm pretty sure they take reservations so take advantage of that if possible.
The food is surreal, tried so many of their menu offerings, with all coming out on top! The environment and service was amazing as well. Vibrant atmosphere, amazing food and service can't be bet!
Visit if you fancy a loud restaurant with amazing food to follow.

This is a super cool Thai spot in Toronto. Someone recommended this place to my friend and I and I'm glad we tried it! 
The line tends to always be out the door as other reviewers mentioned, but they really do a great job of moving people through quickly; we didn't have to wait long to get a table. The restaurant itself is underground, so it has this kind of dark and cozy vibe going for it. Some of the tables are pretty close together, but service is quick so you won't be in a small space for long! 
We ordered beef pad thai and chicken fried rice to share. Unfortunately when the dishes came they were both made with chicken, but by that point we were so hungry that we didn't care and just scarfed everything down rather than complaining! Both the pad thai and fried rice were fantastic and reasonably priced for downtown Toronto. The portion sizes are perfect for sharing, so you can order a few plates and try different options. I don't have a lot of experience with Thai food personally, but I could tell that this was an impressive place and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. 
Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area!

So I've been hearing rave reviews on Pai Northern Thai Kitchen from many people and here on Yelp so obviously this guy had to try, My wife and I did try their sister restaurant Sabai Sabai Kitchen and Bar down on Bloor street a while back and loved it. So they are located near Duncan and Adelaide near the Princess of Whales Theatre. They are located on the lower level and I didn't notice any ramps or elevators but I could be wrong. 
The interior of the restaurant is really deceiving because at first I though it was small and once inside on their floor wow was it big, we got there around 11:40 on a Tuesday and it was not that busy yet. The decor I really like it felt like I was on a street in Thailand having lunch. Right when the clock struck noon bam they got hit with waves of people and it felt like it was a Friday night at your local bar full of energy and hungry patrons. For those of you who missed out on getting a table they also have a market for take away so don't feel left out. 
My wife and I ordered quite a bit just for the two of us since it was our first time here we ate with our eyes first and rolled up the stairs later. We ordered a Papaya salad in Thai spice level and the Kung Tawt which is the fried black garlic shrimp with a tangy Thai dipping sauce. The papaya salad was made with super fresh ingredients served with crispy shrimp chips, pork rinds, rice noodles and some sliced cabbage. This salad can be made to order on the level of heat you want however I found that even the Thai spicy wasn't bad but I do eat fairly spicy so be careful. The Kung Tawt comes with 6 pieces of large prawns deep fried until golden very crispy and fresh as well. 
As for the star of the show we ordered the Chiang Mai Beef Noodle soup and Fried Basa Fish with green curry served with rice. The noodle soup was nice with tender beef chunks, topped with fresh bean sprouts and a couple of fried crispy wonton skin and the soup was delicious but I found it slightly on the salty side but overall very good. The deep fried crispy basa fish came with 4 sizable filet portions with a side of green curry made mild spice and a bowl of white jasmine rice. The filet's were crunchy but juicy on the inside dip it in the curry sauce and a spoonful of rice mmmm delicious. I did wish that the curry we can choose the spice level as well because to me the curry was weak in the spice department for me and even when I added 2 dishes of the hot chili oil it was ok just a bit of tingle for me. 
Despite how busy they get during their lunch rush our server was on her toes, I noticed she kept all her tables she was waiting on with everything we need from water topped up or a new can of beer. everyone here is super friendly.
Can't wait to visit again.
Fei Jai out!

This place was so good!! We had to wait about half an hour but it was so worth it! I ordered the tea mac and the khao soi with chicken drumsticks. The drink was also really good, I mean its just thai iced tea with alcohol, how could you go wrong??? The soup was really amazing though. The crunchy fried cracker(?) on top was yummy dipped in the sauce and the chicken was super tender and fell off the bone. The noodles also had a great texture but what really made the dish was the sauce. The sauce was just the right amount of sweet, salty, spicy, and creamy... truly chefs kiss. If I could, I would have taken the sauce home and eaten it with rice for like a week.... I still think about this dish and it's been a while since I went...

Tastey food but not all seating is pleasant 
Sometimes sitting in the back feels pretty isolated from the restaurant.

I give this restaurant four stars. I have eaten food at Pai twice, most recently in late November 2019.
Pai is a trendy Thai restaurant located in downtown Toronto. It is one of the most popular spots in the city so you need to make a reservation in advance. It is busy and loud, and constantly has hip hop and pop music playing in the background. The majority of the guests are millennials so it might not be the best place for everyone.
The food is very good and very filling. I always order too much which is okay as the leftovers (excluding anything crispy) tend to travel well. There are a lot of menu options and you can't really go wrong with anything.
Highly recommended. I will be back soon. Four stars.

Thai food. Check. Great taste. Check. Good quality ingredients. Check. Good ambience. Check. The fact that you need to wait for a little minute to get food here shows how much the people love this popular Thai place. Highly recommend if you like Thai cuisine.

The food was amazing! I would definitely come here again to try other things on the menu. We had two dishes, Khao Soi and Pad Thai. 
The Khao Soi was very flavourful. It was savoury, creamy, and light. The beef was very tender and the noodles light and chewy. Both tasted amazing when coated with the curry. 
The Pad Thai had many ingredients and flavours that balanced well together and reminded me of the Pad Thai you can get in the streets of Thailand. I liked that they put the peanuts on the side so you could mix in as much or as little as you wanted.
The staff was very kind and pleasant to talk with. They made you feel very welcome which I really appreciated. 
The atmosphere was very relaxing and bustling with people. It was very busy but very comfortable with the Thailand decor. 
They ask have many vegetarian options, so I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!

I'm really not sure why this place has such great reviews, I found the food merely average. The interior reminds me more of the Southeast Asia budget "backpacker" vibe, ie partiers. It's certainly a part of the Thai experience but not really my thing.
Tom yum soup - this was pretty solid with vibrant flavors and a good kick. Maybe I've really lost spice tolerance but I was starting to drip before I was done with the cup...
Pad cha hett - mushroom stir fry. I got this with black rice just to try something new and it didn't quite fit the rest of the dish. If you get this, stick with the jasmine. The stir fry part was disappointingly bland though. It had a bit of a fennel taste to it, not sure what that comes from.

Delicious food and friendly staff
Nice vibe, Good decoration
Reasonable price
Very busy tho, better to make reservation!
Some of the best Pad See Ew I've ever had. Service was great, prices were fair, busy place (which makes sense given the quality). Would highly recommend! 5/5 stars

Pai consistently offers great quality and taste at both their locations! And on top of that they also offer halal options! The only thing with Tyler downtown location is that their service is sometimes great- sometimes not.. depends on who ur server is! Hence the one star less!

Pai Northern Thai Kitchen is one of the most popular Thai restaurants in Toronto and the restaurant won few awards from the NOW Magazine (2014 ~ 2016 Readers' Choice Runner-Up). Chef Nuit Regular also own three other sister restaurants (Sukho Thai, Kiin, and Sabai Sabai).
Parking is not fun in downtorn Toronto, but I managed to find a lot about 4~5 blocks away. Our party got here at 6:45 PM and the hostess said the waiting time is approximately 45 minutes to 1 hour. I put my number down so that they can text me when our table is ready, but I started to get a bit anxious because I wasn't too sure whether I would actually get a text via data roaming (using US number in Canada) and my friend had delayed texts during this Toronto trip. Luckily one of my friends was able to utilize his unparalleled soft skill by talking to the hostess after we waiting about 30 minutes and somehow he was able to get our party a table immediately afterward.
The menu selection reminds me a lot of Pok Pok (a very popular Thai restaurant in Portland). You will find mostly Norther Thai cuisine and no pad see ew is on the menu (I didn't even notice until one of my friends mentioned about it). I still somewhat questioned why one of my friends ordered Pad Thai when that's not even on one of Yelp's highlights, oh well.
***
Grabong (freshly shredded buttercup squash fritters lightly coated in red curry paste batter, deep fried and served with a sweet garlic tamarind dip with nuts - CAD $13): Squash fritters were lightly fried and they didn't even taste like squash (more like sweet potato). Oh man that sweet and spicy dipping sauce tasted extremely addicting. This is a must order dish.
Pad Gra Prow with Crispy Pork (Moo Grob) (holy basil stir fried served on steamed jasmine rice and topped with a Thai style fried egg + nam prik nam pla sauce [fish sauce, garlic, chili & lime] - medium spicy, CAD $17.5): WARNING - If you don't like fish sauce, then you will NOT like this dish. Luckily I like fish sauce and this rice dish tasted a bit like a Thai version of Taiwanese minced pork rice with an egg. Medium spicy wasn't very spicy. It was a very delicious dish and I also recommend this dish too!
Thai Iced Tea (CAD $5.50): Maybe I was pretty thirsty, but that was one good Thai tea. I probably finished the drink in less than 1 minutes.
***
EXCELLENT Thai food - good enough to compete against some of my favorite Thai restaurants in Los Angeles (e.g. Daisy Mint in Pasadena, CA). I wouldn't mind waiting for a hour if I am coming back here again.
Amazing, from start to end, just expect a wait time but food was worth the wait. Will come back when we visit Toronto in future again.

Long wait as expected since I was looking forward to trying this place. The hostess was friendly and quick to seat me. As a disclaimer, I completely empathize with employees within the service industry; particularly in these touristy areas which become extremely busy, so I always have patience and understanding if things take a while. It can be super overwhelming and anxiety can take over, so I understand mishaps. However, when employees are blatantly rude and inattentive, it should be brought to a supervisor's attention so they can be corrected.
I was seated and was promptly greeted by a waitress. I ordered water, waited 30 minutes for my waitress to return to take my order as she said she'll be right back to grab me a menu -- I never saw her again. Went up to the bar politely asking if I could place an order, whenever they had a moment (not even requesting to sit there since I understand the seating arrangements for reservations). They rudely said I needed to be checked in in order to sit, after just explaining that I had been seated yet I haven't seen my waitress in half an hour. 
Meanwhile, I saw everyone who was in line behind me receive their food, who obviously had different and attentive servers. The bartender didn't even consider letting me place an order, didn't apologize for the poor service, despite me already waiting to receive a seat in the restaurant which I would've happily returned to if he had been willing to place my order. He simply said no, with no apology or any question of who my server was so I could be assisted. So bizarre. Wish I could've tried this place due to the great reviews and my love for Thai food!

Not sure what the hype is about. the food here was very mediocre at best.  here is what we had and thought:
garlic shrimp - ok
tom yum soup - good
khao soi with braised beef - ok
green curry with fish - barely edible 
thai ice tea - just ok
i don't recommend and don't plan to eat there again.

The best Thai food in Toronto and (in my opinion) one of the best restaurants in Toronto! I know everyone says this but trust me it's not overrated at all. Their Penang curry is my favourite!! Not only is the food delicious, but the service is spectacular and the plating of their dishes are so fun. The cocktails are also all really good, with fun Asian twists. The Lowry is a must on a hot summer night.

Loved this place. We arrived right before the huge dinner rush and were seated at the bar only waiting 5 mins. All the staff and bartenders were very attentive and awesome! The vibe of the place is very cool, they played 90s high hop which was very enjoyable. The food was excellent and so was my Thai mojito. I had chicken satay for an appetizer and chicken massaman for my main dish, both were perfect! I definitely recommend trying this place.

We arrived at 12:05 on a Friday, and despite having been open for literally five minutes, Pai was already packed, which is always a great sign! We ordered the khao soi, massaman curry, and pad thai. Each was the best version of that dish either of us had ever tried. The depth of flavor in the sauces was so impressive, and every protein, vegetable, and noodle/grain of rice was cooked perfectly. Service was quick.

I LOVED this place! The atmosphere, the food, the service, the story behind the restaurant, everything is excellent. These two people met and fell in love in Pai and they decided to bring back their love of cooking and of Pai to Toronto. How amazing is that???!!
My high school friend took my boyfriend and I here on our last day. He says it's a popular spot amongst Ryerson students. 
Upon entering it just had the feel of authenticness and creativity. We only ordered a pad thai to share because we were planning on hitting more spots later in the day. Although it was hard to resist the plates of good food that the servers were bringing everyone else.
We got it really mild and it was so good. Lots of well blended flavours and textures. 
You NEED to come here. 
Visited on July 2nd 2017

Simply the best Thai food I've ever had. The Tom yum is just perfect.
The Crispy pork Pad Kra Pao is so comforting.
Nice drink selection, good vibe, great service.

For our monthly Tuesday downtown Toronto visit, my husband and I decided to try Pai. Which is just around the corner from the Princess of Whales Theatre (Duncan and Adelaide). When we arrived and stepped into the restaurant the atmosphere was quite interesting. The interior was decorated with items from Thailand which was nice to see. The restaurant was quite large with plenty of seating (may be 75 plus) and it also had a Pai Market from those who are in a rush and just need something to go. I have to say...it's quite the hot spot for lunch goers for a Tuesday.
Since it was our first time at Pai, our eyes wanted to eat the whole menu...however we did keep our order to a minimum of two apps: Papaya Salad (which we requested for Thai Spicy) and Kung Tawt which is the fried black garlic shrimp with Thai Dipping sauce. Both apps were very flavourful and delicious. However if you cannot handle spicy food...remember to check ask the waiter about the spice levels.
As for our main dish, I ordered the Chiang Mai Beef Noodle Soup which was extremely savory and appetizing. I couldn't stop eating even when I was full to my neck! My husband ordered the Fried Fish with Green Curry Sauce and Rice. The fish was perfect cooked and the batter for the fish was perfectly fried for the perfect amount of crisp. The flavours in the fish and curry were exquisite and mouth-watering. 
Can't wait to go back to try more items from the menu!

Pai never disappoints. The food is consistently good no matter what you get. I try new items on the menu or different combinations (e.g. with meat, shrimp, chicken, fish) each time and I always leave happy with what I got. The service is good and the line is never too bad, especially if you get a drink while you wait.
One of my go to spots for Thai food in the city. Pad Thai and pad sew ew are two of my favourites here. I always opt for a mild or medium spicy level to give it a bit of a kick

I've gotten take out and dined in, here are my experiences:
Take out - we ordered via UberEats (dinner time)
- got 3 pad thai, 1 of them had some blue plastic in it... 
- portion is good
- tasted good 
Dine in (lunch time)
- pad thai was too salty (all 4 that we ordered) 
One thing I always get is their thai iced tea!!! Love it!  Tip for this: bring a reusable straw - their straws are paper and it gets too soggy. It's also difficult to drink it without a straw because of the crushed ice.

Many people recommended me to try this Thai dining place as they said the taste is same as the real Thai food in Thailand.
well, its cool, especially the Tom Yum Soup. You must try this and you will taste many different types of herbs inside.
Recommend this place but no 5 stars because many food were sold out today such as all the salads and their famous mango sticky rice.

Visiting from DTLA, CA and hands down... thee best Thai food I've ever had in my entire life. The heat, the savory, the acidity, and the balance of all things magical that make every dish at Pai that decadently transport you back to the northern province of Thailand. Must get: Pud See Ewe, Tom Yum Soup, Chicken Satay, Beef salad, Shrimp chips, etc. You will not be disappointed and will only be captivated by the Pai! Eric was amazing, warm, and welcoming!
-Would I come back? In the blink of an eye!!!

Great atmosphere and energy, pretty packed, so expect a short wait. The hosts are fantastic and the server was nice enough. The prices are quite reasonable too! 
We ordered a Thai sausage appetizer sampler which was delicious!
For entres we ordered the pad cha hett (vegetarian option) and the masaman braised beef. Both were fantastic and had a comfortable level of heat.

Came by for lunch the other day and the experience left much to be desired despite being Thai Select... 
Was able to be seated upon arrival upon opening and ordered the Thai tea which was a tad too sweet...not quite like Thailand...
Moved on to the Khao Soi with braised beef and it was ok. The braised beef was dry and overcooked....bummer
The crispy pork belly was embarrassing as i think it was refried from yesterday and was super dry...
Staff was ok. Portions were generous.
$30/head after gratuity and tax for lunch...

Let me start by saying the food at Pai is delicious! Nice presentation. The service is excellent! Quaint layout with simple decor. Very busy!
We started with a pitcher of sangria. I can't remember all the ingredients but there was guava and lychee involved. Very refreshing.
The spring rolls were crispy and delicious. Also vegetarian for the health conscious.
Pad Gra Prow with Crispy Pork (Moo Grob), served over rice, was outstanding! The pork had a lot of flavour and I loved the crispy bits.
The green curry chicken was creamy and rich with a coconut curry flavour! I'd be happy with just the sauce over rice.
The Pad Thai with beef may be one of the best I've had! Every bite had a different layer of taste and texture.
The fried fish with green curry sauce was perfectly crispy, yet flaky. As good as it was, we preferred the other dishes.
Was this the best Thai restaurant I've been to? Maybe. I highly recommend it. I'll be back.

Pai was a recommendation from a friend who is familiar with downtown Toronto and I'm so glad we made a visit. We arrived around 1:45pm on a Sunday not knowing that they open at 3pm on Sundays. We got some drinks nearby while we waited for the restaurant to open. We returned at 2:55pm and there were already a few people waiting outside. We were surprised there were other people trying to eat at such a random time. The restaurant opened and my boyfriend and I were seated. It was hard not to notice that within just 25 minutes of the restaurant opening at 3pm on a Sunday, it was nearly filled! At this point, we were thinking that this place must be good. 
We were right! We had Thai iced tea, green curry (served in a coconut), and pad Thai with shrimp. We enjoyed the Thai iced tea; it was definitely better than average. The green curry was really awesome and flavorful. The coconut that it is served in is small, so you get the rest of it in a regular bowl. The pad Thai was better than average as well. My boyfriend really liked the shrimp in particular. Our food came out in about 15 minutes after placing our orders. 
Very lovely ambiance with warm lighting. Good service. Great experience overall. Zero complaints. We were impressed! 
Taste | 4.5
Atmosphere | 5
Presentation | 4
Service | 4
OVERALL | 4.5

O. M. G! This place was worth the hype and so much more! We had a reservation at 9, but arrived a half hour early. They sat us right away. I love that type of customer service! 
Upon entering the ambiance is great. They had pictures of celebrities who have come here and loved it including basketball players and the like. The restaurant appeared small because it was so packed, but has as good amount of seating. I loved the décor. It gave off a bit of an exotic feel without appearing tacky. It was great! 
The waiters are efficient, but since its so busy they come sparingly and take your entire food order at once, so when you get there make sure you get down to business and decide what you want to order. I looked at the menu before coming and knew immediately what I wanted to eat. We ordered the moo ping for an appetizer. It was decadent and full of flavor. From the time I sat down I knew I wanted the pad thai and ordered that right way. Luckily you were able to choose your spice level for this dish. I chose mild which was just on the cusp of being too spicy for me. It felt a kick in the back of my throat, but nothing I couldn't handle. If I can handle it, anyone certainly can. I loved the flavor! Since I have never been to Thailand, I don't know how authentic it is, but it was good regardless. The portions were perfect for me, but my fiancé thought it was a little small. They have seasonal deserts which constantly change. We got mango sticky rice and it was refreshing and unique. That isn't something I have ordered or even seen before (perhaps its not all that unique though, it just felt that way to me!) I loved it! 
The drinks were ok. I really liked my plum mule, but my fiancé wasn't a fan of his thai mojito. I tried it and prefer a more traditional mojito myself, but it wasn't bad. I like the fact you can't taste the alcohol. 
Overall, this is a must if you live in or are visiting Toronto. What an enjoyable experience!

Hard to know how to rate this one, but I think a 4 overall is fair.
There was a lineup to get in, but tables for two were readily available so we did not have to wait other than in the line to check in. I liked all the cozy little spaces and how you have to weave through the rooms. 
I was so impressed that they can manage both vegan and gluten free. I ordered a beef Penang curry without shrimp paste and they were great. That Penang curry was a solid 10/10 from me. Yummy and generously sized (I could not finish).
The oxtail was a bit of a miss. More sweet and spite and none of the savory you would expect with oxtail. The shrimp chips was a ridiculously large appetizer and therefore a good value. Tasty enough that the leftovers were brought home.
This is a good repeat with allergies in our family. I am sure that our teenager will love it.

Heard this place is really famous in downtown and tried with my colleagues...
I tried the pad Thai... it was sweet eventhougjt I said almost closest to the max spice level.
I will probably try some curry again. :)
The veggie roll was good :)

Did takeout. $16.50 chicken pad Thai "foreigner spicy." I thought it was good but the dish is like 80% noodles, would have expected more chicken for that price. The staff all seem to be English-speaking, so placing an order on the phone was easy. And they were all extremely nice.
I'd go back here.

Just another Thai restaurant. 
Got Pad Gra Prow with ground pork (mild) and Khao Soi with beef. 
Pad Gra Prow is really oily. Can't taste the basil flavor at all. I.e. It's lacking the flavor that makes it a pad gra prow. Also, mild means no spicy here apparently, would have ordered medium spicy if I knew that. Pad gra prow is my favorite northern Thai dish and I order it every single time when I see it on a menu, so it was really disappointing to have this. If you want to try a real  and yummy pad gra prow, a Thai food truck in Austin or Jinda Thai in Abbotsford, Melbourne Australia can do a much better job than this place. 
Khao Soi is not special. Beef is very tough and dry. Khao Soi at Kin Khao in San Francisco or Lotus of Siam in Las Vegas are better options.

I miss their Thai food there!
The curry and Tom yum soup are always two of the dishes that I always ordered! Must try if you loveeee Thai food! :)

Came in at 4pm and was seated right away even though it was already pretty crowded. The khao soi is a must try and the chicken satay was also very tasty. Their food is also very reasonably priced. 
Because our server was busy and it was pretty loud, she didn't hear us order a khao soi and we realized she didn't put it in after we thought we were waiting too long for it. It was honestly really hard to get her attention too so we asked a couple other servers to check if the order was in and they said that it wasn't initially but that it was coming now and that it would be discounted. Although it was a little annoying, I understand how she could have missed it and the discount was a pleasant surprise. Kudos to all of them for handling it so well!

Be aware this is for 4 persons size. We as 2 people are  talked into ordering it to substitute for running out of mango stick rice. This costs 18 cad, the same price of a main course. We weren't be warned either size or quantity. It consists most of supermarket quality ice cream with large quantities, we ended up left more than half unfinished. There is very little mango and coconut meats. We are happy with everything else except this. After I have talked to a waiter on this, no action from their side. Overpriced dessert. I was super excited to learn this restaurant from a  YouTube channel, but wasn't happy about this experience. not a repeat. Hopefully you 'd be cautious with any suggestions from waiters.

Thai food is definitely one of my favorite types of food and Pai has been on my list of places to try for a long time.  It has a great atmosphere and the food was really good as well. It is always busy here and I must say that the service was pretty good for how busy it was. 
We ordered a few different dishes which included: Thai chicken wings, Kung Tawt (Black Tiger garlic shrimp), and as a main I had the Khao Soi.
Thai Chicken Wings: I am a big fan of wings and these did not disappoint. The flavours were great and the crispy shallots were a nice touch
Kung Tawt: These deep fried breaded tiger shrimp were good, but nothing to write home about. the quality of the shrimp itself was really good but I feel as if you could get a similar dish at many places. 
Khao Soi: This was definitely the star of the night for me. I am a big fan of soupy noodles and the curry broth that was in here was very rich and flavourful. It was spiced just right and I just could not stop eating!
All in all I would come back to Pai and recommend it to anyone looking for good Thai food. The quality of the food was good and the atmosphere was a plus. My only complaint would be that I would have liked the portion size for the mains to be a bit bigger.
Went to the Young and Eg location.  Live music Thursday nights! Great food like the downtown location!

Came here on a Monday at lunch and it was really busy. I love the cool, hipster vibe of this place, it feels very casual, has really cool decor, theres a bar and overall it just feels comfortable.
We ordered the Papaya Salad which I really liked. The papaya is soaked in tamarind sauce giving it a sweet & sour taste, it came with flavourful shrimp chips, crispy pork grinds, some noodles and cabbage. Everything eaten together tastes so good! Definitely recommend!
I had the Masaman Beef Curry, at first the bowl looks kind of small but its actually very filling. They give you a lot of beef (perfect for meat lovers) and its very tender. The curry tastes like regular curry but with a hint of sweet&sour tamarind which I really liked.
My friend had the Khao Soi and to me it was just ok, it tastes like a regular coconut curry. Reminds me of a Malaysian Laksa.

Unpopular opinion here but I think this place is overhyped. The food isn't absolutely terrible, but I've had better Thai food elsewhere. 
When I was eating there I was super hungry so everything tasted really good and I wolfed it all down...but when I think back it was only good because I was so hungry. 
The oxtail was okay but there was barely any oxtail in it. They use a big bowl to make it seem like a bigger portion but it's really not that much and for $16, not really worth it. The pad thai was just okay...it wasn't very flavorful and it was kind of dry. The Khao Soi was very heavy tasting and also didn't come with a lot of stuff in it. The chicken wings were pretty good but nothing special. 
Chill place and vibes, but I found the food very average overall and expensive for the portions.

Been here a few times. Always busy. Even when the weather's not great, expect a bit of a wait.
On my latest visit, we ordered shrimp chips, the Pad Thai, Khao Soi (egg noodles) and a Thai Iced Tea.
The shrimp chips comes as a big sized bowl, are pretty tasty, and served with a tamarind sauce; a little sweetness to compliment the savoury chips. The Pad Thai tastes quite like the ones I've had in Thailand, different from what you might find at places like Thai Express. A little saltier, and less sweet.
My favourite though is the Khao Soi: egg noodles in a curry-based soup, topped with some fried noodles and your choice of meat (go for the braised beef). Comes with a small side dish of pickled veg, lime, and hot sauce. Very flavourful. The Thai Iced Tea is pretty good too.
Probably my favourite Thai restaurant in Toronto. Will come back again!

PAI is one of those restaurants that come top of mind when my friends, in town and out of town, want to catch up over a meal. With the recent renovations to help expand the space, it's been progressively easier to nab a table for a small group. 
My favourite appetizers are the Grabong (shredded squash fritters) and Miang Kung, both which are great for sharing. Standout mains include the Pad Thai (of course), Red Curry, and Pad Gra Pow.
To top the meal off, you can't go wrong with the Sticky Mango Rice, or a Thai Iced Tea!
Really happy we found this while visiting Toronto, excellent Thai food, excellent service , a little spicy for us but delicious , Go!

The reviews did not lead me wrong! I was in Toronto for work last week and wanted to grab some tasty Thai before returning to Chicago (aka the land of mediocre Thai food). Pai is not your standard Thai place or menu but what they do, they do really well. 
I stopped in on a Wednesday afternoon before my flight and was amazed to see the place packed at 4pm. I snagged the last available table and sat down as the line started to form out the door. 
The menu is limited in that they don't have all the classic Thai dishes like cashew chicken or ginger chicken. But they have plenty of options for curries, noodles and a few stir frys. So everyone will find something. 
I started with the Tom yum soup which was by far the most unique and delicious version of Tom yum I had ever enjoyed. A very tasty base with fresh shrimp and spice. 
For my entree I opted for the pad gra pow. I had never seen this dish served with a fried egg on top but this felt more streets of Thai authentic so I was happy to try it. The sauce was heaven and the chicken was finely cut without being ground that seemed to keep it tender and full of flavor. The egg enhanced everything. This dish was pure perfection and heaven and unlike any other variation I've ever had. 
By the time I left the line was easily 25-30 deep and it wasn't even 5pm yet. The hype is real and worth it. I highly recommend a visit to Pai but do it during an off peak time to avoid waiting. I hope to be back to Toronto soon just to enjoy Pai again.

Are you a foodie? Do you want Thai food? Look no further! 
Wish I could have tried more, but I was all by myself. Lol I started off with the atom Yum soup. Surprisingly, this was my favorite dish. The soup was super flavorful, and full of fresh and delicious vegetables & shrimp. Perfect combo of sour and spice. 
Main course - pad Thai with beef. Definitely the best ps Thai I've ever had. Perfect noodles, well balanced ingredients, and great flavor. I ordered it with farang spice (regular spice), I thought it was delicious, but next time I'll order the Thai spice. 
Great prompt service too! I walked in around 2pm on a Wednesday. The main room was pretty busy, so I can imagine this place is swamped during average lunch and dinner hours.

On a Thursday night, I was surprised to see how busy this place is. Once I got inside I noticed the decor and settings to be quite warm and welcoming. Line up was fairly short and the staffs are quite attentive. For my first ever order I had to get the pad thai. Portion was good enough and the taste was there. We also ordered some chicken wings and they were really delicious and tender. Enough taste to satisfy my palette. Overall I really enjoyed the vibe and experience. 1 star off because the washroom has a very unpleasant sewage smell. Better if they added scented candles.
