I don't know why I didn't give them 5 stars in the beginning as there really is nothing i'd like Pai to change/improve on. Their food tastes the same every time and their service is always on point! Don't go on my check-ins, I have been here more times than I can remember.
We are truly blessed to have Chef Nuit in Toronto.

Hip young Thai restaurant that meets or surpasses  the old school authentic Thai restaurant taste! Cool decor and atmosphere, played good music. Young waiters and waitresses. 
Accommodated us by seating us at the bar! They also had the option of traditional Thai floor seating. 
We were in a rush and opted to sit at the bar. The food was unreal!!!!!!!! 
We had a papaya salad for starters which we were hoping was spicy but literally had no spice factor at all. It was ehh...I have had better.
But the main dishes were top notch.
I ordered the Pad Gra Prow with chicken and I can not stop thinking about it. So delicious. The pad thai was also yummy. But the Pad Gra Prow was my absolute fav.

My friends and I were craving Thai food for lunch so we came here. 
Food:
Pad Gra Prow 13...Try it with Shrimp or Crispy Pork (Moo Grob) 15
Holy basil stir fried with your choice of ground Pork, Chicken, Beef or Tofu served on steamed jasmine rice and topped with a thai style fried egg. (contains oyster sauce) Served with nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chili & lime)
I wanted to try both shrimp and pork at the same time. I preferred the ground pork over the crispy pork in the rice. It was nicely marinated and flavourful! I've asked for their chili oil. It went well with the rice. 
Nice happy atmosphere. Good service and very authentic Thai good. I am so glad I came!

I had one meal here and my mouth still waters every time I think about it. We ordered as much as we could stuff into ourselves and it was absolutely mindblowingly good. I love Thai food, and I was told by a friend that this was the place in Toronto. I'm so glad I went and I can't wait to go back. I can't remember what I ordered at this point - but I don't think it's possible to order wrong. The spice level was higher than most Thai places, the freshness was outstanding. It was busy (pre-COVID) but so worth the 15-ish minute wait.
If we lived closer, we'd be here way too often!

The lineups here were quite intense if you didn't have a reservation. We decided last minute to eat here so reservations were al booked for the week. 
When we arrived we had to wait in line to even get an electronic pager. Once we got the pager we waiting at the back until the lights flashed, signaling that our table was ready.
We ordered several items on the menu. We started off with a small Tom Yum soup. It was probably one of the most savoury and delicious soups I've ever had. The soup had a strong fragrant scent of lemongrass and had a good kick of heat. 
Next, we got the Gaeng Kiaw Wan (Green Curry) and the Khao Soi. The curry was served in a coconut with a side of extra curry and rice. Again, the aroma was amazing. The curry was creamy and light. It was really delicious. The Khao Soi was definitely my favourite dish. You are served a massive bowls of noodles in a coconut-curry broth and contains egg noodles topped with fried noodles. The broth was extremely flavourful. It had savoury and sweet elements that really brought out the dish. I also enjoyed the tender bites of beef. I was so full after eating.
Overall, I was quite satisfied with both the service and food here. Definitely need to book in advance next time!

Wow there's definitely a reason why this is the most reviewed restaurant in Toronto. Definitely call in with a reservation to this place because it was packedddddd. First of all the place was HUGE. When you walk in it looks like a very small shop but don't be fooled. The vibe felt extremely homey and vintage. I loved it.
I ordered the Tea Mac cocktail which was basically an alcoholic Thai tea and it was amazing. I could barely taste the alcohol it was so good. I also ordered the Tom yum soup which was fantastic. The portion was smaller but it was the perfect amount of spice. For the entree I got the Khao Soi, I was blown away. I typically don't love curries but this was a very light chicken coconut curry with noodles. It was soooo good. And for dessert we got the egg custard sticky rice. Probably some of the best Thai food I've ever had in my life.

Great time here. 
Got seated right away in the bar area during the post work rush. 
Ordered Grabong for a starter and it was delicious. 
I had the Pad Cha Hett and it was amazing. So much flavour for a vegetarian (possibly vegan?!) dish.
Service was a bit slow but still great. Food was great. Atmosphere was great. 
Would definitely come again and again.
The food and service were great. Our dinners had an excellent flavor. The only negative was that portions were a bit small, with lots of rice or noodles and a small portion of meat and veg.

It was so delicious! I had the Pad Thai and the portion was generous and the perfect amount of spicy!
Highly recommend, will definitely try again!
Best Thai place in town! I've only tried their Pas Thai, Khao Soi and duck wings and I recommend it all!!!

Really fun spot in Toronto with great Thai food! Lots of variety and the waiters always knows what they're doing. No worries when I go with friends with lots of dietary restrictions from allergies. The waiters are honest and friendly. Make sure to get the Thai iced tea!
A fantastic meal. Restaurant was very busy but service was very quick. Didn't wait long for anything. Food was epically delicious. Recommend.
Over-priced, small portions, bland and just disappointing. I wouldn't recommend at all.

So. Full.
Delightful Thai food. I had the pad Thai with beef and the garlic shrimp. It was delicious! Came with six other friends, make sure you make reservations! This place was packed. We could only have lunch at 3:00 pm. 
The place is hot, noisy, and crowded. Beyond these slight discomforts, the food is really the standout quality of this restaurant. Be prepared to pay slightly more than your normal pad Thai. But we had monster leftovers after. 
FYI my spice level for my pad Thai was medium. I normally have a generally higher tolerance of spice than the average person, and I was slightly sweating while eating it! Might have bit into a pepper or something because whew my mouth was burning! Even the garlic shrimp had a kick to it.
Despite how busy it is, the staff never rush you while ordering or eating your meal. They get it. The food is worth savoring. They're helpful and friendly. 
Overall I'd definitely recommend eating here!!

Food: A very popular place in downtown for thai food and it definitely did not disappoint me at all! I did not order pad thai (what I usually stick with) because I was trying to be more adventurous and I was very glad with my food choices! I highly recommend the pork rice with egg as it was the best out of three. Im guessing the pork was marinated with a lot of different ingredients and so with the fish sauce and lime juices, there was a burst of different flavours going on in a single bite. The chicken wings were amazing as well but nothing too surprising. The curry noodle was very interesting as I did not expect them to use egg noodle, the beef brisket was too hard though. I did still enjoy the coconut heavy flavoured curry overall. 
Portion: Normal to small
Environment: I was put to sit at a high table and the only issue was that there was no where to hang my winter jacket. Other than that the vibe of the restaurant was really nice with all the decors!

Warm welcome fr (server) Maketa who eats here 'every night'. ('Not Jealous!') The curry is 'out of this world', the fish, chicken or pork soo succulent and fresh. Chicken pad thai also very tasty. Personable yet uber efficient service. N.B. On  Sat at 5:10 pm we had a 70 min wait, so arrive early to leave yr contact info.

Wow, there's over a thousand reviews to this place. Cool. That just shows glhow great it is. 
Location:
Downtown toronto.  2 blocks from King Street street car.
Parking situation:
May the force be with you. 
Actually I exaggerate. There's a parking garage practically around the corner. Lots of spaces. Pretty reasonable. 
Entrance:
The sign has an arrow pointing up but it's in the basement. Confusing at first.
Seating:
Been a few times. The last time. It opened at 3. We got there at 3:15 and had to sit at the bar. Crazy. After we ordered 20 minutes later we looked and there was a line at the door. Crazier. 
They have floor seating apparently as well. No thanks. 
Food:
Delicious. Loved everything. I'm not even going g to list everything I've tried and lived. It's all good. For real.
Price:
Not bad. Upper end for Thai food, bit Thai is normally super inexpensive anyway. Won't break the bank
 
I'll be back!!

Almost a year after my first visit which was not as exciting and ended with a three-star review. 
This visit was very different, my cousin was visiting and she wanted to have Thai food and this was the closest place. We were seated within 15 mins (minus reservation on a Wednesday afternoon) and got to try their traditional seating which was very comfortable. 
We ordered the fried Tiger Shrimp, Chicken Fried Rice, Beef Panag Curry, Mango Sticky Rice, and Thai Iced Tea. The Iced Tea was much better than the last time and the Chicken Fried Rice was delicious! It was also my first time trying Mango Sticky Rice and it was so good. The Beef Panag Curry was good but not the best I've had. Overall the experience was much better this time around and I'll definitely be making another visit soon!

Really loved that place! It's easy to find a restaurant with good thai food, but it's not that easy to find a thai restaurant that has a nice mood. I often find that thai restaurant are too simple or too formal.
The crowd is pretty young, mostly people in their 20s. Staff is also super dynamic and the food was awesome.
PAI is the kind of place that as soon as you step inside the restaurant, you can smell the good food, see people having fun and you just know right away that you came to the right place.

The food is absolutely the best Thai you may find almost any where in North America. Excellent ambience as you were in Thailand at one of the bars or food stand. All people are friendly and providing really great service.

My sister and I came here for an early dinner at ~4:30pm on a weekday, and we were glad we came that early because the place filled up very quickly that people were lining up at the door even before we got our food. We got Pad Thai with shrimp, Green Curry, and Thai Iced Tea. 
Food-wise, I was really satisfied: everything was delicious with good portion sizes. But I'm docking off a star for the service. The Thai Iced Tea was brought to me without a straw, and no employee walked by us for a while, so I had to go up to the bar to ask for a straw. Also, the Green Curry was supposed to come in a coconut shell with the coconut flesh still in the shell such that you can eat the coconut flesh with the curry, but they were out of coconut on this night. I was looking forward to this coconut experience, but I missed out. Hopefully I visit Toronto again soon because I'd really love to try it!

After hearing all the hype about this place I was really excited to try out the food for dinner. Honestly there was nothing wrong with the food but I think this place is really overrated. 
The pad graw prow was good, but the portions were a bit small. The dish had a nice savoury flavour but it wasn't really anything special. The gai satay (chicken skewers) were also decent but nothing special. You can't go wrong with thai iced tea, I'm definitely glad I ordered it. 
In general the food here was just average, but definitely not worth the wait if you don't have a reservation. Remember to make your reservation like a week in advance if you plan on coming for dinner.

This place is a gym! 
Even my Uber driver told me that he picks up orders from here and it's always packed. 
Do I was excited when I pulled up, once inside there was a bit of a wait. After I situated myself in line I waited no more than 12-15mins. And luckily I was by myself so I was seated right away at the bar. 
To wrap this experience up the food was delicious! Omg!!! I wanted to order from there the next night but they weren't available at the time on Uber Eats.

OMG YES! Please do yourself a favor if you're visiting Toronto and stop by Pai. We visited with a Toronto native who high recommended this spot. Upon walking in the vibe was great! The laid back atmosphere was a great way to fight the polar vortex. 
We glanced over the menu and my eye fixed on the winter dog drink, this drink had lychee in it, so I was in! Not only was this drink extremely delicious but it was extremely strong, I was buzzed before our meals were even dropped off.
We decided to share lunches family style, the items that we ordered were the green curry, khao so and tom yum. Everything looked so good and we noticed that the portions were pretty large so you can def share. 
Pretty quickly our meals were dropped off nice hot and ready to be devoured. The tom yum was pretty plain which is surprising because the green curry and khao so were over the top amazing! I loved the green curry the best, it a savory curry sauce with mild spice packed with so much flavor! This little spot is definitely a Toronto go to!

My husband made dinner reservations for us at this restaurant. I would say this was the best restaurant we ate at during our week-long vacation in Toronto. We ordered the papaya salad, tom-yum soup, braised beef noodle soup, chicken pad Thai, and Thai tea. 10/10 for the papaya salad, tom-yum soup, and Thai tea. 10/10 for the customer service. Highly recommend!
Good Thai food, the service is excellent and the place is nice

One of my fav Thai restaurants in downtown Toronto! I always love going here for the food and vibes. I suggest making a reservation though, because they always have a wait during peak times (I went on a Wednesday around 630 PM and had to wait 1 hour for a table of 5). I always order their Pad Thai with shrimp and their papaya salad is a must order!

Great food and service!! I had the CHIANG MAI beef noodle soup and was outstanding!! Rich flavors and a big size - you don't need to order anything else to get full!!
Next time in Toronto will visit again!

I'm obsessed with this restaurant... I never really liked Thai food before coming to Toronto - but this place has converted me! And I'm surprised at how many Toronto residents don't know about them! I love the atmosphere, the service, and of course, the food! My favourite is the Khao San beef brisket soup... The meat is so tender, and the broth is extremely flavourful. The combination of soft and hard noodles is also very unique!! Worth a visit for sure if you're in town.

Great food, fun atmosphere & cool staff. 
The wait situation: line up to put your name in, then wait from there. Waiting times vary. Reservations are only made in advance.
The drink menu is awesome. 
We shared the fried shrimp appetizer, green curry with chicken (served in a coconut!), and crispy fish. 
The curry was my favorite, and important to note that the chicken was very tender (not dry, as is often the case when I order chicken with Thai curries). 
Their house chili oil is excellent if you like to add spice.

Went there on a thursday night at around 6:15 and surprisingly there was a line for this place. I guess it is a popular spot around here. Waited about 10 mins to get in, but there were empty tables thats reserved while there was a line outside. 
We ordered the curry that comes in a coconut (green curry) and the panang curry. We also had their fried i think is butternut squash and their thai ice tea. Everything taste good. Wait time for the food was minimal, service was good and i dont have a bad thing to say about this place. 2 people spent about 70 including tax and tips.
I would recommend coming here but maybe make a reservation ahead of time.

That Umbrella Guy @ Pai for lunch.
We got in early when they opened at 11:30, and within half an hour most of the restaurant was filled. Except the Pai Market. They don't take reservations for lunch, so it'll be a bit of a battle to get seats.
Now, if you're in a rush, there is the Pai market that I mentioned. It's a section in the back of the restaurant (go to the back and turn right) that offers a number of merchandise and ingredients for sale, as well as some lunch combo options separate from the regular menu. For $10, you can grab one item (might be like a curry, or a stir-fry, or something) with rice. Great if you don't want to wait in a huge line.
 
Since our group had made arrangements to get here early, we got seats.
Their menu is not too big: around 10 or 15 items in total. This should make ordering a bit easier.
I ordered a Pad Thai at Thai Spicy level. The waitress asked if I was sure that I wanted the thai spicy, just in case I wasn't sure what I was getting myself into. It was definitely a bit spicy, as I could feel the heat on my tongue, but not dangerously spicy as others at the table had warned. But I think if you're not good with heat, it might be something to avoid.
The pad thai was alright. Not too greasy, and came with a generous amount of chicken.
The heat definitely makes it a bit interesting, though perhaps I should try it without as much spice next time to get more of the flavour.
20% auto-grat is applied on parties of 6 or more, which I'm not a fan of. In terms of service, it gets really really busy so they have less time to tend to your needs. I guess the auto-grat is meant to take that into consideration?

Pai was another restaurant that was scouted on Yelp before we arrived in Toronto. The reviews were great and I absolutely love Thai food. 
We arrived here minutes to 9PM. The place was packed and I should have expected that, we were in the entertainment district on a Friday night. The restaurant is a lower level type restaurant.There was a along line going down the stairs to just put your name on the wait-list. We contemplated leaving but we decided to head straight to the take out area instead.  For a Asian restaurant to play urban music and reggae music was quite interesting.  It had a nice Caribbean vibes (Welcome to the 6ix!)
We ordered two Pad Gra Prow, one chicken and the other with shrimp served w/ (steamed jasmine rice, thai style fried egg, nam price nam pla sauce). We also ordered a fried fish (crispy base fillet, steamed jasmine rice, crispy shallots, fresh chili sauce and tangy tamarind sauce). The wait for our take out wasn't bad. They have a nice little charging station for people to charge their iPhones. (unfortunately the ports were dated)
With most Thai restaurants, the atmosphere, decor is as important as the taste of the food and the beautiful arrangement of there dishes. So I'm sorry I didn't get the full experience.  Overall the food was good and I would return.
I got the pad thai. The portion was decent but the flavour was average. Service was good and I liked the ambience but it is a little loud.

The food was delicious! The wings were some of the best I've had. Definitely recommend them. I also got the Laksa soup which was also delicious. I also have to shout out the music wall in the women's bathroom. I appreciate all the love for Black American artists.

It's my second time being here. Really love the food. It's always so popular even in a weekday, if u have a dinner date, make sure u call and make the reservation.
Thai chicken wing - super yum, we only places one order, I would place 2 orders if I wanna share with 2 other people.
Tom yum soup - the tomato soup base was really fresh and flavourful.
Mango and sticky rice - basic
If u like Thai food. I would recommend u to try it.

Delicious Thai food that tastes authentic and is very filling. This restaurant is always busy so it could be tough to get a spot but everything from the pad Thai to shrimp is delicious. The spice is just right too.

Great place downtown for thai food. Place does get pretty crowded, always best to make reservations. 
Beware, "Farang spicy" is still very spicy!!

We mistakenly believed that this restaurant would be empty at 5:15 on a weekday. It was anything but. Luckily, they were able to get a table for two within five minutes. They've managed to fit quite a lot of people in the space that they have.
I ordered the khao soi, while my friend ordered the pad gra prow. I was starving before my meal, but was quite full within ten minutes. The curry is quite filling by the end. It was a little spicier than I anticipated, but I have very little tolerance, so it probably would be fine for most people. 
Like many others, I was impressed by the service. I've eaten at many other restaurants a lot emptier than Pai with much less attentive employees. Kudos to the servers for making sure all customers were taken care of. I think this practice also ensures that people are in and out within an hour or so. Would definitely return if I was ever craving Thai food.

Tried Pai for the first time for lunch and liked it enough to eat it again for dinner (though we tried different dishes).
We ordered the spring rolls, Gaeng Kiaw Wan Fish, and Khao Soi Beef.
Spring rolls were delicious. They're deep-fried vegetarian rice paper wraps, mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots. sprouts served with a sweet and spicy Thai chili sauce. One order comes with three rolls cut in half (six pieces).
Though the portions didn't look that big, they were quite filling, and my friend and I couldn't finish all our food.
The Gaeng Kiaw Wan Fish was a curry served in a coconut. Some "fishing" was needed to find all the fish pieces. The curry was flavorful but not *too* salty. I liked the bamboo shoots in it and thought the fish was nice too. The consistency was a tad runny for me, but it was still delicious.
The Khao Soi Beef was good as well. The meat was tender and the curry was flavorful. I also liked the crispy noodles that came with it.
Wish I had more of an appetite when I went so I could've tried more dishes, but I guess that'll have to wait until the next time I go.

We enjoyed every dish we ordered- pad thai, khao soi, and the oxtail hung lay.  They were very accommodating with the nut and shellfish allergies in our family which we appreciated! Ambience very nice as well!

Hi Yelpers!
So instead of Kiin I went to PAI. The vibe is very comforting and hip. Love the atmosphere. We were greeted by a pleasant host. 
As for the starters we ordered Grabong. This starter is shredded butter squash fritters that has been lightly covered in red curry paste batter. The fritter is then fried and served with a sweet garlic tamarind dip with nuts. It is lovely if you are a fan of fried food similar to French fries or sweet potatoes fries. The red curry on it gives it a very weak spice but adds flavour to it which then is intensified by with the dip. Awesome starter dish!
The next starter we ordered is Gai Satay. 5 grilled marinated chicken skewers with peanut sauce. Love the peanut sauce! That's what I was looking most forward to about this dish. The nuttiness is awesome! Though 5 skewers.. they are small in portion sizes.. downfall for me.
For the main course I got the lovely Gaeng Kiaw Wan which is in a coconut. I'm ut is green curry with bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, basil leaves and coconut milk. The meat I opted for was shrimp. It was delicious. Unsure if the coconut as a base did anything to the dish. 
My partner got the Gaeng Masaman with braised beef. The braised beef is in a peanut, tamarin curry with potatoes and topped off with crispy shallots. Both main courses had jasmine rice. 
The servers were really nice and attentive to making sure we were okay. The service time for food was also pretty fast. 
I really enjoyed my first time experience with PAI. I will definitely come back again!

This is the best Thai restaurant of all time. Their food is delicious! I had the green curry in the coconut and squash fritters when I stayed in. I had the most spiciest (wished it was spicier) but still so amazing! They had amazing cocktail drinks and next time I will try their Thai ice tea, it was on almost every table when I came in! 
This place was amazing, super busy because everyone is familiar with PAI! It is a must try when you're in downtown Toronto! I can't wait til I bring my boyfriend to try this place! 
I gave it a four star because even though it was the best Thai restaurant in town. It's super busy, always. I can see why, the food speaks for itself! But that being said, my coworkers and I always find it a challenge to call in a take out and sometimes they never pick up! There was two times that we wanted to order take out at work and it was frustrating so we end up ordering at a different place. I was also there on Tuesday and forgot my blanket scarf there, I tried calling that night for it and the next day, no one returned or picked up my phone call. Hopefully, it is still there if I have time to pick it up when I'm not busy at work!
Tip: do make reservations ahead of time if you're planning to eat in! Saves the trouble and so much time!
Westernized Thai food, not authentic Thai food. Not recommended for authentic Thai food.

we got the pad thai, garlic shrimps, a mojito, and pineapple shake. i've  had  authentic pad thai in thailand so i found their pad thai  a little too sweet. however, the chicken was very juicy and the noodles were perfectly cooked. as for the shrimps, it was nice and crispy but nothing spectacular. loved their mojito, very refreshing with bold flavors and a strong kick.

Do I ever eat or review anything other than Asian food? We will never know.  But what is clear, is that I am a fan, and Pai made me so so happy during a recent visit to Toronto!
I'm not too generous with my five star ratings, but Pai deserves it based on the actual restaurant (so cool!), AND the food - the penang curry specifically!
The restaurant is laid out in very specific seperate rooms, each has a different vibe alltogether. The furniture and decor changes as you walk through the restaurant. It was fun walking through the various dining areas to end up at our bar seat in the back room.  
Once sat, we started with the shrimp crackers, which were a great snacky starter- they aren't porous and airy like your usual orange/white/pink basic shrimp crackers. These were brown, very shrimpy with a hint of spice, and almost cassava cracker-like. They were awesome, and so was the tamarind dip that came with them.
Thai iced teas here were amazing, and we were quite happily drinking those eventhough their cocktails also looked amazing. Especially the lychee one. Some other time! 
He orderded pad thai, I went for my alltime fave the penang curry. Best. Dish. In. A. Long. Time!  Holy cow. The depth of flavors in their version is amazing, each bite you detect different things and you just want to keep eating. I would love some right now, actually.
We had to finish with the mango sticky rice because that dessert is our "thing".  I have never met one I don't love, and this was no different. 
I liked Pai so much that I would return in a heartbeat- which says a lot since Toronto has so many other places to discover!

Ive been here before pandemic. It's good food and the interior transports you to what you could imagine to be a hideaway tucked in on a street somewhere in Thailand.
It is a bit pricey and the service is dicey at times and for that I'd dock a star.
Haven't tried many dishes but Pad gra prow with crispy pork is really nice. Good vibes and service overall.
one of the best pad thais ive had! a lot of people say its overrated but i enjoyed it. great service and they seated our party pretty quickly too

What cool spot. Really liked this place. Doesn't look like much from the outside, and quite frankly pretty easy to miss, but inside is a whole other story. It's pretty bumpin! Friendly staff, cool ambience, and the food....great! Good taste, decently priced, decent portions, and a nice simple menu that you don't have to spend hours going through.

This place was absolutely delicious! Their papaya salad was extremely well balanced and probably one of the best papaya salad I had and believe me, I had alot of papaya salad in the past. Their sangria was extremely tasty and I couldn't get enough of! Everything was authentic and everything  on their menu looked so good.   Great ambience and friendly staff.  My only advise is to come early, they fill up fairly quickly!
First time in Canada. Totally recommend this restaurant. Worth the wait. Soup was amazing to start. We had paid Thai and the green curry dish. It was all excellent. Plus great service.
Great overall experience.  The food was yummy and the service was good.  I would recommend this place

Will this review be number 2200 for Pai? Wow, I had no intention of holding off until then but today as I look at Pai's Yelp page, I'm honorer to be writing this review for Toronto's most popular restaurant or listing.
It's always busy, always, so make sure you plan ahead with either a reservation or show up early to get your spot in line. But surprisingly, for a subterranean restaurant located below Duncan street just south of Adelaide, it's HUGE. You might think that by comparison to other Toronto restaurants that the seating near the main room bar is the end, you'd be wrong. Pai twists and turns like a labyrinth through the streets of Bangkok (and it's eclectic decor adds to this feel) opening up to numerous dining areas, bars and private dining spaces.
It was busy so we told the staff we'd take any seat, even side by side on the bar, which was a smart idea because with other patrons being told the wait would be 45-60 min for a table we were seated in less then 5.
We ordered a couple of drinks to start and at the recommendation of not one but two servers we ordered the MIANG KUNG as a shared appetizer. This social dish was super fun, sort of like DIY Fajitas at a TexMex joint but thai and fresh. It comes with a platter of fresh betel leaves, chilled baby black tiger shrimp, ginger, garlic, shallots, lime, chilli, roasted coconut, roasted peanuts, coconut sugar, and tamarind sauce to toss together into a hand rolls and enjoy. What fun, and so delicious!
Knowing that the chef here is one and the same that started my favourite Thai spot before this - Khao San Road, I knew I needed to order my favourite dish of hers to see if it still held up. KHAO SOI made of fresh egg noodles, golden curry, crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, choice of braised beef, chicken breast or chicken drumsticks. I always go with the braised beef because it's so damn soft and fall apart I couldn't imagine eating it with anything else.
Lastly, service was quick, friendly and really helpful, despite the place being so busy all the time, mistakes would and should have been expected, but no, flawless top to bottom. When I can get a seat here again, I'll definitely be back, if you still haven't pai-d them a visit, get thee to this place and swiftly.
Eatcrest Out

Beautiful location with unique indoor decor. The food was excellent. I have traveled all over Thailand and tried a variety of dishes. I ordered the khao soi which is a famous northern Thailand dish. Pai's khao soi was very delicious and brought back memories of when I first tried it at one of best khao soi restaurants in Thailand. Also, the food came out very quickly and the service was excellent.

Best Thai food I ever had in the Toronto area. I came here at 12:10 which is 10mins after they opened and already all of their tables were filled! If I had came any later I would have to wait to be seated. This place was already looking promising. I had the squash fritters, khao soi, pad gra Prow, and their chef nuit pad thai. The squash fritters were a great appetizer with a slight crunchy squash fry dipped in their house made soy sauce, just the thought made me curl my toes. I first had their pad gra prow with beef which was packed with flavor and pieces of minced beef were explosions of umami of their own. The pad gra prow with chicken packed a sweet and sour taste to it which is nice alternative to the umami packed pad gra prow I had before. The most disappointing dish I had was the khao soi but it was still very flavorful. With a light coconut curry broth to it the noodles were coated evenly with the sauce and the beef inside was fall off the fork tender. I was blown away from how tender the beef was but this is my least favorite dish here because I am not a huge fan of curry. Overall I would be coming here again and again.

Great sized portions given that inflation is getting out of hand. None the less they did not hold back on any of  the food portions. Great food packed with flavour and fresh ingredients definitively recommend stopping in for some excellent food and lively dining area. They do get quite packed on Saturdays.

I was searching for food and noticed the high reviews so I decided to get lunch to go. I got a tofu pad Thai with medium spicy. It was not spicy whatsoever. The dish itself was very sweet from other pad Thais I had in the past. So I was a little disappointed as this is my usually go to dish for Thai food. I mean there is a chance that this is supposed to be legit pad Thai and I just didn't know it. 
The quality of the noodles, sprouts and tofu was good. It was fresh and cooked well so that's a plus. It's just the flavors that didn't meet my expectations. I may try this place again. There are a few dishes I would like to try. Also it seems like a decent spot to dine in with some friends.

extremely good food - very authentic! 
please try the Pad Thai and their desserts are all just amazing - must try !

First time trying grabong and it was delicious! It was a long wait so better reserve ahead of time! Very nice atmosphere. Serving is a just a little bit less than expected. Other than that great experience!

In A Nutshell:
-Pai is different than your usual Thai restaurant.
-It's a blend of hipster & Thai food.
-It can get very crowded, regardless of the day of the week.
-The layout is very dark & cozy.
-The food options are easy to order and you can control the level of spice to your tongue's desire.
-The betel leave wraps are very unique & hard to find outside of Thailand, so order that.
Overall, I recommend coming to eat here.  If you want to make reservations, do so in advance.  They won't take dame day reservations bc this place is BUSY & POPULAR.

I have always wanted to try Pai but was never able to eat there in person due to how busy they always were, pre-pandemic. Since staying at home I've been able to order from them a few times and WOW. If the food is so good delivered, I can't even imagine how tasty it would be in person!
The chicken and shrimp pad thai is my absolutely favorite. Plentiful chicken and shrimp, the portion size is great, and the flavors are absolutely on point. I also enjoy their spring rolls, but the price seems high for only two spring rolls which don't taste much different from Salad King's spring rolls (for half the price).
I can't wait to try Pai in person, in the meantime I will be reordering delivery and I suggest you do the same!

A restaurant with lots of energy and fun place to grab dinner. It is super busy, so I suggest going early. Drinks took surprisingly awhile to get, but the food came out of the kitchen quickly. All of the food tasted great.

This Thai restaurant is SUPER delicious! Made reservations in advance in order to get a table for 2. It gets super busy after 4pm. 
We got seated immediately after we got there. Service was slow and it took a bit of time to get our food and water. Perhaps they are understaffed and it's crazy busy in the restaurant. 
The food was delicious! I have been to Thailand before and it tastes very authentic compared to what I had before. The mango sticky rice was the best I had in Toronto. The pad Thai was flavourful and not just sweet. We ordered chicken fried rice and it was perfect. The portion was decent but we definitely needed 2 entrees, 1 appetizers and 1 dessert to be full. We also ordered chicken satay. Everything was flavourful and authentic. Highly recommended to come here for lunch/dinner! 
I would definitely come back again in the future! Love their hipster vibe!

I had high expectations because of the ratings. However, the food was really disappointing.
We ordered a Thai iced tea(5/5)
Pad Thai(3/5) too sweet
Panang beef(1/5) beef way over cooked and the rice was dry as bones
Tom yum soup(2/5) way too salty
Service were alright. The place is super busy and crowded with loud music.

Service was amazing and staff were knowledgeable, saw them clean tables between customers which is great. Tables were distanced appropriately and their patio still felt cute and cozy.
Food was delicious and surprisingly filling because the portions did not seem very large at first glance. I ordered the khao soi with beef. The brisket was very tender but didn't have much taste to it, the real winner was the broth.
Delicious food and a great ambiance but get there early because they will sell out of a few things by then end of the night.

Pai Northern Thai Kitchen is known for its authentic Northern Thai cuisine, which often includes bold flavors and unique combinations of ingredients. Many customers appreciate the restaurant's dedication to providing an immersive dining experience that transports them to the vibrant streets of Thailand.

The constant line ups for this place made it so appealing. We went on a Tuesday around 7 and waited for about 20 minutes which wasn't bad at all. With all the hype, I guess my expectations were pretty high and unfortunately, it didn't quite live up to the hype.
We started with the spring rolls with glass noodles inside. Super yummy and probably our favourite bite out of everything we had. My boyfriend and I then shared 3 dishes - papaya salad, pad thai beef, and the morning glory.
The presentation of the papaya salad was absolutely beautiful. The chicharron was a nice crunch on the side, but overall the flavours were quite muddled and the dish lacked any freshness. The pad thai was a bit dry and the sauce was very heavy on the oyster sauce which totally overpowered everything and just took on a one-note flavour profile. Morning glory is one of my favourite veggies and despite the decent flavour, the vegetable was overcooked. With such a delicate and tasty veggie, I wished it was done justice since it's such a rare dish to come across.
I'll definitely be back to try their other dishes and hopefully, I'll find some dishes to fall in love with.

3.5-4 
Came about 30 minutes before closing and it was still pretty busy. Music is loud, and so are people so it's a bustling place. Our server was nice and came to check on us every now and then, seemed like she was both hostess and server taking orders.
Menu is straightforward, sectioned off by appetizers, curries, noodles and specialities. We went with the ones that were most mentioned on yelp! 
All the meat is seasoned and cooked well (the beef is braised in the green curry, the chicken is tender in the khao soi and the beef is pan fried deliciousness in the pad Thai).
As for the taste- green curry has a bit more kick in it, the khao soi curry is TO DIE for (so good!), and the pad Thai is a bit on the sweeter side.
Spent about 70 CAD for 3 dishes, a bit on pricier end but worth it.

Came on a Thursday evening around 5 and the restaurant was already starting to get packed! I love the atomosphere here and the decor! The staff were nice and helpful. Their menu isn't as selective as other thai restaurants i'm used to but they have great selections! We got the sausage, papaya salad, pad ga prao, and khao soi. 
I really enjoyed the sausage and the sauce that came with it. The papaya was good too and i liked how they included all the extras i usually eat with it at home like lettuce, noodles, crab chips, and fried pork skin! The khao soi was a bit different than what i'm used to since i usually eat it with rice noodles but it was decent. The pad ga prao was really good! Lots of flavors and by the end of our meal, our plates were all clean! I looked around and saw the tables around us has emptied their plates completely too. The total was about $80.

Great food and fantastic service.  It gets very crowded.  Don't expect to get seated right away.  We had about a 45 min wait but it was well worth it.  I'd recommend the Khai Soi, Khao Pla Tawt, and the Pad See Eew. All great dishes.

Came here on a Sunday night and to our luck there was a short waiting time. After reading all the glowing reviews to this place I had this on my list as a must go to place when I'm in Toronto. My friends and I decided to do family style got the following to share:
Spring Rolls ($8.50 CAD): This was a great appetizer to share amongst the 4 of us. This came with mushrooms, glass noodles, carrots and served with a sweet and spicy Thai chili sauce. I liked how they didn't skimp out on the filling in the spring rolls and it was nicely paired with the sauce.
Khao Soi ($16.50 CAD): Don't skip out on this dish! This was extremely rich in flavor and the egg noodles were perfectly cooked. The texture of the crispy noodles paired well with everything in this dish. It kept me wanting more!
Gaeng Kiaw Wan ($17.50 CAD): The green curry was just alright. It's served in a coconut which is super creative however, I felt as if this dish was a bit bland. We ordered this dish with tofu, which could be the reason as to the lack of flavors.
Pad Gra Prow ($16.50 CAD): There wasn't anything special to this dish. We ordered this with the crispy pork and was disappointed to find that the pork wasn't crispy and was actually quite soggy. It made it hard to chew because of how soggy it was.
Sadly, I had a mediocre experience and left feeling disappointed with the food. The service was lacking and it took some time to flag someone down to take our order.

65/100
Really good Thai food, no complaints but from what I have had before it's also run of the mill.

OMG YUM!
My boyfriend brought me and my parents here for dinner after a theatre show. The ambiance is so cute, but a little loud (my mom didn't like that, but everyone else was fine). I loved the story of the restaurant told in polaroids when you walk in. 
We ordered a grabong app to share and I had the khao soi with tofu. Both dishes were amazingly delicious! I think the price was fair for the location, food quality and portions. Our bill came to $92 (without tip) for 4 entrees and 1 app. Would highly recommend this place! I think they are on Skip the Dishes or UberEats too.

A group of friends and I visit Toronto annually in July and we've been trying to get a reservation to Pai for the last 3 years. It's always been fully booked over 1-2 months out, but this year we finally made it to lunch! I was always inspired by Pai's history and how they started the restaurant, so I was really excited to taste the food.
The inside feels stylish, hip, and authentic. The atmosphere is pretty dim especially since it's in the basement level so there isn't much natural light. We were immediately seated at a long bar-height table. For drinks we all got the thai milk-tea which was really refreshing.  For appetizers, we got the grabong (really crispy and great to share!) and kung tawt. 
For entrees, people at our table ordered the Khao Soi, Pad Gra Prow, Green Curry, and Pad Thai. I got the Khao Soi with beef and farang spice, and I think it was my favorite by far. The golden curry soup base was super creamy and rich in flavor. At first I wish there was more, but by the end I was really full and satisfied (maybe still wish there were some extra noodles). The included fried noodles on top added the perfect amount of texture to the braised beef and soup dish. I tried my friend's Pad Thai and to be honest, I wasn't super impressed by it -- it seemed to be overly salty and lacked some sweetness and sourness. Regardless, this is my best and favorite Thai restaurant I've been to and it met my expectations and more!  The staff are super friendly and give really good recommendations.  
MAKE A RESERVATION AND GO EAT, you won't be disappointed.

Meeting a friend after 20 years and he suggested we meet @pai , never heard of the place .
Landed at 7:15pm and it was a dry lane and it's in the basement floor , but as you enter u r shocked to see the place is huge like 200 plus seater and fully packed and u have a 1 hr waiting on a Tuesday ....oooou !
We were given a pager and suggested we could wait in the waiting area where they offer beverage sales and we ordered some ipa .
After 45 minutes we got the place to sit on the bar counter where we ordered their favourite squash bites and chicken satay . The place was nice energetic n staff was pleasant !
For main course I ordered massaman beef with steamed rice and my friend ordered green curry which was served in a raw coconut , exciting to see .
The food tasted authentic n delicious!
Coming back soon to experience another vibrant evening !

Should I even have to tell you how good Pai is? Aren't 2K and counting reviews enough lol
And yeah true to it's amazing rating Pai doesn't ever disappoint.
Been here a few times over the years and haven't once been disappointed nor has the taste changed.
Always get their sangria which has some delicious lychees! Another favourite of mine is the Grabong or squash fritters. They come with this delicious tangy dipping sauce!
Have tried their noodle bowl, pad Thai, green curry, fish plate and on my last visit tried the red curry and as usual wasn't disappointed.
Dessert was the mango and sticky rice which was heavenly! The fried banana is also excellent.
Wait staff are great, super attentive and caring. Answer all questions and provide recommendations.
A must visit if you are in Toronto!

Yum! I ordered the Khao Soi with braised beef and I was delightfully surprised. The waitress said it was standardized to a "medium" spice level so I was pretty skeptical at first, but then she further reassured me that it wasn't too spicy and it turned out great! I'm glad I listened to her because I really enjoyed it! The curry was very creamy and flavorful with a sweet undertone, and the chunks of braised beef were fairly large and tender. The crispy noodle topping also added a great crunchy texture to the overall dish. 
It was a filling and yummy meal! I just felt that the music was too loud because I had to scream to talk over the small table and I could barely even hear myself.

I'm okay with long waits if the food was worth it, but from what we ordered, it was decidedly not. 
We didn't have a reservation and the place was packed New Years Eve around 5 pm. We waited at the bar and ordered a thai iced tea to pass the time. It was overly sweet and lacked flavor/tasted watered down. 
We were seated at a shared table with another party. Fair enough, but the wait was long, and we struggled to flag down a waiter to refill our waters.
Finally, the food. I'd read a bunch of Yelp reviews and pored through photos while we waited and eventually settled on the pad gra prow. My boyfriend got the panang curry with fish.
The pad gra prow was mediocre to the point that I could not finish it despite being hungry. I paid extra for crispy pork, which turned out to be borderline crispy ground pork that was under-seasoned and extremely dry. This was plated on a bed of rice, equally dry, and a serious lack of sauce to rescue the scenario.
The fish panang was excellent though - rich and flavorful curry, flaky fish. That, as well as the currently favorable USD rate, tempered the experience for me.

Mouthwateringly good food! Is that even a word lol? Regardless, this restaurant served my hungry self and I ate and left no crumbs! My daughter Britannica, 13, also recommends it here and claims it's her favorite restaurant! Coming back asap!

We were vacationing in Toronto and we're looking for something different for dinner. we took an Uber to this place and they were able to accommodate our party of 10.
I've only had pad Thai once before and I was familiar with it but I wasn't sure if the kids were going to enjoy it as much as I did.
You reminded me of someone's basement cuz it kind of actually was in the basement but it was decorated as such. The chairs were the same chairs that you said and when you were in high school I thought it was pretty neat how they repurposed furniture.
It wasn't too loud but it was very crowded and the I ordered chicken pad Thai I kind of wish they would have brought me chopsticks to eat it with but I didn't ask for it so there's that. They also accommodated the kids by making them chicken fried rice which was not on the menu but they made it anyway which I thought was really cool.
portion sizes were very good drinks were refilled almost instantly overall very good job.
We ordered the Moo ping skewers, one of which was raw inside. They replaced it, but my pregnant wife already had a bite which ruined the rest of the meal.
Ambiance alone gives this place a double thumbs up. Pair that with amazing food and excellent service and you get the 5 star trifecta
Best Thai in the city hands down. Vibe at the downtown location is better but always a line up to get in so if you don't have reservations your best bet will be the uptown location.

I've always ordered Pai from Uber eats and still one of my favourite Thai places in Toronto! I has a great reputation for a reason. Since it is a very popular place, get there early for a table. We ordered the Northern Thai platter which was great for sharing for 2 people. It's a dine in option only.  Everything in the platter is delicious and a fun thing to try something new.

Pai
I AM DEFINITELY GOING BACK TO THIS PLACE!
Found this place thru google and decided a try because of the reviews. 
I ordered the famous curry and i was a bit disappointed because it wasn't in a coconut shell as how they advertised it (could've added some presentation). But also im glad I got it because it was one of the BEST CURRY I've tried my entire life!!! It comes with a rice bowl too!
We also ordered a soup i forgot what it was called but it has some strong flavour on it which made it a little bit too much. It also has nuts which im not really a fan of. 
Service was fast. Place is cool!! Staff are really kind :)
Please you need to try their curry

Would highly recommend Pai for thai lovers. It's a must try for anyone who hasn't been before. One piece of advice, get here early. The line up  is insane and I completely understand why.
Lucky, we got a table after work on a Friday night without any issues. By the time we were finisehd around 7:30, close to 8. The line up was out the door.
The vibe of the restaurant is amazing, lots of energy and smells amazing as soon as you walk in. The restaurant itself is pretty biog with lots of seating. Really cool mom and pop shop feel, the food definitely is the highlight.
We got the pad thai, chicken wings, thai ice tea, fried rice and khao soi. Hands down, the best thai meal that i've ever had. There was so much flavour in each dish, the pad thai was perfect. Noodles were perfectly cook, the peanut garnish and lime wedge to add that citrus taste. BOMB.
Chicken wings and fried rice were also unreal. You can really taste the breath of the wok in this dish. I can't explain it but there's a hint of char in the dish that adds an extra element. I'm so hungry right now!
I'd suggest the thai ice tea also, some places make this overly sweet, but not Pai. definitely worth it!

The service was good but I don't know what was happening with the lunch last week. I got a beef Gaeng Panang and the beef was rubbery and dry and tasted as if it was left out for a while. My friend also ended up getting a stomachache after (the same dish but vegan version) which lasted for days. We don't know if it was from the food because she eats spicy curries often and this was a first. At least my other friend's rice dish was good

PAD GRA PROW - currently my favorite authentic Thai dish in Toronto. 
I typically get the beef version with mild spice.  Tastes as close to anything that I had while in Thailand - 100% recommend.

Mmmm....
From open to close, there's almost ALWAYS a line up from the hostess to the entrance door all the way up the stairs, and sometimes to the sidewalk. My advice? Come earlier than your scheduled time, and be prepared to wait!
There's gotta be a reason why there's a wait, ALL the time. 
It's simply because THEIR FOOD IS FANTASTIC! 
The restaurant has a casual ambience, and traditional decor, makes you feel like you're having authentic street food in Thailand. 
Server is with you right away, orders come super fast, and they're always prepared the very same way, every single time. My favourite my far will always be their Khao Soi  but all their dishes are worth a try!
Ever since I visited here for the very first time a few years ago, I haven't stopped bringing my friends here that's never tried it before. So if you ask me... I say COME AND TRY IT IF YOU HAVEN'T ALREADY!!

Roaming around downtown Toronto and get hungry , decided to grab something nice for dinner , yelp introduce me to here at Pai Northern Thai Kitchen , it was full pack but have the chance to grab there best pad thai on the menu and it was delish , staff are courteous and kind , leaving the place with a full tummy and a big smile !

Definitely a place to go. This is Thai restaurant. 
I'll start by the toilets which are very Clean (with capital letter). I'm use to hear that if toilets are clean, then the food must be clean as well.
I definitely live this place and will go again to try others things. I've try the p plum cocktail with ginger beer and vodka. You don't feel so much alcohol in the there and its refreshing. A nice cocktail for hot summer though.
As a plate I took a salad plate that were very spicy. I didn't really like it because it was too spicy but my bad, I didn't read well the color as advices.
But I loved at the others plates and honestly I can't understand if you don't like it. It's not so expensive and the atmosphere is very nice. A bit hippie style with disco music :) just one comment, take are too close to each other and it's a bit noisy.
Make sure you have a reservation of you go around 7pm.

Came here at 8pm on a Friday night and only waited 10 minutes for a table of 3! And the food took ~20 min to come.
GREEN CURRY WITH BEEF (5/5)- l really enjoyed the bamboo shoots, the medium spiciness was perfect, and I loved that it was served in a coconut! Scraping off the coconut meat into the rich sweet green curry gave a chewy component and an added coconut taste to the already delicious coconut-based curry. There was ~9 generous chunks of beef that was tender and moist. 
CHICKEN PAD THAI (5/5)- The perfect sweet and sour savoury combo. It had a great amount of chicken, noodles, and bean sprouts that were cooked & infused with just the right amount of sauce so it JUST coated. Topped over were peanuts,  green onions, and a refreshing shredded cabbage. The noodles were thin & flat and had a slightly firm chew. 
KHAO SOI WITH BEEF (4.5/5)- They gave a good amount of fried noodles along with the normal noodles that were soaked in the amazingly coconut sweet & savoury red curry. I would've drank it all if I wasn't sharing it haha! There was also a generous amount of beef chunks that were tender and juicy.
After hearing so many good things about the authenticity and food at Pai, I'm so happy I got to finally try it out (with a short wait time too!). I'm sure I'll be back again soon :)

Value 4/5
Taste 4/5
Service 4/5
Presentation of food 4/5
Appearance of the establishment 5/5

Hands down the best Thai outside of Thailand and maybe I'll go so far as to say even better than that in Thailand... If you're visiting Toronto and only have time to eat at one place? This is it. 
We were seated at the bar around 6:00pm Friday. There will be a wait but not too long. 
Food:
Kao Soi: 6/5... this dish was phenomenal. The fresh thin noodles combined with the addictive curry coconut soup... I couldn't get enough. I chose chicken thighs per staff recommendation and it definitely was tender and flavorful. 
Pad Thai: 5/5. Bae got this dish Thai Spicy as a challenge and he was challenged indeed. But the fire didn't build which was great. 
Spring rolls: 5/5. Crunchy. Who knew vegetarian spring rolls could taste this good... 
Service: Attentive & so friendly!
Decor: The vibes do transport you back to Thailand! Very cute and pretty big space. 
Definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Toronto. MUST GO.
Amazing food but there's always a wait and it's always more than an hour and even though the food is worth it I think they should offer more tables for reservations in advance!

Went here on a Friday night for dinner with my girlfriend and her cousin. Originally we were expecting a very long wait because we were warned at how popular this place gets, especially on a Friday evening. Apparently they recently expanded the dining area which was great news to hear! We were seated right away and the waitress came about 5 minutes after being seated to ask if we had any questions about the menu. We had previous recommendations on the food here from some friends and one of the people we were with, so it didn't take long for us to know what we wanted. 
If you have not tried Thai iced tea before, it is a must try pair with your dinner! For food, we tried the Chef Nuit Pad Thai with chicken with mild spice (soooooo good with a great portion), Gai Satay chicken skewers with sticky rice (beautifully presented), and the pad gra prow with fried pork (DELICIOUS!). 
All the food came in about 30 minutes, which was great considering how busy they were. Plus, with good company, time goes by faster! 
Overall, i would give this place 6 stars if it was an option. Great experience and even better food and service. Thank you, Pai for always making me crave your food.

I called this place 3 days in advance and found that I couldn't get a hold of anyone given that all directions the machine sent me to were automated. It directed me to make a reservation online and I shortly after (late at night) received a notification that they did not have ANY tables for me that day (Friday night). I walked in 2 hours in advance on the day of (5:00pm) and got in the long line up. Got to the front and I was told the person that it was my cousin's 30th, it would be a surprise and therefor needed a table at a secluded spot and that I needed to come back at 7:30pm (30 minutes before my requested time). *It was a table for 4 we were requested not a table for 10. 
I came back at 7:30pm and got a table in a place right across the restaurant where I knew the birthday girl would see me from miles away. We didn't get a table in a secluded spot as requested. She of course saw us from a mile away .... womp womp. It wasn't a surprise when her jaw dropped from the entrance. 
Appetizer:
Vegetarian Spring Rolls were good. Plenty to keep two people good for appetizers. The fish sauce goes beautifully with it. 
Main Course: 
Panang Curry. I requested that this be as spicy as possible and was told that the curry was as it came and we couldn't request for a higher spice level. Unfortunate. They brought us a house-made oil (which was not spicy) but it made the dishes take A LOT better. I also was brought chopped thai chillies which was nice. I asked this to be vegetarian and was brought a vegan dish. I returned this to get my dish brought to me some time later while all the other guests at my table were eating. Also remember to ask for a separate plate for this dish as the curry bowl is filled up and so is the white rice bowl - leaving no room for you to put them together to eat. 
Dessert:
We had one of the two ice cream options. Can't remember the name of the option I chose...think it started with a G. It wasn't great at all. The taste may grow on you the more you eat it but definitely not something many people would look forward too. 
They didn't fall short of bringing the birthday girl ice cream (not free of cost) and singing Happy Birthday to her as a group. 
4 people with 2 appetizers and 4 individual main courses = approx. $120.

Whenever I crave Pad Thai, this is the place to go! I have been to many Thai restaurants and I can say that Pai makes the best Pad Thai I have ever tasted!! I love the food, atmosphere and service. Everything is amazing and definitely worth your money.

There are only a few Thai places in North America that will actually give Thai hot to white people. You can beg and plead and explain your love of hot food (we grow chiles and I have worked for a hot sauce company), but the kitchen will be all, "Nope, they can't handle it." And then I'm sad and disappointed and threaten to sneak some Dave's Insanity Sauce in my pocket next time. But Pai's pad Thai made me suffer a little, and that's worth five stars on its own, and now I'll go to the place every time I'm ever in Toronto until the end of time, which should be a few times even though I live in Buffalo.
Beyond that, the appetizers made you rethink what could be done with fried shrimp and spring rolls, the decor is adorably kitschy, the service (we sat at the bar) was excellent, and there was an eclectic Christmas market going on on the middle of the dining room. Pai somehow blends basement dive, sports bar, and semi-upscale Thai food semalessly, and if making the food legit Thai hot hadn't already earned them five stars in my book, pulling off the latter trick would have.

The high rating is well deserved. Pai is just delicious Thai food plain and simple. I've been a few times, it's always packed. The ambience is rustic and nice. It's kind of a basement but it's a big open space with cute lighting, good vibe but still pretty cozy. It's busy without being overwhelming. The service is really efficient considering how busy they are. 
I had their green curry which comes in a coconut - honestly I was enticed by that just for the look but it's also a young coconut and you can scrape off the coconut meat! The grabong app is really great to share. It's really like French fries made from squash- really nice. I had their rotating tap beer which I can't recall but was great
This is definitely must try place in Toronto. I'm glad they continue to go strong. If it were closer to me I would definitely be a regular.

I loved "The Story of Pai" which was posted in multiple locations throughout the restaurant. The just of it is that a Canadian man went on a trip to Northern Thailand, ended up meeting his future wife and moved with her back to Canada. Chef Nuit and her husband opened several restaurants with the goal of duplicating authentic Thai cuisine. 
When we arrived on a weeknight the line was out the door, but once we made it to the host stand our wait was only about 15 minutes. 
The menu is very thoughtful - some of the traditional Thai dishes such as Pad Thai and Tom Yum Shrimp and others that I had not seen before. 
I can see why the place is so popular - the flavors were outstanding in the handful of dishes we were able to sample!

Probably don't need more convincing that Pai is good with near 7k Google reviews at 4.6 stars.
It made an ideal late lunch spot and flavors were bold and punch-y. We were seated immediately and the late afternoon crowd was relaxed. We ordered Spring Rolls, Papaya Salad, Pad Cha Hett and Khao Soi, but truly everything that came out of the kitchen smelled and looked delicious.
Go here!

We loved the usual chicken pad thai and warm service. 
The atmosphere ws electric and there was so much joy. 
This place is always busy but they will try to accommodate you as soon as possible.
Must go place if you like thai food.
Such a great place for Thai food. The khao soi with beef brisket is my go to! So flavourful and the portion size is enough for two meals or to split between two people.

A friend asked me what do I miss most about Toronto since having moved to London, ON and Pai is what immediately came to mind. Their Penang Beef Curry is life! So so so GOOD!
I also am not a lover of Pad Thai but their's is awesome. So is their Pad Gra Pow, their Spring Rolls,and their Gaeng Masaman. I think the only thing I have tried and not loved is their Green Curry, which to me was a bit on the loose/oily side.
I used to work 5 minutes from this place and the odd time I could get a reservation (which is rare because this place is almost always packed) I would go. I have been spoiled and no thai food quite compares to the deliciousness that is Pai. Not in Toronto at least and certainly nothing in London, ON.

When you work in the financial district and have an hour lunch break, trying new restaurants becomes such an easy and convenient past time (especially if you forget your lunch at home). I've always tried going to Pai for dinner, but it gets so packed and doesn't seem worth an hour plus long wait. So there I was, deciding that Pai would become my next lunch break endeavour. 
Pai opens at 11:30am on a Friday and a coworker and I rushed to get here just before 12, which was a good thing because it was already so packed when we arrived. We managed to get the last two seats at the bar, but it felt like they just stuck us in the corner right next to everyone else waiting to get a seat. I ordered the green curry with fish and was so excited to receive my food in a coconut (just like all the other yelp reviews indicated), but was so disappointed when it came in a plain white bowl. The flavours were there, but it tasted like the same flavours I could get at any thai takeaway place and didn't seem like any overly special dish. Not to mention, it took about 40 mins for our food to arrive which didn't leave us much time to eat. 
Their food is quite decent and the restaurant's vibe is super chill, but I wouldn't rate this higher than any other competent thai restaurant out there.

I tried 3 things at Pai: beef salad, spring rolls, and pad thai. I'm visiting Toronto for work, and everyone in the office had hyped this place up. I mean it's Yelp reviews also look pretty strong. I walk in, the place was pretty packed. We got a table for our party of 6. It took them a while to take our order because it was a busy place. They got my order wrong. I ordered spicy pad thai and it came out with no spice. I do have to say, they provide pretty good service, but I was not too impressed with their food. With that said, I also have to say, I have really high standards for thai. I would recommend this place, but just know that it is a bit over hyped.

Pai was very busy when we arrived (around 5:40 pm), but that was expected as it's known that this restaurant is very popular. We walked around 20 minutes and were served almost right away. I ordered the khao soi with beef brisket and it came out relatively quickly and nice and hot. It was absolutely delicious - the broth was rich and creamy, the brisket was so tender and flavorful, and the mix or soft and crunchy noodles made for a unique experience! Even the restaurant itself is adorable with the family's story on the wall, tons of pictures, fun lighting and decor, and a map of Pai. Now I want to go to Thailand even more than before!!

I was recommended this by many friends upon moving to Toronto, and after going I can see why. I got their pad Thai with chicken and holy this pad Thai was one of the best ones of my life (given that I have never been to Asia..). Like I almost don't even want to try anything else from their menu because I just want to keep goi back for their pad Thai. Generous portion size as well. My friend got the green curry and also really enjoyed it, apparently it also has a good kick, so looking forward to MAYBE straying from my new favourite dish to try this next.

Loved this place so much that we came here twice during our stay in Toronto. 
First time we visited here was Saturday late afternoon for late lunch with 6 ppl including 3 vegan friends and they were very accommodating for our request. I also love the fact you get to choose how spicy you would like. Sometimes I can't eat certain dishes cuz it's too spicy but no issue here and it tells me they cook fresh for you. The place looked crowded when we walked in first but the wait wasn't too bad. All dishes we tried were super fresh and tasty. I also loved their cocktail. 
We came back 2 days later cuz it was sooooo good! My favorite dish was papaya salad but I also loved my drink, Tea mac. If you like Thai ice tea, you need to try this. 
Solid Thai place with cute and welcoming atmosphere and great service. I will come back for sure.
Food is always great the service was always bad. I would order takeout, but refuse to go dine in

Strongly recommended by literally everyone that's tried this place, I expected Pai to be an overhyped experience before I stepped into their door. I ended up being wrong on so many levels.
Right after walking down the steps to this basement Toronto restaurant, I was greeted by an authentic, unique, and trendy decor that was like no other place I've seen. It was so noisy and welcoming!
What really wowed me though, was their food. I decided to try just their chicken chef nuit pad thai with farang spicy today, and it was the most incredible pad thai I've ever had. The chicken was perfectly cooked and came in large chunks, and all the noodles were so soft and tender; it just all melted in my mouth as I chewed through them! It tasted so good, with just the right amount of everything. 
I asked for hot sauce too, and they gave me a chili oil hot sauce instead of that awful chili-garlic-sriracha-like substance that all the other places give. Chili oil is genuinely spicy, and only helped augment the flavours of the pad thai.
After this experience, I can safely say I'm definitely joining the Pai recommenders crowd; it's just too good to not pass up. Definitely get reservations when coming here though, it's always too busy if you arrive closer to peak hours.

Unfortunately, I'm in Toronto for work on my birthday. I'm tired af and trying to find a restaurant not too far from my hotel. I go to a few but those places are pretentious as hell. Not what I'm looking for tonight. I check Yelp and find Pai. I get there about 5:15, get a seat at the bar. By 5:30 it's PACKED. Since it's my birthday, I decide I'm going to drink what I want and sample whatever catches my eye eye on the menu.
I sit at the bar and start with a shot of tequila (the shot of the day) and a Summer Dog. The server/bartender seemed very friendly and was like like, " Yaaaaaas. Good start." Food- I start with the wings. The drink is good (could be stronger but that's why I got the shot), the wings -OMG delicious. The sauce on the side is absolutely unnecessary. I also get a papaya salad. I wish I could order it without all the extras. When the papaya salad was brought to me, the server asked if I've ever had it before. Why? Is there a secret way to eat it? The question was kind of strange to me so I had to flex and let him know I had been to Thailand about 10 times in the past year.
The papaya salad while good, the dried shrimp were inedible. They were so hard I couldn't even break them with my teeth. The noodles on the side are unnecessary. I had already asked them not to bring me the pork rinds and I only ate a few of the shrimp chips-they are pretty unnecessary as well.
After I ordered those two the server took my food menu. I wasn't done ordering yet. I ordered another shot and another summer dog and enjoyed the music. The music was absolutely phenomenal! I really could have stayed all night listening to the music.
Since the Khao Soi got rave reviews I wanted to order that as well. The server seemed annoyed. Not sure why as I was a quiet client and spending a lot of money in this place. Anyway I got the Khao Soi and another Summer Dog. The Khao Soi (with chicken) was absolutely delicious. It was really more than I could eat but like I said, I decided to sample whatever I wanted. I finished the Summer Dog and asked the server to prepare my food for take away. If I'm ever in Toronto again (I doubt it) I would definitely come back here. And I will recommend it to anyone that I know.
Very good start to my night.

Simply put......I want to move to Toronto and live above Pai so I could eat their perfect pad kra prao every day for the rest of my life.  Perfect from the addition of thai style fried egg, nam prik nam pla sauce, and slices of cucumbers on the side.  I ate in silence, each bite better than the last.  This belly filling meal got me through the rest of my very long day.  
This place is packed though, and from what I understand it's packed at all time and most times you have to wait for a table.  IT IS WORTH THE WAIT.  
Service was super friendly - atmosphere casual and fun.
I'm planning a trip back to Toronto soon, and who would blame me that Pai is the central part of the itinerary!

This is my favourite place for pad thai! Honestly it seems like a simple noodle dish but Pai hits the spot with the perfect tamarind seasoning for their pad thai. I did have take out for their khao soi and I prefer it better as a dine in dish.

My family visited Pai on a Saturday night, they ordered take out for me. 
I tried the chicken pad Thai (mild), fried shrimps, and chicken fried rice. 
All the items were AMAZING! I never had real Thai food in Toronto, only tried it in San Francisco. 
The pad Thai flavour was something I never tried before, the noodles were so soft. The chicken fried rice didn't look like it had much flavour since it was really white in colour, but it was the best fried rice I ever had! The shrimp was also not over cooked, the coating around the shrimp was yummy! 
The food was not super hot but it was amazing, I can't wait to dine in and enjoy it fresh!
The food was pretty good, wait was long, thai iced tea and grabong were excellent,  shout out to Colin the best waiter I've had in a Toronto!!!

Visiting from out of town and found this place by accident. My wife and I both like Thai so thought we should try. Food was just excellent. Sorry I don't live closer or I'd be spending a lot of time here.

Come here for delicious Thai food and a kick a$$ vibe. Be prepared for high energy and high quality food...not a place to come if you want to have a nice conversation with your significant other, because, honestly, the awesome tunes that they are blasting on the many speakers through this basement level joint is going to be far more enjoyable.
We ordered the kung tawt (deep fried tiger prawns with thai chilli sauce), the Khao soi with chicken (noodles in golden curry) and the Chef Nuit pad Thai with shrimp. Every dish was superbly satisfying, and we wished we had more room to try some of the other curries.  Good selection of drinks as well, and great servers.

I Have nothing but WONDERFUL things to say about this place! Happened to chance upon this place and were so glad we did. The wait was long but so, so worth it. We were in love with the place before we even walked in - and let me tell you - once our table was called - we couldn't believe how big the restaurant was! So much more than meets the eye at first glance. All the servers - from the front end to the back - were sweet and courteous and so helpful with their suggestions. We ordered the pad Thai and Pad Thamada - and it was such a subtle yet flavorful first bite that we couldn't wait to devour the rest! The drinks were also so yummy and strong. Totally worth the visit and we can't wait to be back soon!!!

One of my friends brought me here and I am so glad she did!  I am a big Thai cuisine lover and this definitely had me satisfied and more.  We didn't have a reservation so we just did walk-ins for lunch.  There were a lot of people waiting but we didn't wait that long for a table of 2.  I  think we waited around 30 minutes.  The space itself is pretty lively.  There is a bar and lots of tables.
I got the green curry.  You get to pick what kind of protein you want with the curry so I got chicken with my green curry.  The curry was not too sweet or too spicy.  Definitely a good balance.  What I loved most about it was that the curry came in a coconut!  I would definitely come back to try the other dishes when I am back in Toronto!

Amazing food! To busy all the time is better if you make a reservation.
Nice service!

Last time we came we waited over 40 minutes to get a table so you know I made sure to get online reservations weeks in advance. We were sat at the back corner all the way in the place (didn't even know the restaurant was so huge?!?!) so the lighting wasn't the best but made for a very cosy dinner (shout-out to the people who sat next to us for not minding those few seconds we took pics with cellphone lighting lol) 
We started with the very popular squash fritters and finished the appetizer within minutes because that sauce is just fabulous! For mains two of us had the Khao Soi with braised beef and the other had green curry. For drinks we had beer, the Thai Ice Tea, and the Dazed and Confused. Personally, even though the flavour was amazing and creamy, the Thai Ice was way too sweet, but the Dazed and Confused was both beautifully presented and tasted the best! Highly recommend! The portions seem small at first since the bowls are huge but we were stuffed by the end AND had leftovers! Also we always love the presentation of the green curry as it comes in a coconut! TOO CUTE. 
The atmosphere inside the restaurant is warm and welcoming. The staff are beyond nice and super patient when we asked about their drinks menu and always came to check up on us even though we were in the way back corner. 
Also, the decor, including the board of the PAI Toronto Story is so adorable, so when you're waiting check out the cute decorations and the framed pictures. 
Can't wait to come back soon!

Visited On: October 4, 2018
Meal: Dinner
Dining Style: Dine-in
Would I Return: Yes
Ordered:
-Shrimp Chef Nuit Pad Thai ($18.50)
Thoughts:
Unfortunately, this place doesn't take reservations, so go early as we did have to wait about 30 minutes for a table. This was also on a weekday, so I can't imagine how busy they get on weekends. Luckily, they let us wait in the bar. I ordered the Chef Nuit Pad Thai with shrimp and really enjoyed it. Portions were good, they gave a lot of food and we were all starving so we finished ours. There weren't many shrimps but the overall flavours were amazing.

The food tasted fairly good, especially the beef noodle soup. Prices are a bit expensive but portions are fairly large. Just a bit too loud/crowded; not good for holding extensive conversations or a peaceful dinner. 
Also recommend reserving in advance because there was a line extending out the door. Food took over an hour to be served. Would not go again during such crowded hours.

Delicious Thai food but it is super busy on weekends. I would recommend going early. Service is quick and friendly. Ambiance is ok, but a little bit loud inside.
I had the khao soi and beef curry. Both were absolutely delicious. I will definitely be returning to try more items.

I've had lunch here a few times over the past few years and although it's always been packed, the food is delicious and authentic and the place is definitely trendy.
Most recently, I had the Khao Sai braised beef for lunch at the bar. The food came very quickly and the Khao Sai is braised in a sweet coconuty sauce with garlic, spices, etc. The "broth" is so good I can basically drink it and that I did.
