It also had these crunchy things on top that beautifully decorated it and always provided a neat textural experience when eating it.
The braised beef was out of this world soft, my only gripe with it were the pieces of the beef were a little too big and I wish they cut them up smaller. All in all - this one dish made for a filling lunch! I definitely look forward to trying more things next time I'm here!

Craving for good Thai food, tried their restaurants a while ago and wanted to come back. This time I tried their pad Thai, thought would be a safe choice. The noodles has the right texture, it's chewy and it's not mushy. But overall taste was very blend.

I'll keep this short and sweet since there are many reviews on here that can get very in-depth. 
Pros:
-The Tom Yum Soup: perfectly balanced, flavourful & delicious. Hits all the right spots and delivers all the right flavours. Extremely good for a Thai restaurant in Toronto. The only way you will find better Tom Yum is if you fly over to Thailand to get it.
-The other food was good too but the Tom Yum Soup Stole the show. I don't remember what else we ordered because I just kept eating the soup. Ordered a bowl of rice to exclusively eat with the soup. 
Cons:
-Really, really, long wait times but worth it in the end. Get ready to wait around and grab a few drinks first if you are planning on coming here.
Summary: Worth the wait, get the Tom Yum Soup.

overall: literally the best thai food i ever had! hundred percent worth the wait
menus: 
thai iced tea: 8/10
pad see ew with shrimp: 10/10 
green curry with chicken: 10/10

You know you've been to a place too often when your wifi on your phone automatically connected! That's me with Pai ;) 
I went to Pai again the other day and left completely satisfied with the food and everything. It was a crowded Sunday evening given that it was Father's Day. However, we were seated fairly quickly because we only had 2 people. I overheard in the lineup that some parties with more people were given a waitlist of 45-60min. Pai should definitely consider getting on the Yelp Waitlist feature.
For food, I stuck with my usual appetizer Grabong. It's so good and definitely hit the spot. How can you get tired of fried squash fritters?? Goodbye diet! 
For the mains, I wanted to venture to their other selections outside of my usual Khao Soi or Masaman Beef Curry. So I tried the Panang Curry with beef instead while my boyfriend got the masaman beef after my strong recommendations. The Panang Curry has a nice aroma and you can definitely taste the jasmine scent. The beef pieces are small sliced pieces rather than the braised chunky ones in the Masaman. Overall I liked it but I think it help to reaffirm my love for the Masaman Beef Curry.

Wow this place is popular!! I got here on a Saturday morning exactly at 11:30am when they opened and there were already a handful of tables filled up. By 12pm, the restaurant was almost full. 
The decor gave me local Thailand vibes so the place looked like it was going to be authentic. 
I got the chicken pad thai and I guess I had super high expectations coming into this restaurant because of the reviews. Sadly, it didn't meet my high expectations. While the noodles were cooked very well, the use of oyster sauce was a bit overwhelming. 
For appetizers, the satay was average, but if there's anything you need to get, it's the breaded garlic shrimp!!! 
Overall, the food was good and I enjoyed my meal, but it didn't blow my mind like I had expected!
Awesome northern Thai food. Ordered the Kai Soy did not disappoint. Pared with a Sing Ha beer fantasti.

4.5!
Wow! Standout Thai food in a busy, central  Toronto neighborhood. 
This is a really cool place, you find the sign and then walk downstairs and you are transported to Thailand. Very similar to some restaurants I actually went to when I was in Thailand, I felt that this experience was really authentic. From the atmosphere to the food, all the details equaled one really fun and delicious experience.
I went with the Khao Soi which I chose because of the many images of it on yelp and I wasn't disappointed. Everyone in our party was jealous of my beautiful golden curry with those crunchy egg noodles poking out. The broth is rich, sweet and deeply flavorful, I got through about half of the broth before succumbing to a food coma. I also tried a bite of the pad Thai, and it was delicious, however I'd definitely recommend the khao soi if I had to choose again. Someone else got the panang curry which looked wonderful but I didn't get a chance to try it. I loved the small and concise menu, there's no watered-down or fusion/Chinese food here, it's strictly and authentically Thai. 
Prices are quite reasonable, you'd be hard pressed to find a cheaper restaurant with that standard of food anywhere in the area. We didn't do any appetizers so our bill only came to $40 or so for two including tax and tip. 
The only reason for the 4.5 is the portion sizes. My khao soi was a good size, I couldn't finish just because the broth was so rich. There was also a good amount of the braised beef. The pad Thai was a bit small, both people who had it finished it fairly quickly and then were digging into my leftover khao soi. Maybe we should have gotten appetizers but I think they could have been a bit more generous with the noodles, given how inexpensive they are. But again, the prices are quite decent considering the area. 
Service was good, our water glasses were filled regularly and all the food arrived quickly. We arrived just before 6pm on Wednesday evening and were seated right away, but shortly after 6pm a massive line began to form. I would recommend getting here early if you want to avoid the wait! 
I absolutely loved the look of this place, it's colorful, funky and lively. It reminds me of being in Thailand which, I think, is really the goal of a Thai restaurant. Can't wait to come back to try some other dishes! I'll be dreaming of that Khao soi until then!!

I just realised I forgot to review Pai Northern after visiting a few times over the years. It's definitely one of the better Thai restaurants in Toronto that caters the mainstream, while staying quite true to traditions. 
The first thing you will notice walking in... the scent. A mix of Jasmine rice and fish sauce? Waiting in the crowded bar area is a bit of a torture, but you can order drinks at the bar. During my recent visit I realized how insanely large this place is... don't be discouraged by the wait, tables are turned quite quickly. 
Here is a quick summary of the food:
Tom Yom soup: Super flavourful. The lime is strong and the shrimps are plump.
Wings: Just delicious, not too spicey
Grabong: shredded and fried sweet potato - a must! 
Green Thai Curry: Not my favourite here, to be honest. 
Panang Curry: Definitely prefer this over the green.
Khao Soi - I had my first Khao Soi here, and I was hooked.
All in all, you can't go wrong. My only gripe is the 20% gratuity that gets added to parties of 6 or more. I've seen up to 18% gratuity at other places and in my experience service is always poor when automatic-gratuity is in play. Although I am happy to say the staff at Pai Northern, during my recent visit were attentive, and deserving of a solid tip.

Yum! Everything was so yummy!!!  We walked right in and go seated and served right away. We came in for a late lunch and split everything we got. 
My favorite thing was the Chicken Pad Thai! We got medium spice, this was not spicy at all. It was perfect! It had just the right amount of flavor and subtle kick. The portion size was also perfect. It was plenty for two to split (especially for lunch). This was a recommendation from a friend while we were visiting. Another amazing recommendation that I would love to pass along! 
There was a variety of items of the menu that I would have loved to try! I'll just have to try them on my next visit to Toronto!
Food was great, very consistent with the quality. Best Pad Thai in Toronto. Great Margaritas!

I came here for the first time not too long ago, I was craving some Thai food and a friend suggested this place. We got the Chef Nuit Pad Thai, Panang Curry and Ginger beer. I personally love ginger beer so I was super happy they had some! 
The Pad Thai was amazing, full of great flavour and a big portion. I could tell why it was a favourite amongst those who dine there (according to my waiter). The curry was also very good, a nice consistency and had a lot of chicken and veggies in it. My favourite though was the Pad Thai!!

Best Thai food in Toronto. I eat here at least once or twice a month. They make the perfect pad thai. Masaman curry and the minced chicken with rice ( forgot its thai name ) are delicious. And I always order the starter soup and spring rolls. Yum.
the vibe at pai just makes me happy.

Good Thai food and friendly service in downtown Toronto. Get down the stairs and feel transported to a little part of Thailand. The decor is nice and charming, and service was efficient. Went on a Friday for lunch and the place was packed. Tried the Khao Pad Beef and the Masaman Curry - both delicious and paired well with a sangria and the Woodhouse lager. 
Recommended and would try again if in the area.

I come here regularly as I love the food and the atmosphere. I recently went for the Tom Yum soup. Trust me this is the best Tom Yum soup in the city! They are generous on the shrimp portions and it has a spicier kick which I loved!!
I usually come here for the pad gra prow but now I'll have to order both platter on my future visits.
The service is excellent and the food is amazing!

One of the few Thai restaurants in Toronto that's comparable to Thailand. This place has some spots available for online reservations but they prefer taking walk ins. So we tried to get there a little earlier to bypass the line. 
We arrived at 7pm (prime dinner time) and the line up was already out the door. But surprisingly, we were seated pretty quickly; waited for about 10 minutes. The service was quick and attentive which is great for a super busy place.
If you like spicy, you'll love their spicy levels here. Most Thai place isn't spicy but PAI can definitely bring on the heat. 
Best dish was the Shrimp Pad Thai, great heat and flavours. I would prefer it more if the noodles weren't stuck together. The chicken skewers were moist and tender. Papaya Salad was fresh and great with the shrimp chips. The Pad Gra's crispy pork was a bit hard and chewy. It kind of reminded me of chinese bbq roasted pork left overnight. Khao Soy was very rice and creamy. And the Tom Yum was a tad salty for me. 
But overall, great flavours and service. I'd say this is closest to Thailand.

Top notch Thai restaurant in downtown Toronto. 
The pad Thai tastes very close to the ones on Bangkok streets. 
The place is always busy and the service is always fast and efficient. 
Nice interiors, courteous staff. 
Not a local but I come here on all my Toronto visits. 
Must go!!

One of my favorite places for Pad Thai. I personally think its the best in Toronto. The space is really cool and surprisingly large - they even have a lunch area where you can pick and choose different bases and sauces. 
My go-to is the Chicken Pad Thai with Spring Rolls. It's my favorite. The spring rolls have a great crunch and are filled with veggies and glass noodles and served with a sweet & spicy sauce. The Pad Thai is not overly sweet and you can taste the quality of the ingredients. 
I have eaten here a  number of times and will continue to eat here. 
Keep Eating,
Angela

I've been here a couple times and it's still consistently good! I brought some first timers here and they really enjoyed the food. 
Ordered the Pad Thai, Masaman braised beef curry, and Khao Pla Tawt. Of course we also had to order the Thai iced tea! Everything is fairly priced, maybe with the exception of the Thai iced tea (only because I think $5 is more than I expected for it) 
Would recommend everything that we ordered! It's usually really hard to find a Thai place that uses braised beef for their Masaman curry, which I find makes a difference, which is why I always order it when I come here. The beef is so soft and good. The same goes for the Pad Thai, taste is on point! This is the first time trying the Khao Pla Tawt but honestly we loved it too. The fish was fried but it was still moist AND the sauces that it comes with are so good (one sweet and one spicy). 
Will continue to come here and eat the delicious food!

Omg. The food is SO. GOOD. This was my first Thai food place - went with a group of people from work (like 30 of us, booked in advance). The service was great despite it being suuuuuuper busy on a Saturday night. Glad we had a reservation cuz there was a 30min wait outside. 
10/10 would recommend! Maybe go at an off-peak time if you don't want to wait.

My favourite thai restaurant in Toronto! Gra bong (fried squash), Tom yum soup, and stir fry morning glory are my favourite appetizers. If you have more people who would like to try the soup, I suggest ordering the dinner portion to share, it comes in a hot pot which is neat.  
Dinner favorites are the pad gra pow with crispy pork and green curry chicken/shrimp. Make sure to add the crispy pork if you're a fan, it is extra cost but it is definitely worth it. The green curry is served in a coconut and extra sauce in a side bowl. 
Dessert I like the mango sticky rice. And they serve a great selection of pretty cocktails and beers on tap. 
I do find over the years the size has gotten a bit smaller but it's still delicious.

Papaya salad was super tasty.  It is just the right amount of spice to get the sweat glands going :) had the beef kao soy and chicken green curry. Both were good but should probably ordered something different as both dishes were really creamy.  The reservations are booked months in advance so try to drop by before the rush hour to get a seat.  Will be back to have some more of the papaya salad.

Food was great. Both meat and vegetarian selections were fantastic. Staff were really nice and had great service. If you're coming from out of town, parking right outside of the restaurant was hard to find, but there is a parking garage around the corner.
Our order:
To start, we got the individual size of the Vegan Tom Yum, and an order of spring rolls. The Tom Yum was delicious and the spring rolls were great too. We also got the Pai Sangria and a Singha to drink. I personally like Singha, and it was exactly as expected. The sangria was really good as well. A bit sweet if you're not used to that level of  sweetness, but it's a sangria, so it's expected.
For mains, I got the Oxtail Gaeng Hunglay, and my wife got the Veggie Pad Thai. The oxtail was recommended to me by the staff and did not disappoint. The pad thai was great as well. Both were a fairly large quantity. Neither of us were able to finish the main courses, and got them packed. I found the rice that came with the Gaeng Hunglay wasn't enough for the amount of curry there was, but I had rice at home so it wasn't a problem. 
For desert we did the Coconut Sorbet. They warned us that it's a large portion, and they weren't wrong. I probably wouldn't get it again just because of the quantity, but the taste was definitely there.
We'll definitely be coming back to Pai!

Honestly, this restaurant made me have the shits. I had explosive diarrhoea and my bum itches a lot. Its been days since I had this food yet, my tummy still turns. I had the chicken fat Thai and peanut furry curry. I can bet on my last bottom dollar thats been creeping from the anus of the couch that I will never be returning. 
Stay safe,
Shreky Baby.

Came here for lunch on a Thursday about 12 noon.  The place was already packed.  Heard that this was a popular place.  I ordered the chicken Pad Thai mild.  It came served on a banana leaf on a plate.  Peanuts and cabbage salad were served on the side of the dish.  It had big slices of chicken.  It was delicious.  Probably will come back to try the other menu items like Thai fried rice.  If you are a group of six or more a 20% auto service charge will be added to your bill.  Read the fine print at the bottom of the menu.
At the back of the restaurant they have the Thai market. Here you can get one meat item & rice for $10.  No need to line up.

Best Thai food hands down!  Definitely one of the best thai food restaurants I have tried. 5 stars for quality of food, the vibe and the authenticity of the ambiance. 
Wait time:Came here on a weekday for an early dinner and still had to wait a good 25 minutes. The line was out the door and only grew longer as the time passed by. Try to make a reservation if possible. They will seat you in a waiting area where you can order drinks as well as appetizers before you are ready to be seated in the dining area.
Appetizers and drinks: Appetizers were some of the most delicious thai food I have ever had. 
Fried coconut shrimp: Quality shrimp that is lightly breaded in panko breadcrumbs and deep fried. When you bite into the shrimp, you can taste a hint of the coconut and other spices. The shrimp is fresh and soft. Definitely recommend this appetizer!
Satay Chicken: The meat is so tender and the peanut sauce that comes with it is not too heavy. Tastes great and I would probably try their chicken wings next time as well. 
Drinks: Ordered a Thai Mojito and a sake. I would probably skip on the mojito next time as it was pretty sugary. Sake pairs well with spicy food.
Main entrees:
The main entrees were also equally impressive. 
Thai (green) curry in Coconut: Really delicious curry and looks great as it is served warmed in a coconut. 
Stir fry ground beef with rice and fried egg: This was probably my favorite dish. Lots of different spices and flavours. Authentic thai food taste--I can't recommend this enough. 
Check this place out! They also sell shrimp chips by the bag for $5 dollars.

Ahh, the famous Pai! With almost 5 stars and over 1,000 reviews, you can't help but have high expectations. I don't really remember the names of the dishes, but hopefully you can connect two and two. Everything was quality made and the ingredients were fresh. 
Good
- The skewers were excellllent. Never had skewers done that way before. They were moist and tender and the flavour was subtle but very tasty. I would order this again in a heartbeat. 
- The sticky rice that came with each meal was really well done. 
- Beef salad was yummy. The cold salad mixed with the beef was a nice combination and the sauce had a bit of a kick but really complimented the dish.  Portion is not that large considering it's a salad, left with wanting more. 
- Thai milk tea was yummy but very sweet. I liked it but I had to water it down a little as it was very concentrated. 
- Presentation of the dishes felt very authentic and everything looked delicious. 
The Ok
- I ordered the main dish that has ground meat with a fried egg on top on a bed of rice. I was okay with this. Wasn't blown out of the water and it's unfair to compare, but I prefer the Vietnamese style of the rice/meat/egg combination. 
- I think it's my own bias, but I really did not enjoy the sausage appetizer. It was dry and the flavours were peculiar and not what I was used to. 
- We sat outside, but when we were waiting for a table, the interior was quite dark and cramped with tables and people almost touching each other. If you're able to, get on the patio with good weather. It's a great experience! 
All in all, really solid restaurant that gets packed in no time. My brother was sprinting to get the table we wanted and we had to have an early dinner at 5 pm. Shortly after that, the line spilled out into the streets with hungry patrons. Really recommended (but get a reservation). 4/5!
Very good experience, nice food, pleasant experience, definitely a come back. Nice service and ambiance
Good, authentic as usual.  Really like their green Thai curry. Staff is extremely friendly
Fantastic Thai food! Everything we ordered was really good! Great service and ambiance!!

They really should have a majority northern dishes if they want to be called a northern Thai restaurant. 
Way too many uninspired curries and phads all central Thai food and not great. 
The few northern bits like gai yang, Sai oua, and som tam isan are vary wildly in quality depending on who's in the kitchen. And this is the same for all of Regular's restaurants. During covid, they didn't even have sticky rice... At a northern Thai restaurant! Focus on one and do it well. Focus on the northern food and do it well. This city has far too many mcThai restaurants and its a shame to see from someone who's cookbook displays much for range and creativity. 
Toronto is ready for real northern Thai. Not slightly better versions of the same stuff that's been served since the 80s.

Pai was highly recommended by literally everyone in Toronto, and it was on our top of the list during our 7 day visit to Toronto. Pai served to its reputation. We dined at around 2pm for late lunch and luckily there was no wait although the restaurant was packed. We were excited about this underground, funky, hip atmosphere. We ordered khao soi with braised beef and tofu pad thai. Thai ice tea was tasty. 
Service was okay. Our server seemed nice but spent little time interacting with us. Food took a long time, about 25 -30 minutes, to come out. Bathroom was spacious and clean. 
Food was delicious nevertheless. Khao soi with braised beef was rich in flavor. Noodles were perfectly cooked, probably housemade. Beef was tender. It was mouthwatering. Pad thai was good but we should have ordered something else. It was good and definitely better than many other thai restaurants, but it was comparable with others. Tofu was too soft, which made overall dish's texture less interesting. 
Overall, we had a great meal and wish to come back soon and try other dishes on the menu.

Great food and amazing ambiance. However, despite being seated just after 5pm, many "only available after 4pm" dishes were unavailable. Some dishes are also a bit pricey, but seemingly well worth for the quality.

This place makes some of the best pad Thai hands down! 
The wait is quiet lengthy most times, but if you can wait, the reward is real! While you wait, you're given a button that will flash once your turn is up to get a table. Also while you wait, you can order drinks and snacks which will then get added to your table. 
This place is much larger than it appears from the entry. It has also a couple of traditional seating arrangements where you take off your shoes and sit on a carpet with a low table.

My go-to dish here is the pork Pad Gra Prow which is described as "Holy basil stir fried with your choice of ground Pork, Chicken, Beef or Tofu served on steamed jasmine rice and topped with a thai style fried egg. (contains oyster sauce) Served with nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chili & lime)."
The ground pork has a really great balance of sweet and savoury and tastes more like crumbled sausage than typical ground pork. Breaking the egg yolk over everything, but especially the rice, levels up the dish even further adding creaminess and bulk. Just when you thought it couldn't get any better, splash some of the fish sauce over everything, to up the complexity and umami flavors even further. I've also tried the crispy pork version (pictured, $2 up charge) which has small chunks of Filipino-style lechon mixed in with the regular pork.
But wait...there's more...their homemade hot sauce is so good I might just marry it. It's oil-based and has some dried-up strands of something or other (maybe shrimp?) along with spices that ups your already delicious food that much further. 
Usually get take out but the decor is fun and chill and makes you feel like you're in some neighbourhood bar in the Southeast Pacific. Pro-tip: if you're getting take out, head straight to the back near the kitchen and order from the little booth.
Closest subway station is St. Andrew which is less than 5 minutes walk away.
The *only* reason this place gets 4 stars vs. 5 is the price. At almost $17, even at lunch, the Pad Gra Prow is something I can  afford once and awhile rather than something I'd get more regularly if I worked or lived downtown.

Found this place through google reviews.  I came here on a Thursday night casually after work to eat dinner.  This place was packed.  This is a very cool hipster Thai place. The focused is northern Thai food with a sweeter taste. They do have a full bar as well. 
Food: ordered the Thai wings, starter the Tom yum soup, and the pad gra pro with crispy pork.  IThe Thai wings were amazing.  Very Crispy and tasty. However, the portion size was just sad. You get 3 pieces for $6... the starter Tom yum was okay.  It was cold the first time and I had to send it back to get a hot one.  It was a very tasty soup.  The pad gra gro with beef rice was amazing.  The sunny side egg was cooked to perfection. I squeezed a bit of lime to bring the flavor out more. I ended the dinner with a Thai ice cream.  It was very well balanced and not as sweet as the Thai iced tea. It was creamy as well.  (4/5) 
Service: I sat at the bar and the bartender was phenomenal.  He gave me recommendations and quickly served me water.   He was pretty attentive. (4/5)
Atmosphere: the place is a bit deceiving in size. It looks small but it seems like it can easily sit about 60-70 people.  It is very hipster and loud. It is pretty chill place to hang out and have a great dinner with friends.  (4.5/5)
Overall I am going to come back here with friends to enjoy drinks and dinner.  They got some pretty creative drinks.

It was our first visit. The place was crazy busy, lineups straight out the door! Reservations cannot be made over the phone, you have to go in person and wait to be seated and/or put your name down on a waitlist to be contacted. We waited an hour to be called over. In the meantime, went across the street and sat in a coffee shop.
The food was good although I was quite disappointed with only 5 pieces of shrimp in a dish that cost $18. Hmm. Really? Understandable that seafood is pricey but don't be stingy and charge extra and not provide sufficient amounts! Something to consider.. I was deprived of adequate protein.
We also ordered an appy that never came. Our main dishes arrived with no appetizer in sight. Flagged down a server to cancel that order.
If I ever go back, I'll try the khao soi.
Giving the resturant 4* because service was decent given the fact that staff were running around trying to attend to diners and the place was clean.

We came on a Saturday for lunch around 12pm and surprisingly had no wait. 
I ordered a Khao Soi with beef and it was marvelous. I visited Chiang Mai back in 2013 and this dish really brings me back to the cuisines there. It's very authentic and one of my favorite dishes I had in Thailand. One thing that I love about this dish is that it has a mix of crunchy and egg noodles. Really changes the texture you feel compared to a typical noodle dish. The beef is quite tender and the golden curry is extremely flavorful. 
The seating here was a bit cramped cause the table was right up against a wooden support. Try to avoid that seat if you can!

Not exactly sure what the hype was about.  The restaurant really feels more like a bar that serves food than a serious Thai place.  On a Monday night the place was full of hipsters and millennials which in and of itself isn't bad as long the food is up to snuff.  
Looking at the menu I was really looking forward to the Tom yum soup but it was way too over powering on the lemongrass and spice for my liking so by comparison the thai wings seemed a bit bland.  My entree rice dish, the name escapes me now, was average and not very memorable.  I think the reason why it has such a high number of reviews is because it caters to said millennial crowd who perhaps hasn't had too many life experiences to know that this is grossly over priced.
Find a Thai place in an ethnic neighborhood instead.  You'll pay half as much for something twice as good.

I finally understand what all the buzz is about! I went here to grab some food for Mother's Day, and I'm so happy I did.
Lots of people waiting for their orders but the process is super thorough so it's not an unpleasant experience. You order online on their website and receive a time to pick-up. When you arrive they have an electronic screen with order names on it,  they also call out your name if it's ready. Super painless and efficient.
I ordered the tum yum soup appetizer, chicken pad thai, Massaman beef curry, and chicken panang curry. Everything was delicious. Other reviews were right to highlight how delicious the pad Thai and curries are. The spice level I chose was "medium" and it was just perfect. Could have done it a bit spicier but didn't want to chance it this time around.
The portions are not large but good for two people. It's definitely packed with flavour so you're paying for quality - not quantity. Definitely worth the higher end of prices for the tastiness of the food.
Highly recommend!
Great ambience, good food and competitive pricing. Worth a try if you are in downtown.

We only tried out Pai once, but our first experience was great! Very friendly customer service and the restaurant interior reflects a rustic-patio vibe - very cool. We tried the "Khao Soi" dish, which is probably the most popular - so good!! Highly recommend, with the golden curry and braised beef [or choice of chicken breast/drumstick]. The "Thai Iced Tea" ($5.75) is also a classic on the menu, a signature Thai drink and it was delicious! Highly recommend Pai for great Thai food!
Tip: head to Pai early, we've seen the lines get pretty long after work hours (past 5PM)!
PAI is my favourite Thai place in toronto. They are the best panacean curry!! and their restaurant interior also looks very cute.
Definately one of the best thai places in the city. This is place is a must if your looking for a thai restaurant in Toronto.

What can I say? It's only our favorite Thai restaurant of ALL TIME. Okay we haven't been to Thailand, but compared to other Thai restaurants we've tried in Asia, NA, Europe, Chef Nuit's Pad Thai is a distinct winner. Other dishes such as Pad Gra Prow, Curries, Spring Roll, and Tom Yum do not disappoint; I can't say I've regretted ordering anything at Pai. (share the same roots/chef as the original Sukho Thai I think...) Their Yonge and Eg location is awesome, too. The decor and ambiance is actually a step up!

This place made me feel like I was back on the streets of Chiang Mai again. The Ambiance is just spot-on! It's such a fun, lively atmosphere and the space is huge! You think you're seeing all of it but it goes back quite a ways.   
The food is also very authentic. We had the fried squash blossoms, which was an enormous amount of very crispy delicious fritters, and a picture of lychee sangria to start. The sangria was very good and I particularly enjoyed the exotic fruit flavors. For our entrees, we had the green curry served in a coconut and  and the Pad Gra Pow. We got the Pad Grab Pow Thai spicy and it definitely seriously spicy. My husband loved it but I struggled. It was delicious though. 
I thought the prices were a little bit high for food was delicious, but simple. But we are in the middle of a city so a little inflation is to be expected.
Excellent Thai cuisine. We ordered to go and the food was prepared exactly as ordered & in a timely manner. We will be going again. Solid A

I enjoy the atmosphere and the food here. There's always a line up but if you make a reservation you don't have to wait long. Small groups can share a table and you can be seated faster if you forget to reserve a table. 
I usually get vegan khao soi for myself. The flavour is good but not always consistent. Sometimes the sauce is too thick and other times it's too runny. Overall things are good and I'll visit again.

In terms of Thai food, Pai meets the mark above any other place I've heard of or been to for Thai cuisine.
Atmosphere: 8/10
Entering through glass doors, you walk down stairs to what looks like a modern speakeasy. You are greeted by the hostess and luckily we were promptly brought to a table (a wait is very common even on most weeknights).In the case you do wait, on the left side once you enter there's a bar area with some sitting space to sip a curated cocktail. In the evening the resto is dim lit and all through out the large space it is filled with musical memorabilia on the walls to entice the wandering eye. Though the space is pretty large I don't remember it being very noisy, which is conducive for easy conversation.  
Service: 7.5/10
After being seated a server comes over and asks us if it's our first time dining, for me it was, and I was excited to begin our adventure. The server was helpful in showing us some enticing options on the menu though the friends who brought me pretty much knew what the top choices to order was. 
Food: 8.5/10
For Thai food, Pai is a cut above most others that try to compare. Here is what we had...
1. Northern Thai Sausage 7.5/10
This was different than most sausage i've tried before, with a great savoury taste, this dish is a nice app to share. The sticky rice fits well with it. Probably my least favourite, though it was still good. 
2. Grabong (squash fritters) 8/10
For an alt take on fries, you can't go wrong with these. Paired with the Tamarind dip these are a delicious starter to open your palate to everything else Pai has to offer. 
3. Khao Soi (8/10) 
This dish gives you great flavour with contrasting textures of the braised beef (you can also choose chicken breast or drumstick), curry broth and fresh egg noodle that had the end part deep fried and sticks out of the bowl. Not incredibly spicy but definitely gives a power pack of flavour for your taste buds to delight in. 
4. Green Curry chicken served in coconut (8.5/10)
This is certainly the dish people pilgrimage to Pai for. The idea that serving a curry with meat in a coconut bowl is genius, as it's able to soak up all the coconut flavour and then allow you after to scoop out the juicy flesh of the coconut. This was my favourite dish to try that evening and I highly suggest you order it when you go. 
5. Pad Thai (8/10) 
This thai pasta dish surpasses most pad thai's out there. Noodles were fresh and the sauce was the boss of this dish! Enjoyed every single bite. If you want a familiar taste of thai food, go for this dish. 
Verdict is in and Pai is guilty...... 
of being one of the best Thai resto's in the city! Expect a good time and great food to boot! I can't wait to go back again, and again, and again....and again.....

Delicious food, variety of cocktails/drinks to try and great casual ambiance. Staff are very friendly and this place is quite popular so expect to wait during rush hour times (they have buzzers) or prepare for time in advance. Personally, my wait wasn't so bad (~10 minutes at 5:30PM- was I lucky? Who knows.) 
Side note- they have a bit of We the North theme going on as well. There's a bar and dining area. Seating is larger than what you originally see (there's more seating are past a small hallway).
For food we tried: the Grabong (a great app to share with a group of friends/personal staple app; sauce is sweet and complements it), Moo Ping (3 skewers of nicely marinated, chewy/fatty pork) and the Kung Tawt (fried shrimps with a sauce to dip).
For mains we tried the Khai Soi (AMAZING. Highly recommend. Personally, I prefer the chicken over beef, but the beef is nice big chunks if that's your preferred meat); and the Pad Thai (delicious, as you expect with pad thai).
For cocktails we've tried the Thai Mojito, Summer Dog and Plum Mule. I definitely need to come back and try their lychee sangria. Thai iced tea is always a good option if you don't want alcohol. 
For dessert I tried the mango sticky rice. Simple and delicious but pricier than expected (10$!!). Make sure you ask what the prices are because the dessert options aren't on the menu.
I foresee multiple trips to this location and I'll just work my way around everything on the menu or simply to come back for some Khao Soi.
It's crazy I was in Malibu (Cali) at a high end sushi place and the server said the best Thai place in Toronto issss....Pai...and we all agreed hahaha.

Even though the wait times for dinner are usually quite long, this place never disappoints. It's got great authentic thai food and flavor, plus it's a great place to meet up with friends after work in the entertainment district. Expect to wait for about 30 minutes when you get here during prime dinner time, but I think the wait is worth it. It's quite loud and not very accessible. Over the years, they've downsized some portions (especially the coconut curry, which used to be a large coconut). It's a very trendy and fun place for a date too.

I had Green curry and Pad Thai. 
Both were superb with presentation and taste. 
Thai ice tea was average.
Green Curry is served in coconut shell.
I removed star for wait time and service.

We went on a Thursday night around 9:15 pm and the place was packed. They have a happening bar area. The decor inside is trendy. 
Nice cocktail and beer list. Cool mule was refreshing. Lots of vegetarian options. The taste is where all the stars are worth. Service for a busy time was efficient. Ask for the hot sauce it's so spicy. 
Pad gra prow with tofu and a fried egg was tasty as hell. The pad cha hett was equally tasty with the veggies and mushrooms. The gaeng panang was flavorful and a safe dish one can't go wrong with. 
A must visit if you want Thai cuisine right in downtown Toronto.

Why have I not written a review for Pai yet! Let me hop on that bandwagon and get in on that hype. 
Discretion: My review is entirely based on the food alone since I have never dined in. I cannot comment on the service. 
Needless to say, Pai is amazing. I have had it multiple times (doesn't help that we live literally right above it), and they have been consistent every single time. There's no one experience that fell short for us. I have never actually dined in yet, since the line is ridiculous and I live right by it, but ritual/take out never failed once. It is probably one of the best thai restaurants, if not, the best one so far in Toronto.  
Food wise, I think most of us would agree that this place serves delicious authentic thai food. Having been to both northern and southern Thailand, the food at Pai is as authentic as can be (but obviously at a much more inflated price, which is understood). 
THAI CHICKEN WINGS - juicy plump wings and very well seasoned. A great starter! 
GAI SATAY - can never go wrong with satay. 
LAAP SALAD - the minced pork is marinated very well. It is a very nicely paired dish with the sticky rice. And there's something in her sticky rice that is quite addictive. 
PANANG BEEF CURRY - no complaints, absolutely delicious. 
PAD GRA PROW - One of my go-tos. It hits the spot every time. The rice is delicious, the minced beef is so well-seasoned. The combo is a killer, and I love it! 
KHAO SOI - Hat off to the authenticity of this dish. It tastes exactly the same as the ones I've had in Changmai. The only one complaint I have is that there isn't enough egg noodles!  The coconut milk in the curry makes the soup so incredibly addictive. 
CHEF NUIT PAD THAI - also one of their staples. There is a very good balance with the tanginess and sweetness in the sauce. The noodles are stir-fried just enough that it is not too dry nor too wet. It is really so so good! 
Pai nails every dish every time even on our take out orders. This is a restaurant that I recommend to all my friends who are visiting from out of town. Keep up the great work Pai!

I've come to Pai a handful of times seeking something flavourful, and my tastebuds have never left unsatisfied!
The wait time to get a table can be long, especially during lunch and dinner time. We got here at 5:30 pm on a Saturday and waited about 30 minutes. By the time we left at 7:30 pm, the wait time was over an hour long! So definitely get here early. While waiting, you get a buzzer, so you're free to get a drink at the bar or get some much-needed fresh air without losing your spot in line.
Although the wait time can be long, the food definitely makes up for it! We started with the Moo Ping, which is grilled pork skewers--although small, they were absolutely delicious! I had the Gang Kiaw Wan, which is green curry served in a coconut. Not going to lie, I did get this dish pretty much because it was served in a coconut, but the food definitely tasted as good as it looked! Although it was medium spice, it wasn't too much to handle. The curry's sweetness and the rice definitely helped with the spiciness!
Other than the long lines, my only complaint would be the service, especially during busy times. Our server basically disappeared after almost taking our orders. Thankfully the bartender was attentive, and stepped in to take our orders and bring us the bills when we were getting restless!
All in all, I would definitely recommend a visit to Pai. They serve some of the best Thai food you can get in the city, however be sure to leave enough time for the wait!

We made a reservation about a month ago for 8pm on January 3rd, and my date and I got the following:
-Gai Satay
-Starter Tom Yum Shrimp
-Gaeng Masaman
-Pad Thai
-Thai Ice Tea
-Thai Ice Tea Ice Cream
And what can I say. . . They were all so good! We had high expectations of the place, but we were not disappointed.
Gai Satay:
The chicken skewers were tender, and the cucumber dressing complimented the skewers really well. I'm a HUGE fan of peanut sauce, and I have to admit that their peanut sauce was really good with a nice kick to it. But we enjoyed the cucumber dressing more. I also found that the peanut sauce went well with the skewers more, once the dish got cold.
Tom Yum:
Top 3 Tom Yum I've had in my life. The other comparable one was in Japan. It was perfect.
Gaeng Masaman (Chicken):
My date ordered it so I only had a few bites. Well. . . it may have been more than a few bites because they were gooooooooood!
Pad Thai (Beef):
I'm not sure if I should even bother writing a review for this because everyone knows how amazing their Pad Thai is. This might have been the best Pad Thai that I've ever had.
Thai Ice Tea:
They were really good but GET IT WITH LESS ICE. When I asked for a tiny bit of ice, they gave me the perfect amount.
I love Thai Ice Tea. Many of you would probably disagree, but it almost tastes like Kinder Egg Milk Tea.
Thai Ice Tea Ice Cream:
They were exactly as I imagined it to be but creamier. And the tapioca complimented the ice cream well. The peanuts and cereal added a nice crunch to the dish as well. It was a good amount to share.
Service: The waiters and waitresses were really nice, but the service itself was unremarkable. They were busy, but they didn't come to fill our cups once. However, when we needed something, they were prompt and attentive.
Needless to say, I would definitely come back here again to try the Green Curry and Spring Rolls. But I don't know. . . I feel like I would want to order the same thing over again. :P
If you can get a table here, definitely recommended. Quality Thai dishes made fresh. Very busy.

Still my favourite Thai place in Toronto! 
Ordered the following:
1. Sai Ua Platter: 10/10 (Northern Thai): Homemade Pork belly sausages served with sticky rice. The sausages were so flavourful & the tomato relish was bomb! 
2. Green Curry w/ Shrimp: 10/10. Good amount of spice and curry. Comes with a bowl of rice. Can't go wrong with this dish! 
3. Beef Khao Soi: 10/10. The curry was SO DELICIOUS. Beef was nice and tender. Good amount of noodles to go with the curry. Would definitely order this again
4. Mango rice (dessert): 10/10. Half a mango sliced on top of glazed coconut milk sticky rice. DELICIOUS!!!!! Great way to end.

I tried the pad thai and it was pathetic. Never going back again. It had a lot of cabbage and wasn't made fresh. Totally disappointed as I went there first time with high hopes after reading the review.
Honestly there are many better Thai restaurants in Toronto. I feel like Pie's food is usually really greasy/oily, and the flavour isn't as good as the competitors. I love the Thai ice tea tho.

First of all, an emphasis that the food by itself is 5-star quality. I have no idea what magical ingredients or spices they put in their soup/curry/noodles, but it's absolutely delicious. I also really enjoyed the vibe of the place - the decorations were on the hippie side, down to the tables and chairs and the washrooms. Reservations can be made easily online, a huge plus in my opinion (especially downtown...).
The stars I took off were for service alone. We went there on a Monday afternoon at 2pm, and the restaurant was half empty. So I really cannot understand why our waitress seemed to be in such a hurry to get us out of the place. 5 minutes after I received the menu, she came up to ask for orders - of course, we said that we needed more time. She gave us another 5 minutes, then came again! We asked for more time.
On the other hand, it took us multiple tries to get our water glasses refilled. Please understand that this was pretty annoying since the food could get quite spicy and water is sort of a necessity. Then, as soon as my bowl was empty, the waitress (the same waitress who disappeared throughout the rest of our meal), materialized and asked if we would like our bills. Needless to say, we were not greeted on our way out.
Damnit, Pai! I really wanted to give you a high rating after salivating over all the pictures here.

A 4 day trip and I went there twice! That, is quite unusual for me to do so. The place reminded me of wandering through the busy streets of Bangkok and ending up in an underground authentic Thai spot! 
The place has a great contemporary vibe with an in-depth authentic flavors of Thai food. Their spring rolls and Pad Thai are to die for! The spices, quantity, quality is pretty spot on! 
A perfect place to go , especially in the bitter cold winter times of Toronto!

Rating: 3 1/2*
I finally made it here after having this restaurant bookmarked for the longest time. I was always intrigued with the outstanding reviews and wanting to learn more about Thai cuisine. 
We came here right after they opened at 11:30am on a Saturday. We were a party of three. 
I'll format this review based on the title of one of my favourite Western movies. 
The Good: 
I like the decor of the restaurant and the actual location. The way the restaurant is set up with the tables, the decorations and being in a basement, helps convey the feeling that you are somewhere in Southeast Asia. The restaurant is divided into a "Kitchen" and "Market" sections. The Kitchen section is the restaurant part. 
The washrooms are nice and clean although the Ladies one was out of service and you needed to go to the Market section. 
Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Shrimps at a falang spicy level was a great dish. The noodles were cooked right, there were a proper amount of shrimps and the spice level was appropriate. I like you can adjust the spice level in this dish. The Falang is the second spiciest with the Thai being the first. Also, you can order the Pad Thai with beef, pork, chicken or tofu if you want. 
The Bad:
The service was a bit lacking. The initial table that the hostess gave us was not convenient for us and we requested a different table as the restaurant was fairly empty at the time. She was not impressed and wouldn't let us sit at the back. We ended up sitting at the table right as you come down the stairs. Our initial waiter was good but after he took our order, he disappeared and we got different people serving us until we left. 
The Gaeng Klaw Wan with chicken dish was a bit disappointing. They state that the dish comes in a mild/medium spice level. It was a bit bland for us. The presentation was cute as the curry was served in a coconut. 
The prices are on the high side. Some of the dishes are not worth what they are charging for. 
The Ugly: 
Khao Pad Thamada with chicken dish which is basically a stir fried rice was not very good. The dish was so bland with no hint of seasoning or spice. I had better fried rice in a Chinese restaurant at a much lower price. 
Overall, it was an above average experience but I highly doubt that we be coming back to this place again.
#39 of 2018

Finally got to try out Pai! Super late review tho, oops. I came by party of 4 on a Sat afternoon to grab lunch. A lot of people told me it gets really busy and it did looked a little packed but wasn't too bad. Lively and upbeat place! Didn't have to wait long maybe like 6 mins. Got seated on one of the high tables on the side near the low cushioned seats. Spacious enough for 4 people. 
I ordered the khao soi and this was good but it was a little on the cool side imo. My friend also said the same for his bowl as well. Was creamy and brothy. They were generous with my chicken protein. 
The pad thai was prob one of the best I've tried. 
I really enjoyed the thai iced tea. I've been craving for one ever since!
As an app to share, we ordered the garbong? Don't know if I spent this right but it's basically squash fritters. Tastes like sweet potato fries to me but this was really good and I would order this again. The sauce that came with it was a perfect match.
I would come back again!

Another solid Thai restaurant. However since they all seem to have almost the same menu everywhere in these new spots (and similar taste) not sure how to rate these anymore. This is a much better setup than the other offerings. I mainly stick to either the Pad Thai or Khao Soi with beef. They are good as always and I also appreciate that they have Delerium Tremens beer which goes well with the food. The wine prices are decent as well.
3.5 stars as its a given that most of these Thai food places taste the same.

There was a loooong line out the door. But do not let that deter you! Line goes pretty fast surprisingly. It's all worth the wait!! Had the crispy garlic shrimp appetizer. It was super delicious!! Scarfed that down and decided to do the veggie pad Thai. I know sounds boring but it was possibly the Best Pad Thai ever! Noodles were perfectly done with great flavor as well.
While enjoying the pad Thai I decided to have another dish since I won't be able to come back again on this trip. I should have taken the servers recommendation for the ga prow. Instead I opted for the oxtail. The meat was super tender. However it was a tad sweet for me. Should have listened to the previous review. The set up of the restaurant is pretty neat!
All in all it was a great meal and definitely recommend.

DELICIOUS THAI FOOD. We were so excited we literally planned the night before to make sure got everything we wanted including the delicious pad thai (two orders) and khao soi and the delectable Thai chicken wings (two orders). There are three wings per order fyi. The entree portions are generous! The khao soi was very rich, so I wouldn't like to have *just that* so the balance was wonderful to achieve with sharing the dish and sharing pad thai as well. The noodles are perfect thickness, and the curry so yummy. You'd think pad thai would be a basic order, but the noodles here are excellent, and the seasoning was on point without being too sweet. Call ahead to make a reservation because this place is well-known!

I got the chicken peanut pad Thai it was tasty but feel like it should have vegetables. It's really important for a dish to have variety besides noodles and meat. It add some colour and texture to the dish.

The experience was the complete opposite of my expectations. Was imagining a quiet, fancy-ish authetic Thai establishment with mindblowing food.
There's a patio but the inside of the restaurant is like a basement, loud music and dark, quite westernized. The whole vibe is very casual, all the servers are wearing their summer clothes aka cargo shorts and runners.
Menu prices are very steep, around $16-18 for a main. We got the Chiang Mai Beef Noodles and Chicken Drumstick Khao Soi, both less than averag even when price is not factored in. Both proteins were dry...never had dry dark chicken meat before. Beef noodles definitely had a larger profile of flavours and was mildly spicy. Khao Soi was the reason we came and it was a disappointment. Didn't like the noodles and the bowl seemed quite boring, just noodles after noodles in curry.
Service: There were a lot of staff but yet hard to get anyone's attention. Had to wait a couple mins before one server came over so that we could tell him our order was wrong.

If youre looking for an intimate & quiet place, this is not the restaurant for you. It's always pretty packed in here. They give you a BUZZER and you wait for your table. 
However, if the noise doesnt bother you - you'll get authentic thai food here.
Ordered the following:
chicken pad thai ($16.50)
Khao Pla Tawt - a.k.a Crispy fish fillet with rice ($16) lol 
Thai iced tea ($5.75)
The flavours did not disappoint!!!
The only downside with this is the LACK OF STAFF. Considering the amount of people that come & go in this place, I expect more staffs. It usually takes time to catch the attention of the staffs to ask or request for things...
But other than that, I'll still go back for the food.

How the hell does this place get 4.5? Ok i get that the decor is nice and service is good. But the food though. I got green curry and it's not even spicy??? Like how is this Thai food. More like white people's Thai food

Food: 4.0/5.0
Service: 1.0/5.0
Value: 3.0/5.0
Decor: 3.0/5.0
Overall: 3.5/5.0
Pretty long wait on a weekday late evening.  The food was actually pretty good when it was served right, so I'm really aggressively ignoring the all-over-the-place service in giving these guys the 4th star.  It was a busy night, but still, the water was super slow to arrive (the young lady covering our table spent maybe a third of her time chatting with a colleague), and one of the entrees arrived cold (assuming it sat somewhere for a while).  As I write this review, I regret not leaving a smaller tip.

I think they have the best Thai food in Toronto.
They own a bunch of the other restaurants in the city.
Papaya salad is super refreshing. The fried pork rinds and prawn chips that come with it are are super yummy.
Khao Soi with braised beef has depths of flavour. The braised beef is very tender.
Pad Gra Prow with pork belly is bomb as usual. Fragrant basil with crispy pork belly. Fried egg on top.
I would recommend going right when they open for lunch at 11:30am. It fills up fast.

Came here for an early dinner on a weekday; be warned, it gets really packed because the food is DANGEROUSLY GOOD! The best authentic Thai food that I've had in Toronto!
I would actually give Pai a 4.5/5, only due to the slow service. The restaurant itself seats lots of people and does not have too many servers, so the service is actually quite slow (but still everyone was extremely nice and friendly). We got seated right away and did not need to wait the line since we were okay with a communal table, which was actually enjoyable since they separate your party and the party next to you by leaving an empty seat. 
We ordered the Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Chicken! It was so packed with flavour and the portion size was really good. It was a nice blend of both sweet and savoury, with the perfect amount of peanuts and coriander. 
I'm excited to come back soon to try more food from their menu!

If you want to dine in and experience an explosion of flavour - this is the place to be! Try their famous Chef Nuit's Pad Thai and Pad Gra Prow which is my personal favorite  for starters, get the Shrimp Chips! The ambience on both branches also are super hip, you can go to this place for pretty much whatever dining purpose - casual dinner to date place. Unpretentious and worth every penny!

I came here on a Monday as a group of four for lunch. By the time I arrived, my friends had already gotten a table so I didn't have to wait.
Pai is huge! If you get seated in one of the rooms in the back, it's like walking through a maze to get to your table. This time we were seated in the room to the left of the entrance and bar and there was a lot of natural lighting that came in. Even though it was a weekday and during lunch time, it was still quite busy and there was a good amount of chatter in the air. I love that the restaurant is so big, has a casual vibe to it, and is decorated nicely with cool paintings on the walls. They also had coat racks and hooks for jackets which is great for the winter time. 
The service was quite good as our waitress talked about the menu and the daily specials. I ordered the khao soi and it was delicious. It was also plated very nicely with crispy noodles coming out of the bowl, and had a bright orange colour to it. I really enjoyed the egg noodles as they were cooked just right and were chewy but soft from the broth. The dishes are a little on the pricier side but they make it up for flavour and lots of ingredients in the dishes. 
Overall, I enjoy coming to Pai as it's in a great location in the downtown core, has a great casual vibe to come and hang in with friends, and a simple menu with great tasting dishes. Will be back when I have a Thai craving!

Flavoured pad thai dish
clean light taste and crsipy texture of the vegetable fibers
Good for lunch

My favorite restaurant in Toronto. My go to order is the raw papaya salad, pad Thai (obviously), the fried fish with rice and curry and of course I'd recommend anything from their dessert selection. I've been here so many times and the experience every one of those times has been nothing short of exceptional. I highly recommend for all Thai food lovers!

I've been here 4 times, and have tried the squash fritters (amazing!), classic pad Thai (also great), the green curry (it comes in a coconut and you can eat the coconut meat!), and the Miang Kung (betel leaf wraps, good low carb/paleo option). 
I love coming here with friends but be warned of the long waits (45-60min) during peak times around 7pm.

Pai hits the mark for me for authentic Thai food in the heart of Toronto. Located near the entertainment district, Pai is inside a basement and well renovated. A unique design and tight seating, it does give you a bit of a unique Asian feel.
We arrived on a Saturday evening with a long line ahead of us. We told the host we'd be happy to sit at the bar or sit with others (basically we'd sit anywhere). Originally indicated we had a 1.5 hour wait ahead of us, he managed to fit us in a smaller spot within 10 minutes! 
Food itself is meets my expectations. We particularly enjoyed the Khao Soi with the soup being flavourful and the noodles fresh. The Thai iced tea is also a must try if you're at Pai. Service will probably seem a bit rushed but that's because they always have a lineup!
Overall, I'd visit again and put Pai at the top of my list for Thai restaurants in the city.
Best Thai restaurant in Toronto. The Khao Soi is so rich and divine. There are different styles of Pad Thai. And the vibe is like a backpack or hangout in Thailand.

Even though there was a wait of about 30 minutes it was totally worth it! The appetizers as well as the entrees were absolutely delicious. The overall atmosphere was very chill and hip. Since the restaurant was quiet crowded the servers were buisy but very kind nonetheless. 
I recommend the Grabong for starters and the Panang as an entree! Delicious!

We'd heard great things about this place a long time ago so tried to make a reservation... We were shocked that we could only reserve for 6 weeks or something in the future. "Must really be popular!" When, 6 weeks hence, we finally went, we realized (duh) that this place clearly only allows reservations for 1-2 tables, and everything else is drop in, wait and enjoy the vibe.
We smartened up our second time, showed up and waited in the waiting corral/bar with an interesting IPA we'd never tried before and our little flash 'em device that would alert us when our table was ready. Our flash 'em never flashed and when I asked the hostess what was going on, it was clear we'd been missed on their list, or whatever. No matter, she got a table for us and we sat down. The crowd is young and having fun here, the key is to just go with the flow. 
The food is excellent! Make sure you get the tom yum! The green curry in the coconut is also amazing, don't forget to scoop the innards.

My boyfriend and I stopped by here before the Raptors game last Sunday at around 4:30PM. We didn't have a reservation but managed to get a table right away. The restaurant was still around 80% full during this time, which I was expecting considering what a popular place it is to eat in Downtown! 
We ended up ordering the Thai iced tea ($5.75), Khao Soi with beef brisket ($15), the Chicken Satay Skewers ($14).
Thai iced tea: Price was a bit steep for what it was but I totally changed my mind after taking my first sip. This was SO delicious and refreshing!! I could not stop drinking it and I almost wanted to get another order of this. The drink was the perfect ratio of black tea, condensed milk and ice. Very refreshing and I highly recommend giving this a try if you enjoy bubbletea/iced tea in general. 
Khao Soi: This was quite yummy -- beef was perfectly cooked and the crunchy noodles added a nice texture with the soup noodles. The curry-based broth was delicious and I wanted to slurp this all up.
Chicken Satay Skewers: These were tasty as well and great for sharing but for the size and portion it felt a bit steep for $14. I probably wouldn't get this the next time I come here.
Service was very attentive and friendly. The restaurant is quite loud as many large groups come here to socialize and hang out. I suggest making a reservation or coming during off-peak times so that you don't have to wait forever for a table.

As an asian, i tried many Thai restaurant. This one is definitely a good one to start if you are new to this cuisine. The dish seems a bit little for me though compare to its price. But the flavor is good.
Dishes are delicious and full of flavour; their spices blend very nicely with their coconut concoctions to create a very savoury after-taste that comparatively as pleasant as the smell
The price is so good for the food quality, definitely will come back! Beware that the place is usually full, so if you are looking for a quiet place, this is not what you are looking for

I've been wanting to try this place in years. I guess I had too high of expectations given their price and popularity. 
Grabong - This was probably the best thing on the menu. Very hot, crispy, and perfect for sharing! However I would say it's a little heavy for an appetizer - best for groups of 4+.
For mains we ordered Khao Soi, Pad Gra Prow, Gang Kiaw Wan, and Tom Yum Kung. The food was okay, but nothing really special in my opinion. Everything except for the Tom Yum Kung was a little too sweet for my liking. 
I honestly was expecting a lot more.

One of the best Thai restaurants in Toronto! There are always lineups, especially during dinner hours and on weekends. Food is amazing - pad thai, papaya salad, pad gra prow, curries in coconut shell. It's one of the few places that serves fresh coconut water that doesn't come from a can.

Finally had the chance to try out PAI in downtown Toronto! Have heard really good review of this place from tons of friends so I decided to come and try out!
I made reservation couple months ago because they're always fully booked and if you come walk in, good luck in waiting for hours to get a table cuz this place is PACKED!! However, they're so considerate that having a corner for you to sit and grab a drink while waiting which is pretty nice during this winter time 
Their service was good in general, from the moment I came until leaving the restaurant, all the staffs are nice and polite! 
We ordered Som Tum Tad (papaya salad) with salted crab for starter, it was quite a bit too spicy for me considering I don't have a high tolerance in spicy food  although we only ordered medium spicy...but honestly the salad is really good other than the fact that is spicy and the crab itself is too little in portion so I'd recommend getting shrimp than crab in this dish 
Next, I ordered Khao Soi with braised beef cuz I've seen good reviews of this dish on yelp so I had a pretty high expectation for it. I'm not sure if I had my expectation too high, the soup base is too sweet for me personally...that's something I was disappointed about  but the noodles was chewy and not mushy, and I think they fried some noodles and have it on the side which gives me an interesting texture when eating everything in a bit with a little bit of crunchiness 
My overall experience here is nice and I would wanna come again and try their curry and pad Thai
Oh! And just a heads up for their portion is slightly smaller than other restaurant that you normally go to so one starter and two mains would be good for two person if you didn't eat anything before dinner
Ambiance is great, fun and friendly staff, amazing food. Great cocktails and perfect atmosphere.

Authentic and traditional Thai cuisine!!! We ordered the pad Thai and it was delicious, the butternut squash appetizer was very good and it didn't taste greasy even if it was fried. The only problem we had was the veggie stir fry I ordered was cold and they brought another one and it was still cold. However, everything I tried was incredible. It was like taking a trip to eat in Thailand for the night.

It was alright. Went in here for lunch service and ordered the Khao soi.  I knew all the hype surrounding this restaurant. 
To be honest I don't understand why they are awarded with such accolades I stayed in Thailand for a month so I will use that for comparison. 
I find the Khao soi too rich and coconutty. It over takes the subtle nuances of a balanced dish. It just taste like coconut cream soup. I wouldn't make this the quintessential place for Thai food. Support other local businesses.

Came here twice and had the vegetarian spring rolls, grabong, chicken pad thai and Thai iced tea ice cream  Everything we tried was absolutely delicious! I'm not a big fan of spring rolls but these were amazing! The grabong - butternut squash fritters were so yummy and not at all greasy. The pad thai was perfect - not too sweet at all and the Thai iced tea ice cream was the perfect dessert. This is one of my favourite Thai restaurants. We also sat at the traditional Thai seating area where you take off your shoes and sit on a cushion which I wouldn't recommend because it was very uncomfortable. 
I would recommend this restaurant to anyone and can't wait to come back for the 3rd time.

What an amazing place. The vibe is super cool, with Whitney Houston and Biggie Smalls playing while you eat. The staff was so nice! We started with the Kung Tawt and Spring rolls. My kids and my husband gobbled it all up. We moved on to the pad Thai with beef and shrimp, then the Pad Graw Prow and I can't remember the other name! But it was a delicious curry. 
We have a lot of Thai restaurants where we live in Southern California and I must say, this place was better than most places back home. 
The waitress was so accommodating, kind and was always checking on us. I can't recommend this place enough.

In 2019, this was voted the best pad thai in Toronto. It was definitely better than the rest I've ordered from DoorDash-- not too greasy, balanced flavours, choice of spice level. The finely shredded cabbage was appreciated as a fresh ingredient to add some crunch, but look at the pic! It definitely needs more colour and the nutrients they would bring. Red pepper, more lime, mung bean sprouts and definitely cilantro! It needs to be kicked up a notch on all levels. The veg that was there was old and overcooked. Probably won't order this again.
Great atmosphere! The food is definitely tasty and is true to Thai flavours. The portions are great as well.

This was a highly anticipated Thai place that had been recommended by a lot of our friends. We've been to Toronto several times, but had never dined here after several failed attempts. We decided to dine here at off-hours since the wait was always so long.
This place is definitely worth a visit. Being from the SF Bay Area, where there are lots of Asian food snobs, we didn't think Thai food could get much better. Boy were we wrong. This Northern Thai style restaurant exceeded our expectations. The ambience made for a lively yet authentic feel, and it felt like the perfect escape from the rain into a whole new world.
The laap salad was by far our favorite - a mix of sweet and savory, with a blend of flavors that made for the perfect mix. The only other southeast Asian salad that I think compares is the tea leaf salad from Burma Superstar.  We also tried the squash fritters, which I think we could've done without, the pad gra prow, which was delicious (and that's my go-to Thai dish) and the khao soi, which was just perfect given the weather - flavorful, but not overwhelmingly so, and not too spicy. Finally, before yelping other dessert places and deciding there wouldn't be anything quite as good as mango sticky rice, we went with just that. And that did not disappoint! We wanted to get 3 more so that each person could have 1, but decided that wouldn't be so healthy...! Definitely coming back the next time we're in the 6!!!

I ordered the following from ubereats since I know the lines are long:
-starter Tom yum (2.5/5) too sweet but had two shrimps in it and plenty vegetables 
-Grabong (3.5/5) pretty good but not for me
-khao sai (3/5) VERYY creamy and a bit too heavy for me but the noodles were good and the chicken was tender even after reheating
-chef nuit pad Thai (4.5/5) I got it with beef and Thai spicy. WARNING IT IS RLY SPICY. I'm Chinese and used to Sechuan spiciness but this brought tears to my eyes. Def get medium spicy to begin with even if you think you can handle spice!!! 
Overall pretty good but I was hoping to try their papaya salad since it's my absolute favourite dish but it seemed sold out online in kits via ubereats

Just had dinner here and was satisfied. 
The service is great, everyone was attentive, quick, and pleasant. Atmosphere is nice, it's actually not that loud and you can hear the person across from you. Very busy, so make a reservation if you can. Food also came out a good time, not that long of a wait. 
We ordered the Tom Yum soup as a starter, great flavors - I love the spicy and sour flavors battling it out in my mouth. 
My partner had the Pad Thai, we both found it to be sweeter than we liked, but it was a good portion size (especially for sharing) and fresh. 
I had the Khao Soi with braised beef. Really yummy if you like coconut curry with beef and egg noodle. Portion of this was also pretty decent. Good for sharing as well. 
To drink we had the Thai Iced tea, really flavorful and not overly sweet. 
I would come back.

This is one of my favourite Thai places. I love the vibe of it! It's like walking into another world. Super colourful and lively! 
The pad Thai there is my favourite. I've tried them all. I can't pick a favourite. They do great curries as well and their drinks are to die for. You feel like you're on vacation here. 
Great to get take too though to bring home. 
I have a wonderful experience every time I go. 
Fun to go with friends or on a date. Might be too loud to go with older parents.

Love this place. The service is always great and food tastes amazing. And because of that you need to either make reservations in advance or go at odd times, otherwise you gotta wait for their food. 
I think they've recently expanded too so maybe that helps a little. I say at the small patio outside their main entrance this time and it was fine. Portions are typically generous and full of flavour. There are times when I'm so full from lunch here that I don't even want to eat dinner.
Not good food. It sucked. It didn't taste good at all. Never going back with my kids again.

We loved it!  From hostess to bartenders to wait staff it was amazing. The food is the best we've had since before the pandemic!!  Absolutely loved everything about this place and would highly recommend it. Only negative was most of their taps were out but still a good selection of drinks. Try the Spicy P drink!

I have very mixed feelings about Pai.
We came in just before the dinner rush on a Tuesday. There was a small wait but we got a table pretty fast considering it's popularity. We hadn't decided what to get just yet, when someone came to take our order. We told them we'd need a bit more time, but it became quite difficult to get anyone to take our order after that (eventually we did of course). 
We ordered the grabong, chef nuit pad Thai with beef, pad gra prow with chicken, and khao soi with chicken. 
The grabong was amazing! Really interesting to look at and had a great flavour and slight crunch. It's a great appetizer to share and tastes great with or without the sauce. I would definitely recommend trying this!
The chef nuit pad Thai was pretty good. Really nice all round flavour and not overly sour--a really good balance between sweet and sour! This was a favourite of ours as well.
The pad gra prow is where things begin going downhill. The rice was hard in some places--and not in the "crunch bits at the bottom of the rice cooker" way, but more like a stale "we left this out on the counter for half a day" type of way. The chicken and egg on the dish were very standard. The whole dish just felt very lackluster and sad. If you want to eat this, go to any Vietnamese restaurant instead.
The khao soi also had mixed feelings. The coconut curry itself was very delicious and rich--but almost too rich. It was definitely one of those foods that feel very heavy on the stomach after only a few bites. The egg noodles inside were also VERY soft--like it was overcooked and mushy. I think it would be better if the noodles were a little more al dente.
There are lots of hit and misses with Pai, which makes me hesitant to come back and try new items. The only thing I'm sure of is I would definitely recommend the grabong.

My friend took me here to celebrate after an amazing interview (spoiler alert: I didn't get the job). Let's get this straight, I'm not well versed with Thai cuisine besides Pad Thai, so I didn't have much expectations. The restaurant is generally very busy but we somehow managed to avoid the traffic. Though if you are waiting in the lobby, I recommend reading the owners' story on the wall (It's adorable).
I ordered their Khao Soi and it was fantastic! The soup was rich and had a bit of heat, the perfect combination! The beef was also so tender. Because of that experience, I now order Khao Soi whenever I am at a Thai place but none have lived up to Pai's.
If you're looking for a new Thai place, a new date spot, or somewhere to celebrate your new job, buckle up and get ready to fall in love with Pai.
It was really busy like always but we were able to get a table. The food and service are always on point, James really took care of us and made it a great night!

As i was eating there I was thinking Pai was very similar to Sabai Sabai and Khao San and then i found out that they are apparently owned by the same owners so no wonder there. Unlike other Thai places the menu is minimal with only a few options listed but the food is great. I tried their Khao San and loved it. I know it has noodles but i would still get a side of rice since i really like the flavorful broth and could still eat that with the rice. Also the bowl by itself wouldn't fill me up. Unlike other Thai restaurants that I've been too, the prices are also higher.
Food: 4.5/5
Service and atmosphere: 4/5
Price: 3.5/5
Overall: 4/5

10/10 I would visit again
Got the recommendation from a local and so glad we visited! 
Super cool decor and very friendly staff. 
My date ordered a Thai iced tea and loved it! I enjoyed the sangria, it's homemade and delicious. 
I had the chicken pad Thai and would recommend it. 
.

Awesome and authentic Thai restaurant with a dope hipster vibe.
Came here with 2 coworkers around 8 pm on a weeknight and had to wait about 30 minutes, but worth it! It's actually pretty spacious if they take you to the back room area.
Grabong is the perfect appetizer to share! It's a bundle of fried squash fritters with a delicious dipping sauce.
I got the braised beef khao soi dish as my entree. The noodles were perfect and it was nice to have braised beef in a Thai dish, which isn't the norm.

I came here on a Saturday for dinner with a large group. We made reservations ahead of time because our group was over 9 people. When we arrived it was packed at the front and I knew the food would be amazing.
I had the Khao Soi with beef. The presentations was nice with lots of dry crispy noodles poking up from the rich flavoured curry. It was mildly spicy but it was just right for myself. The server was very helpful and made small conversations with us.
Overall a wonderful experience and I definitely will be back to try other dishes. Perhaps I'll try a drink next time too!

Heard locally that this was one of the best Thai places in Toronto so had to give it a try!
The vibe of the restaurant was definitely pub-like. However it was a very friendly place and the service was excellent. The only downside was the food was alright.
We ordered basically everything on the menu to try such as the Tom yum soup, pad Thai, the fish, panang chicken and etc.
The food wasn't very hot in general and it's presentation seemed either rush or just no real effort in presenting the dish. 
However it was a very fun experience, and a great place to kick it around with friends

This place is BIG but it's also PACKED so be prepared. We came here for a friends dinner party. If you have a group of more than 8 people, I strongly recommend making res otherwise you're going to be waiting foooorever. 
The service and servers in general are quite nice but kind of slow. You can't come here, hope to be seated quick, eat and leave. This is a camp out. Literally. 
I got the Tum Yum flavoured soup with shrimps. It's was okayyy. There were a lot of tomatoes. Like 11 and I'm not a fan of tomatoes. However, the portion size was quite big. I didn't finish it because it was shareable. And it comes with this flame thing to keep it warm which was nice. 
My friends tried a whole bunch of other stuff that they really liked. And everything is practically under $20 for large portions which is nice. 
The atmosphere is also nice although it can get loud real quick. Also, there are stairs that lead down so if you have kids in strollers be ready to carry.  
Overall a good experience.

Haven't even tasted the food because I've been waiting for an hour after being told it would be a 25 minute wait. Apparently the restaurant staff are incapable of asking table squatters to leave. 20 minutes ago we were told that this table was finished eating and we would be able to be seated shortly and yet, where are we? Not seated. Waiting. Starving. Confused. :( 
Will update if food was worth.

Pai has one of the best Pad Thai I've ever had (no ketchup was used). It's crunchy and flavourful. I really like the ambiance and the music they play. Always crowded but with very good reason. 
The service is always quick at lunch time and my plate is always empty within five minutes of the server putting it on the table.
