Best pad Thai in town, came around 3-4 pm at an off hour for lunch and it was still packed! Would recommend the masang curry, pad Thai with chicken was delicious as well. One of the best Thai places I've been to, will have to come back to Toronto just to taste this again!

Good  !
love pai  and it is good taste 
Enjoy the meal and thanks pai during this special period

I like that their food has both authenticity, yet at the same time, creativity. Everything very delicious there. I like that you can customize spice levels as well. The atmosphere is very fun, and inviting, definitely great if you're going out with friends. 
It is quite loud though, not a huge restaurant. 
Service is great too. Staff seem like they enjoy working there. 
Can be challenging to get a reservation.
Hands down favourite Thai restaurant. Used to drive hours just to go here. Khao Soi, pad thai and the fritters are my regular orders.

Pai is very good. It is brought to you by the people that brought you Sabai Sabai (which is one of my favourite Thai restaurants in Toronto). I would recommend going with a few friends. The menu at Pai is best enjoyed family style. 
The Chef Nuit Pad Thai is a signature dish and is delicious. It taste homemade. On this occasion, I paired it with a Thai milk tea which I would recommend.
The price is slightly higher than other Thai places but it is fair for the quality you are getting.

As usual, this place is very tasty, but very busy. 
We came on a Thursday night around 5:30pm. We waited about 15 minutes to grab a buzzer, waited for about 15 minutes for a table that we shared in the party room section and waited even longer for our food - close to 30 minutes! 
The Thai iced tea we ordered came fairly quickly. Tasted good but nothing overly special. Would have liked it more if they used ice cubes instead of shaved ice.
I ordered the Penang beef curry. You could choose the spice level to your liking and the dish comes with a bowl of rice on the side. It's a good portion if you're not extremely hungry. The dish was very flavourful as expected. One of my go to favourites. 
My boyfriend ordered the pad gra prow. It's not a huge portion especially if you're hungry. He enjoyed it but not the best he's had.

Came to this place for dinner. We sat at the "patio", which is basically the street. Was kinda noisy as expected in Toronto. Its a trendy place with lots of young ppl 
The curry was awesome,  but the papaya salad for $15 ish was a little of a miss and I had better before.

I've never had any Thai food before coming to this place and after trying Pai out, it's like a whole new world has opened up for me. This place was pretty good. Had the Pad Gra Prow, which was egg on top of beef and rice and it was pretty good. 
Pai had a decent wait time, seems like a popular place to be and with good reason. 
The environment was awesome. The music they played was old school hip hop. And the servers was pretty nice too 
One of the better places that I've been too.

I came here for lunch while visiting Toronto. Pai sells some classic Thai dishes but also has a focus on Northern style Thai food. Prices are on the higher end for average to meager portions; flavor was on point though. Would come back to try more Northern style dishes.
The interior was decorated fairly randomly; it feels like you're in a pirate ship, there are cut outs of NBA players, and some paintings. Service was very friendly.
Ordered:
Pad Gra Prow - ground Pork with white jasmine rice and topped with a thai style fried egg. Comes with nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chili & lime). Was really flavorful, but the portions were fairly light. At the price, I wish it was more substantial.

Food is good and the place is nice. Service also is good but this place is packed! I would say although the food is good but it is a bit expensive for the portion. I ordered a chicken pad thai and gaeng masaman with braised beef. Pad Thai is a bit on the sweet side and not enough peanut for me. The gaeng masaman braised beef has good curry but the beef need to be more tender. Overall it's good place to eat and make sure to come early otherwise you will need to line up for roughly 30mins for 2 people if you come at 7pm. Also the food take a bit time to come. Although food portion isn't big but it's filling enough since it's either come with rice or noodle. Also they don't take same day reservation

This is absolutely my favourite Thai restaurant in Toronto. Or I should say my favourite restaurant of all time !! 
Nice service. 
AMAZING authentic Thai food 
I also love the vibes in the restaurant!
Strongly recommend everything with curry! And the desserts are also worth a try! (Mango sticky rice & coconut ice cream)

love the food, everything is very flavorful and at a good price; however i had a problem with the wait time and is hard to make a reservation. 
You really need to make a reservation a month advance if your planning for  a group gathering or birthday. The staff are nice but get really busy at the night time, if your just in town and want to try thai food come during lunch time , you would experience the thai food the best at lunch time.

A tiny bit pricey (but not enough to drop a star), but definitely worth it for the quality of food, service , atmosphere and drinks.
It was super busy when we arrived, but the hostess advised only a 20 minute wait, which was more like 5 anyway!
We had two DeMartinis, Pai's limey and tart version of the gin classic, with a kaffir lime leaf for an added hipster vibe. They were super refreshing and a great start to the meal. They did have an interesting array of cocktails, around $10 CAD each.
The appetiser selection was so broad. We were tempted to just order from this section but the mains were also incredible. We got Moo Ping (typical Thai street food dish of grilled pork skewers) which was succulent and delicious. This went perfectly with the Som Tum (spicy green papaya salad) with the sweet, salty and spicy combinations.
It was hard to choose the mains. There were a lot of dishes that reminded me of my trip to Thailand but we ended up settling with some great choices: one I've had before and a new dish entirely. Pad Ga Pow (spicy chicken with Hoyle basil, Thai fried egg and rice) and Gaeng Masaman (peanut and tamarind based curry with rice). Both of these dishes were exceptional, with hugely different flavours which gave us a well rounded dining experience.
We did eat a bit too much that we didn't have any space for dessert. They did have mango sticky rice (my favourite!) I honestly couldn't eat another mouthful.
I can't wait to come back to Toronto just to visit Pai again!

We waited in line for 20 mins on a Wednesday night but I won't complain because this is one of the busiest restaurant in Toronto as far as I know.
I ordered the so-called legendary Khao Soi and sadly I didn't like it very much.
The dish was very sweet and I got sick of it after 2 bites.
What I do liked very much was the appetizer squash fritters. The potion was generous and it taste amazing. My boyfriend enjoyed his pai thai as well.
So far I ain't all cuckoo about this place but I do like to give it another shot one-day to figure out of why this is one of the most popular restaurant in TO.

The Pad Thai here is best I've ever had. This is a basic staple in all thai restaurants I have been to. If you don't know what to get, you can't go wrong with this. We also ordered a special Khao Soi Braised Beef. It was good, the soup was not hot when it reached our table, but the overall flavor was still decent. I probably would not order this again, personal taste, because I thought the flavor of this curry had a higher emphasis on a turmeric and coconut flavor. 
As a note, both of these dishes were ordered mild! Boyfriend and I felt this this was a bit spicy! Boyfriend cannot eat spicy food (as he thinks chicken from Chipotle is spicy). Nice comparison for those who are wondering what kind of spice level to get. 
Only reason this is 4 stars instead of 5 was because the soup was not hot when it reached our table and it was hard to flag down waiters to help get the check or to-go boxes.

The best place with gud food excellent service. I would have rated it more than 5 star if thr was option to select ! Amazing ambience with lots of noise not bothering you at all .
All that we ordered right frm the noodles to the shrimp curry and chicken thai curry were excellent .
I really dont recollect the exact names of the dish ordered but all were worth . Would visit again soon

I absolutely love Pai!! 
I am not a huge fan of Thai food but Pai has got me hooked and I find myself craving it! The way they season everything is just phenomenal. I recommend everything on the menu, its so delicious. Very reasonable on the price too.

Slightly overrated to be honest. 
The chicken satay and garlic shrimp were amazing. The chicken was very soft and shrimp was extremely flavourful and crispy. 
But the main course of pad gra prow was disappointing. My friend didn't think her chicken pad thai was anything special either.  On my rice dish the spinach felt stringy and overcooked and didnt taste that good. The rice was very overcooked too.

This place did not disappoint! Their mushroom spring rolls are amazing and I ordered their green curry with tofu and veg. Highly recommend their pad thai also! 
Great quality and truly a wonderful meal!

Awesome small restaurant find in near Mccaul and Baldwin. Stumbled on this place via Yelp. We had the fried chicken and a few other dishes. The curries are pretty spicy. They have a lot of great plates for sharing. be careful with some of their hot sauces as they are quite spicy. I recommend their chicken leg.

PAI is one of my fave place for Khao Soi!! 
My friend and I came for girls-night dinner on a Thursday. We started with their PAI sangria and switched to merlot with our dinner. My friend ordered the pad Thai (foreigner spicy level) and I got the Khao soi.
The taste was 5 star, but the portions have decreased since I last came in. Their service is also good, but felt a little rushed after they saw us finish our meal. 
Will I go back? Yes, because of Khao soi

I L O V E P A I ! ! !
This is easily my favourite thai place, and favourite restaurant in Toronto, for that matter. 
I have been here several times and it has not disappointed each time. I've tried the Khao Soi, Chiang Mai Beef Noodle Soup, and Gang Kiaw Wan (in a coconut). I can say that the portions are enough for me (I don't eat that much) to be full and not finish all the rice or noodles. Wait time to get a table can be super long and the service is not amazing, but the food is so good it keeps me coming back. 
I would recommend to come around 5-6ish on a weekday if you don't want to wait. 
This is a good place to come with friends, family, partner, coworkers, even alone really!

I haven't had anything here I didn't like, but my favorites are Tom yum shrimp and the green curry with fish. 
The tom yum shrimp are fried perfectly. It'll tear-up the roof of your mouth, but it'll be worth it. The green curry...you'll want to eat/drink every crumb and drop of it. I'm not even the biggest green curry fan, but this dish is unbelievably good.

I've been lusting after this place for months and lucky enough today was my chance to try it out.  I went for lunch with a friend and there was a small wait.  This place is in the Financial District so I think it's aiming to grab the suits and serve up quick lunches - quick turnover equals more money.  Kinda like an upscale-ish hole in the wall.  
It's a decent size but they pack in the tables so you feel like you are sitting in your neighbour's lap (hopefully they are good looking), but it lends to the good vibes in here. 
The drinks are unique and interesting but slightly pricey for what you get, but I guess the price is ok for the area.
Originally we were told a 20 min wait but it ended up being only about 6-7 min wait and we were able to order drinks at the bar.  We both had the beef curry (massaman curry).  I chose medium spicy but honestly I didn't find it that spicy - a nice little hint of heat with a soft hint of sweetness.  It was delicious. The food comes quickly so if you are on your lunch you should be good to eat and run.

Omg! What a joint!!!!!!!!!!!!!
The coconut  curry (chicken) was un-fucking believable!!!
The best Thai food I've ever had in my life!

Pai is definitely one of the best places to get Thai food in Toronto. The restaurant's food is consistently good, and comes out quite quickly. The servers are also knowledgeable about the dishes on the menu, and friendly to answer any questions.
I highly recommend the squash fritters, which are deep-fried clumps of shredded squash, as well as the Khao Soi, which is a thick curry noodle soup. For drink, I suggest trying the Thai Iced Tea - it's creamy and bright orange, and has a strong sweet taste. 
The only downside is that this restaurant is quite popular, so there always tends to be a line, especially on weekends. It also tends to get loud in the restaurant later in the evening!

HEART EYES ABOUT THIS THAI RESTAURANT. I legit loved every dish we ordered and I will be coming back to try everything else they have to offer. The ambience is very upbeat and lively, and the interior gives off an exotic vibe - almost makes it seem like I've stepped into Thailand for a bit. 
We ordered a few dishes to share including the chicken pad Thai, Panang beef curry, and Gaeng Masaman with braised beef. Just as a side note - the spice levels on curry dishes cannot be adjusted (all the curry comes mild) Anyways, each dish was so flavourful and delicious. We got the foreigner level of spice for the chicken pad Thai but it was pretty spicy so take caution! 
For dessert we ordered the mango sticky rice which is a specialty not included on the menu. Unfortunately, our mango sticky rice only came with one slice of mango, although in previous photos I've seen on Yelp had two slices. Either way, it was amazing - but an acquired taste for those who might find it odd to be eating mango with rice. The Thai iced tea is also a great addition to the meal! Despite being a bit too sweet and quite pricey for its size, it definitely completes the experience.

Great Yelp find! As of the time of my trip to Toronto, Pai had 1646 Yelp reviews and was the top reviewed and rated place in Toronto. (I always use the Yelp app to filter based on number of reviews, pro tip.) I read about the crazy wait times, so we decided to eat at 4 PM. Eating at an off time without a reservation was definitely the way to go. Even when eating at such a random time, there was actually still a short wait for a table! 
There are two different places you can choose to eat. There is the main dining area and then there is the newer cafe area in the back of the restaurant. As far as I'm aware, the menu is the same in both areas. We sat in the newer cafe area. I ordered the pad thai and my now-husband ordered the pad gra prow. He absolutely loved the soft boiled egg on top dripping deliciously over his dish. The pad thai was definitely solid. Fresh. Big portion. And I liked it so much I ate the whole thing in one sitting! 
My only complaint is that it's a little cramped in there. Because this place is so popular, they really try to cram in as many tables and chairs as possible. I couldn't comfortably keep my coat draped on the back of my chair because it was right up against the wall, and my purse only just barely fit on the floor. As people walked by, I kept having to readjust the purse so it wasn't getting in the way. I can see they are addressing the space issue by trying to expand. I think it would be great for them open another location!

One of the best parts of traveling is trying different food and restaurants. Even better when yelp help you discover a gem like This!
We went on a Sunday afternoon, be prepared to wait or make reservations in advance. There was a line just to get to the host and jot down you name and how many in your party. They have a market area that does not have an alcohol license but you my get seated faster. We didn't mind not drinking alcohol so went that route, we were seated there within 5 minutes. 
It was a rainy chilly day so I went with hot Jasmine Tea. It came in a cute pot with enough for several servings. For dinner I got the Gaeng Hunglay with Oxtail. I honestly had no idea what it was and was hesitant because I am not a fan of sweet and sour but I LOVE oxtail. When ever I see it on a menu I tend to choose it. I am glad I did! This has been one of my favorite dishes at a restaurant. The curry had just the right amount of heat, nice kick of flavor but did not have you sniffling. Mixing the rice in with the oxtail and sauce was a perfect balance of flavors. Meal left me full and happy!
I would definitely come back here if I ever visit Toronto again.

This one is a bit overdue, but to start my string of reviews will be Pai. It is regarded as the best place to get Thai food in Downtown Toronto. Honestly, I'm not that big of Thai food since my spice tolerance is non existent haha. So to start, the restaurant doesn't look as extravagant or fancy but it still gives a very welcoming atmosphere and ambiance. Besides, the food is really where it's at! Depending on the day you go it does get really busy, so be prepared to wait a little bit if you don't have a reservation. Once seated, me and my friends opted for the spring rolls as a starter. Deep fried, vegetarian spring rolls. Pretty good filling plus the sweet and sour sauce was very tasty. For my main, I got the beef Pad Gra Prow - this can come in pork, chicken, beef or tofu. I got the beef (no spice of course) and it was seasoned very well and was packed with so much flavour. The fried egg really complimented the dish well. My friends got the pad thai and curry. Unfortunately they both like their dishes spicy so I didn't want to risk it haha. To sum it all, it's a great spot to have lunch or dinner! Will definitely be back.

Great food, lived up to it's hype.
Enjoyed dining in at Pai with my family of 4, 2 adults and 2 tweens, during a brief moment in lock down where indoor dining was allowed, pre-omicron.
The starters were fine, but nothing to write home about, had shrimp chips, chicken wings and spring rolls.
The mains will keep me coming back again and again. The Khao Soi tasted like the real deal, the broth was flavourful the noodles perfect and the beef tender. Highly recommend
The Pad Gra Prow was amazing. Perfect comfort food with all the flavours of south east Asia. Also recommend
Also had the chicken green curry, great presentation and the pad see ew, both lovely but didn't blow my mind as the Khao Soi and Pad Gra Prow did.
Ambience was great, casual, comfortable. Service was lovely. Just a great dining experience.

After coming back a couple times over the years, the quality of food hasn't changed - which is quite impressive and why I feel like I need to update my review. The line is still out the door, but moves pretty quick. 
Most notable dish is the green curry served in a coconut. 
The appetizers should not to be passed over either!

In town with a large group, so I had to check out the best thai place in the Toronto area. After finding this spot, I had to bring my friends here and try it. We had a reservation and did not have to wait in the very long line to even put your name down on a Friday night. 
When our table was getting ready, someone overheard it was one of our friend's bachelor parties, and gave us a complimentary drink. We were seated shortly thereafter, and it was then that I realized that this was probably the best Thai I had ever had in my life. The food was so good, and while I got the penang curry with chicken, I tried the pad thai (also delicious, and something I do not normally like). While our group of 12 was loud, the whole restaurant was popping and a lively place. If we did not want to try other places in Toronto, we probably would've come back for breakfast, lunch, dinner and dessert.
Also great drinks, if you're looking for more than a bite.

For me, Pai had been one of those restaurants that I've always heard good things about, but had never gotten around to trying. You know, the one somewhere in the middle of your restaurant wish list that you keep passing over for ol' reliables and trendy gimmicks... Well, I finally quit procrastinating and checked out the place. 
It did not disappoint. 
Even just from an organizational standpoint, Pai was impressive. Huge space packed to the max, and somehow the food came out super fast and perfectly correct. The server was friendly and patient - not frazzled in the least - and they offered multiple vegan options. Incredible. 
Now for the food itself... everything was a total party in the mouth. The panang curry was probably my favourite dish of the night. I could have easily bathed in that sauce. The Pad Thai was probably my least favourite dish, but it was still a solid Pad Thai (and my friends loved it, so you might also think I'm crazy for saying that). The papaya salad was definitely the dark horse. I wasn't super keen on ordering it, but I'm very glad we did. Tangy, refreshing, and a lovely hit of spice. 
The prices are slightly higher than your average Thai place, but nothing crazy. Pretty sure every dish was still under $20. Plus they had some decent sounding drink specials ($5 tequila on Friday... drink responsibly!). All in all, a fantastic experience that completely lives up to the hype.

3.5/5
Looking for a place DT for Friday night dinner went to Yelp for some  help and Pai caught my attention with its highly recommend reviews. Got there just before 6 and was seated but shortly after the queue started to grow. Service was prompt and our server was nice and  gave her reco for the popular items we skipped the pad Thai and went for Khao soi and Pad gra prow that was her top picks khao sou came first and was very tasty just as I expected from other khao soi I have noodle was portion seemed small for the price and it was not hot enough border line warm at best the pad gra prow was good love the jasmine rice but again it cold have been hotter in temp. All in all good place with a good vibe and recommend

The wait for 2 on a Sunday night was about 10 minutes. They are pretty strict about their closing time so keep that in mind! The restaurant is huge! So many rooms and seating options. The bathroom was clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. We ordered a spicy pad Thai. It was not spicy and was very tamarind forward. The proteins (chicken, shrimp and egg) were all cooked perfectly. It was a generous portion size. We would definitely want to come back to try more of their menu - just wasn't blown away by the pad thai.

I have been past this location hundreds of times and wasn't aware of it. My friends and I went for lunch and were thrilled at our experience. Two of us required vegan and gluten free meals and the other two did not. The menu clearly indicated which items could be done vegan and gluten free and we were able to choose our spice level.
Two had the red curry dish with tofu and loved it. The other two had the pad Thai, one chicken and mine was with tofu and medium spice. Spice level was perfect and tolerable. The meal was so delicious. I was full after eating half of it and should have had the rest packed, but it was so tasty so I finished it. My friend ordered the coconut sorbet (vegan) topped with pralines, toasted coconut, tapioca and corn something. It was outstanding. I was too full to enjoy it so I will go back just for that. I had coconut water with my meal, which was very flavourful but expensive at $6 per glass. The pad Thai was $13.50 but it was a big portion.
It is casual inside with tall and short wood tables and a bar. I'm definitely going back since it is walking distance to Princess of Wales, Royal Alex, Tiff Bell Lightbox and Roy Thompson Hall. They have a sister restaurant close by called Kiin which the server said is a little more upscale.
The food was really great and they followed instructions when I asked them something specific online. Thank you!
Our to go meal is their chef nuit pad Thai with chicken, gaeng massaman curry with beef and Thai ice tea!

Pai was the dinner destination I hoped to find as I explored what makes Toronto the fun, international, popping city it is.  A local friend I was visiting brought me to this popping and delicious Tai restaurant for dinner,  and I see why she wanted to show it off! 
From their menu, I saw a lot of rice options, but I was craving noodles; so I reluctantly ordered the vegetable/tofu Pad Thai, despite usually finding this dish less exciting than other Thai dishes. One bite in, and I was so thankful that I went with my gut. 
The Pad Thai was possibly the best I've had, I think partially due to the peanut sauce and it being perfectly spiced. I got the second to the highest level--I'd recommend this level to others who have a pretty high spice tolerance but nothing to prove. 
The vibe was really cool/hip, but not intimidating. Again, what you look for when visiting such a big and eclectic city like toronto. I will say that for a Sunday night it was very busy, and the system for getting seated was different than what I was used to--instead of putting your name in, you line up and the hosts seat your party as tables become available. Despite being packed the line moved pretty quickly, and I don't think we stayed in line longer than 20 minutes. Eventually we were seated at the bar but it was a cool ambiance and the bartenders were great at checking on us even as things were busy.
Great experience and, even know there are more amazing options I've yet to discover, I'd definitely go back if I returned to Toronto!

Pai is one of the best Thai places in Toronto! Our go-to orders are their pad thai, squash fritters (MUST order) and their spring rolls. We also love getting their Thai iced tea! The squash fritters are a huge appetizer so you definitely need a couple of people with you to share it with.

The prices are a little steep, but the hype is real. We came for lunch at 12:30pm on a Saturday with no reservation and luckily didn't have to wait at all, even as a group of 8. We must have come at a perfect time window because all the vacant tables were filled 10 minutes after we were seated, so I recommend making a reservation!
The restaurant interior was dimly lit and cozy, and the service was friendly and competent. I shared the ~CA$6 Thai Chicken Wings with two others in the group, which were quite small but on point with that classic Thai-style chicken flavor. I'd only recommend this appetizer to someone who REALLY likes chicken wings though.
For my entree, I ordered a ~CA$16 Pad Gra Pow, which consisted of holy basil stir fried with a choice of meat (ground pork), steamed jasmine rice, a thai-styled fried egg on top, and nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chili, and lime) on the side. I wished the portion size had been at least 25% bigger, especially given its high price. HOWEVER, THIS WAS ONE OF THE MOST FLAVORFUL AND SAVORY MEALS I'VE HAD IN A LONG TIME. I wolfed down the meal in record time, and you could tell that the food at Pai Thai was good overall because our table grew quiet when all of it came; you could only hear chewing and slurping noises at that point.
I enjoyed my experience at Pai Thai and would be down to come back again! If you've never been here and are visiting Toronto, I highly recommend trying this place out. By the way, the Toronto Aquarium is a 15-minute walk from here, so you could factor that into your itinerary. Bon Appétit!

I was visiting Toronto for four nights, and this place was so good I came here for two of them! 
My friend recommended this place to me so I came here with some other friends. I ordered the Khao Soi with chicken breast. My friends were both vegetarian so they got vegan dishes, and when I got my Khao Soi it was the vegan version with tofu, broccoli, and cauliflower. It was still very delicious, the broth is very flavorful, but after I realized after a few bites, they swapped the dish for me. The chicken portion looked smaller but was still a lot of food. I got the chicken wings and pad Thai with chicken on my second night, and it was very good. The chicken wings were a little too salty for me but that pad Thai was on point!!!! And a huge portion too, I ate a quarter of it if that! 
The mango sticky rice is also delicious!! It's a small portion but very tasty.
It looks like they get super busy during regular hours!! But they have a waiting area and a bar. I'd love to try their drinks next time- they sounded quite yummy!

This is a very busy place right around the entertainment district in a smaller road/street - very popular among the business folks but also even at night. The one downside I would say if you go in a group of 5 or 6, they'll charge 18% service charge or it was 20% I don't remember but it was something ridiculously high. For a place like this where it is too busy to even get service, it's hard to justify such an automatic tipping percent. Understandably that is because they are busy but doesn't justify for that type of treatment.
Irrespective of that, the food is good. I've been here a couple of times but after awhile it does get kinda boring simply because you eat the same type of similar food - relatively wet, saucy, and it really only works out if you want something saucy to eat from.

Wow, where do I start. I only had the Khao Soi and the garlic shrimp so I can only speak on those two. 
The Khao Soi deserves a 15 out of 10 star rating. The soup is creamy, mildy spicy (just enough for that kick), melt in your mouth beef, and not too thin or too thick noodles that will have you craving more. 
The garlic shrimp was crunchy, flavorable, and delicious!
If you're in toronto, this is a must try place but be prepared to WAIT.

I happened to pass by this spot and was intrigued by the crowd and busyness of the place. I figured "why not", and requested a seat for one. I was a little nervous since I just heard the hostess tell the group before me that the wait was 45 min-1 hour, and it was only 1.5 hours before closing. Luckily flying solo has its perks, as I was seated immediately at the bar. 
The place was super busy and the bartenders were always busy scrambling around making drinks and serving food, but they made sure to stay attentive. The lady I had was nice and always made sure she got to everyone at the bar. 
I ordered the Sai Ua Platter, Chef Nuit Pad Thai with chicken and a sangria. Everything was delicious! I was so full I could barely finish. I asked for mild on the spice level but def should've opted for a level higher. The sausage came with sticky rice and it was such a nice presentation. They gave a nice helping of the pad Thai and everything was perfect.
I see why the place is so popular and would def come again!
Amazing Thai food. I haven't had anything bad on the menu and I've tried most of it. Now on kitchen hub and the quality is just as good. (The downtown location can be quite busy at prime times)

Yummmmmmmy best Thai food in all of Toronto!!!!!!! 
Tonight, The food was delicious including the pad Thai! We also got the green curry inside the coconut which was a delight!! The veggie spring rolls were good too. Pad Thai was good but not the best hat I've ever eaten. I think their pad Thai has been better in the past.
My husband got the ginger beer which he really
Enjoyed but i felt it had too spicy of a kick that hurts the throat.
I got the fresh pineapple shake which was delicious and very refreshing. 
So the line to get in the restaurant seemed really really long and we waited outside but as soon as we got to the front we were seated immediately. The reservations and waiting in line are the biggest drawback of this place. The line seems to move faster than you can imagine but it can sometimes still be quite a long wait.

This place is awesome! A great gem in the city that serves delicious Thai food. 
Their papaya salad and their Khao Soi are my go-tos. So delicious. 
Atmosphere and ambiance is relaxed and fun--great to go to with coworkers or friends. They have a really cool bar area too at the back of the restaurant. Highly recommended for good Thai food in the city.

If you are thinking about going to this place on a weekend, reserve a table right now!! This place is almost always booked especially in Winter. There is usually a long line-up in front of it. Do yourself a favour and avoid the line up in the cold weather and book it in advance.
We reserved a table for two 3 weeks in advance. The place looks like you have walked into a store in Thailand! The decorations, old tables and candles all add to the coziness of the place. Service is quick (they have so many tables to take care of so they would rather you order quickly). 
I really liked their Thai tea. Cocktails were good too. Their famous dish is the Khao Soi. I got it with braised beef. Sooooo good! Their green curry was also amazing (it is served in a coconut!).The portion sizes are huge at this place, I think one main and one appetizer is enough for two people.
For the spice level we both got mild, which was the perfect amount of spice.
Tldr: This place is a must try if you have not been there yet!

They're rude and not helpful. It's not as clean or well stocked as it used to be. Especially the meat department. Very questionable. A video is circulating of them drying salt fish in the dirty lane way.

The food was amaaaaazing. We started off with the best chicken skewers ever. The meat was sooooooooo tender (not sure how they do it) and charred to the right amount.  It came with satay sauce which is the bomb, and also a vinaigrette if you prefer something lighter in between. 
For the main, we ordered the Khao Soi and Pad Thai. Where do I begin, I have never had Khao Soi before, it is egg noodle in a cocounut curry sauce. This was soooo yummy I am still thinking about it. I couldn't stop drinking the soup and the noodles soaked in the flavours. 
So. good. 
Comparatively, the pad thai lost it's luster, but don't get me wrong, it was still really good. We ordered spiciness of medium but it was more like a mild mild. 
This restaurant is always hustling and bustling, so expect a wait time. The turnover is actually quite fast and the space is bigger than it seems. 
Will definitely be back if in the area!

Pai is delicious! However, the prices are a bit steep. Pad Thai and a Thai Iced Tea was around $22. However, I was really hungry so I thought why not give it a try. They are on the 'feedback' app which offers discounts if you buy ramen at a certain time of the day. Though that app varies from time to time depending on whats available. 
I didn't think it was anything special, but also it was such a long line up to get in. They have a great system where you can leave a phone number and wander around in a bit. 
I think trying pad Thai was not the best choice since it was so common everywhere else. I would definitely go try again and hopefully my experience will be better!
Amazing food, great drinks and a nice atmosphere. Would love to go back when in Toronto.
Pai never disappoints! I love their Thai green curry as well Masaman curry with rice. As a pescatarian I have plenty options. The food is always fresh and delicious!
Eating at this restaurant is like jumping off a cliff... it's a 1 way flight to hell

Rating: 3.5
Waited about 30-40 mins on a Friday night. They didn't have the chicken skewers so we decided to get the Thai chicken wings($6 for 3). They were good but very small like pub wings and they were nothing special. For the main dishes we got khao soi and curry in coconut dish. With the hype of the Khao soi, I didn't find it anything special. The noodles were very soggy and the sauce was very oily. The curry in coconut however was very tasty. Overall it's definitely worth trying it out for the more authentic side of Thai food.
Note:
- place is very loud and gets pretty crowded
- make a reservation online or else you'll have to wait a bit

There's always a line up at Pai, and that's for good reason: the food is just amazing! Luckily, we didn't have to line up because we made a reservation (over a month in advance).
The menu is extensive and offers a great variety of drinks and authentic Thai food. My favourite dish here has got to be the Pad Thai, but you can't go wrong with the Khao Soi or curry dishes either. 
The atmosphere is lively, although it could be a bit loud. The service is very good as well. 
If you happen to be in the financial district, Pai is a fantastic place to catch up with someone over dinner, get to know somebody better, or just grab some food with a group of friends.

The standard against which other Thai restaurants are judged in Toronto.
The quality is very consistent, and their noodles are hearty and tasty. Pad gra prow, a spicier rice dish, is equally hearty and simple yet satisfying.
The chicken skewers are great.
Overall solid food, good decor, the delivery product is adequate and always reliable.

Great tasting thai food in the heart of the entertainment district downtown Toronto
It can get very packed in here and long lineups are a frequent sighting, which speaks volumes on how great the food tastes here
Prices are very reasonable and you can get a good meal for under $20.
For my latest visit, I ordered the gaeng hunglay ox tail stew which comes with jasmine ice. My friend had the khao pad thamada stir fried rice with chicken. Both of them tasted great and we found that the ox tail stew with the thamada rice made a really kick ass combination. Tasty!!!
We got in around 6pm on a Sunday and it was decently packed, but luckily there were tables at the back for us. By the time we left around 7:15, the lineup was out the door lol. 
Get here early and you shouldn't have to wait too long for a table

I have now been to this restaurant several times. I can't get over how busy it is, even when it's only just opened at 4pm in the afternoon! 
I love their cocktails! So tasty! The wait staff is so friendly and efficient. 
All of the food I have tried there is amazing. I love the pad Thai which normally I find Boring - but not at this restaurant! Love it there! And the spring rolls are delicious. The various chicken dishes I've had are excellent. All of it. By far one of the best Thai food restaurants ever.

Hmmmm..... I would rate this place a 3.5.
The food was good but not as great as people have rated it and there was a line up half way around the block by the time we left the restaurant . 
We ordered the Khao Pad Beef, Khao Soi Chicken and the Dried Shrimp Papaya Salad. The papaya salad was my favorite dish and the sticky fried was good but not to the level of deserving a perfect rating. I will pass on the Khao Soi, if I return.
Service was prompt and friendly. It was a 20 minute wait from just outside the front door which I thought was ok, because the restaurant has a near perfect rating and was packed!

Pretty good service from servers.
Tasty peanut sauce in beef stew noodle. Paitai was also good but that Thai salad with betel leaves was most unique.
Long wait since we arrived peak time. I couldn't understand why people lined up on a Monday night to eat there till I ate that cold dish.
The raw salad ingredients included garlic, lime, red pepper, green hot pepper, fresh chopped peanuts, sweet and sour sauce plus petite shrimps, wrapped in dark green leaves.
It's the first time I saw that dish in FL or CA.

Wow, this restaurant has such friendly service. Everyone from the hostess to the bartenders to the wait staff greeted us with genuine smiles on their faces. The drinks were very interesting and tasty concoctions. One had vodka and lychee, another had Thai tea and cocoa powder. If you love Thai or are new to Thai this restaurant will not disappoint. My husband had Pad Gra Prow with crispy pork. Total comfort food. Anything topped with a fried egg is a winner! I had green curry in a coconut. Curry was yummy and I also found myself snacking on the coconut itself!
The restaurant is a bit cramped but the service was outstanding and made up for that. If you come before 6:30 the wait is not too bad at all. Highly recommended!

PAI has become one of my go-to restaurants for lunch-time Ritual orders if I don't have time to make my lunch ahead of time. 
The quality never disappoints and the portion size is perfect. I love the both the green curry chicken and the red curry chicken with the squash - delicious and filling. 
The service is also always great.

This place is amazing!!! I ordered a Khoi Soi with beef and every bite was delicious and very flavourful. I had their coconut breaded shrimp as an appetizer and it was worth it. Super crispy and very tasteful. The Thai ice tea is a must try as well! Super refreshing and taste so good! 
The staff was super friendly and very quick service for the amount of people around lunch time. Would definitely come back here.

First Experience:
I came here with my coworkers at lunchtime. We were seated quickly despite our large party of 9 with no reservation (PAI does not ordinarily take reservations). It took sometime for our food to come after ordering, but that is understandable given the business of the lunch rush and our large group. All our food came out together and was hot and freshly cooked. All the dishes looked wonderful and authentically Thai, and smelled lovely. The dish I had was the Beef Chef Nuit Pad Thai with the Thai Spicy option. A detailed review of my dish follows:
Beef Chef Nuit Pad Thai, Thai Spicy:
This Pad Thai was delicious. The bean sprouts, beef, sliced cabbage, and crushed peanuts worked together with the sauce and noodles to create a myriad of exciting flavours and textures in every bite. The Thai Spicy option is the hottest option on the menu, and will not disappoint spice enthusiasts. For those less courageous, there are no spice, mild, medium, and farang spicy options as well. The dish was coherent and each element complemented and built off another in perfect harmony. This dish was wonderful and reaffirms PAI's reputation as THE Thai restaurant in Toronto.
Second Experience:
I don't usually review places twice, but the food warranted another review. I came to PAI again with my friends on the weekend for mother's day. We were seated incredibly quickly despite the occasion. We ordered a number of appetizers and mains. Detailed reviews of the food I tried follow:
Gaeng Masaman with braised beef:
This curry was immensely delicious. The depth and layering of flavour were incredible and the consistency was silky smooth. The beef was mouthwatering and braised to perfection. The dish was perfect, and was unbelievably enjoyable. It was a very rich, so it's best enjoyed hungry!
Grabang: 
The grabang is a tower of deep fried butternut squash fritters. It was a visually impressive appetizer, and great for sharing. It is crispy and delicious and the peanut sauce it was served with had great flavour.
Gai Satay:
These chicken skewers had a strong peanut flavour and were very good. The chicken was not dry and the cucumber dressing was a perfect pair.
Said Ua Platter: 
These pork belly sausages were wonderfully fragrant and different from any sausages I had ever had. The relish was quite tasty and complemented the sausages well.
Overall, my second experience at PAI was also incredible and I can once again affirm this restaurant as THE Thai restaurant in Toronto.

This is hands down my favourite Thai place in Scarborough. The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside but once you are inside, the decor and atmosphere instantly make you feel like you've been transported to a local eatery in Thailand. As for the dishes, my go to appetizer is the chicken toast. It's crunchy and savoury but perfectly paired with the sweet dipping sauce. PadPrik chicken with rice is the perfect amount of spicy and just so amazing-a must try. The pad Thai here is also delicious and generous in portion size!

I really really enjoyed the food. I had red curry and it was delicious. My party had pad thai and she loved that as well. Very friendly and attentive service. The place has loud music and pretty close table seating, so it is not a perfect setup for a romantic dinner, but if you want great good and vibrant atmosphere, this is the place!
Amazing. Only bad thing is that the wait is always long, but that's just a testament to how good the food is.

The service is amazing, the waitress was very attentive. The food was even better, it came out in large portions and for the right dishes, they came out hot. The food was absolutely delicious, it was that flavour kick I expect from Thai food. The price is fair for the quality. Their drinks are delicious, though a little weak. Overall, I loved the food and ambiance. 
Word of advice: make reservations or come early, the lineup gets crazy long starting at 6pm.

I was really impressed with Pai Northern Thaï Kitchen ! I had heard many good things about it and went with a regular. I tried the green curry - which came with medium heat - with chicken and bamboo shoots. The cocoanut milk in the curry balanced the spice perfectly so it was not too spicy and came with a side of rice. The curry was served inside a cocoanut so extra props for creativity ! Since the cocoanut was not very large, they provided extra curry in a side bowl. I tried a bite of the pad Thai as well and it was very good. 
The atmosphere was casual and the space itself was very large, but separated into several rooms so it was easy to carry on conversation with your group. The only unfortunate event was that the fire alarms went off because someone opened a fire door. All of the staff were extremely apologetic and kind. 
 
Can't wait to go back already !

Located on a small street, you might miss it as it's dark and located in the basement.  It was a packed night, but they had the reservation set up for 18 customers. The table was high and so the chairs that were provided didn't have a back support, let alone a place to hang your jacket/coat!! Many of the guest just sat on their jacket. Not convenient at all. There were hangers, but not close to our table. 
Compared to other Thai places, this place is dark and the interior design is a mix match of a carnival scene and a night market scene from Asia. 
Happy:  The veggie spring roll came out quickly and it was hot. I would have preferred a different sauce than the typical one. My main chicken curry dish came in a real coconut which was a nice appeal. (It stated in the menu.) 
Not happy:  However, it was not hot nor warm either!! I was disappointed indeed. It felt like the dish was just left there for the waiter to find. At least the jasmine rice was warm. There weren't a lot of chicken pieces, just a lot of curry sauce!! My partner suggested I say something but I was already too hungry past 9 pm. He ordered pad Thai and he said that he had it better at other restaurants. 
Verdict: I wouldn't go back. I like my food hot (in temperature) and if the cooks are not cooking it right, then there's no point in eating out. It certainly destroyed my experience! At least the service is decent.

Authentic Thai - AMAZING FOOD!  This is my husbands favourite Thai restaurant in Toronto (mine is Jatujak). We usually avoid going downtown, but PAI is the exception.  What we usually order: [Gai Satay Skewers] - These tender chicken skewers with a peanut sauce is an amazing starter [Morning Glory] - This is the best morning glory dish in the city! Always our go to order [Green Curry] - This is the dish that made PAI my husbands favourite Thai restaurant in the city. It is packed with flavour and very unique from other green curries as this one has a fishy taste to its curry sauce. [Khao Soi] - This one is one of my favourite Thai Dishes, and although they don't make it as well at Jatujak, their version is still pretty darn good.  Overall, Pai is a delicious authentic thai restaurant, serving up some amazing flavourful dishes. It does tend to get super busy here, so heads up!

This is the best thai restaurant I have ever tried! Come here with reservations or expecting a bit of a wait. The restaurant was packed and the service was relatively quick. The curries and dishes tasted exactly as they did on my trip to Thailand! Absolutely delish and cute rustic ambiance.
Would definitely recommend coming here and I will be visiting again!
Amazing food and drinks! The Pad Thai was super flavorful and hearty, the gaeng masaman was delicious. The atmosphere is very hip and cute, I can see why it's always packed at Pai.

Love Thai food and came here because they offer Halal beef options. It is very authentic Thai food, the curries we ordered was very tasty. We also ordered Pad Thai with beef and it was delicious. The shrimp soup was very good, it was a little too spicy and I would recommend asking for mild if that is possible. We would come here without any hesitation.

The food here is yummy and the atmosphere brings one out of Toronto's hustle and bustle and into the ambiance of beautiful Thailand.
The service was mediocre. They had a rather bland lemongrass iced tea, which sounds really delicious on the menu, yet it was extremely disappointing when it arrived and ended up tasting like lemongrass syrup water! WAY TOO SWEET! 
The take out 'side of sticky rice' was a morsel if that. TRIPLE PACKAGED: plastic zip bag (completely unnecessary) + styrofoam + paper bag = Pai restuarant being no friend to the environment and a complete turn off for ever going back! 
I believe my 4/10 star rating is even generous!
Excellent food but always busy so plan accordingly.  Probably the best Thai in the city.

This is probably the best Thai restaurant that's not super expensive in TO. 
Of my many times here I've gotten the fried rice, the khao soi, the pad Thai, the coconut curry. And the best is probably the fried rice here. Very rich in favour and probably the best fried rice I've ever had. 
They also have a killer sangria but their drinks are more to the pricier end. 
That said, the reason why this is not a 5 stars is because of the long wait that always exists here (30-40min wait) and the loudness of the restaurant.

After seeing all the positive reviews on Pai, my boyfriend and I just knew we had to make a reservation and give this place a try...and I'm so glad we did. 
We ended up ordering the khao soi, pad thai and grabong. Although I was surprised to find that a lot of these flavors closely resembled certain Vietnamese dishes that I'm personally very familiar with, all three dishes were amazing and the portions were generous. If I was a local, you'd probably catch me here at least once a week. The service here was also fantastic. We were promptly seated and our server was extremely sweet. I have no complaints! 
For dessert, we of course had to end with mango sticky rice. If you haven't had this dish before, I strongly encourage you to try it! You won't be disappointed. Everything here tasted incredibly fresh, particularly our dessert so I was thoroughly satisfied.

I cannot stress this enough - make reservations. 
We came on a Friday night and it was super busy. The line outside was insane. The restaurant itself is quite large, with a fun and loud atmosphere. Don't come here to have an intimate conversation. 
Drinks took awhile to come but were worth the wait. I had the Thai iced tea cocktail which was EXACTLY what I hoped it would be. 
We started with the tom yum soup which was incredibly flavourful as well as the grabong. The squash itself was a little bland but the sauce served with it was good. 
I ordered the gaeng masaman (braised beef served with rice) which was delicious but very rich. The serving size was quite generous and I took half home as leftovers. I also tried the pork pad gra prow which was pretty good. For dessert we had mango sticky rice. This was okay. Of course the dish is made by the quality of the mango and this one wasn't terribly ripe. 
Overall service was fine and the prices were reasonable. I did enjoy myself and I would definitely return although I would say this place is a little overhyped.

I've been a long time appreciator and lover of Pai.
It really is a home run when it comes to flavours. What you get here is big bold and perfect flavours, at a relatively reasonable price point.
 
What you don't get here is a relaxed atmosphere to enjoy dinner. It's very loud and designed to give you a Thai bar vibe rather than a more relaxed and formal setting like Kiin (same family of restaurants). The end result, this place is perfect for a night out before drinks (as long as you can control yourself to keep your food intake light) and a great spot for a fun lunch experience. 
As a protip, the Market concept they created for quick lunches is a great idea to eat big flavours without waiting a long time.

I'm not big into Thai food so Chicken Pad Thai is my go to option at any Thai restaurant. The Pad Thai here was good but took a while to come out. The noodles were also softer than I'm used to but the flavour was delicious, and the portions will fill you right up. 
My friend got the curry which came in a coconut bowl which was pretty interesting. I'll be sure to get that next time!

hmm I think Pai has improved over the years.
I actually wasn't a huge fan of the pad gra prow, pad Thai or Chiang Mai noodles here before, but from my recent visit, the food was better than I remembered.
Sangria is nice and sweet here. Service is cool too. 
Loved the pad gra prow this time, but I wouldn't get it with the crispy pork next time because it was a bit hard.
Some of the best thai in the city. Really great - highly recommended!
Great food, always a delight. Can't wait to go back. I love to recommend to newcomers to the city.
Holy actual shit. The Khao Soi...I get it every time I go. I am physically unable to get anything different.
food so serious man, the green curry was very very good and the chicken satay was cooked perfect as well

They managed to get two of us a table in 15 minutes on a Sunday night, which was surprising and impressive considering how popular this place is. We ordered the most popular dishes: Khao Soi, small tom yum soup, green curry and mango sticky rice. They were all 5 star dishes. The sticky rice was  chewy and sweet, the mango was a little dry though. Might as well order the sticky rice as a side. The green curry had bamboo roots, so if you do not like the smell of it, you better avoid it.
Got the pad Thai with chicken and shrimp and 1/2 lb of wings. The sauce with the wings is amazing and wings were super crispy. Pad Thai was one of the best I've had. Would 1000% come back

Meh...for the wait and reviews I was so excited to eat here but my local strip mall Thai place has the same or better food. The shining light was their cocktails. 
Pad Thai is my judgement dish and they didn't hit the mark.

4.5 stars on yelp? Well deserved. They use some kind of spices that make their food seem like it's on steroids. Everything was so aromatic, tasty, fresh, and authentically Thai.
The atmosphere is loud and resembles a market-esque restaurant. The line goes out the door, so you better grab a reservation or get takeout if you want to be in and out of this place.
For appetizers, we ordered the northern Thai sausage. You could tell that the sausage was made in house and was stuffed with fresh herbs and spices. 
It came with a house special sauce for dipping, sticky rice, and some crunchy lettuce/cucumbers. The combination has various textures and flavours that compliment each other and accent the juicy sausage. Definitely would order this again.
The khao soi that is so loved at this location, has definitely earned its reputation. The coconut milk, spices, chicken, and egg noodles were prepared to perfection. Best khao soi I've had so far. I would also want to sample the beef version in the future.
Bf got the masaman chicken which he loved as well.
For dessert, we ordered the mango sticky rice. My boyfriend was surprised because he said that the mango they used reminded him of the sweet juicy mangoes he's used to from Taiwan. Tastes like candy and they coat the sticky rice with a touch of condensed milk. Highly recommend this for dessert.
The bill was quite pricey, coming to $70 for the both of us. It was definitely worth every penny. The spices and food are too good to miss if you're in the area. We will be back again soon!

The food at Pai is delicious. A little bit over-priced, but the quality is consistent.
The atmosphere is a little dim and cozy, but the seating leaves something to be desired, when it's crowded it feels like I can barely move.
I find myself coming back for the food and it's consistent quality.

Finally had a chance to try Pai! I've been meaning to try this place for a while and have always been discouraged by the long line ups. 
Now I understand the hype! 
Came here on a Sunday around 6pm, and waited around 30 mins for a table. Ordered some drinks: Sangria and Tea Mac (thai iced tea + vodka) highly recommended if you're a fan of Thai iced tea. 
For dinner, we had the chicken satay with peanut sauce (good flavours), chicken Pad Thai (pretty good), but the star of the meal was the Pad Gra Prow with beef - highly recommend this dish! 
Overall: good, efficient service, good drinks, great food, would def return, and maybe even wait a bit longer!

Food was DELICIOUS! Seriously, really good. The Thai iced tea is amazing as well. Place had a great vibe, and service was great even though it was very busy. Be prepared for a line because this place is so popular, but know you'll have a great time once you're in!

Be ready to wait, since this place always has a line! It is worth it though, their curries are so decadent and satisfying. I used to only get green curry at thai restaurants, but once I tried my friends khao soi and have been ordering that ever since! I love the combo of noodles in the soup and crispy noodles protruding out of the dish, it gives a lot of texture to the meal. I usually get it mild or medium spice level, since their scale of spicy is a bit higher than what I am used to. I would recommend erring on the side of caution when it comes to spice level until you know what you can handle. Definitely recommend that everyone tries Pai at least once while in Toronto!

Most unique Thai restaurant I have ever been to not just in Toronto but ever! If you get a chance to while you wait to be seated, check out the story of how the restaurant was started, great stuff. 
I would advise calling to make a reservation, the place was super busy (even on a Thursday night). 
Once seated, we ordered the fried butternut squash and chicken wings, I could eat the fried squash everyday for the rest of my life. It was so freaking darn good. For the main course, we tried the pad Thai and the green curry, I thought the pad Thai was a little light on flavoring and the green curry was lukewarm. I think due to the crazy dinner rush, they got a little sloppy on the prep but the items tasted great.
Finally, the drinks here are off the hook! I recommend the sangria, light and refreshing! Mmm mmm mmm! Butternut squash and sangria!
Always wanted to check this place out and finally got the opportunity. Pad Thai was A1. What really added onto the delicious food was the authentic dining experience.
Visiting Toronto from Cali and wanted something different and tasty, with a great vibe... randomly chose this spot.. highly recommend...!! Try the Gaeng Hunglay with Oxtail..

Got a spot on one of their outdoor patios during my honeymoon. Ordered the Gaeng Masaman with Braised Beef and was greeted with an absolutely beautiful dish. Service is top notch, and the wait isn't too long. 
Pricing is very reasonable as well. I highly recommend making a reservation otherwise the wait for a table can be long.

Went there 3 times 
Went there with group of f people and ordered few different dishes to try,,all was good.Very busy ,long line little bit to much to wait on weekends but worth it.

If you want authentic Thai food with great flavours, you have to check this place out! The chef from Khao San Road branched out and started up Paid. It's bigger than Khao San (so your chances of getting a table at lunch is increased exponentially). We got a table for 1:00 on a Friday for 7 people, only because someone knows the manager, otherwise, be ready to wait 10-30 minutes for a table.
I had the khao soi (egg noodles in golden curry, with a choice of braised beef, chicken breast or drumstick). The flavour and spices were great! The crispy noodle gave it a nice crunch, just wished there was more of it! As the whole dish was in the curry, I felt it was too much. They should separate the noodles from the curry. The Thai iced tea was great (similar to the Hong Kong style tea) - sweet, milky, lots of ice.
If you're in the mood for Thai food and are in the entertainment district, check this place out!!

A little expensive and there is always a huge wait and line for walk-ins. The food is great and the appetizer platter is amazing. That being said, I feel like this place has been pretty inaccessible after it gained its popularity

This is was a great experience. I got the khao soi, which was heavenly. However, i had a few bites of my boyfriend's pad thai, which was not out of the world or anything (but not bad?) just-- the desserts are overpriced which made me sad bc i really wanted to try their mango sticky rice. I'm not a fan of rum but my bf loved their thai mojito so much-- i didnt think it was overly sweet or anything like someone down there in the reviews said. Still, if i ever come back to toronto im definitely coming back for more khao soi. Loved!!

We ordered take-out because the wait was too long. Our 5 meals took about 30-40 minutes to make, which is understandable considering how busy it was. 
.... AND THE WAIT WAS TOTALLY WORTH IT! I ordered the Pad Gra Prow with ground pork. This must be eaten with the magical fish sauce that comes with it. Once mixed in, the meal is extra delicious and has a unique taste to it. This is the best Thai food I've EVER had. I am definitely going to go back!!

I LOVED Pai. The wait was long as we came on a Saturday night, but it moved quickly and was worth it! We had been told before that the place was huge but didn't realize it until we were brought to our table walked through - it IS big! 
The food was really good. We got the Khao Soi, Pad Thai,  and Fritter and nothing disappointed. We've been looking for pad Thai here that reminded us of Bangkok and this is the best we've had in a lonnnnnnng time. So delicious! (And not red. Always a plus! Hehe). 
The servers were courteous and even though it was busy we didn't feel left behind or ignored at all. Loved the feel of the restaurant and unique vibe. 
Can't wait to go back.

I ordered the Pad gra prow with chicken. Lots of rice. Very little chicken. It was tasty but definitely over priced Thai. Did take out and they didn't include any cutlery :( apparently you need to ask in advance so heads up.
Food was Gold! It was delicious and the atmosphere was great. You might have to wait but it's worth the wait. One of the best in town!

I love Pai! It's my favourite Thai restaurant in Toronto. The food is consistently delicious and authentic to the flavours of Thailand (I've spent a month there). Their typical Thai dishes like Pad Thai and green curry are really great. It's my favourite pad Thai in the city. Another thing I've never seen on any other menus is their Miang Kung which comes as a make your own mini wraps with betel leaves, cooked shrimp and a variety of finely diced aromatics like ginger and scallion as well as lime and pomelo for some tartness. Add a little bit of the tamarind sauce and peanuts and you've got yourself a flavour bomb. 
Another dish they do really well is their Khao Soi. The portion is very generous and the yellow curry sauce is very rich. Highly recommend! For apps, I love their Moo Ping pork skewers, they're sticky, charred and full of fatty deliciousness. You can cut the rich flavours with a refreshing Thai iced tea that's made with sweetened condensed milk. Honestly, all their food is so good here! 
The vibe is very fun here too, very busy, a bit loud and decorated with fun bits and bobs that give a throwback to the town of Pai which is where the owner originally opened her first curry house. Make reservations 48 hours in advance or expect to way when you get there. I recommend going early for best availability.

We were in town for Pride and stumbled on this place scrolling through Yelp.  What a gem of a place!  
The decor is on point and the place is spotless.  We were sat at a nice large table on a raised platform.  We were asked to take off our shoes but I don't think that's how it was everywhere, just our table.  
We started with spring rolls which were well made, if not standard.  
For dinner, I got the Khao Soi and it was pretty striking.  They put crispy noodles in vertically.  They know what they're doing as it's a great shot.  
The service was efficient and quick.

Great place and fabulous food. Had heard that they get really busy so went early shortly after they opened for the day (4:30pm). Was seated and we ordered four dishes: pad Thai, panang curry, Khao Soi and Laab salad. All of dishes were just tasty and delicious. 
Service was good with the server coming by often to check on things and to refill our glasses

Lovely and sweet story of the restaurant... ...
Thai Chicken Wings and Pad Thai are soooo good！

We dined at PAI on a recent vacation in Toronto. It's a somewhat cavernous, busy, noisy venue with a good variety of Thai favorites. Service was adequate.
For starters, grabong was a substantial choice; the looming mound of squash frites was tasty, but a bit larger than we bargained for. We tried the Pad Thai based on a review we'd read; it was OK (better than the typical U.S. version, but not outstanding). Pad Gra Prow had more complexity. In both entrées, the spice levels were just as we ordered.
If you need a Thai fix in Toronto, PAI is A-OK.

The best Thai food in Toronto - hands down
Everything chef Nuit makes is incredible.

There was a long line to put in our name on the waiting list. Normally I would of moved onto the next location, but we waiting it out.  Soon enough we were at the bar enjoying a Thai beer and seated shortly after. I ended up ordering beef soup. It was legit.  
There were 2 tables where you could sit on the ground and eat at a low table.  I would suggest calling ahead to reserve it if you can remember!
Atmosphere was solid. It would be a perfect place for a first date, party, or just a regular night out with friends to enjoy Thai food.
Amazing atmosphere, great staff and the best Thai food in Toronto. Highly recommended! (also great for children)

Best Thai food I've ever tried. 
The staff is friendly the food delicious. Beer is great too.

Decent Thai food. I got the pad thai with chicken and medium spice. There wasn't a hint of spice and there was absolutely no kick at all - maybe I should have gone up a notch on the spice meter? The chicken pieces were nice and tender, perfectly cooked. The overall dish was on the greasy/oily side, but the flavours were nice and savoury, veering more toward the sweet/sugary side than spicy.
The garlic shrimp appetizers were the winner. At 6 pieces for $13, it's on the pricey side but they were so good and so worth it. Super crispy and paired well with the sweet chili sauce.
The Thai iced tea was pretty much highway robbery at $5.75 and filled with 50% ice - not worth getting. While it looks like the cup is completely filled, the smashed ice isn't noticeable until you take a few sips and realize you're halfway done your drink.
Overall, I'm glad I got a chance to try it but there's nothing that makes me want to re-visit.
Great space. Staff helpful. Food mid-range Thai. Noisy young crowd. Steps up a killer. Had an elevator but only noticed it on the way out. Love procecco with Thai food.

The place is small, the wait is long but the food is worth it! We arrived right at 4:45 and took a seat at the bar. By 5:00pm, PNTK was packed and had a line - and I can see why. Their food is authentic, fresh and seasoned to perfection. Their drinks pair wonderful with anything you order on the menu. Order the Khao Soi! You won't be disappointed !

Came here on a Saturday night around 8:30 PM and waited about 20 minutes for a table. We ordered the pad Thai, spring rolls and the green curry. 
Part of the green curry was served in a coconut, which was a nice touch. The coconut itself was tasty and the meat added a nice crunch to the curry. The green curry itself was pretty average and comparable to other good Thai places, nothing outstanding. Spring rolls were also indistinguishable from AYCE buffets. 
The pad Thai was exceptional. Other places taste just sweet - but this place hit all the spots. A real depth of flavour that's often lacking in Americanized pad Thai joints. Only comment is be careful of the spice level. The Thai Spicy level is NO JOKE. Unless you love eating extremely spicy food, be very careful when ordering this!

A friend and I were feeling the munchies and decided to check this place out. 
The restaurant is located under street level so you need to walk down a few stairs (a concern only if you have mobility issues). Lighting is low/dim but thats part of the vibe/atmosphere. I found the staff friendly, quick and efficient. There is plenty of seating but it does quickly fill up after 6/7pm. If you have a big group, there is a private room in the back or a tatami style area in the front near windows that has 2 large tables with cushions (I would definitely visit again just to sit there lol). 
For food, I had the popular Thai Ice Tea and Chef Nuit Pad Thai with Chicken. Both very tasty! The Thai tea was refreshing and the Pad Thai had a nice sauce for the rice noodles.

Lives up to hype. 
Food so good. Lovely to an enjoyable level. 
Recommend for all. 
Easy 5 stars.

Stepping inside Pai Northern Thai Kitchen transfers me back to Northern Thailand where the food is spicy and flavoured, people is friendly and nice, and the weather is hot and hotter....
Pai Northern Thai Kitchen is a heavenly place for me.
We were luckily to arrive at around 11:30 when it opened on a weekday and right before the lunch crowd came in. Make a reservation if you have a big group, you won't regret that. For singles, there is always the bar area if you just want a quick meal.
Lunch menu is limited but includes most of my favourite items. My NYC guest wanted to try everything........ and of course being a wonderful host, I let her go crazy a little.
We ended up sharing:
Papaya Salad with Dried Shrimp ($10)
Chef Nuit's Pad Thai with Chicken ($12)
Pad Gra Prow with Egg ($12)
Mango Pandan Sticky Rice ($8)
Thai Iced Tea ($4.50) for my guest
I should not had used the word "sharing" as my guest just have a few mouthful of appetizer and mains and declared them too spicy for her. I was kind of happy to stuck with finishing everything! Aside from the dessert!
Dinner menu has some interesting item which I would love to try. I guess I would be coming back. Again and Again.

They have a small lunch menu here but the choices all sound delicious...Chiang Mai Beef Noodle Soup, Massaman with Braised Beef and Rice, Thai Omelette with Ground Pork and Rice, and Khao Soi to name a few.  Also not the typical choices you have at most Thai restaurants, which is a nice change of pace.  It's like a menu of Thai comfort food.  
For my first time here, I dined in.  A couple of my friends ordered the Tom Yum soup and raved about it.  It looked pretty good loaded with shrimps, mushrooms and whatnots.  I asked the waitress for a recommendation and she said everything is good but one of her favorites is the Pad Gra Prow.  After going with that, I decided I could dine here every day and did so for the next 3 days.  I'm hesitant to order the pad Thai because I tried a bite of my friend's pad Thai and didn't like it (soggy and bland).  
Pad Gra Prow (pork with basil) with Fried Egg ($12) - One of my favorite dishes in Thailand but is rarely done right elsewhere.  However, they did it very right here, top notch. The flavors were authentic (could be saltier as it was on the sweet side) and delicious!  It even came with a side of chili fish sauce (prik nam pla!), which was not needed, but was nice to be offered.  The pork was minced to perfection.  The portion of rice given was also spot on.
Thai Omelette with ground pork and rice $12 was absolutely tasty.  This is not your traditional omelette as it was deep fried scramble eggs.  It had ground pork but it also had dried shredded pork (moo yong), which I haven't had in the longest time.  There were also basil, onion and red pepper that added to the great flavor of this dish.
Massaman with Braised Beef and Rice $12 - If you're in the mood for coconut based red curry, tender beef, and potatoes, you'll like this dish.  There are also onions and peanuts in here which I really enjoyed.
Thai chicken fried rice $11 - It was ok, kinda plain.  I got it as a takeout and it could have used some fish sauce.  Unfortunately, I didn't have any at the office.  Where's the prik nam pla when I needed it?
Small Tom Yum Soup $5 - This soups is pretty good.  I got it medium spicy and it was just the right amount of spiciness.  There were 2 jumbo shrimps in the soup.
Thai Ice Tea ($4.50) - They didn't have Thai ice coffee, so I went with this.  It's a bit more expensive than other places, but they do give you a big cup of it.  
Mango and sticky rice $8 - One of my favorite Thai desserts.  It was good here, but not quite $8 good.   I'll can go to Sabai Sabai for my Thai dessert fix for $5.
The service was friendly.  The décor is nice and gives the place a Thai ambience and not just Thai themed.  The take out counter is in the back towards the kitchen.  They take credit cards, including American Express.
I read that the owners are also part owners of Sukho Thai and consultants at Sabai Sabai and used to be associated with Khao San Road.

Amazing food. I ordered the Pad Thai and chicken satay. Good, informal ambience. There was a 25 min wait, but it was well worth it. 
Note: "Farang (foreigner) spicy" was spicy for me. So order accordingly!

Pai is brought to you by the same people from Khao San Road and Sukho Thai.  Due to various circumstances, they are no longer affiliated with KSR.  (I hated the ridiculous line ups there anyways.)
This location is currently on a soft launch and there has been little to zero media attention.  You're only going to know about it through word of mouth, or a walk-by.  However, word is going to get out really fast and the lines will be inevitable.  
The food is delicious!  Tons of flavours, spices, and levels of heat.  Noodle dishes, rice dishes, vegetarian fare...  Something for everyone.  
Friendly and helpful service.  No liquor license as of yet but soon to come.  
If you want authentic Thai food, give this place a try.  You won't regret it.  
Why 4 stars?  I want to check out the full menu.

Definitely one of the best Thai restaurants I've been to outside of Thailand. 
Don't let the long line deter you, it moves very fast. I particularly like how personalized all the wall decor is. Leading into the restaurant, there is a collage of how the restaurant owners met and started the business. There are lots of pictures with various patrons (not just famous ones). 
They have a focus towards rice based dishes and while their menu is not extensive, every single dish we tried was phenomenal. 
For apps we got the papaya salad. I really like the side of cabbage to cut the saltiness of the fish sauce and the chiccaron 
The Tom yum is spicy and delicious. The dish is actively heated by an open flame (but weirdly enough is only a tad bit hotter than room temperature) 
The pad gra prow is amazing. I love the crisp pork belly intertwined with the minced meat. The fried egg is perfectly cooked. We asked for super spicy and for me it was just mild. I did get chili oil on the side which helped
Lastly the braised beef khao soi was unforgettable. The coconut soup base is very thick and creamy. The egg noodles perfectly chewy. It also comes with a fried egg noodle garnish that we broke up and placed in the broth as well. 
The only not great thing at this place was the sangria. It tasted delicious. Lots of fruit and very tropical. However i couldn't taste any liquor at all. So, I probably would just get juice instead or a beer.
Don't waste my time with online ordering prompts that lead to a screen that says "pickup is not available today " -- it's foolish and inconsiderate to treat potential customers that way.

Overall: 4 stars for amazing Thai food, friendly faces, bustling hot atmosphere. I've come back mainly because I was so impressed with the food. It's pricier and portions aren't huge, but this is balanced by high quality food and taste. 
Food:
Not sure what more my review might add to what's already been said, but the food here is among the best Thai I've had in Toronto.
I started off with the chicken skewers (Gai satay) and they were amazing. The skewers were very tender, juicy and flavourful.
I tried their Pad Gra Prow in both pork and crispy pork. Personally I really preferred the crispy pork. It was crunchy, juicy and tender. The egg came put perfectly and the rice was delicious. 
I tried both the Goeng Klaw Wan (curry in a coconut and the Goeng Masaman (red curry). What stood out most to me was how rich each curry was. It was full bodied and creamy. I found myself tremendously impressed with the food. Medium spicy was fine by the way. 
Service:
This is a bit of a difficult topic. They are very busy and popular. They try their best to accommodate but because of the traffic, I found that while the faces were friendly, it was hard to find my server. Getting drinks or refills was difficult because it's very noisy, and the waiters/waitresses are constantly on the go. 
Ambience:
I love the decor. It's very spacious inside. There is loud upbeat music playing. This is not the kind of restaurant you want to go to for a quiet conversation. You will find yourself using your outdoor voice to communicate. The patio might be a better option for conversation.

A dark, hectic, loud basement that is surprisingly large. Service is excellent and when it's busy you have the choice of a shared table which adds to the communal experience.
There could be a wait but there is a holding bar so it's not so bad. Bottom line, food is absolutely spectacular. Most other reviewers seem to agree so I won't go on.  A must if you're in Toronto.

Overrated and overpriced. We came here with high hopes of enjoying good thai food at around 3 PM on a Saturday. We had to wait at least 20 minutes for a table but it was fine since you could enjoy a drink at the bar while waiting. When it was time, we finally got seated in a small table. Our waiter was barely paying attention even though we were sitting right next to cashier. The food came out and the portions were small for the price. I didn't really enjoy my meal as there was barely any meat and more curry than anything. When we were done with our meal, I was still hungry so you can tell how small the portions were... It was definitely not worth the money.

Now that my office moved closer to Pai (I used to be located closer to Sukhothai on Wellington), i often go to Pai for take out (via Ritual). I've tried other thai restaurants in the city and nothing even comes close.
