My go-to is their pad thai, often opting to add shrimp to my chicken pad thai. Servings are always filling and never disappoint. 
I prefer Sukhothai only because they have cashew chicken and calamari (both fantastic!),  so their menu is different, but they both have pad thai :) 
Highly recommend reservations especially during peak times like lunch and after work. Otherwise be prepared to wait,  because the food is that good!

This American fell in love with Canada during her work trip! Such a diverse city with diverse flavors, such as Thai! This restaurant was recommended by a food blogger friend based in Toronto and her review to me was accurate! I went for lunch after working hard at an event and it certainly hit the spot! It was crowded for lunch so you know it's a popular joint! 
We wanted the traditional seating to get the entire experience. Must say our legs cramped up after a while but at least we experienced it!! 
I tried various versions of pad Thai and all were very flavorful. 
I recommend ordering tea on a cold day. The shared pot of green tea sure did warm these Floridians up!
The location is very close to CN Tower and Union Station, so easy to walk to. Not so easy to Uber to with the construction right now.

We loved Pai Kitchen! We were vacationing in Downtown Toronto and this was the first restaurant we ate during our stay. We decided to go here because of the great reviews and I'm GLAD we did. We ordered the beef curry, pad Thai, and egg rolls. Food had the right amount of spice and was freshly made. I would have given 5 stars if the staff would have been a little more attentive and friendly.

This place is obnoxious, overpriced, food is repetitive.
The ambiance is super cheesy and tries to be a dive bar. It is full of hipsters. Another example of a Toronto spot trying way too hard to be NYC. Get your own identity.
The prices are just silly. You get two winglets for 10$. Not even the whole wing! You can't even share something like that. The bigger dishes are just full of filler like fried taro. Everything seems to have the same flavour base of a coconut curry with some basil. 
Very boring place.

This place is amazing! The atmosphere is trendy and cute. The food is so good. The best pad Thai I've ever had! I highly recommend going here. They have thai iced tea and amazing cocktails. I feel this is a hidden place but I'm so glad I found this place on Yelp because it was the best place I ate during my Toronto weekend!

I came here at 4 pm on a Friday and it's super packed. I sat by the bar and the waiter was very nice and communicative. I ordered spring rolls and regular Tom Yum soup with rice. The spring rolls came pretty fast and it was delicious. The Tom Yum Soup however, was served a little warmer than cold.  I had to ask the waiter to heat it up for me.... the waiter was very nice to return it back to the kitchen and then brought it back to me. The second time it was warmer than the first time - but yet not as good or hot enough for me and the last time I had it a year ago.

Oh... My gosh. I can't overstate how amazing this place is. The décor is funky and interesting, the space is massive, the service is quick and efficient, and the price point is absolutely more than reasonable. My boyfriend and I got two apps, four drinks, and two mains - the bill came out to $100. Especially considering the quality, this was an incredibly pleasant surprise.
For apps, we got the garlic shrimp and chicken skewers. Both were fantastic. The shrimp were generous sizes and came with an incredible sauce that was sweet and a bit sour and overall perfectly complemented the shrimp. The chicken was juicy and came with a peanut sauce my boyfriend and I basically fought over, and a cucumber sauce that was refreshing and tangy.
For mains, I got the chicken green curry in a coconut. My boyfriend got the beef pad thai. We were both beyond excited and groaning with delight through pretty much every bite. The pad thai was medium spicy but nothing over the top, and I got my curry mild spicy because I wasn't sure just how spicy the medium would be. The chili oil we got on the side helped me bring it up to a good spiciness although next time I'll definitely go for the medium. For context, I put scotch bonnet sauce on pretty much everything, if that helps give an idea of my spice tolerance.
Drink-wise, we both got the shot that was on special (the raptor, which was basically just stoli but with an "herb blend" that we couldn't actually taste, lol. Fine by me as vodka is a personal preference of mine). Boyfriend got the STEIN (aka huge amount) of Sapporo which is on special Sundays and Mondays, and I got the Lowry - effectively a gin mojito, absolutely filled to the gills with mint. It was delicious and dangerous, since I couldn't taste the gin at all despite it being 1.5oz. 
We waited maybe 5 minutes (this was on a Monday at 6pm), and were out the door within about an hour, I'd say. The place was full but the staff were totally on their A-game, and at no point did I have to wonder "where's our server?"
Basically, by the end of the meal we had very, VERY enthusiastically determined this was our favourite restaurant in the city. It'll be hard to go anywhere else on date night now.

Our concierge at the hotel suggested we try this restaurant - particularly because my friend is gluten free. It was terrific! He warned us that there would be lines and a bit of a wait, but we arrived around 5:40 pm on a Friday and waited only 5 minutes. They had just opened two seating areas so the traffic flowed fast. I had Pad Thai and my friend had curry. Both were incredible. I also had the Kawain Punch. It was good and refreshing. The atmosphere was incredible and we didn't want to leave! It did get loud so we finally headed out. Very good food and excellent device.

So the only bad thing I ha r to say is I don't live in a Canada I'm a New Yorker. Best Thai food I've ever had and I love Thai food. If I lived here I'd frequent Pai weekly ! Best Thai for I've ever had. The cocktails were decent too.

Visiting Canada as a tourist and getting awesome food feels awesome.
Amazing Thai cuisine. Loved the ambience. Very busy place but was worth waiting for 20-25 mins for the delicious food. 
Veg and tofu Thai curry - served in coconut. Very rich taste of the curry. Lots of veggies and tofu.
Khao soi - Had this first time and it was sooooo delicious. Chicken was so tendered and the curry was very very tasty. 
Mango sticky rice - OMG! Haven't had better mangoes then this place. 
I hope they open in Philadelphia!!!!

The hype is real for this one.. sorta. 
I tried almost everything off their appetizers and their appetizers are to die for! Their fried shrimp and a spring roll like item (totally blanking out on names now) are absolutely divine. We loved the chicken wings too. I would visit again just for the appetizers. 
Now for the entrees .. my fiancé and I both got the famous khao soi and it was not good. The bowl was huge but there were so little noodles inside and the curry was way too salty. I do not understand why people are raving about this dish.

This is my #1 place to get pad thai. I love pad thai and I've been in search of a place for years that can compare. 
Atmosphere is really nice, great place to go with friends. There's always a line-up to get in, so you know it's good.
Food: Deeelicous!
I think this is probably the best place in the city to get Thai, if you disagree with me please tell me what compares cuz I'd love to try! haha.

Excellent Thai in a super cool setting. You enter into to the restaurant head downstairs and observe that it is definitely a popular place. We were very fortunate to get a table on walk in. The crowd is very Toronto downtown. Urban, many young professionals and people looking and sounding like they were having a good time. It sure was a boisterous place. The scents in the air of coconut curry's and delicious Thai food get the salivary glands dripping. 
What I came here with laser focus was to try the Khao Soi. Where I live in MTL Khao Soi is pretty much non existent. The creamy flavours and spices is what I was seeking. Man oh man was it decadent, rich a bit sweeter than I've had it before however delicious non the less. We really enjoyed the dish. Also we had ordered the chicken satay and a Pad Thai (which my daughter could eat some). The satay was creamy and the peanut sauce I could lick the serving plate clean it was that good. However I try to keep some composure especially in a fine dining establishment such as this. The pad Thai was creamy as well. Overall everything was good. I'd agree with another reviewer that they tend to put a bit more sugar in the dishes here as people tend to enjoy this more in North America. It was decadent and rich.
Service was really friendly and accommodating. At first they put us at a table in the corner. Than another table opened up sitting cross legged style and we asked if we could move to this. The accommodated and it was appreciated. Lots of very interesting nice Thai accents through out the restaurant. Definitely a winner and high quality Thai food!

Heard great things about Pai, so made plans to visit while in Toronto and booked a reservation ahead of time.The vibe of the place is interesting - almost like a grunge meets hipster with a dash of asian. 
Service was fine. Food was fine. Prices seemed on the high end for Thai food, but the $ matches the feel/ambiance they're going for.
Not sure if I've just been spoiled by the Asian food in California, but overall we left feeling underwhelmed based on the reviews and the hype.

I came here with a friend for a birthday lunch and tried the khao soi. Now I usually don't finish my food (I'm a snacker) but I ate the WHOLE thing it was so good. I also had the mango sticky rice for dessert, which made me pretty darn happy. This is a great place to have authentic thai food and just to hang out with a friend. The decor is mismatched with a cohesive feel. Just go forth and enjoy good thai food!

From what I understand, Pai is brought to you by some of the same people who launched Khao San Road. I came in here for a late lunch (2:30pm). Craving Thai food, KSR was closed, which made Pai a welcome addition to the neighborhood. At 2:30pm, the restaurant only had a few tables with guests so we had our pick. Although there weren't many patrons, service was slow. When we walked in, there were 3 waiters who passed menus to each other until one of them agreed to seat us.
It took a while to get someone to take our order. I ordered the Thai iced tea and the green curry. It took a long time for the iced tea to be delivered. The iced tea comes with crushed ice, likely because it's super sweet. Granted it's really good, but once you start getting closer to the bottom it gets sweeter. The green curry was very tasty and reminded me of the curry at KSR.
Overall the food is excellent. The service on the other hand could use some work.

Haven't had much Thai food in Toronto but I'm glad we stumbled upon this place.  The decor is really nice inside, makes you feel like you're in a Thai market.  The food here is insane.  We ordered 5 different dishes to share with the table and I cannot think of a single dish that disappointed.  My favorite overall was the Laap salad(recommended by the server).  Come here with a big group, have a few drinks or sake bombs, and enjoy the delicious food.

When you walk past the door and see dozens of people lining up outside a restaurant when there are plenty of other great choices within a few steps, you know there is something special about it. And Pai did not disappoint! As much of a struggle as it was to get down the narrow stairway to the crowded and noisy waiting area for our table with our stroller, once we were shown to our table through a labyrinth of dining rooms (the place is huge inside - don't let the tiny entrance fool you!) it was all amazing. The food was tasty, authentic, and unique. The service was quick, drinks were tasty, and the staff was friendly, helpful, and flexible!
This is definitely a must visit spot on Toronto if you enjoy Thai food, and are not intimidated by crowds and lines and patient enough to wait a few minutes for a table!

I've never eaten in the main restaurant, just the takeout market in the back. I believe there's only 4 or 5 things on the menu that change occasionally. They have picnic tables set up so you can eat there if you like, which we always do. I love the khao soi. You get a huge flavourful bowl. I'm stuffed by the time I leave. Service is quick and the staff are lovely. One of these days I will suck it up and stand in line for a table in the restaurant.

The best Thai in the city - I am likely 1/1000000 of all the reviews that shares this opinion. I've been going here since this opened and Pai has remained the top of my list of Thai eats. Sure, I hate waiting for my table because it is so busy but I can't blame everyone else there! Blindly pick anything on the menu and it will be worth it - here are a few of my favorites on the menu: 
GRABONG
CHEF NUIT PAD THAI
FRIED FISH
GAENG MASAMAN
PAD GRA PROW.

Not as good as the hype!
I was excited to try Pai after my experience at Khao San Road. However, we might have ordered the wrong dishes because I was not that impressed.
I highly recommend reservations. We went on a weekday for dinner and there was still a 20-30 min wait.
We sat at the bar. The bartender was very nice and offered recommendations. I noticed that he was probably new as he had two glasses as "examples" for how much liquid he should pour for the drinks (see pictures).
I got a Thai Iced Tea ($4.50). I would not recommend it - I felt like I had diabetes from drinking it. Also, it was not filled up to the top. I think he needs an example of the Thai iced tea drink to follow too!
The bartender suggested we try the Pad Gra Prow, beef with crispy pork. It did not live up to expectations. It was okay, I guess, but not great. For $15, it was a good enough portion for one person, but a bit expensive for some beef and pork on top of rice.
We also got the green curry, gaeng kiaw wan in a coconut, $15. We got mild spicy and it was more like a medium spicy, I think. Also, it needed more rice. There was so much curry that we were basically drinking a curry soup that had rice at the bottom. It came with a lot of stuff inside too: basil, shrimp, and bamboo shoots. There was so much that they had to put some shrimp in a separate bowl (according to the bartender). I liked this dish - very delicious - they scrape the inside of the coconut and put it in the curry too. I just think they should give more rice!!!
I think I would come back but not get the Thai iced tea and I would order what I know will be good. The Khao Soi, for example. I really regret the Thai Iced Tea. And next time I'll make reservations.

My friends and I have waited 3+ years to get into this restaurant. We make a trek to Toronto every year and Pai has either been closed for a holiday or had a massive wait every time we've visited. And then we discovered the online reservation booking system and finally got a reservation a month out for 3 pm on a Saturday afternoon. Hurrah! Having just heavily biked around Toronto, we were so hungry and could hardly wait to get our food. I was a little worried the food couldn't meet all the anticipation built up over the years. That was not the case. There wasn't a dish we ordered we didn't like. Of the dishes I ordered and tried of my friends', my favorites were the kha soi, green coconut curry, and tom yum. I loved the delicious texture from the bundle of crispy noodles on top of the kha soi. The coconut curry broth was so flavorful and had the perfect consistency. The green coconut curry was served in a coconut shell with extra curry that couldn't fit into the shell served on the side in a bowl. Flavors were also amazing. The Thai iced tea was perfect for such a hot afternoon. The server was friendly and didn't rush us despite the super long waiting line next to the door. Absolutely loved my experience at Pai, this is THE place to visit for amazing Thai food in Toronto!

TLDR: Five stars from someone who has lived close (ish) to Pai for four years and always defaults to it for Thai food.
The ambiance is great here, feels very streets-of-Thailand-esque, and has very cool decor. Note that it's always busy, for good reason, so be prepared to put your name down and wait! I've eaten here in person several times, but I get takeout on Ritual often to skip the line. 
As someone who frequents Pai, here is the verdict.
Must try: 
- Chef nuit pad thai: Generally you can judge a thai restaurant by how well they do their pad thai. The serving size is huge, so be mindful of that (it's great value)! Pai does a solid pad thai, and comes with either chicken, beef, pork, or tofu/veggies. All of the flavours are great, and is just the right amount of sauce and garnish!
- Khao soi: My personal favourite with braised beef. Egg noodles topped with a golden curry. 
- Thai iced tea: SO GOOD. Just do it.
- Tom yum soup: The presentation of this is cool, and it comes heated by flame! Tom yum soup is delicious, has a great kick of spice! They are also quite generous with the portions! 
Good dishes: 
- Green curry/panang curry: I find the curries are well made and have good taste, but lack a bit of imagination and you can get them at several other places! They are also a bit pricey ($16-$17) for what you get! 
- Chicken wings: These are good, but definitely not a highlight
Skip: 
- Pad Gra Prow: There's not too much to this dish, just rice, egg, either with ground pork, chicken, beef, or tofu. This feels like something you could make at home and a bit amateur, and definitely not worth the price! 
- Gai satay: I've definitely had better, and it's a bit pricey for a couple skewers.

I loveeeee Pai! It is one of my go-to Thai places in the city. 
My go to order is Gaeng Kiaw Wan, a green curry served in a coconut. They usually give you additional green curry in a bowl because the coconut is so small, but I love scraping the coconut meat and eating it with the curry. Note that if you order take out, the green curry will not come in a coconut. Their grabong (deep fried squash fritters) is also delicious and addictive!
My only complaint is that it is too popular and there are often long waits on Thursday & Fridays evenings and weekends. Get there early or be prepared for a fairly long wait!

Phenomenal. I do believe that this is one of the best Thai restaurants that I've been to. The Vegan Pad Thai was FABULOUS! They have some
Great options for vegans! Love the ambiance too. Such a vibe. Try it out!

This is probably the worst service I've encountered in Toronto. I wanted to come on a public holiday, because everything else in the neighborhood was closed, and I tried calling several times but no one answered. When I arrived, the hostess gave me the worst attitude, asking, "So do you want to wait or not?"
Beyond that, the atmosphere is incredibly dark and so noisy that you cannot possibly have a conversation.
Hipsters only.

I've recently discovered a newfound love for Thai food. I've been trying out some new Thai dishes from various restaurants and have thoroughly enjoyed them all but I can honestly say, none of them compare to Pai.
I would consider Pai one of my new favourite restaurants in Toronto. The food is spectacular and mouthwatering. They offer a small menu but don't let that fool you, everything is made to perfection and will leave you wanting more. My friends and I got as starters, the spring rolls and the thai chicken wings and for mains, the Thai Fried Rice. I loved the fried rice and although it may seem a simple dish for some, I felt that everything was cooked to a high level of quality and taste. My friends loved it as well and the starters were a great addition to the main! My friends preferred the chicken wings to the spring roll but they couldn't keep their hands away from their fried rice.
I couldn't even take a photo because we were all too excited to start eating but trust me, get the chicken wings and the fried rice if you're there. You won't regret it. In terms of decor, I like how Pai's underground type of vibe gives the place a more intimate and personal feel. When you come out of the restaurant, it makes it seem like you were in another world for a few hours. You get so accustomed to enjoying the dark, somber lighting with its creative art pieces strewn around that stepping out into the busy downtown streets comes as a shock. I think the best place to go to Pai to avoid the busy lineups is around 1:30-2:00pm -- we got there around this time and got a seat very fast as well as avoided a packed restaurant. 
I can't wait to bring my friends and family here and have them try this amazing restaurant. Thank you Pai for making my lunch and my friends' lunches so enjoyable!

The pai thai is the best I have ever had.  Even better than Thailand.   We loved the curry chicken and the spring rolls and the Thom Young soup all amazing.   The prices are reasonable and the the staff so helpful.  Specialty drinks also great deal and so creative.  Don't be scared off by the wait.  Line moves very fast and you won't regret waiting.  We shared food with strangers at our table that became friends before the night was over.   Can't wait to go back!

DO NOT take your chinese parents to PAI!!!! 
I took my dad for a green curry, he said it was like spicy soup with a couple of meat that charges 17 dollars.... what can I say, PAI has changed. Taste was not as good as the last few times I was there:(

Hands down the best Thai restaurant you can find in Toronto Imo. Everything on their menu tastes delicious and authentic. Chef Regular prides herself on using the best ingredients possible to recreate the food of her native country. Her efforts shine through in the cuisine here, as you'll be hard pressed to find a dish that doesn't leave a lasting impression. 
My favourite item here is probably the Khao Soi. It is rich in flavour with an amazing balance of savory and sweetness. The consistency always seems to be perfect as well-never too watery or oily for a broth. Combined with large tender chunks of protein (chicken or beef), this dish is an absolute winner at Pai. 
The Pad Thai here is also very good. Probably second only to the signature one at Khao San Road. I love the flavour of its tamarind sauce, but I wasn't a fan of the cabbage that came on the side. It gave the dish some texture but took away from its flavour Imo. Good thing it came on the side, so that it's optional to mix in with the noodles =) 
Last item of note is the Thai Iced Tea. Unlike most Thai restaurants that serve this drink, I found the one at Pai to be less sweet and more enjoyable as a result. Mine came with crushed ice that was refreshing to drink through the straw as well =D
Overall, you need to eat at Pai if you love Thai food! Try to make a reservation online if you can, as walk in wait times can be frustrating at this popular joint.

I have always heard good things about this place. A friend of mine and I tried to walk in on a Friday night without a reservation, big mistake. Although, months later I finally got the chance to try it out. I went on a weekday right when it opened, and there was not much of a crowd. 
I had the 'Chef Nuit Pad Thai' with chicken. My friend had the 'Thai Fried Rice'. We loved them both. I was able to finish my pad thai considering the portion was just around the normal side (not too big, not too little). I was expecting a bigger selection on the menu. 
The environment was super casual and chill during the day. The service was a little slow, but the staff was super friendly nonetheless. 
I would definitely come back to try their desserts.

The line to get checked in was out the door. There's still a 20-30 minute wait after.
Attentive servers, food came out quick. Had the Pai Pad Thai and Pai sangria. The sangria consisted of lychees at the bottom, however was a little weak on the alcohol. But the pad Thai was redeeming. You get to choose from 4 different spice levels. The dish overall was flavourful and wouldn't mind a repeat.

Amazing flavours. Bustling environment. Excellent service. 
My belly left happy after a great dinner and the restaurant ambience was just the cherry on top. This place is loud, dimly lit, and very trendy. The typical wait is around 15-20 minutes during peak hours though that isn't that long compared to other restaurants. 
Gai Satay ($12.50) 5 Marinated Grilled Chicken Skewers - Served with a nice peanut sauce and tangy cucumber/garlic/lime/chili sauce on the side, these skewers were such a flavourful and tender app. 
Chef Nuit Pad Thai ($15.50) - This is THE staple dish at any Thai restaurant though Pai does it well. Stuck on what to order? Get this. The rice noodles had the perfect texture and wasn't too mushy plus it had a good amount of protein in it. My only complaint is that I could've devoured a bigger plate for the price.  
Khao Pad Thamada ($14) Fried Rice w/ Egg, Green Onion, your choice of protein - So delish! The rice was so fragrant and not bland whatsoever. If you like garlic, tangy, and sweet - this is the dish for you. It's served with nam prik nam pla sauce (fish sauce, garlic, chili, and lime) which you can choose to drizzle on yourself. 
Tip: One main is a good size per person so don't expect to get full if you share one dish with a buddy. Their portions are just the right amount per person.

Came in for lunch on a Friday and the place was absolutely packed! The place was fairly busy and rather loud but the food was extremely delicious and very flavourful! Two noteworthy starters are the spring rolls and the deep fried chicken wings - both are super crispy. In terms of the level of spicyness, I'd say not to worry too much. I generally don't tolerate spice too well, and their medium is still very approachable!
Their green curry is no longer served in a coconut but it's still delicious!

We saw this restaurant upon our return from Byblos the night earlier and there was a line out front so we figured that it must be good and worth waiting for. We took a chance and asked our concierge to make a reservation for us which we got at 8pm, so we got lucky! When we arrived, we walked right in and were surprised by the sheer size of the location. Since we had our hotel hook us up, we were grateful since we didn't have to line up at this highly recommended place a few mins from our hotel. I asked the host when we were being seated what he recommends, and we decided to order entrees only. We ordered the Penang curry with chicken that comes with white rice and it was pretty good as could taste the kaffir lime and basil leaves. We also ordered pad gra prow, holy basil stir fry with a fried egg on top of minced chicken and it was very good. We all agreed the best dish was the pad Thai with shrimp, stir fry rice noodle with tamarind sauce, it had just the right balance of fish sauce and was absolutely delicious. Our server and the restaurant was very busy. The decor was charming as they had vintage pieces through out and vintage rock stars hung up on the walls. So glad we had a chance to try it on our long wknd trip to T-town.

Time for a quick-ish lunch, but not wanting to go to the food court or underground walkways in the entertainment district? Check out Pad Northern Thai Kitchen.
Walked over from my office on University Ave. with a long-time friend, while I was Toronto for meetings.  #3 (at the time) lunch restaurant within a 10X10 block radius (may be higher now).
At the tail end of the typical lunch window (1:50pm) and the place was still bustling.
Waitress gave us a quick walkthrough of the lunch menu, and we ordered the first two things she described:
1) CHEF NUIT PAD THAI (always get the Pad Thai for the first time at a Thai restaurant) 
- stir fried rice noodles, house-made tamarind sauce, beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, Thai coriander, fresh lime, home roasted peanuts.  We chose chicken as the proteing.
2) PAD GRA PROW (northern Thai recipe)
- holy basil stir fried with your choice of ground pork, chicken, beef or tofu, steamed jasmine rice, thai style fried egg, nam prik nam pla sauce
Both were excellent, with medium spice.  Service was timely and helpful.
Win, lose or thai.....this was a win.
Will be back.

Cannot say enough good things about this place. when we went we went with a friend who had a food allergy and they were so accommodating and were very careful to let us know if anything had peanuts in it. The service was excellent! The only downside was it took a while to get into the restaurant. This place is so popular that normal you have to wait an hour just to get seated. But if you are willing to Wait, it is for sure worth it! I would highly recommend and the story of the restaurant itself is cute as well. Throughout the restaurant there is decor that tells the story of how the restaurant got started and who the owners are. A really charming place that has really authentic food.

I have been back to Pai for many times after the first review and it never disappoints me and my dates.  I have tried different items on the menu in each visit and they are all tasty. I love Thai spicy level and I can taste different depths of spice in each dish. 
The service and kitchen management have improved and stabilized since the grand opening. Lunch is very fast even though it is always full. The best thing is it takes reservation; therefore, it makes one of my regular lunch celebration spot with my friends and coworkers. If I didn't make reservation, I would go before noon to try to get a seat at the bar. 
Another one good thing is there are a lot of choices of food that you can share with friends. Food decor / container and placement are beautiful; they always look good in photos. :)
Extremely flavourful. Signature dishes are worth it. A little pricy but what isn't now days

Khao San Road and Sukho Thai. Those were the two Thai restaurants I'm most familiar with in Downtown Toronto, and was extremely satisfied with both restaurants. I decided to try Pai, after reading reviews on Yelp and BlogTO on the fact this restaurant is on par with the two Thai restaurant kings mentioned above.
The signs outside this restaurant almost threw me off. When I saw the up arrows outside, I thought the restaurant was on the second floor! I was searching for a good 10 seconds for the stairs, but didn't manage to find any...then I saw the stairs heading down. Boy, I'm really confused now. I made sure the stairs heading down were the ones to the restaurant, and sure enough it was.
Service was slow pretty much from the point I entered the restaurant and throughout the whole time I was there. It took a good 3 minutes for me to be seated, and the restaurant wasn't exactly full when I was there. It also took a good 5 minutes for a server to come by and ask for what drink I wanted, to the point I ordered the food with the drink just to save some time.
The food came out at a decent pace though. I ordered the Chef Nuit pad thai mild, and it tasted excellent! I would say better than Khao San Road given price factor, but I still prefer Sukho Thai a bit more. The peanut ratio was actually perfect as well; I had some restaurants where they put way too much peanuts to the point it warps the taste of the pad thai itself.
I'll give it 4 stars because the food really was excellent, but if you're coming during peak hours expect to be seated at least an hour; the service here really is slow.
Free wifi! Ask for password.

Everyone talks about how great Pai is, but to be honest it's really quite average. I live a few minutes walk from the restaurant and will sometimes get take out or a lunch special out of convenience. The Pad Thai is overly sweet and the flavors too overwhelming. I have been to Thailand three times and the food there does not taste this way. I'd say there are definitely better options out there that doesn't require such a crazy wait.

This is my favourite Thai restaurant I have ever been to. Normally I get the Green Thai Curry with chicken when my friend and I visit this spot. It's our favourite to go to. Last time we went they were out of Green Curry. I decided to try something new and went with the Massaman Curry. Amazing! This place feels like its own underground world, its winds further and further under the street level. Sometimes a long wait, but worth it!

Food was great, though I feel like it's a bit overhyped. You can definitely find similar food for cheaper in Toronto. While the fried squash and pad thai were amazing, I found the curry just average and the portion for it a bit small.

This place is worth the wait! Despite the busy weekend traffic and the 45-minute wait, I was truly impressed with the food. 
I ordered the Grabong and Gai Satay as starters and neither dish disappointed. 
I absolutely loved the Khao Soi. This dish was spectacular and felt authentically Thai. It tasted exactly like the ones I've had in Chang Mai. I was impressed. 
The decor and ambiance was very cool as well. Highly recommend.
Pai never disappoints ;) Chicken wings, pad gra prow and shrimp fried rice are my go tos...
Great Thai good!! Love the pad gra prao snd khao soi!! Comparable to my experience in Chang Mai

This was my first time in this restaurant, atmosphere was cool, Kao Sui was just amazing, creamy coconut curry sauce, beef, egg noodles and fried noodles. Some of my colleagues have been here several times, they had fried rice and were happy with their choice. It was quite crowded during weekday lunch time, to beat the crowd try to be there as soon as they open at 11:30am. Bon appetite!!!
Delicious. Best pad thai and pad see ew in Toronto

Oh my goodness. This is one of the best thai places that I've ever tried. Food is delicious and flavourful! The presentation was executed pretty well. The wait time is quite long if you don't have reservations. 
The ambiance is dark and quite loud. Good for small gatherings. Authentic, very hip and cool place.
Food:
Grabong: freshly shredded buttercup squash fritters, red curry paste batter, sweet garlic tamarind dip, peanuts
- SO GOOD! MUST TRY!! good for sharing
Chef Nuit Pad Thai: stir fried rice noodles, house-made tamarind sauce, beansprouts, tofu, egg, chives, Thai coriander, fresh lime, home roasted peanuts, choice of chicken, beef or tofu and veggies
- AH DROOLS. The flavour is just an explosion in my mouth.
Khao Soi: fresh egg noodles, golden curry, crispy noodles, coriander, green onions, choice of braised beef, chicken breast or chicken drumsticks
- Super yummy - very rich and creamy! Also filling.
Green Curry: green curry, bamboo shoots, kaffir lime leaves, basil leaves, green peppers, coconut milk, choice of chicken, beef, pork, fish, or tofu and veggies, served in a coconut
- oh my, very refreshing! You can taste the freshness from the basil leaves and lime. The sauce base is light and and delicious. 
In terms of pricing, it's a bit high compared to other restaurants. It's worth it though. A must try especially if you're in the area.

I came here yesterday evening with some co-workers. We were a fairly large group with a reservation, so we were taken to a side room. I should note that there were quite a few people who were waiting.
The seats were pretty close to each other, so it allowed for more intimate conversation. The waiter was really nice, letting us take our time to order. 
The food took some time to come out (partially due to both how hungry we were and how large the group was), but everyone's food came out at the same time. It all looked, and tasted, delicious. The meat in the Khao Soi was tender. The soup at the end was a nice touch.
I'd definitely come again, but I'd be wise about the time, as it can get busy quickly.

5 stars because the food is good, the service is great and the atmosphere is lively. Pai is known for long wait times and fully booked reservations but luckily we only had to wait about 10 minutes to get seated for Sunday dinner (though we shared a table). A main dish here costs $15 minimum and it makes me want to go back to Thailand for $2 pad thai.

I found this place because it was most reviewed on yelp. The restaurant is located in a basement. I sat at the bar and ordered the khao soi- egg noodles in curry topped with crispy noodles, coriander, green onions and braised beef. Egg noodles are not my preferred choice, but I enjoyed the curry. There was also plenty of tender pieces of beef to be found. I can see why this restaurant is so popular.

Soup is good,  mild spicy and fresh lime taste,  with shrimp mushroom veggies. perfect for winter. 
However the chef Nhui pad Thai is very oily and sweet. Maybe good for some people, but personally feel too much sauce.

Beautiful presentation. Long line ups that prove the food is incredible. Nice staff. Great location. I would come back here in a heartbeat. The curry was mouthwatering and was served in a coconut! I absolutely loved my time here. Check it out! Come for lunch or before 5:30 if you can. Lineups really do get long. Food is totally worth the wait though.

We came in for dinner a little past 8:30pm on a Thursday night without reservation - we lucked out and got a table for four relatively quickly, the line-up got pretty busy shortly after we were seated.  
Tip: Make a reservation on their website as the place gets packed!
Atmosphere: The restaurant had a cozy, marketplace feel.  Super lively.  
Service: Our server was friendly, and gave us several recommendations that we went with.  She came by to advise us before she ended her shift which was professional, and appreciated!
Food: We shared the Grabong ($14, shredded squash fritters served with a sweet garlic dip) for starter - it was interesting and I wanted to love them more because I do love my fries, but they came out a bit flaccid.  For our main, we got the Khao Soi ($16.5, fresh egg noodles in golden curry with braised beef).  We went with Medium spice level, and I don't think I would go beyond that level because it had quite the kick!  The curry was extremely flavourful and I especially loved that they topped it up with crispy noodles.  I would go back to Pai for that bowl alone!  Our second main was Pad Gra Prow ($18.5), we chose to go with the crispy pork.  It was a bit on the greasy side but that's what crispy pork is about right? ;) We also ordered the Thai iced tea ($5.5) which was a nice complement for a full Thai meal experience.  
Price: Reasonable
Overall: Will I go back? Yes!

Over 2700 reviews...clearly you're going here!! But let's chat anyway. There will be a wait unless you have a reservation, we went during mid day on Saturday and there was a line but the wait was not that bad. Most importantly you can order drinks at the bar - I got the Lowry, super refreshing!
Food (mmmm): 
For appetizers we got the Gai Satay (the peanut sauce was just right) and Northern Thai Sausage were both flavorful!!  And as great as these were the Hunglay Oxtails and Pad Gra Prow were even better!! We got a really good serving of oxtails and they were very tender. We got the ground pork pad gra prow and on first bite we were very pleased. 
You've read in other reviews that the service can be slow but everyone was so nice and helpful with explaining the menu and providing favorites. In all this big and busy place serves up some great comfort food and I would definitely go back. Enjoy!

We came here for lunch excited to see what it was all about. I didn't foresee it being downstairs with a lively, somewhat loud, atmosphere. 
After the initial orders and having our food served I felt we were sort of an after thought and forgotten about. It may have been a shift change but that is really no excuse. 
The food itself was good but nothing super. The papaya salad was tasty but not quite spiced up to the level I expected. The panang curry had good flavor and probably a dish I'd order again.

So much yums in one meal! 
He took me here when he heard I've never been because apparently it's one of the gems in the city, & to be honest, I've never been to a thai restaurant.. I know, I know.. shocker! 
The place is underground and it's cute as hell. Decor reminds me of going away to thailand or some exotic place. Dim lights, romantic setting.. it was perf. Definitely a perfect place to bring your ladies, gentlemen! We didn't make a reservation (oops lol) and we ended up having to wait an hour but it didn't matter because we just walked around the area.. I'd say it was worth the wait! They text you when your table is ready and you have 5 minutes, so don't walk away too fast. 
They have options that can be made vegan, which he made sure for me before he picked the place. So awesome. I had the green curry vegan dish (tofu/veggies) and it was served inside a young coconut, which I loved. The aesthetic was real. With the jasmine rice, it was perf. He had some other rice dish.. honestly I can't recall because I was so fixated on my own deal. It had a fried egg on it though.. and he finished it all, so clearly it was good. Huge portions! 
Service was quick and friendly, which is always appreciated.
Pai, you are the apple of my eye.

I came here during lunch hour on a weekday and it quickly filled up within 30 minutes. By the time I left there was a queue waiting for seats. Service is excellent and quick. Atmosphere is busy.
For my dish I chose Green Curry again. I believe the level of spice is predetermined now whereas in the past you were allowed to choose your level. As such it's not as spicy, but still has a good kick. The coconut taste blends well. There is a healthy portion of eggplant.The portion is great -- the steamed rice soaks in the curry sauce very well. You could almost have another bowl of rice to indulge yourself.

THE restaurant you need to visit when in downtown Toronto -- Pai is basically a landmark here, must see, must do/eat. It's as much about the experience here as about the food. Don't be intimidated by the subtle exterior; with just a modest "PAI" sign it can be tricky to find. But inside is a much different kind of experience -- music is modern and pretty loud, makes the restaurant feel more casual and a bit club-like, so not the best place to come with families or children. The staff are very attentive and down to earth despite how crazy busy they are. Be prepared for a wait if you try to come during peak hours (11am-1pm lunchtime and 6pm onward). Depending on how many people in your party the wait can be up to an hour. With 1-2 people the wait is generally within 30 minutes. The restaurant is large, but it is so packed. There are shared common tables, individual tables, and bar seating. Bar seating is a great option for 1-3 people!
The food. Actually, if you're simply coming for the food, I'd recommend checking out Sukhothai, which is owned by the same people (?) but is somewhat less busy (usually no wait). The food options and quality are pretty much the same. Must-order mains are the khao soi (try it with the braised beef, sooo tender and well seasoned), green curry, pad Thai, and pad gra pow. I very strongly recommend the khao soi -- you will want to chug the entire bowl of curry broth. I've also ordered the ox tail here before on their dinner menu. In conclusion the red meats are very well made here. For appetizers I strongly recommend the squash fritters, but unfortunately those are only available at dinner time. For lunch today we tried the papaya salad. The papaya salad itself was well made, retained the fresh papaya taste without hints of added sugar (I hate that) and was made more interesting with the addition of green beans, dried shrimp, and tomatoes. It's definitely for sharing as it's a huge plate that also comes with shrimp chips and rice noodles, etc. 
In the past I've tried their desserts -- not sure if the coconut based ice cream was seasonal, but it was my favourite. Came with many interesting toppings and was so dense. The mango sticky rice was also noteworthy, but nothing extraordinary.
Overall, Pai is my favourite Thai place in town. Not the most authentic or healthy, but definitely a place to indulge in good food and good company.

I've been here a few times. It's my favourite Thai restaurant.  I've enjoyed everything I've ordered (I've tried most items on the menu).  
Sometimes, there's a long wait to get a table here. It's best to make a reservation when possible.

I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE did I mention LOOOOOOOOOVE this place!! So good I drive here all the way from mississauga. 
They have an amazing Pad Thai that can also be made vegan which is not as easy as you may think (for it to still taste good that is!) 
Everything I've had here was amazing, spring rolls, pad Thai, dessert, green curry just TRY EVERYTHING! 
They are packed on weekends and do not take reservations :( which is my only issue here. But then again the place isn't very big so I understand. 
The vibe of the inside is super cool too, looks like the streets of a Thai market. 
I also found out they even have a private room you can book for events and large groups. 
If you haven't been here yet and are contemplating it, stop thinking! JUST GO! You won't regret it!

The food was really good! 
I got the Vegetarian dish and it was really good
The sangria here is AMAZINGGGG you deff have to try that out

I definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Toronto. Great atmosphere and fantastic food! We got there right at the restaurant opened at 3 pm and it was already packed, and now we can see why. The appetizers were excellent, we got the spring rolls and the grabong. The service was quick and everyone that attended us was extremely nice. For our entrees we got the pad Thai, khao soi, green curry, and Tom yum soup. To be honest, the green curry was not my favorite but other people in the restaurant seem to enjoy it. My personal favorite was the Pad Thai. All the other dishes were exceptional as well and next time I come to Toronto I will definitely be back!

This is one of the best Thai restaurants in downtown Toronto! I've been here twice and both times were on a weekend. I would make a reservation if possible but it seems like their reservations are usually full except for a few odd times like in between lunch and dinner or really late at night. I only had to wait 15 minutes for the one time I went on a Sunday for dinner. The decor in the restaurant is super cute - it's a great spot for dates! To top it off, the customer service is really good!
As for the food, I've tried the pad Thai, the squash fritters (it's on the menu with a Thai name that I don't remember, but there's English descriptions under each food item), khao soi, chicken wings, Thai milk tea, and non-alcoholic ginger beer. My favourite dish was the squash fritters! I highly recommend - it's one of their most popular dishes. They give quite a bit so it might be a little too much for two people. The chicken wings come with a Thai sauce that is the same as the ones they give for the fritters so I wouldn't recommend getting that sauce with the wings if you also order the fritters. The dish comes with three wings, but you have the option to add a fourth if you're sharing. The Thai milk tea here is my favourite. They use crushed ice and the flavour is amazing! Also for those who are environmentally friendly, you'll be happy to know that they don't serve the drink with any straws (they were using paper straws but they've taken that out since the first time I visited the restaurant).
Love this restaurant - you definitely have to go this place a try! And it probably won't just be your first and last time there!

There is no service at this restaurant.
Okay, to be fair, there is very scant service. When I reviewed the many reviews on this restaurant, majority of complaints were about the lack of service. 
How sad that the owner(s) doesn't get this right.
They've got a great thing going on here.
Unfortunately, if the management doesn't realize why the cheese cake factory spends millions of dollars on employee training, this restaurants future is doomed.
Everything is good - some of my favourite Thai food in the city! Love their pad gra prow

Pai is definitely worth the hype, a must try!!
After several friends recommended this restaurant we finally decided to make the trip downtown to try it, and here's my review of Pai:
Mains and Apps: 5*: 
Golden curry dish with fresh and fried egg noodle was delicious.  The curry flavour was unique and flavourfull.  Came with around 6 to 8 shrimps which was generous in my opinion.
Green curry chicken in young coconut dish was delish.  Especially scraping off the meat inside the coconut and mixing it with the curry.  Comes with rice, and if the curry doesn't all fit into the coconut they will give you a seperate bowl for the rest.
Thai Chicken wings was also very nicely marinated, crispy, and juicy.  $5.50 for only 3 wings (not whole wing, the winglette part only) is a bit pricey though, I think it should come standard with 4 pieces, had to pay $2 ectra for 1 more wing.
Drinks 5*: Thai Iced Tea was great and came in a large sized cup with ice.
Dessert 5*: Mango Sticky Rice: myst tey dessert!  Comes with 2 big pieces of mango and the rice was yummy.
Place 5*: not fancy but a great casual atmosphere.  Makes you feel like you are in Thailand, well done with the decor.
Service 4*: only complaint is that food orders came out quite slow.  Apoetizee and drink came almost instantly but main dishes took 30+ mins.  We also ordered a Pad Thai for takeout and for some reason, that came early while the food we were eating there took much longer.  Also be prepared to wait for seating, quite a line up even at 4pm on a Saturday.
Overall, would love to come back and try more dishes.

Came here with high expectations after hearing many recommendations from friends but left slightly disappointed.
Wait time was about 20 minutes before we got seated which was expected on a weekend night. What really blew us off was the service - after being sat down in a corner seat, we had servers walk by us more than TEN times over the course of 25 minutes, to which all of them decided to ignore us even with us waving them down. We were seated for 35 minutes and did not receive a single acknowledgement from any server - I had to get out of my seat, walk to the front desk and ask for a server to come and take our order. 
Although this whole ordeal left us with a bad taste in our mouths, the food was great. I tried the thai fried rice with beef - although not the best I've had, definitely still up there. The thai iced tea was amazing, very authentic yet not too sweet.
Would revisit solely for the food. Hopefully the service is better next time around!
The Pad Thai turned out great even though I got it delivered. It also goes well with the Thai Iced Coffee.

Believe the hype: the food was so good.
My husband and I were in town for vacation and were told about this spot for their food and chill environment.
There was a pretty long line when we arrived on a Sunday evening for dinner. We waited about 15 minutes before a table was available. We ended up opting for community seating which was quicker.
The vibe was fun and cool, aside from the very loud talkers beside us. But that's no fault on Pai!
We wanted to start with their shrimp chips, but they were sold out. So our server suggested the Kung Tawt (tiger shrimp) which was solid.
For our main dishes, my husband ordered the Pad Gra Prow with shrimp while I ordered the fried fish. Both dishes were prepared well, and the flavors were so good. The sauce that came with the fried fish was also very yummy!
It was a great experience and I would gladly come back whenever we're back in town!
Always crazy busy but food and atmosphere lively, inviting and friendly. Fresh,tasty and reliable classic Thai dishes. Apps excellent for sharing.

Pai is so highly rated and I can understand why! I've only been here maybe 2-3 times and it's always so busy every time. My favourite dish from here is the panang curry chicken. Even though it's very busy, the service is still pretty good. I would love coming back to Pai, even with the long wait, because the food is just so delicious!

I have absolutely no complaints about the food here. The Tom yum soup was made with tomatoes and herbs from God's garden. That was hands down the best bowl of Tom yum I ever ate. The thai restaurants I've been to in the states make the broth watery. This broth was rich and flavorful. I also ordered the oxtails that were magically delicious.  They were so tender and flavorful. I need to find my way back to Toronto JUST so I can eat here again. Even if I don't do anything else but eat here I'd be satisfied.

Upon entry, it's obvious the restaurant is constantly busy with a warm, cozy, and inviting atmosphere. We were lucky to be seated immediately and drinks were brought promptly. The server was attentive, welcoming, and informative. For appetizers, we ordered the grabong, or squash fritters with a sweet tangy dipping sauce. It was delicious, with a light crispy texture and flavor. We ordered a large portion of the tom yum which came with a nice pouch of rice wrapped in a bamboo leaf. The panang curry was creamy and had a nice kick with a side of bamboo wrapped rice, and the pad thai was full of flavor. The khao soi had an amazing curry sauce that complemented the noodles nicely. The pad gra prow with beef is delicious as well; the beef was well seasoned and the over easy egg complemented the dish nicely. Portions were a good size. Overall one of the best Thai places I've ever experienced. Highly recommend!

This is one of my favourite places for Thai food in Toronto. In terms of authenticity I say it's a bit over commercialized since I've been to Thailand and if having to compare I can't say it's authentic. It's definitely really tasty and it's always packed, I like the consistency of the restaurant.

Really frackin' good. 
I went on a weekend in the afternoon, and there was tons of space for me and my two friends. The server was attentive and friendly and the atmosphere was really chill.  
I had the Khao Soi and it was a thick curry with perfectly cooked noodles. Very filling and delicious. I asked for medium spiciness and that was a very good level of spice to warm you up without burning your tongue. My friend got the Pad Thai with the most extreme spiciness; I took one bite and my mouth was on fire for a good five minutes, with lingering sensations for another twenty minutes! I tried my other friend's Masaman Curry and it was very fragrant and yummy, I don't think you can really go wrong at this restaurant!

The food here was absolutely amazing!!! BUT the wait was terrible, unsure if it'd be worth going again. 
My boyfriend and I got there on the early-ish (around 4:30 I think) and we only waiting about 5-10 minutes to be seated. However the wait between which we ordered our food (around 4:45) and when our first plate reached our table (around 5:50) was EXCRUCIATING. It felt like everyone around us, even those who were seated after us, were getting their food first. 
We ordered two apps and two entrees because that's how hungry we were, we had to keep each other entertained while we waited which was really difficult because were some of the hangriest people you'll probably ever meet. 
It might've been from how hungry we were, but the food tasted absolutely amazing. 
Might come back with a good excuse!
*edit*
I was writing the draft back a few months ago, and just recently came back with my boyfriend to meet our friend. The wait was not as bad, about 20 minutes. The portion sizes seem to have gotten smaller, but it's still equally as loud and dark inside. It makes it hard for the servers to see you when you want to order or to ask for more water or the cheque.
Still loved this place regardless, kind of want to try sitting on the floor mats one day.

Came here on a Friday night for dinner. The food was so amazing, however the service was a bit slow. This place is crazy busy, so try to come early to avoid the rush. We got here at 5pm and were able to get seated very quickly, however it did take a while for the waitress to come around and collect our drink and food orders and for the food and drinks to come out. When we were leaving there was a huge lineup going outside of the door.

Just tried this place via Uber eats for the first time. The "best of Toronto" label tells the truth - this was some damn good pad Thai. I tried it mild and it tasted like no spice, so next time I will try medium spice for a bit more of a kick. 
I got it with chicken and it was very succulent and juicy.  Warning - The pad Thai is more of a brown colour with a pile of some sort of slaw on top which is off-putting when I opened the take out container. But it was very delicious, I would get it again in a heartbeat!

Easy take out service and was the best Thai I've had in a long time. So happy that I found this place on my visit to Toronto. 
They are super busy, so order ahead and even then you may still have to wait in the back.

East meet West. Perfect for joint for Hipsters. The food is not the greatest. It does fool alot of people. Its pretty loud in there. If you on a date and don't like to talk not a bad place to be. If you want to have a good conversation. Make sure you are good with sign language. 
Price for the food is ok not bad. Service can be better but you get what you paid for. Wash down Thai food perfect for Canadians.

Had dinner here tonight and the place was packed. We ordered the Thai chicken wings, pad Thai, oxtail, & ground chicken over rice. Food & service was excellent. We were seated at a table where you have to remove your shoes. Almost like sitting on the ground and it would have been cool if we were younger. Food was tasty, but you don't get a lot for what you pay. Definitely a place for anyone to try but not a repeater for us if ever in Toronto again.

A shame because this popular spot seems great. But they're always out of half of the already restrictive lunch menu. The few things they have available are good but again lunch is really restrictive and they run out quickly of the popular items.

Worth the hype! Finally got to try this place today! Friend warned me that the wait is always long but today we only waited 20 min for a group of 6.
I got the chicken pad Thai with Thai ice tea and it was some of the best Thai food ever. I loveeeeee the Thai iced tea! It's so creamy and has a very nice tea flavour, prolly the best I've had. The pad Thai was super flavourful and noodles were perfect. I also tried my friends pad gra prow and it was just as yummy.
Service started off slow but picked up near the end. I really enjoyed the experience here and it is def worth all the hype.

Got the chicken pad Thai and spring rolls to go. Nothing special here, didn't particularly care for the spring rolls which were a bit over done. The inside of the restaurant looked cool and was busy, but the food definitely didn't deliver like I was expecting from the high Yelp rating.

I came here with my boyfriend because of the good reviews. We both love Thai food, so we were so excited to try Pai! We didn't have a reservation and we came here during lunchtime, so we had to wait a little but it was expected.
We ordered the Sai Ua Platter (Northern Thai Sausage) as an appetizer for the both of us. It was delicious, but the portion was so tiny... It was like they took 1 tiny sausage and cut it up into small pieces. I really expected there to be more for $14... kind of wish we didn't get it at all. 
For our main, we shared the Gaeng Panang Curry just because we wanted to have some room for dessert later on at a different place. The curry was delicious! We asked for extra spice, so they gave us a little bowl of chilis to put in the curry. They really pack a punch! The curry was smooth and one of a kind. Never had a curry that was quite that good. 
Overall, I would come here again to try more curries and mains but I think I'll stay away from the appetizers.

No one eats more than I do. Seriously.
I am a fat, fat man, in a little man's body. All I do is eat, then walk to the next restaurant to burn off a couple calories to eat again. I've eaten all over this great city but only started writing reviews now because the Ball & Chain's sister got invited to Yelp Elite and she can't even boil water and only eats where I tell her, so here we go:
Best Thai in the city. End of.
Used to be khao san, but pai is now the captain now.
Better than the more hipster Sabai Sabai and the rest of them.
The Khao Soi is heavy af and you might need unbuckle your belt, but it's so worth it

Ordered take out from Pai: 
Spring rolls - big fat crunchy rolls amazing flavour.
Green curry - super well spiced complex flavour.
Tom Yum soup- well spiced broth.
Pad Thai - perfect!
I loved that you could pick your spice level. We went with Thai spicy level and be warned it's no joke!  
Would order from here again. I really want to try the sausage. Yum!

Dinner at Pai was a good experience with good food. I'd recommend going here for dinner with a friend who likes to socialize.
The food was very good, especially for the price. I had a Thai tea, the squash fritters, and the Khao Soi. All were good. The fritters was an enormous portion but not too filling, good for sharing with the table. The curry was tasty but a bit boring. 
The service was good. We sat at the bar, and were impressed by how much attention the bartender paid. He even took the time to join our conversation (and we welcomed him) on a busy Saturday night. I was also very impressed by how quickly the food came out. 
The restaurant is a little dark, and feels divey. Somewhat Asian, informal decorations crowd the walls. It was packed on a Saturday night. Thankfully, we didn't wait at all once we talked to the host, because the place seats so many people. 
Overall, we enjoyed Pai. I'd recommend going here for dinner with a friend who likes to socialize.

Hands down best Thai food I've ever had! Delicious from start to finish. I knocked a star because the service was pretty underwhelming. The waitress would just sit around while we were waiting on her to come take our orders and needed napkins etc.

So, when I hear Thai I think noodles; Far from it. There was noodles but there was soooo much more. I had one of the best fries fish and the stickiest of sticky rice. Service was excellent. Oxtail and noodles were great as well
Didn't like it...all food taste too sweet. Even the meat! I don't believe thai food needs to be like this

This was my second time at Pai. While we originally wanted to sit down but there were no seats available and the wait was extremely long. So, we did takeout!
I ordered the Pad Cha Hett which is a vegan stir-fry containing mushrooms, snow peas, chili paste, and other Thai spices. It was served on a bed of rice. It was extremely delicious with the perfect amount of spice (mind you, I like my food pretty spicy). However, considering the ingredients used, I found it a bit pricey and the person taking our order was quite rude but that's to be expected from a popular and hip restaurant in Toronto. 
I would definitely recommend this place to others. The restaurant has a great fun, young, hipster vibe to it and it's relatively affordable. Will definitely come again and again!

Worth the wait! There is always a line up to eat at Pai but I have been meaning to try it out for a while. I ordered the Khao Soi and was not disappointed! The curry was very flavourful and perfect with the egg noodles. My braised beef was a bit tough but they give lots of meat. The price of Pai is amazing for the delicious food. Additionally, the Thai tea was also really delicious. I feel it is difficult to find a good Thai tea around this area but Pai does it well. 
The service was great despite it being super busy and the atmosphere was live. I would definitely recommend you to try this place, and I will be going back in the future.

Went here for lunch and found it packed! The waiter was surprised we were from out of town so I assume it is a well-known popular local place. Small menu for lunch but the waiter had good recommendations. We tried the wings as an appetizer and I had the Crispy pork holy basil. My colleague had the green curry which she raved about. I ordered the crispy pork farang or foreigner spicy, one step below Thai spicy which had a bite to it. 
While we waited for our food prior we were complimenting Pai about its decor of old albums from the 80s and underground rock feel. I even saw a back room I assume designated for private parties. 
Would recommend to anyone! Definitely would return

The best Thai food and mocktails I have ever had. Ordered the shared sampling platter and could not have been more pleased. A little bit of every taste profile you could ask for from spicy sausage to sweet and crunchy sweet potato fry like beignets.
The food is generally fairly consistent. But with the vast amount of great Thai food in the city. I would rate the food here 4 stars!

Needed to give an update! This place has definitely proven itself worthy of 4.5 stars in my last few visits. I find waiting in line to put your name down is actually longer than the wait for the table. This place is always busy so be mindful of that if trying to make a plan after. I loved their cocktails, and they also have 5 dollar daily shots. The grabong, pad thai and khao soi are my go-tos, however I have had the massaman curry and this is also very delicious. What I do find is the spice levels are not what they used to be. It lacks that kick that I felt the very first time I came here. Regardless, everything is very tasty, and although it can be a bit pricy after ordering a few dishes, it's a great place and has an awesome atmosphere for a night out.

You gotta check this downtown toronto restaurant. Very authentic and great ambiance! Friendly staff and food service. We had the PAD GRA PROW with crispy pork and Thai fried rice it was phenomenal. Some of the best fried rice I've had you literally taste char from the wok on the rice amazing flavors! 100% recommend!

Amazing fresh Thai food with vegetarian options! Must say, the Pad Thai was great! Usually need a reservation but this time we were lucky and walked right in. Tons of things can be made vegetarian or vegan and lots of creative drinks! Glad we made it!

Foodwise, this place brought me back to Thailand. Easily the best Thai food I've had since dining in Chiang Mai and Bangkok. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu but the Khoa Soi and Pad Thai were standouts.  Ambiance is cool but a very loud restaurant so don't expect a quiet atmosphere.  Can be a long wait but 100% worth trying as it'll be one of the best culinary experiences of your life. 
Chicken Pad Thai (Thai spicy): 5/5
Khoa Soi: 5/5
Spring Rolls: 5/5
Mango Sticky Rice: 4/5
The Lowry (drink special): 3/5
I went there for lunch.  I ordered the shrimp for stater, it was excellent.  For the main course I order chicken pad Thai & beef green curry.  The food were delicious

Come to Pai to try authentic Thai!!! Ok, but on a less lighter note, Pai lived up to its hype as the food was superb. 
We went to pai on a Sat night, and upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised by its vibrant, busy and lively atmosphere. 
 
We tried Thai tea for the first time. It was a lightly flavored black tea that had a hint of cream making it slightly sweet and refreshing.
We ordered 3 different dishes to try. 
1) Miang Kung 
        An interesting dish that required us to make our own wrap with different ingredients (mentioned in the menu). There was an example of how to make the wrap. Combining all of the ingredient on the betel leaf created a balanced explosion of zesty, tangy, spicy, and savory flavors 
2) Chef Nuit Pad Thai (with chicken)
         Signature dish that lived up to its expectations. Best Pad Thai I have ever tasted. 
3) Khao Soi (with braised beef)
         It was a great light and sweet curry. However I would suggest not drinking too much of the curry soup. 
We would definitely come back with a larger appetite to try other items on the menu.
Tip: Make a reservation

Ordered from this restaurant for takeout. The pad thai was excellent, packed with vegetables and tofu, and very spicy. The khao soi is a must order, full of flavour, and has a lot of vegetables and tofu. Both dishes were very rich, and lasted me about 3 days. The dishes were packed carefully for take our

Got Khao Soi as well as Pad Gra Prow this time around. Both dishes were good. Also got the Plum Mule drink which was pretty decent. The serving speed was reasonable given that it was pretty busy. They forgot to refill our water after being reminded several times though. 
The food is decent (minus the horrid Pad Thai, don't get it). Good vibes and ambience for both small and larger groups. Expect a wait if no reservations (20 to 30m for lunch), they text you when your table is ready. 
There's a food court style Pai Market towards the back with a more limited menu but no wait required.

I finally returned to this place after a one year hiatus - I've never had enough time to wait. On a Friday night, I waited 1.5 hours for a table for 2. Luckily, I live around the corner so I went home to get ready while waiting. 
The atmosphere and food was better than I remembered it - it's clearly gained more popularity. I was craving some Pad See Ew, but they don't that so I opted for the Pad Thai (unoriginal I know). I forgot their spicy scale is so different from Khao San's so I went for the "foreigner's spicy" - one level below Thai spicy and...IT WASN'T SPICY AT ALL. Either that, or they forgot to put any spiciness in my dish. 
That was a bummer, but everything else was great. It's pretty loud so I felt like I lost half my voice after my dinner. That was probably also because it took almost an hour for our food to arrive (they must have been extra busy that night).

so far, all the things i have ordered tasted very good! It is always pack. thats the only issue.  
service was great even tho the restaurant is packed.

PAI honestly has all the qualities of a good restaurant - great food, good atmosphere and friendly service. The prices are fair for what it is. This is definitely a restaurant that I will keep on going back to.
I've been here multiple times and have tried a couple things here and all are great:
Gaeng Masaman with Braised Beef - a tamarind curry with braised beef and served with Jasmine Rice. Beef is very soft and tender; the curry is sweet with a small kick of spice and a slightly-more-than-subtle hint of peanut, overall very balanced; and rice is rice. The potatoes served in the curry are shaped in medium-sized spheres and are firm upon grasp but soft when you bite into them. Both the beef and potatoes have been cooked in the curry enough that there is that second layer of flavour to it. 
Khao Pad Thamada - a fried rice with your choice of chicken/beef/tofu or veggies. I've had both the chicken and beef and they were both good but nothing exceptional. I think what really helps take the dish to the next level is the chili oil that it comes with. The chili oil adds a medium kick of spice, subtle garlic flavour and a nice aroma to the rice. Probably some of the best fried rice I've ever had
Chicken Skewers - a bit expensive (I think it was $15 for 5 skewers) and the skewers weren't huge, but they still tasted great. Chicken was perfectly cooked, and were very tender upon biting them. The peanut-based sauce that it came up with made it even better.

Top notch flavor. Really seriously delicious pad thai and khao soi. I come here all the time for takeout.
But don't even bother trying to get a seat cuz you'll be waiting for an hour on a normal weeknight.
Inside, it's really well decorated and lively. But also SUPER LOUD, so not suited for intimate conversations or catchups with old friends.

Ambiance: would be the best hang out choice to start up the morning or end the evening... 
Service: very fast and consistent
Price: lower average price
Food: close to authentic thai. Tasty! 
Others: not sure if it's because it's like underground, but my nose is super sensitive... I can smell the sewage after sitting there for 20mins... And that somehow turned off my appetite... Even with all the flavours and spice, the sewage was still bothering me and not my buddies... I won't for sure be eating there after smelling the sewage

Pai is by far the best Thai restaurant in Toronto, everything I've tried from the menu has been delicious and I've never been disappointed yet!
My favourite items is the Khao Soi, which has amazing flavours (from the golden curry) and topped with crispy noodles served on fresh egg noodles. Their Green Curry tastes delicious and is served in a coconut when you dine in. the Pai Thai also tastes delicious and doesn't have an overpowering sauce like other places. My friends love the Gaeng Masaman and always orders that when they eat here. Lastly, my favourite item of them all is their Thai Iced Tea drink, it's a must try as its not super sweet, one sip and you are hooked.
The restaurant is always busy during lunch and dinner and can get pretty loud, its best to try and make a reservation/call ahead otherwise you'll be waiting for 30 mins or more.
Definitely a must try place if you love Thai food, the food here has high quality ingredients and is delicious. You won't be disappointed!

Pai is one of my most recommended places to go to in Toronto. Not just the best Thai food but for anyone looking for solid, amazing food. You will not be disappointed.
I have probably tried over 70% of the menu and it all tastes great. Recently have ordered takeout delivery for Pad Gra Prow and when I got it, the egg was still runny. That's the kind of detail you're getting as most places would've had an overcooked egg by the time it got to me.

Food is really good, I can't think of a better Thai restaurant in Toronto. Very reasonable prices.
I've been here a couple of times and the service however has never been amazing, and the last time it was pretty poor. We were seated maybe an hour before closing and had one of the worst experiences with a server at any restaurant. Rude and water was never filled even though it wasn't too busy at the time. The table next to us was asked if they wanted anything before the kitchen closed but the server simply walked by our table, as if we'd done something to upset her.
Really disappointed as the food is great but this experience has given me mixed feelings.

Fantastic menu and a great service experience.  I was a fan of Kiin and Chef Nui's other Pai.  This past weekend we visited the uptown location for the first time.  Service was excellent and the menu included some authentic, not typically found, items.  Not a disappointing bite was had.

Thai food that's so tasty! 
Got the pad Thai twice. Had the opportunity to come twice in two weeks for a work trip and this stop is what I was excited about most in between the two. 
Looking forward to coming back to Toronto!

Pai has one of the best and most delicious pad Thai I've ever had. SOOOO GOOD!! I got the chef Nuit paid Thai with chicken, and it was absolutely delicious with medium level spice (I believe there are 5 levels to choose from). The kick of spice, tang in the tamarind sauce, and portion size were all perfect. It's a bit pricer ($15.50 not incl tax) than other pad Thai dishes around the area, but the quality and taste definitely make up for it! 
 It was very busy when we got here (around 8pm) but thankfully there were still seats at the bar. Staff were very friendly and asked us about how we were finding our food, and the food came out quite quickly as well. I love Pai! Definitely want to try out the other dishes next time I come here, which will hopefully be soon! Highly recommend!! The hype is worth it :)

Dont be intimated by the long line outside. It moves relatively fast. The food is worth the wait if you're willing to hang in there. We got very lucky and got to sit down traditional style with our shoes off for our dining. We ordered the chicken wings with the tamarind sauce with the chicken penang curry with fried rice followed by the thai peanut ice cream. 
Very thrilled with our experience here.

This place was super busy when we arrived. We didn't reserve beforehand and luckily for a table for 2 the wait was only about 25 minutes. 
The music is loud here and it has dimmed lighting, kind of give off a bar atmosphere. 
We ordered the squash fritters, green curry with beef (medium spice), and khao soi with chicken breast.
The squash fritters was very good. You can taste the squash since it's not over battered and is fried nicely. The dip that comes with the fritters gives it a sweet and spicy flavour and the large portion size is perfect for sharing. 
The green curry with beef came in a coconut filled with lots of veggies and beef. Then extra curry came on the side. The curry comes with rice and I would have to say this dish was just ok. It was creamy and had enough spice but it lacked flavour. 
The dish that stood out the most was the khao soi with chicken breast. It was very creamy and the combination of spicy, sweet, and savoury totally gave a umami taste to this dish. The noodles are great and the khao soi came with garnishes on the side which it didn't really need because it was already very good on its own. However I would have to say chicken breast is not the best choice for this because the chicken came out to be kind of dry. 
I would come back for their takeout service since it is quite busy and also the loud music makes it hard to converse with my party.

Sweet baby Jesus!!! This is the best Thai food i have ever tried in my whole life. First off the entrance is down some stairs when you first walk in so do trip :). My gf and I came in for lunch the other day and ordered the Tom yum soup (best we have ever tried), the green curry w shrimp in a coconut (to die for), and some of the vegetarian spring rolls (love them). I wish we had more time to explore the rest of the menu during our short trip to Toronto. We will def stop by the next time we are in the area! Might stop by on our way out of the city as we drive back to DC.
Incredible food, fun environment. Drinks were decent but not amazing. The food was absolutely delicious, best Thai food I've had.

SO GOOD!!!!
I'm not a fan of Thai food because I've never had good Thai food until I tried Pai. Such good food, although portions are small, we ordered two plates for lunch and it just filled us up. Would definitely recommend to check out for a nice (non bloating) meal 
The ambiance is super authentic to Thailand, only concern was that the tables were toooo close to each other, more of a lunch room vibe than restaurant when it came to seating. 
Worth my money though, will be visiting again

Great restaurant with unique tasty food. I'm always for the hunt for something different, and by now, pad thai etc is normal fair to me. 
Enter Pai, with their unique (to me) fare. We ordered several appetizers to share and one main. 
Miang Kung- different ingredients that you put together in betel leaves.  Very tasty and light with the right amount of spice. Everything works well together (shrimp and pomelo, what???)
Som Tum Tad- green papaya saladwith salted crab. To be honest, I just wanted to see what a salted crab was. I think if you're not Asian or are not used to "different" foods you would not enjoy this much. But then why would you come here, right? Interesting, and again had the right level of taste, but I wouldn't get it again
