A little more invigorating spice would have satisfied my pallete a bit more.

Wow. I'm surprised I haven't discovered this Thai restaurant earlier...! My best friend said it's her favourite Thai restaurant in downtown so I decided to give it a try. We made a reservation for 9pm on a Saturday and they seated us a few mins after 9. There was a huge line up waiting for a table so I recommend making a reservation beforehand. 
I ordered the green curry and mango sticky rice for dessert. A few mins later, we got our mango sticky rice.... Not sure why they brought us our dessert before the main course but oh well I was hungry so I didn't mind. The mango sticky rice is literally a piece of mango on top of some sticky rice. It tasted good but not worth the price of $8.
My green curry came in a coconut shell. The coconut was too small to hold all of the curry, so they put the extras in a separate bowl. It was flavourful and had a lot of chicken and veg. After I finished the curry, I scraped off some of the coconut meat to try. It was really good! 
Service is great. The waitress we had was awesome and attentive. Came to check up on us frequently just to see if everything was ok.
I would totally come back for some more curry!

It was crowded on a Wednesday evening but the food was well worth the wait. I had fresh coconut water which was amazing along with a bottle of ginger beer. I also had shrimp with Penang sauce and sticky rice. 
I could go back again two days in a row. 
I think I might!!!

Hands down one of my favourite Thai restaurants in Toronto. YOU NEED a reservation weeks in advance (especially on weekends) if you're coming for dinner. There's always a lineup literally out the door whenever I go. 
Despite Pai being huge, their service is fast and their staff are incredibly friendly. Some must eat dishes include their classic pad Thai, Penang curry, spring rolls, and mango salad. The portions are very hefty. I often order a bunch of dishes with the group I'm with and we share. For a party of 4, I usually order 2 apps and 3 mains and we don't usually finish every bite on our plates. 
The restaurant is very cool inside - very King Street west vibe but in a good way. The ambiance positively contributes to the atmosphere. 
Lots of good variety for different dietary restrictions. 
Note: I am not sure if they have an alternative way to get into the restaurant but when you enter there is a small flight of stairs that may be challenging for those with accessibility needs.

I've been here before and so excited to bring my son as he loves pad thai and I want him to try this. We enjoyed all that we ordered! We had the Thai ice tea, grabong of squash fritter, shrimp pad thai, gai satay, pad gra prow pork and oxtail. Yummy to our tummy. A bit pricey for so worth it!!
ordered via Uber. Really bad. Watery curry. Used to be best in Toronto. Quality has gone.

1. Always make a reservation a few days ahead of time unless you're cool with waiting 40 minutes in line.
2. Very very cool vibe -- I mean, it's underground and it's very beauuutifully decorated.
3. The oxtails are to die for (although I heard they don't serve it anymore). The khao soi and green curry (served in a coconut) seem to be fan favorites. But regardless, please be more adventurous and don't order pad thai.
4. I'm not a sweet tooth, but my friends all seem to enjoy the mango sticky rice.

I cant believe I've never written a  review for this spot, they definitely deserve it! I have never had a bad experience coming here, I've been here with friends, family, a date, and they've all been near perfect experiences!
Food (5/5)- this food is the bomb.com (excuse my antiquated terminology, but it's exactly how I feel about it). Pad thai, delicious. Khao Soi, out of this world. Green curry, bomb. Thai Iced Tea, addictive! You can literally not go wrong ordering, everything is top notch. And I've been to Thailand, this restaurant would be successful there or anywhere else really!
Service (4.5/5)- it's always great service, very kind and helpful with the menu, but it's always a busy spot so dont expect regular checkins, you do have to wave someone down when you need something (not much of a complaint, I'm glad such a good spot got so popular, they deserve it).
Vibe (5/5)- I love the energy in here, since it's always busy, it always feels upbeat and lively. I love the busy decorations, I sometimes walk around and read the story about the owners or about Pai in Thailand.
Tips- be ready to wait to be seated (15-30mins), but believe me when I say it's worth every minute waited!
In conclusion- must go!
It's really good for northern Thai and tastes very authentic. Price not to steep so totally recommend.

This place is definitely worth checking out. Pai is situated in the heart of Downtown Toronto and is only a few blocks away from the CN Tower. The vibe is unbeatable. 
I've had better khao sois tbh, but it was pretty tasty. The wings were delicious. I would be back!

Such a cozy little restaurant in the heart of downtown. The food is great, and I've always had really friendly service with the waiters/waitresses always ready to help.
This restaurant gets booked up fast so either be ready to wait in line or make a reservation in advance.
Very good food...CSR are on point very attentive....order anything all done perfect....book before you go

I've been here a couple of times and it's safe to say that Pai is one of the must go Thai restaurants in town.
However, the Khai soi, one of their signature dishes really fell short today. The entire dish was off, different from what I had in previous visits. They skimmed on the sauce and noodles. The beef portion was on the generous side but they were very dry and hard to chew.
Perhaps I should have ordered that dish at Khao San Road (their sister restaurant) instead.
Always amazing tastes and flavours. Pai has been consistently great through the years.

Me and my partner came in for dinner on a Sunday evening. During the dinner rush I have waited around 15 minutes at most - they have a bar inside area where you can grab a drink and wait. 
The ambiance is trendy, bumpin' and busy, playing 90's music. The place is surprisingly big yet cozy with cool decor. 
We got the Som Tum Tad (Papaya Salad) with Dried Shrimp ($14) and Gaeng Panang (red curry with chicken) ($16). The papaya salad was sweet yet refreshing, coupled with salty chewy dried shrimp with sinful pork rinds and shrimp chips on the side. The curry was creamy and delicious. 
It's worth mentioning we've been here multiple times and the Gaeng Masaman with braised beef ($16) and the Pad Gra Prow (fried ground meat with chili oil and a fried egg) ($16.5) are our top 2 favourite dishes here. You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu--it's all good. They have several items on their menu that can be made gluten free or vegan.
The service is solid - it doesn't feel pretentious to me like a lot of establishments in the surrounding area and we didn't need to wait long to get the bill once we were finished. Dishes are a little on the pricey side compared to other Thai places, but I always leave feeling full and satisfied. My biggest problem is that I can't try every item on the menu at once.

Super crowded, sub-standard pad thai - but wonderful, cheerful, boisterous atmosphere nonetheless.
We arrived on a Saturday at 4:00 PM and it was very, very crowded. Make sure you book reservations prior to coming in, or you'll be waiting, especially if you're with a big group. Our group of 5 ended up sharing a table communally with another couple. No problem. Random, but note that if you're wearing jackets - there's no coat rack, from what we were told. So be prepared to stack your jackets and purses on whatever stool you can find.
I ordered the pad thai (with chicken) and the khao soi (with braised beef). Flavourful to a point, but without the usual tamarind kick that I've come to expect. It was perfectly average. The khao soi came with a delicious broth, but the beef wasn't as tender as I thought it would be. Overall, not the best pad thai or khao soi I've had (to be honest, those awards still go to Khao San Road). They weren't terrible, but they weren't the best. The community atmosphere makes up for the experience - while table spacing wasn't the best, we really enjoyed the decor and overall environment. 
For a pad thai and khao soi (at $15.00 each), I paid $40 with tax and tip.

This is my second time in Toronto and my second time here. This is a great spot with a cool ambiance and yummy food! Not to mention the service is amazing as well. It's conveniently located in the heart of the city.
My first time trying Thai food. I was blown away with courtesy, service, vibe and food! Great portion size, I shared both of my meals with 1 other person and it was enough.

One of my favourite appetizers that I get all the time there is their GRABONG. It's basically deep fried squash and they batter it with a red curry paste batter. They also give us a garlic tamarind dip with peanuts. Definitely give it a try if you go to Pai! I usually get either their pad thai or their curry there. Both of those dishes are super authentic and I would say, their spice levels can be adjusted to your preference as well. I got medium spicy and I think I can definitely eat a little spicier. I might try Farang spicy next time for a bigger kick, but medium spicy level was definitely a comfortable spicy level. I got the GAENG MASAMAN last time and the portion was a little bigger than I expected, which is GREAT! My boyfriend got the CHEF NUIT PAD THAI and it was SO good! I 10/10 would recommend the pad thai there. Good nutty and sweet and sour taste too! The portion was large too! I Pai is still my go to Thai restaurant in Toronto for sure!

A quintessential Thai place in Toronto. Reliable service and food options, with ability to change the spice level and make you truly sweat. Good atmosphere to meet with friends or coworkers but always make a reservation because they are packed all the time!

I was in Canada for 24hrs and had to
Rely on reviews on yelp to get the best food possible while here. My cousin and I loved this place! I can say it has been the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to! Oh and let's talk about that peach sangria! It was way too much for 2 people but the price was so right we had to go in, it was amazing! It had peach,guava,wine and ginger so much more and it was amazing! We walked there after seeing the CN tower since it's very close by. Highly recommend this adorable place, it was busy very busy which in my
Book is a good sign! The wait was 10min and our food arrived very fast which was a very
Nice surprise.

Food was okay! Authentic Thai food, but you can find many good thai food under more reasonable price than Pai in other thai restaurants in Toronto! 
(I didn't try Pad Thai there tho, so I don't know if they have authentic Thai Pad Thai).

The best Tom yum I have had! Came here for lunch while in Toronto for few days, was a great experience. Were seated promptly, waiter was attentive. Sangria was so refreshing and lychee flavor gives it whole new dimension of fruitiness. Khao Soi was new dish for me, exceeded my expectations as hit all senses. Overall great place, worth checking out even if long wait.

This is definitely one of my favourite Thai restaurants in Toronto. The Green Thai Curry is so delicious. The dish is always really fresh and the portion is large enough to have by yourself and take home leftovers or share with another person. Another go-to dish I recommend as a side is the spring roll. It's a good size, and is always crispy and never burnt. 
Price wise, I'd say Pai is average-upper in pricing. My only real criticism is that the sweet and sour sauce that comes with the spring roll is more of a jelly that a smooth sauce. However, the whole restaurant is fantastic! 
Please note: This restaurant gets really busy, so make a reservation, call ahead, or order takeout.

I like the food in general, but I don't love it.  And it is too expensive.  Yeah, this pretty much sums it up for me.
I can't say I have eaten Thai food in Thailand.  I compare Pai to the food I ate at a Thai restaurant that was run by a Thai family.  A mom/auntie cooked in the kitchen, and daughter and son worked the store front.  A mini spice tray was placed on every table.  I am used to bold flavours and oiliness from Thai food.  And the flavours be complex and mixed together.  
My conclusion was Pai has the best Thai curry in Toronto - the right texture, the right balance of flavours.  Tom Yum Kung soup was excellent.  It is a treat; I recommend it highly.  The eggrolls and satays were good shareable starters.  The Chef Nuit Pai Thai had a lot of good meat and seafood in it.  As far as the noodle part, it was down to earth with rich flavours.  This dish felt like a home-style food to me.  Gaeng Masaman with Braised Beef had complex flavours, but I found the chef was heavy handed with coconut milk. I wished there was more acidity in it to balance it.  The Khao Pla Tawt was a deep fried fish fillets with house dipping sauces.  The sauces were delicious.  The fish fillets were fresh.  It was good.  It was also nothing more special than plain deep fried fish fillets.  Unless you crave fish, otherwise, I would suggest you to skip this one.  
I ordered a variety of spice levels, from mild to Thai spicy.  I asked for Thai spicy and foreigner spicy for the soup and the Pad Thai, respectively.  I was given a small plate of chilli oil for both.  The soup tasted medium spicy only.  Pad Thai was not spicy, even after I requested it to be foreigner spicy. Does Pai make the food Thai/foreigner spicy or not?  The rest of the food was at medium spiciness.  Please believe me, medium spiciness was mildly spicy.
Services was impeccable and friendly.  We were given the bill without we asked for it, though.  And please tell me it is the location and the staff, because Thai food should not be this expensive.  Our bill was $135 for 4 people, all in.
I like it here, but not enough to call myself a fan. So 3.5 stars overall.

We came here for dinner right after watching a show at the theater. The place was packed and yet the atmosphere is such that you can still have a conversation without shouting. 
The food is simply amazing. For starters we had some crispy delicious spring rolls, guy satai chicken skewers with curry and spicy dipping sauce. 
And for the main we had pad Thai with chicken or beef. The noodles were prefect, the dish had a fresh aroma that made it absolutely delightful. 
The prices are so reasonable for a place downtown. We'd definitely go back.

Completely blown away by this gem. It is no wonder that even with the sprawling subterranean layout there was still a line at 6:30 - although we were seated quickly.  
We had the spring rolls, pork satay, green chicken curry, beef curry - masaman and pad Thai. The green curry served in a real coconut exploded with flavor and has just the right amount of heat. The pork satays we awesome as well. It was all delicious. Do not miss this - although you may not want to eat Thai anywhere else besides Thailand afterward.

Ohhhh yea. The meals I love the best are the one's that surprise me. After finding this place on Yelp, I ventured on over to see if I could walk in and grab a table. The place was jam packed and their was a decent wait, but luckily I was able to snag a seat the bar. The rest is history.
With old school r&b playing in the background, I ordered some fried spring rolls and vegetable pad Thai. While I was waiting I chatted it up with a bartender who gave me the low down on the restaurant as well as the area and where to go. After this great convo, the perfection on a plate arrived.
The spring rolls are absolutely delicious and dipping sauce was amongst the best I've had. I tended to think all Thai spring roll dipping sauces were the same, but clearly I was wrong. It was the perfect amount of sweetness and something else I couldn't quite put my finger on. Either way, the dish was excellent.
The Pad Thai now, best I've ever had aside from what I ate in Thailand. Not too oily, little sweet, perfect mixture of noodles and vegetables and perfectly seasoned. It really was delicious. 
The service was excellent and I loved the upbeat vibe about the place. This place is great for group gatherings and overall just somewhere to go have a good time. Definitely will be back here at some point, and you should go check it out too!

Arrived around 12PM on a Thursday and it was already packed. Had to wait for 1 hour (waitress took our number and said they would text us after a table was available) 
Food: 4.5/5
-I ordered the Pad Thai with chicken and it was delicious. It has the right amount of sweetness and the veggies/nuts added a lot of texture and crunch to the dish. I wish there was more chicken though! 
-My friend ordered their golden curry - tried a bit of some and it was delicious. She enjoyed it very much as well :) 
Service: 5/5
The waiter was very quick to take our order. One thing I liked was that he always came by to ask how we were doing and consistently filled up our water glasses without us asking. 
Environment: 3.5/5
The place itself is quite crowded - especially during the lunch rush. I recommend going right when it opens to avoid the wait. Also, it's quite dark (located underground), and so there was barely any natural lighting.
Will go again :)

Not much else I can add to what's been said here. You combine their food, prices, location and overall atmosphere, Pai is hard to beat as a great dining option for not only the downtown core but Thai food in general in Toronto. 
Always an easy recommend, the line and wait is surely worth it! The last time I was here I discovered they had a whole other section at the end that's got a completely different vibe to the busy main restaurant. I just lucked out and got a seat there thanks to being there early to put our group's name down. 
Always my go to for good with a group when catching a show or just food in the area.
Best Thai food in Toronto! Would highly recommend  - a bit on the pricey side but worth it

We went on Wednesday 7pm on a very hot weather (32 degrees). It was 20 minutes wait for inside and no wait for patio, and as we were so hungry, we took the patio. Luckily it was under shade so i didn't die. 
Tried green curry in coconut with chicken ($16, 3.5/5), and the red curry with beef and rice ($14, 5/5).  Loved them both, especially the red one. 
The price is on the higher side, and place couldve been cleaner..  but I am craving them ever since! 
But from my experience, pad thai wasn't as great. So I will go back for the curry.

Very busy midweek at lunch...there's a good 15 minuet wait so keep that in mind. For appetizer, I ordered papaya salad which I didn't really enjoyed but for lunch we had two dishes. One fried fish and rice, as well as, Nuit Pad Thai...both delicious but I must admit I've had way better Thai food.

This is hands down Toronto's best Thai food! Everytime we go , there is always a line ! Today we tried the personal Tom Yum soup and the Panang Curry and also the Khao Soi. These are always my go to whenever I visit Pai. The taste is very authentic and traditional and really gives you that homestyle food vibe. Needless to say , all three dishes were very rich in flavour and fairly large portions. For two people 3 dishes is plenty of food ! The Khao Soi is a must at this place and you're missing the best dish if you don't order this. Will be coming back again and again to satisfy my thai cravings.

You can't go wrong with Pai! It's a great place to come with absolutely anyone if you want a more than average Thai restaurant! Although I do feel that their menu is a bit similar to their rival - Khao San Road but they do a better job at keeping up with the standard and quality over the years. Staff is always friendly, food is always hot and fresh! 
Food: 4.5/5
Ambiance: 3/5
Staff: 5/5
Price: 4/5 (a bit pricey for the type of street food you are getting, but hey, you are in Toronto.)
Overall: 4/5

Decided to come here with my boyfriend after paint night, as it was close by and the reviews are awesome. Got here at about 8 and there was a lineup of people and a length waitlist. I was really craving Thai food, so we agreed to wait and see what the fuss was all about.
We got seated at the bar, after about an hour-long wait. We decided to get some drinks - their specialty sangria and a Thai beer. The sangria was sooooo good! I would have ordered more, but I already had wine earlier and didn't feel like tumbling up/down the stairs on the way out. I ended up getting the Thai iced tea at the end though...couldn't resist. 
The menu isn't very extensive, so it didn't take really long to pick our items. We ordered their spring rolls to start, the green chicken curry aka Gaeng kiaw wan (served in a coconut!) and the Khao soi. The spring rolls came out pretty quickly and we gobbled them down really quickly, as we were starving! They were delicious and so was the sauce that came with them. 
It took quite a bit of time for our mains to come out though. The place was packed though.. We were hoping our waiter/bartender would have come to see us after taking our orders, but he didn't make it back until after we were done eating our meals. That is the main reason why I'm downgrading this review to 4 stars. The bartenders that were making drinks all night in front of us were amazing. They were not only taking people's orders at the bar, but were pretty much putting on a show for us at the bar. It wasn't anything spectacular like fire, but I was really fascinated by their work.
Sorry, back to the food.. I've never eaten green curry, but was pleasantly surprised. I got it at the foreigner spicy level and had no regrets. It was the perfect amount of spice for me, although my boyfriend found it quite hot. There was a lot of chicken, so I got full pretty quickly. I tried the Khao soi and thought the sauce was delicious. I also really liked those crispy noodles that they give! We finished it with the Thai iced tea and everything was just great. 
Overall, the food was pretty good. I wish they had panang curry on their menu (my usual order in Thai restaurants), as I'm sure it would've been incredible. But, I'm glad I tried green curry, because it was delicious. Boyfriend found the Khao soi to be good, but no wow factor. Drinks were awesome. The bartending crew was amazing - super fun to watch and extremely kind. Our waiter was a bit M.I.A unfortunately.. Overall, not sure if I would come all the back here from Thornhill/North York, but it's definitely a great place for everyone to try.
Amazing place and i like the Green Thai Curry here

I love this find, the setting is underground hip. Tom yum Casaer, ginger mule and tasty noodles. I ran out of noodles but I packed that broth to go. Eating it later with my leftover rice from an Indian restaurant last night.

If you're looking for amazing Thai food in Toronto Pai is the spot for you. Amazing taste as well as decent sized portions for the price you're paying ($15-20 per entree). I went to Pai on a weekday evening and there was about a 30 minute wait. Wouldn't recommend this place for groups as it can be quite cramped and almost impossible to get a reservation. 
I tried the Pad Thai, Khao Soi and Thai Iced Tea and they were all amazing! I would highly recommend both dishes. Although the dishes are a bit pricey, the portions are big enough to have leftovers for later. This restaurant doesn't have a full halal menu like other Thai places downtown however there braised beef comes from a halal supplier so menu items like the beef khao soi, massaman curry and Chiangmai beef noodle soup are halal. Overall, would definitely recommend if you're looking for a nice and tasty meal downtown.

Got here just before 6PM before the dinner rush. This place was packed! 
I ordered the Khao Soi with beef brisket ($15.50). Serving size wasn't very big but the dish was tasty with a creamy, curry/coconut-y soup. The beef brisket was soft and tender. Dish also came with some condiments. 
Service was good too, despite how busy it was, our glasses were consistently filled with water and waitress checked in on how we were doing after we got our food. 
Overall a good experience, thankfully with no long wait time with luck!

I went here with a friend on the weekend - it was difficult to find parking around here, but it was certainly worth it. Thank goodness my friend was there first, because the place was very busy and got busier as we came in.
I had the spring rolls ($8.50) and Chef Nuit Pad Thai ($15.50). I liked the spring rolls the most, although they never seem to give you enough of them in number. The Pad Thai was also great - I wish I asked for a bit less sauce on mine, but that's moreso my own fault.

We expected this restaurant to be busy on a Saturday night and it was! We arrived just after 7pm and there was a 20 minute wait. The restaurant is much bigger than it appears. The ambiance is awesome, we loved the decor and cozy feel.
We started off with cocktails-I had the Winter Dog and my boyfriend had the mule. We liked our drinks and loved the food. The appetizer, spring rolls, came out quick. The sweet chili sauce the spring rolls were paired with had the perfect kick! I had the fried rice with veggies and tofu, my boyfriend had the green curry. The green curry was presented in a coconut, which was cool! The portion sizes here are pretty big. 
I'm giving four stars because I feel like the service we received was lacking a little. Our server wasn't very friendly and didn't come check on us and forgot to bring the waters we requested. If she would have come back to check on us we would have definitely ordered a second round of cocktails. Overall though, this place was great and we'd come back next time we're in Toronto!

Wow !!!!!
Let's start with a thank you to our remarkable waiter  Eric. You were on point . You made our first experience at your resturant one to come back to. Now for the food . The food was authentic, full of flavours and a nice portion. The only reason why I didn't provide a 5 star is price range. A little on the high end if you ask me for what your getting. It still remains street food so it would have been nice if the prices reflected that as well. 
Example 3 chicken wings 6$
Main meal around 15-22$
Thai ice tea 5.50$ the most expensive I've paid in canada ( lots of ice in it ) 
Total for two with a shared dessert 70$ plus tip

Love coming here when I'm craving Thai downtown. Everything that I've tried has been delicious with no complaints at all. 
Food: The portions are well sized and filling. All their dishes are full of flavour that leaves you craving for more. My most recent dishes were the Chicken Fried Rice ($11) and the Green Curry ($11). The fried rice doesn't look like much but you'll fall in love once you try it. The rice is cooked to PERFECTION - it's fluffy and actually looks like individual grains of rice (none of them stuck together at all). The portion is enough for two meals if you can stop yourself from eating it all! The green curry only comes in mild or spicier. It's so rich in flavour and packed with large pieces of chicken. They definitely don't skimp on the meats in all their dishes. I would highly recommend these dishes. 
Service: The entire staff is super friendly and efficient. They are always smiling and usually joking around. For how busy they get, the food comes out fast enough. By 12:05pm they will have a full house for weekday lunch so you will definitely want to get here by 11:40am especially if you have a big group. 
Atmosphere: It's super casual and laid back. I love their entire music playlist and can jam the whole meal long. It gets loud though since you sit pretty close to other tables and can hear everyone speaking. 
Tip: Curry in a Hurry is a preselected curry of the day that changes each day. Costs $10 flat and is takeout only. Well worth it especially if you're in a rush. I was in and out within 5 minutes. 
Overall I would definitely continue coming here. Try everything on the menu!

I love Pai. One of the best thai places in the city. Their Tom Yum soup is bomb! Highly recommend!
The only thing is that it is always busy, so prepare to wait.

I went to Chang mai back in December and went on a frenzy looking for the best khao soy. After coming back from Thailand I didn't realize I would find the second best khao soy in Toronto. Big bonus is that the food is also halal! Great ambiance, awesome service!!
Siwat was a great server! He was efficient and provided us with amazing and fast service. The food was served so fast and everything was delicious. 10/10 recommend:)

Love! Love! The food here! Love how the green curry comes in a coconut and you can eat the coconut meat. Also the papaya salad can be ordered with raw crabs and it's one of my favorites! Super spicy! If you come early you can get a seat quickly... You can't go wrong with anything! We love coming here everytime we are in Toronto.

Pai is a fantastic restaurant, practically hidden away underground on Duncan Street. The atmosphere is lively and booming! I was shocked at how busy they were on a Sunday at 3:30p, especially since they just opened at 3p. Despite how busy and packed they are, Pai doesnt seem to be short on seats with two large seating rooms. We were sat in a clausterphobia-inducing corner, (but to be fair all the seats and tables are all stuffed close together) and left with the menus. Staff are friendly and honest, they were very upfront on dishes they'd recomend and ones they never would lol, but it was appreciated. We ordered the Gai Satay skewers, Thai Chicken Wings, and Hunglay Oxtail curry, which all came out in pretty good timing considering how busy they were. The Hunglay Oxtail curry is AMAZING, so rich and the oxtail flavoring was delicious. The Thai Wings were really good, but I felt 3 wings per order was too little of quantity considering the price. All in all I really enjoyed Pai and would definitely visit again, they only lost 1 star because the seating is a fire-hazard waiting to happen lol.

I don't even know where to begin on Pai. I've recently moved to SF, but literally every visit back to Toronto... I will make a purposeful stop to get myself back to Pai to inhale the Pad Gra Prow. Everything else I've tried is also great but I could write you a poem on the Pad Gra Prow..I first tried it for lunch one day since I used to work nearby, but since then I've eaten it for lunch, for an afternoon snack, for dinner, for a late night meal... and everything in between. It's delicious and such a great proportion of food. I never leave feeling hungry or unsatisfied. It's the perfect ratio of protein to rice and the side veggies and egg are a great compliment.
Aside from my love of PGP, the lychee sangria is a fav of mine at Pai.. along with the fried spring rolls and papaya salad. 
Ambiance and vibe of the spot is also authentic and rustic which adds to the whole experience. Only thing I will say is that the lines are longgggg... I have never been able to snag a reso even tho I hear they exist... but I will continue to come back and wait in line for Pai's food forever.

Incredible. Best meal of our week long trip. Pad Thai was filled with fresh veggies and delicious shrimp. Kao Soi was the best ever according to our son. Garprow was fantastic and flavorful. The Sangria was SERIOUSLY the best we've ever had. I'll be craving that for awhile. We tried to get another reservation during our trip because we liked it so much, but were unsuccessful due to its popularity and incredible food. Cool place and good vibes here.

Really trendy spot that feels "cool". The curry dishes are excellent and they have a casual vibe with great food! Do book ahead so you don't get stuck outside waiting for a table if you can. 
The wait can be a little long if you don't hav anything booked, but worth the wait!

If I had to eat nothing else every again but Pai's Pad Thai, I'd be just fine with it. I order it Foreigner Spicy and it's got just the right amount of heat and flavour. Often, because it's a busy joint, I just get it from Uber Eats, but the actual place is definitely cool.

My favourite Thai spot in Toronto.
Excellent service and even better food, all at a very reasonable price.
I highly recommend the grabong (buttercup squash) to start, it never disappoints.
Can't go wrong with any main here.
The sangria is great, not too sweet but had alot of flavour.

My second time here after trying it out last summer and it's just as good as I remembered! Hands down, one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. This place is always packed no matter what time you go but the great thing is they take reservations (unlike Khao San Road). The atmosphere is always loud and lively, the decor is new with a rustic feel, built like you're inside a hut. For the most part, there is either communal seating or tables fitting 2-5 available. However, they do have a private party room if you're looking to host something with a bigger group. 
Onto the food,
Chef Nuit Pad Thai w/ Chicken ($15) - Honestly one of the best pad thais out there.   Everything about this dish is perfection. Filled with simple ingredients and mixed with the right amount of sauce, you get an explosion of flavors that'll have you thinking about it well after the meal. It's a good portion too.
Khao Soi w/ Chicken Breast ($15) - I don't think anywhere can beat Khao San Road's khao soi but this one is quite up there and I would highly recommend ordering it. It's very filling as they give a substantial amount of meat and egg noodles. The crispy noodles add an extra dimension to the dish but the highlight is still the golden curry. I was so tempted to order an extra bowl of rice or wished there was bread to eat with the curry just so it wouldn't go to waste.
Khao Pla Tawt ($14.50) - They make fried fish really well here as it's perfectly crispy without being too oily. Comes with tamarind sauce and chili sauce to dip along with a bowl of white rice. I preferred the tamarind sauce more because I felt it complemented the fish a little better.  It's not a bad choice but I found it a bit boring to just eat fried fish with rice. And so, I would recommend the next item below: 
Fried Fish w/ Green Curry Sauce and Rice ($13) - Get this if you come for lunch since it's not on the dinner menu!! Pretty much exactly like the Khao Pla Tawt with the exception of the two dipping sauces and instead, you get green curry. I'm not sure why but they only have the Khao Pla Tawt in the evening but I much prefer this one. I can't remember but they probably only give 3 pieces of fish instead of 4 and portions are inevitably smaller but it's much more flavorful. Pour the curry over the rice, have it with the fish and voila.
My only complaint was the amount of time it took for the food to come out. I think we waited almost 30 minutes so I did get a little antsy since I was starving. But all that was forgiven and forgotten after I took a bite.
Pai is a must-try!!

We love Pai. Everything is amazing.  We have been there many times for lunch (quick, authentic, cafeteria style with Thai street food) and for late night dinner.  They are always super busy but the food comes out quickly and the servers are great.  And the best of all, our favorite Singha Beer is now on draft!

It's been awhile since I've given a 5 star rating to a place. The service was wonderful, she kept checking back on us if we were doing good. The food was excellent!!! I think I stuffed myself too much and I was full for days. 
God for the curry and the pad thai! It comes in a coconut!!!
The place doesn't seem that big from the outside, but once you enter the place, they have two separated rooms. One massive room for parties! I love the decor, I love the atmosphere. Although it's a little bit tight in there, the couple next to us was clearly not pleased they have to sit pretty close to us. She wanted to move to a "quieter" place but the place was pretty packed so they couldn't move, and the girl was pissed. But seriously? 
Overall, I love this place, I didn't noticed it while I was there but the music was pretty loud, I was wondering why I was running out of breath while I'm literally screaming across the table. 
I will def. come back for more!

Pai doesn't disappoint! Came here for the second time and ordered:
GRABONG (4/5) 
(Vegetarian deep fried battered squash fritters with a garlic tamarind dip)
This was delicious - I'd like to think that these squash fritters are a healthy version of fries haha. Its crispy and sweet - will order this again.
TOM YUM NAM SAI KUNG MOR FAI (4/5)
(A savoury, spicy and sour shrimp soup with lemongrass, coriander and green onions. Served with jasmine rice)
I love tom yum soup - last time I only got a small bowl so this time I decided to order the tom yum soup + rice as the main. Loved it! The portions were huge!
GAENG MASAMAN with braised beef (3/5)
(Braised beef in a peanut, tamarind curry with potatoes and topped with deep fried crispy shallots. (contains shrimp paste) with rice)
My bf got this one - we asked for mild for the level of spiciness (for the curry) but it was still really spicy. Yummy nonetheless.

Came here for lunch on a Saturday. The wait time was not bad, but as we were leaving there were many groups waiting at the entrance. 
Service is quick and friendly. Servers are always refilling your glass with water, especially needed if you're having lots of spicyness!
We ordered a shared app of the grabong (deep fried squash). A good sharing size portion for 2-3 people. The garlic tamarind dip that comes with it is also very tasty! My fiance ordered the green curry and that came in a coconut (very cute idea). What i liked was that his curry was overflowing and all the chicken was not inside the coconut, so they served some more curry and chicken on a side dish on the side! The portion of this is quite fair and the taste is quite tasty.
I ordered the khao soi with chicken breast and the curry is sooo flavourful. It comes with noodles inside but definitely not enough. I saved the rest of my curry and brought it home to have with rice the next day. Definitely generous with the chicken breast though. 
Though the reason why I am not giving this place a 5 star is because of the price. Any thai restaurant in downtown seem to be a little high in price. Our meal came up to almost 50$ and we didn't even order alcohol! I guess being an asian, I always expect asian food to be slightly cheaper in price. But definitely a place to check out!

After reading raving reviews about Pai, my partner and I decided to give this a try on a cold weekday afternoon.
We arrived right when they opened and was promptly seated, and boy, did the place fill up quickly. (Be sure to make a reservation if you are arriving during the busy lunch hour.)
There was a vibrant atmosphere in the restaurant, but it is quite dark. The tables are somewhat closely packed together so be careful when you are walking around!
My partner ordered the Khao Sao and I ordered the Pad Thai.
 * Pork Pad Thai with medium spice *
 I have to admit, it didn't live up to expectations. I might not have had really good pad thai, but I could tell this wasn't it.
Presentation: 
- Served on a bamboo leaf with a side of chopped cabbage and peanuts. 
- Wasn't really blown away, nor did it look REALLY appetizing.
Taste:
- It was alright, and barely that. 
- The rice noodles were a tad tougher than I would have liked it, and it was really hard to pick at it. 
- The spice weren't really mixed that well. Hit a couple of pockets where it was really spicy.
- Maybe its just me, but I don't like the cabbage to go along with the Pad Thai. The crispiness of   the cabbage might go well with the soft pad thai for some, but they didn't match that well this time. Maybe the rice noodles were just too hard.
Price:
- In line with what other Thai restaurant charges in the downtown area. 
- Worth it? Maybe....not really. 
Overall, I would like to give this another try, but purely based on the name and hype of the place alone. Otherwise, you might be better off grabbing your Thai fix somewhere else. 
Cheers.
The Khao Soi was fantastic. The service and drinks were also great, especially the Spicy P cocktail. The decor and environment made it a great experience.

WE GOT SICK. This was our first time at Pai and was extremely excited because of the amazing reviews we saw on yelp. During our meal, my food was delicious. I ordered the popular Khao Soi with drumsticks. However my friend had their green curry (vegan) and said that it was flavourless and was very disappointed. After about half an hour, both my friend and I started getting very nauseous, thirsty, and dizzy. Overall, we were disappointed. I took time to think about whether or not I wanted to write this negative review because their curries were flavourful and tasty (at least for my dish). However, I would not want someone to also feel sick after eating here. Be careful!!

We came to Pai for dinner. There's usually a wait to get a table. I'd recommend coming earlier to put your name down. 
I ordered the Gaeng Hung Lai (ox tail) and the Sai Va Platter. The oxtail curry is pretty sweet. There's a lot of bones and the meat is quite tender off the bone. It was a pretty solid dish. 
I didn't like the sai va platter. It was a bit bland, but is okay for sharing. I wouldn't recommend ordering it.
I still would prefer the green curry with chicken. I ended up getting this because my friend couldn't handle the spice she ordered. This is the best and most consistent dish here in my opinion. I'd also recommend ordering the Thai ice tea. In my opinion these are the best two things at Pai. It's better than suko. I'd definitely return to try the khao soi.
One of the best Thai foods in Toronto. Atmosphere is great. Curries are great but not enough rice. Stir fried dishes are the best here.

This place gets crowded! We went for dinner on a wednesday night around 6pm and it was a 20-25 minute wait but i will say it was worth the wait. My husband left feeling like it was the best thai food he's ever had. I got the fish and he got the ox tails. We both thoroughly enjoyed the food and would recommend it to anyone looking to have a fantastic meal. Just make sure you make a reservation in advance to avoid the long wait.

While in Toronto for a week visit from the states we managed to hit up this place 2 times! Once sitting at the bar, enjoying the eclectic decor and another time for a late night dinner. Both times we got right in despite it being super busy and no reservation!
We enjoyed the Plum Mule and Old Fashioned as well as the Kung tawt sa-moon prai (fried shrimp), Pad Thai, Panang Curry (get with fish!), and the khao soi with chicken. Everything was truly delicious!

Came here for dinner with my boyfriend, and was surprised to see such a long line up outside! We thought it would be because it was Nuit Blanche, but the couple behind us explained that there was always a line every night. Waited 45 mins which is not bad, the place has a lot of seating. Food was great, my boyfriend enjoyed his coconut curry, but the fish was okay. The chicken skewers were delicious though! May come back to try other things.
One of my favorite Thai places with authentic taste and ambiance.  Most dishes I've tried and amazing.

Yum yum yum!!!! 
I loved having another piece of this pai !! 
I finally got to dine in. This place gets filled quickly
So reservations are highly recommended.   
You can sit at the bar or have your own table. The first time I say at the bar and the bartender, Peter, was friendly funny and made great drinks!!!!  But if you get a table, try to sit at the back and you can go shoeless!!!!  We sat on an elevated area and had to remove our shoes. We had comfy matts to sit on and the table was at a good height.  From the back you get a great view of the restaurant. The ambiance is an authentic casual Thai vibe with retro cool decor. 
The server was quick and knew the menu inside and out!!  
The food: chicken satay was yummy, but could have been more meaty....came with two sauces: peanut and cucumber!  Mains: green coconut curry was rich with flavours and the pad graw praw was nothing less. Spice was perfect !!!  Thai ice tea was smooth sweet and cold :) 
To finish: we had some simple jasmine tea. Whole experience was comfy and yummy :)

Delicious food and cocktails! I ordered the green curry in a coconut! Aesthetically pleasing experience to eat out of a coconut and the curry itself was rich and tasty. It was very filling and you could definitely take some home for leftovers but I was determined to eat it all and scrape out ALL of the coconut at the bottom! YUM
 Great atmosphere with intimate lighting for date night or with a group of friends. Plenty of appetizers to share. The cocktails were delicious as well; classic cocktails with a Thai spin on them. Very sweet, so next time I would ask for less sweetness. Overall everything was great and the service was quick even when the restaurant was completely full.

This place is great! Its a nice little spot that is actually huge inside. We went on a Sunday night, and it was packed, but we still got a table within 15 minutes of getting there. The food we ordered, a pad Thai, basil fried rice, and green curry, were all really good. The service there was also fantastic and the people were so friendly. Lastly, the decot is so unique and different. I would recommend this place to anyone exploring Toronto downtown.
Absolutely delicious!! Fantastic service, great food and drinks. The only downside is they don't take reservations so you'll likely end up in a line up to get in.

This is hands down the best Thai place I have ever been to. Mind you, at most times there is a line to get in the line but I assure you it's totally worth it. Once you are in you can't help but admire the ambience inside.  The detailing of the interiors captures you and oh my god  did I say how huge the place is, its like an endless cave.  
Bottomline - the wait time is totally worry it and if you like thai and/ or want to impress your new friend in town with a place this is a great place to go.

Go-to place for authentic Thai food. Offers different rooms with different decor and service. They also offer traditional sitting, which is a pretty cool experience if you've never done it and don't mind eating while sitting on the floor, shoes off. Be mindful that it is  always packed - but definitely worth the wait!

Great Thai place in Toronto. The menu was designed very well. Some dishes were out as we were told they ran out of the ingredients that got shipped directly from Thailand. Service was so great and the people were so friendly. Nice suggestions on what to order. 
I voted for Moo Ping to be the best dish of the day. The others were so great as well. The flavor of some dishes got tweaked a bit from what could be found in Thailand just to fit well with people' appetite here.

Great Thai spot just off of queen west. This place gets busy so be prepared to wait. 
Casual dining experience with friendly and efficient staff. 
I ordered the pad Thai and it was delicious. Tasty, good portion size and very flavourful. 
All in all a great dining experience.

Went for lunch on a week day. The place was not that busy. Felt like i was in a tropical environment by the way the restaurant was decorated which really set the mood towards the amazing food I was about to eat.
The place was clean. The service was alright. The food was very tasty and flavourful. I tasted all the key notes you would find in a Thai dish.
The bottles of water tripped in out because I thought there were birds in the restaurant hehehehe. That was a cute and fun touch.

Definitely worth the wait. I appreciated the love story of the owners. All of the photos and the creative posters and arrangements throughout the restaurant was engaging and made me feel like I was supporting a pretty cool couple. The line was out the door as we walked closer to the building, but I saw that as only meaning it was worth it...I was correct. The bar area was packed with friendly regulars and newbies from what I caught from various conversations. The presentation of all the cocktails were pretty. When we were finally seated, our orders were promptly taken. It took forever and 5 asks for my friend to get a Coke, which was disappointing, but I was accommodated well. I appreciated the paper straws. My shrimp pad thai was pretty much the best I've had. I've had pad thai in the past that would have too many peanuts or too much oyster sauce or just plain nasty. My pad thai was very fresh and absolutely heavenly. The shrimp were plentiful and a good size. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and the ambiance.

I love every dish I've ever had here. 
If there are more than 12 people in your group, you can book the private dining room with a set menu.

Their pad gra prow is my favourite thai dish ever!!
I also recommend their Tom yum soup..it's the best I've ever had.
I even learned to make my own pad gra prow although it's never quite the same as I never have the proper thai basil to flavour it with.
Sometimes, their service can be slow and bad..but most of the time, they are good. It is bit loud there and crowded so I prefer to have a take out. Nonetheless, most of their dishes I have tried there are definitely true thai flavoured and authentic.
Always a delight. Might take a bit to get a table but worth it. Staff are always super friendly. Food is always a win.

It's been years since I had a go to Thai place. We went to this place because of the hype and it was totally right! This place has great atmosphere and the food is fantastic. It's easily the best I've had since visiting Thai land. If you are craving Thai, this is your spot!
We got pad Thai tofu and veggies and Khao Soi with shrimp. It was very good. Flavourful and delicious

Food was super yummy and authentic. The tom yum soup was packed with flavor. The pad thai was solid as well. Only complaint would be that the beef in the green curry was slightly dry but the curry itself was good. Overall great spot for thai

Hard to find really good Thai food in Toronto. This was my first visit to Pai, but I was impressed. Cool atmosphere and great food! 
I like spicy food, so I ordered my Pad Thai "Thai spicy". For once, it was actually hot! They don't mess around with the heat here, so if you like hot food be sure to order it Thai spicy for an impressive, endorphin inducing kick.

Almost 5 star experience. Removed one star because their menu offer d spice level customization but was not offered when asked.  Red curry was slightly sweeter and extra hot sauce provided on side was not enough. 
Ambience is top lnowtch almost walking into some underground clubs scene. It was filled with people waiting for table.

The food here is so good - now I see why they have long wait lines! Luckily, I got a seat at the bar within 15 minutes since I was by myself.  The spring rolls are kinda spicy and very good. I cannot remember the name of the dish, but it was egg noodles in a coconut curry broth with braised beef, topped with crunchy wonton noodles and scallions....the best meal I had during my weekend in Toronto!!! The broth was super flavorful and the beef was so tender...I'm still thinking about it! :-)

We were there on a Saturday evening. It was super busy, had to wait 35 minutes to get a table. There is a cozy corner inside the restaurant for waiting, good for winter time. The waiting was worth it. Despite the extreme busyness, drink was served on time. I had ordered Tom Yum Caesar. It was a bit spicy and had the expected punch. Loved it. 
The food tasted great. We had tried Pad Gra Prow with chicken and Gaeng Masaman with braised beef. Both dishes were very flavourful. I order mine to make Thai spicy. Bad decision! It was super hot (spicy). If you can't handle spice but would like to try anyway then I would suggest you rather go for mild or foreigner spicy. The portion was moderate. The taste of both dishes were very similar to the same dishes in BKK Thai at North York where I am a regular. If you happen to be in this corner (just North of 401 on Yonge, North York) of the city, I suggest you also try BKK Thai. There food is equally good or better minus the crowd and waiting time. Anyway, it's not as vibrant as Pai and one tenth in size.
Overall the service was great. Can't ask for more in such a busy time. Glasses of water were served and refilled without asking. Highly appreciated the extra paper napkins on the table; proactive thinking - guests will need them specially if they try their food Thai spicy. I would love to go there again with a big group.

Psi had the best Thai food I've ever had!! This restaurant was recommended to me by multiple people and I was blown away. The music was bomb, the food was even better and the drinks were spot on. This is a place I would recommend everyone trying!!

Not bad, but personally it doesn't add up to the hype for me. Everyone told me how amazing the food is but for me, the food is a bit too heavy for my stomach to handle. Location is tucked away in this underground "hipster" like area. Very packed! We waited approx. 20 minutes and wait staff was hard to call but totally understandable. The vibe wasn't very "thai" though; it felt very similar to Warehouse on Queen. 
I went with my boyfriend, I got the curry noodles and he got this extremely spicy rice dish (forgot the name of both but they were supposedly verh popular dishes) Also ordered a tom yum soup and a Thai milk tea. Dishes were served  pretty fast but the workers seem to be overworked :( . The curry noodles were delicious, came with fried crisps but after about 6 bites you get sick of it since it is very very rich. I packed the rest up. My boyfriends rice wasn't really interesting in flavor, just really spicy. He said the Tom yum soup didn't taste right either so he didn't end up finishing it. The milk tea was very very good though, edging on very sweet but overall would recommend.
Overall the experience was ok. We only stayed for 20 minutes after ordering since we couldn't handle the food, my boyfriend ended up getting sick from it when we went home. Would not recommend if youre looking for a light meal or if you have a weak stomach.

We reached at 6 and added our names to their list. The wait time was an hour, so we left our contact number and went to a nearby place to grab drinks. We were seated within an hour and 20 mins. 
The ambiance and spirit of the place is cosy yet buzzing. It was super crowded yet everyone looked comfortable. 
We were told we may have to opt for communal eating and share our table but thankfully we ended up getting our own table. 
We placed our order based on reviews on Yelp. We ordered their Green Curry (Gaeng Kiaw Wan) and Khao Soi which had egg noodles with curry, crispy noodles and your choice of meat. We had the Green Curry with Chicken and it's served in a coconut and the Khao Soi with Beef.
The service was friendly and efficient. Our food came within 20 mins of ordering. The Thai Iced Tea complemented the food perfectly. 
Overall we had a great experience and I would definitely recommend this place!! It's definitely worth the wait and justifies the hype.

Amazing Thai food! Last time I had the khao soi with the braised beef, and the flavors were amazing. The service at the restaurant was also really good, even though they were busy they were very attentive. It gets busy and the wait for a table can be long, but I always have luck getting a community table.
Amazinggggggg. Can't wait to go back and try something else new and exciting on the menu!

I love Thai food, but this restaurant exceeded my usual Thai expectations. My family visited from Chicago and I wanted to take them to some place special. And they wanted Thai, it was on a Monday and it's already packed! It says something about the establishment, that this restaurant could be really good  xoxo The server was really nice and polite! The food was excellent! We had an amazing experience, proud Toronto foodie here! I'm so happy that my family had a really great time. That's what important! Thanks PAI Northern Thai Kitchen!!

I've been to Pai more times than I can count, not sure what's taken me so long to write a review. I believe I've tried most of their dishes, all of which are superstars, but the most worthy ones are definitely the Thai chicken wings, khao soi, satay, fried squash fritters, and the green curry. Whatever you do, you must try the squash fritters, they are so delicious and the serving is pretty big. Fair warning though, they are addictive. The khao soi with braised beef (or any meat really) is also unforgettable, its a northern thai noodle dish with a coconut broth base - this might get a little messy to eat though, still its worth every stain. I love their chicken wings, they are not too sweet, and are flavored with essential thai ingredients like lime leaves and chillis, unmissable in my opinion. Pai is easily the best thai food I've had in North America, so if you haven't tried pai yet, for whatever reason - I hope this review is compelling enough!

First time in Toronto and we saw that this place has so many reviews so we decided to try out this spot. The food was delicious. The dishes were so flavorful. It does get very packed but service was awesome. The waiters we're so friendly and attentive even though they were very busy. I would definitely recommend this place
A great Thai place, uncomplicated, simple, good food. Had the gaeng panang w tofu, delicious with some chili oil. Worth the wait in line.

I'm very, very surprised by all the praise this place gets.. particularly when it is located in close proximity to Khao San Road, which is better in just about every regard.
Entirely mediocre in all ways.  Pad Thai was decent, still much better than something like Thai Express, but had no delicateness to it.. noodles clumped together and were overly firm/oily.  Red curry was sickly sweet and honestly on the verge of being unappetizing.
Also, something I haven't seen really mentioned here in the reviews, and I think is very important... is that you cannot edit the spice level of any of the dishes except the Pad Thai.  Yes, they'll give you a side of chili oil.. but that doesn't match a place that will tailor your order in the kitchen to the spiciness you want.  This is most evident with their Massaman, which has tons of potential, but is just way too sweet served as is (not 'authentic' at all, even though I keep hearing that adjective get peppered around on here). Even the Pad Thai, which I got extra spicy.. you could tell the actual core of the flavours of the dish were mild, then they just throw in more chilis...
tl;dr -- go to Khao San Road instead.. definitely a better Thai food experience, especially if you have a penchant for heat.

*4.5/5. 
*The noise level can get quite loud sometimes with the music and surrounding conversations, but it was never to the point I had to yell across the table.
*Service is CONSISTENTLY bad. The servers always seemed a little forgetful at times when we'd ask them to refill water or extra bowls. They were quite fast when we asked for the bill though. 
-Tom Yum Nam Sai Kung Mor Fai - $15
The soup arrived with a tiny fire at the bottom to keep the broth warm. The soup was fantastic and had a perfect blend of sweet, savoury and spicy. However for $15, there were only 5-6 tiger shrimps and chopped pieces of mushroom, thus I would say this dish wasn't necessary worth the $15 price tag and it would have been nice if fish was included as well.
-Gaeng Kiaw Wan (Green Curry) - $16
The green curry arrived at the table in a young coconut shell and you can scrape off the coconut "meat" from the inside. The curry itself was packed full of fragrant and aromatic flavors, and had the perfect consistency and richness. The chicken pieces were tender and soaked up all the curry flavors. Though it was quite spicy, there was just enough sweetness from the coconut milk to counteract the heat.
*Quick tip: Pay attention when you order any dishes that are being served in a coconut or pineapple shell (like fried rice). If the restaurant is cheap, they will reuse the shells!! However if there are still some "meat" or fruit in the shell. most likely they are freshly used :).
-Sai Ua Platter/Northern Thai Sausage - $14
I found the sticky rice to be on the dry side but the pork belly sausages were perfectly cooked. The greatest part of the dish had to be the relish that contained yster sauce and shrimp paste, with some intense flavors, binding all the components together.
-Squash Fritters: 
The fritters were piled high and it was not as sweet as sweet potato fries, yet still had the "fries" texture. They were light and crispy on the outside, and fluffy and sweet within, paired up with a nice tangy bright tamarind dip. 
-Mango sticky rice: 
Occasionally they would run out of mango and serve with a Thai custard instead, and I dislike it as the custard made the entire dish way too sweet. The mango that they use is a bit more tangy which complemented perfectly with the sweet sticky rice, however it would have been nice if they used incorporated black sticky rice for textures.

Waitress put our orders in front of other nearby customers by accident, left it there for about 10 min and I saw the customers touch the food with their forks as they tried to figure out if it was the wrong order. The waitress came back and they said it was wrong so she took it back. She then walked away to a corner of the room and came back over to us (I guess thinking we didn't notice) and gave us the food. We confronted her and she admitted what she did and apologized. I was in such shock. Another waiter came over and apologized and they promised they were remaking the food. We were very hungry and trusted that they would remake it so we waited and the new plates were good. We ended up paying full price and tipping (looking back I don't know why I did). I probably won't ever eat here again after this experience, it makes me really worry about cleanliness and safety.

My favorite Thai place in Toronto! We've come several times now, and in particular their currys are excellent. In this visit, I had the green curry, which is quite flavorful with coconut milk flavor, bamboo, and any protein you choose. This dish however isn't very large, so if you're hungry, the other curry dishes seem to be quite bigger. They are also excellent, particularly the gaeng masaman. Pai gets quite crowded at peak hours so reservations are quite necessary and the line often gets out the door. At times this causes the service to be quite average. However the food is absolutely delicious and keeps me coming back. Also pro tip, the door to enter is at the side of the same door to exit...the sign at front can be confusing, don't go around the corner looking for it.

We ate here on a Saturday, just before noon (it opened at 1130) and the place was almost completely packed.  Waiter and staff were all very friendly. The menu was fairly small from an entree choice perspective (decent choice of appetizers) but had a good mix. 
Since my wife doesn't tolerate chili heat very well she went with the Pad thai, because this could be customized to "no spice" level. I ended up getting the Khao Soi, because it is a less common dish in Thai restaurants I've visited, and I have wanted to try a good version of it. We also got Thai iced tea in an attempt to get some caffeine, since we didn't have coffee or tea that morning. 
Considering how busy it was, the food came out in a reasonable period of time. The Pad thai was more sour and less sweet than many restaurant versions I've had. I thought it was quite good, but would have appreciated some chili heat (but it was my wife's dish, so...)
The Khao Soi was much better than the other version I have had in WNY. The broth was more coconut-y and very rich, with a decent amount of heat for something described as mild. I did add more heat with the chili oil provided. I ordered mine with braised beef as the protein, and this was very good, much better than its appearance suggested. The beef looked to be cooked  separately and added at the end, and appeared fairly plain with little browing. But it was very tender and more flavorful than expected. I'm not certain which cut of beef it was, but it seemed like from beef shank, removed from the bone and cut into cubes. I would definitely order again, if in the mood.
The main downside is it took quite a while to get my check, maybe sitting there for an extra 10-15 min. Another worker noticed us sitting there waiting with our jackets on for while, so she did get our waiter to bring our check. They were quite busy so it is tough to hold that against them too much. 
 Will visit again if in the area. Next time, I would try the Pad gra prow as the waiter also suggested.  Definitely my type of dish and their version looks great
Amazing Thai Food for grabs, alot of well used seasoning and exemplary care causes the dishes they serve to be the utmost quality almost wishing you had a second order.
Always pleased with both the service and food. Highly recommend for anyone looking for great Thai food in west Toronto.

Visiting from NY and was anticipating a great experience. So disappointing. Long long wait line while standing on a steep staircase. What?? Take names and let people wait outside or get a cocktail at the bar. Seriously strange process with no regard for the customers. 
Food was ok. Don't believe the hype about how fantastic and authentic the food is. It isn't. We ordered a sangria pitcher. Was quite tasty. Thai wings were good. Gai satay was good. TOM YUM KUNG was very spicy hot and uninteresting. Fried fish was good. Good food (3 of 5) Not great food.
Was so dark had to use my phone light to see the menu. 
Service: Strange. Appetizers were brought to us 10 minutes apart. Server was inattentive. (2 of 5)
Not the experience we had hoped for.

My girlfriend and I loved this place! They got us seated in 15 minutes or so & then the magic began. She started with the Thai chicken wings which she loved. She also enjoyed her Thai iced tea. I got the Tom yum soup which wasn't bad, it was just a tad bit sweeter than I was used to, but still good. I got the Thai fried rice which was heaven and she got the green curry. This is a quality place for Thai food and actually a lot larger inside than it looks from the outside.

Let me just start by saying, the thought has crossed my mind to fly to TO just to come eat at Pai. I had absolutely no idea what I was eating, I just asked the gentleman at the back bar what was his fave and he suggested the pad gra prow (I think that's it) and I ordered a Tom yum (it had a little kick). Everything was sooo savory it was ridiculous. The wait was a bit daunting when they told me, but they make every effort to place you somewhere you can eat. Damn near on the roof. I have no complaints at all. My daughter got the fried rice she said it was delicious. Can't wait to come back. The cute story line decor and ambiance are also a ++ the pics will keep you busy.

We tried to come here for dinner on a Sunday night without reservations. Hahaha we couldn't get in! So since my husband heard it has the best Thai food in town, he purposely drove downtown to get take out. Food was great, very flavourful. Please start delivery to the High Park area! We would be your best customers! Uber eats or something of the sort? Something to think about!
It's hard for me to stop from ordering sticky rice with mango on every visit to Pai. It's a simple wonder with perfect balance of sweetness and sourness. I love the chewy texture of the sticky rice.

One of the best Thai spots in Toronto. Always busy so be sure to make reservation, come during non peak time, or in my opinion the best way to enjoy Pai - pick up using Ritual and skip the line! 
Pai's green curry is my all time favourite, the broth is delicious, creamy, and coconuty. 
Khao soi is also great if you want curry but also want noodles.

I have been meaning to write a review for this restaurant for quite sometime now. No matter what adjectives I use, I would be regurgitating the countless praises that have already been sung.
I have been here for more than 30 times till date and have tried all the dishes (barring beef and pork varieties). I am yet to experience disappointment - be it the service, dishes, drinks, the restaurant is top notch. The flavors are authentic and presentation is neat. Regardless of what you try on the menu, you will be impressed, and will be rearing to come back for more. I do. 
I had introduced this restaurant to at least 5 of my friends and they have all been fans. 
I just love the place and, needless to say, I will remain a fan for life!
A tip: if you are in the area for lunch, do stop by for a quick grab-n-go from the Market (11:30 am - 2:30 pm weekdays). It's a good option if you are a 'Thai Express for lunch' kind of a guy. You get a great tasting zero-wait-time lunch for a cheaper price.

My first time here from the US. This place is the best Thai I have ever had. SIT AT THE BAR! Irvin and the lady behind the bar were amazing. 
From food to drinks, to atmosphere, this place is one of the best vibes I've received in a restaurant. I 10/10 recommend and give this 5 stars all day.
Amazing eveytime. The kau soil is amazing and the service has been spot on every time. Order in or out. On point

Been wanting to try Pai for a while, finally booked for lunch! It was super yummy - definitely try their thai iced tea. I got the wings to start and they were super moist and juicy. Spring rolls were fine, the moo ping was delicious, and the pad gra pow was excellent! My family and I were stuffed by the end. It was a bit loud and a bit dark, but otherwise a great lunch! Service was prompt as well.

Fantastic 
Great spot  Great food and Great staff. 
If I am ever back in the neighborhood I will be back. 
Keep up the good work.

Surprised I haven't written a review about Kai before today. This restaurant is one of my favourites. I feel transported back to Thailand every time I step in here. For some reason, I always thought they don't take reservations, so I've always been stuck in a long wait, but I saw last time that they do in fact have reservations on their website. 
My favourites are the Tom Yum Soup, Pad Thai, Moo Ping ( I could just eat 3 orders of these alone), Coconut Shrimp, Khao Soi, and Panang Curry - okay maybe I like the whole menu. 
They also have fun drinks like Thai Buckets, but don't be mistaken these aren't the authentic ones that give you wings! Haha.
Pai northern Thai kitchen is a clean, respectful and professional business with one of the best noodles I've had

Very nice vibe, and the food was quite good. I continue my quixotic search for Pad Thai that is not too sweet, and this iteration was good, though still a bit on the sweet side for my taste. The Tom Yum soup, however, was absolutely extraordinary!  I got the "medium" level of spice, which to my taste was quite spicy, yet not "hot" - which was perfect, as far as I'm concerned. Staff were attentive and the food arrived fairly quickly, given how many people the place had packed in.
Only one negative, that keeps the experience from being 5 stars, was the fact that I was bumped into by multiple servers no less than 4 separate times during my meal.
Now I get that it's a busy place, and that they're trying to serve a lot of people, but the first time a waiter bumps into me while I'm sitting down eating my meal, it can be excused. The second time, it's a bit annoying. By the third, I just start to think that the wait staff is moving too quickly. By the fourth, I was just annoyed, and this detracted from the otherwise enjoyable quality of the food and the ambiance.  So get this settled. Either fewer tables, or train the staff to be a bit more graceful with their movement around the place. Because my the end, I felt like I was at a crowded bar at 1am with a bunch of rowdy drunks, and that's dissappointing.
This place was soo delicious. Exactly what my coworker and I were looking for on a cold fall day. It had a fun/upbeat vibe and great food!
Good food. Nice vibes. The portions are a lot so beat to share if you go with a friend!

This restaurant is all quality. My favourites: pad thai, Tom yum soup and green curry. They're incredibly busy, but the waitress was always attentive when I grabbed her attention. I can't express just how much their food is so flavourful, filling and so worth it! Usually I wouldn't do delivery/take-out, but because they're so busy, I'd rather do take out just to get their food faster. 
I went on Halloween and all the wait staff wore very adorable costumes. It feels like a family in there!
Love it! I will be back!

Delicious papaya salad, get medium spicy. Their crispy pork over rice is total comfort food with the perfect egg on top and lastly, don't forget to order their very authentic Thai sausage (so much lemongrass it's perfection!) happy eating!

Book a reservation. This place is very crowded and popular. It's a trendy place with good food. If you don't mind bumping elbows with other people or sharing tables, this is a good place for fusion Thai food. 
I went with my friend for a summer dinner. It took us a few weeks to get a reservation. They are good in that they are punctual with their seating even when the place was full. The service was fast and friendly. The food was interesting and appropriately spicy. 
The place was recommended by my friend. It didn't disappoint. I didn't give it 5 stars because I didn't feel very comfortable. There wasn't a lot of space. The table next to us was so close that they could examine what my friend ordered. The restaurant was very loud, so it's not a place to have long conversations.

Yay!! This place was everything I expected it to be and more. I was with a semi - large party on a Sunday night and the wait was a little over an hour, but it was definitely worth it. Take the opportunity to make reservations in advance to avoid the wait time! 
I ordered the braised beef khao soi. The broth was silky, the beef was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and the noodles had a slightly chewy texture that I loved. 
Our waitress was the sweetest lady ever and was very attentive and knowledgeable. We threw lots of questions at her and you could tell that she knew what she was talking about! 
Try this place. It's fantastic!

JUST AWESOMEEE!  Everything from the wings to the spring rolls to the pad thai to the green thai curry, and everything in between was so beyond delicious.  This place is hopping, just packed, at all times of the day, and rightfully so!  The food is definitely something to make the trip and wait for.  I really want to go back tomorrow for another dinner, to be fairly honest!  Always amazing :) .

Yay! Another bookmarked restaurant down! And it was so great. We came in at around 5:30pm and it was PACKED. They managed to squeeze us in, but I seriously recommend making reservations before hand.
PRO TIP: they do NOT take reservations on the day of.
Gai Satay (5/5) - AMAZING. Like genuinely the best thing we had at Pai's. I think the peanut was seriously something special--I've never had anything as great. They also came with these spicy pickles which were also ridiculously great.
Issan Sausage (3.5/5) - A smash hit with the rest of the party, but not with me. I thought the hot sauce was fab, but the sausage was pretty dry to be completely honest.
Fish Fillet With Tamarind Sauce (4/5) - Forgot the name of this one but it was great! Crispy and yummy and all around a good dish.
Massaman Beef Brisket (5/5) - BOMBBBB. So good!! Tender and flavourful, well rounded and super comforting.
Pad Thai (3/5) - Meh. Not impressed. Not much to say here.
We also got Thai iced teas which were great--everyone thought it was refreshing and just sweet enough. Give this place a try!

PAI is always packed but for good reason - the food is phenomenal and the place itself is so cool. It's one of those places you are already excited to return to the second you step out the door. Definitely recommend -- maybe try going earlier to avoid wait times.

Love everything about this place. Atmosphere, food, decor, and service.
Bit on the pricey side for Thai food, but great quality ingredients and tasty.
Their beef salad lettuce wrap dish is off the hook.
Make sure to make reservation or be ready to wait in line to be seated

My group was lucky to have booked for a table of 8. We had made reservations almost a month before and we're pleasantly surprised. Why you ask?
First, we swiftly seated in the hidden private room when we arrived. The main area of the restaurant was bustling and then I entered the private party room where you can fit around 20 ppl. The other group didn't arrive yet so the first part of the dinner felt like we were in an exclusive restaurant.
A few of us ordered drinks that many thought were unique especially the spiked thai tea. Now on to the food.  It was a treat with lots of choices as we ended up sharing dishes to thoroughly enjoy what Pai had to offer. I normally do not like spicy but the level of spiciness was just right.
The dish that I enjoyed the most was the Khao Soi which was noodles with braised beef. The whole night was not rushed and they were so accommodating to serve us the cake that was brought from outside. Definitely will return but will need to book ahead again.

It was my first time to Pai Northern Thai Kitchen & let me tell you... I LOVE THIS PLACE. I arrived on a Sunny Sunday afternoon with a friend. It was a busy downtown afternoon, parking was difficult to find. Ended up paying $20 for parking at a private lot. It was a wonder Sunday to walk, I didn't mind paying the $20.
Atmosphere: 
As you enter, you'll feel the restaurant's energy. The exposed brick, dim lighting, upbeat rock and roll music & energetic staff is the perfect mixture to create a drinking environment. In addition with great tasting food, I can understand why this place is rated top Thai food places in Toronto
Food & Drinks:
To start we ordered the Chicken Gai Satay. I've eaten at many places for Thai food, from Khao San Road, Thai House Cusine, Golden Thai Restaurant, Spice Thai Cafe, you get the picture. The flavor and moisture of the chicken was phenomenal. It came with a hott sauce and a vinaigrette, absolutely delicious. I highly recommend trying this appetizer.
For our mains, we ate the Khao Soi & Chef Nuit's Pad Thai. The Khao Soi was delicious to the last spoonful. A variety of flavors run through your mouth in every bite. Spices were perfect, noodles were fresh and the soup was mouth watering. Chef Nuit's Pad Thai was an instant classic, watch for your heat request, they can get real spicy real fast, I requested for the spice to be on the side. Again, fresh flavors, tender meat, absolutely delicious.
Price:
Our bill came up to almost $75 before tip. We also drank Singha Beers & has a couple of Sake Bombs! So much fun.
Overall, just writing this review and thinking about their food makes me crave them even more. Take a look at some of the photos I posted, but I suggest go have a bite in your free time to really appreciate the taste. This will be my new go to Thai Food place when the cravings hit. Great job Pai, thank you for a great atmosphere, awesome energy and most of all delicious food!
